Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: sourboy97
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the MO in Las Vegas many times and it is without a doubt my favorite Vegas hotel. This time I was with a first time Las Vegas visitor, and I thought we might switch to a more traditional Strip Hotel. In the end I stuck with my favorite and after our stay my friend agreed it was perfect. From Matthew at the bell stand to JP and the entire staff at the spa to the pool team,the Mandarin was up to the 5 star rating. The Mozen Bistro staff took our breakfast order the first morning and the next day we simply said bring us the same breakfast and there it was, letter perfect. I recomend the Premiere room, as the best desigined non suite room in town. I have also stayed in the Strip View Suite and it too is wonderful. The Spa itself is worth the stay. even if you don't get a treatment just spending time there a must do. After a night on the town nothing will relax you more. Your Spa journey begins with the ladies at reception who bring tea and slippers then escort you to the spa itself which in my view is a little slice of heaven. Overall the Mandarin Oriental is a great Hotel and a great value compared to the other high end hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite hotel; never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: kawp
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the MO Las Vegas for three nights over St. Patrick's Day weekend. Our check-in was seamless and the front desk staff are very friendly, polite, and helpful. ROOM/UPGRADE: We had booked a Cityscape room on the 14th floor (#1410), facing the south end of the Strip. Later in the evening, we realized our adjoining room (not a feature we liked) was having a party. We had chosen the MO because it's a non-gaming, low-key hotel - we weren't looking for a party! Upon calling both security and the front desk late in the evening, and very early in the morning (when the partiers had returned to their room, and wanted to keep it going!), the hotel offered my partner and I either a complimentary breakfast at MOzen bistro, or a room change/upgrade. Obviously we went for the room upgrade. In preparation for changing rooms, my partner and I packed up our belongings prior to having breakfast, so we could easily change rooms after. When we were at breakfast, the front desk called us saying our new room was ready and transferred our luggage there themselves, which was appreciated. We were upgraded to a Strip-view suite on the 17th floor (#1700). The room was almost double the size of our previous room, with spectacular views of the Strip, and best of all: quiet!! We really appreciated that the MO staff handled this problem quickly and apologetically. (I won't delve into the specifics of the room itself, as this has been widely covered in previous reviews of this hotel). DINING: While staying at the hotel, we had room service dinner twice, and ate at MOzen bistro twice for breakfast. Room service, as you'd expect, was delivered efficiently and politely. Our server even apologized for being 5 minutes early, which was completely unnecessary but appreciated, nonetheless. The prices on the In-Room Dining menus are almost identically priced to the restaurant menus, and there is the usual $5 delivery charge. At the MOzen bistro, I had an omelette for breakfast both mornings, which was delicious and certainly more than I could finish! It is a beautiful restaurant, filled with light, and with great views of the stunning Crystals at CityCenter. CAR SERVICE: We booked the car service provided by the hotel ($100 charge in a Mercedes SUV) to pick us up at the airport and drive is directly to the hotel. It saved a ton of time (no taxi line-up), and was such a calming way to start off our stay at the hotel. During the trip, we took advantage of being chauffeured in a Mercedes S-class vehicle anywhere on the Strip (Walter was our favourite driver, so friendly and helpful!). Basically, if you ask for a taxi at the valet, and their car/driver is available, they will take you anywhere on the Strip. That being said, because complimentary use of the car is limited to the Strip, the car is never more than 10 minutes from being back at the hotel. So, if you leave yourself some extra time and don't mind waiting, the car is almost always available. (Keep in mind, though, that the car can be booked for a fee, so it is not guaranteed to be available). We also booked the car service to return us to the airport on our last day, for a $95 fee. Obviously, these fees are much more expensive than taking a taxi, but if you want to take the worry and stress out of travelling, booking the car service is the way to go. LAUNDRY: After spending some time in a nearby hotel's casino, my partner's sweater smelled terribly of cigarette smoke. As this was the only sweater he packed, we needed it dry-cleaned ASAP. I have never utilized laundry services at a hotel before, as I think they are beyond costly, but this was a necessity on this trip! The prices are a bit much, but the service is quick, and the sweater came back smelling (and looking) practically new. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Las Vegas who is not looking for the typical, cliché Vegas experience. If you want to stay somewhere peaceful, calm, and exquisitely appointed than I would recommend this for you!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and relaxing - almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Coach606
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels in Vegas over the last few years: Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Planet Hollywood, and South Point. Each has it's own niche, but all were essentially the same core concept of a hotel. The Mandarin Oriental is completely different. You enter the lobby to find - nothing really. No check in lines or concierge. Just a beautiful, Asian style lobby and some elevators. You have to go up to the 23rd floor "sky lobby" to check in. Unlike other hotels, the Mandarin Oriental is not trying to be an attraction. There is no casino. There are also no throngs of people or long hallways and shops to walk past. You can get in and out in minutes. Since we all know that sinking feeling of realizing you forgot something in your hotel room at the Bellagio and must now walk back to your room, a 10-15 minute journey, the ease of Mandarin Oriental is a huge plus. It's basically Las Vegas' idea of a boutique hotel. It has one coffee shop, a magnificient "Tea Lounge/bar," a bistro restaurant, and one very, very high end restaurant. That's it. Oh, there's a spa and pool, but no shops, no casino, no 50 restaurants you're forced to walk past to get in and out. There is more. The rooms are fantastic. We had a suite and it was wonderful and plush. The staff is excellent. Soft Asian music pervades the elevator. It also seems modestly scented. I was less happy with the pool. More like a lap pool than anything else. Service is excellent but the drinks were insanely pricey and just not worth it. I'd had a gin and champagne drink at the Barrymore the night before and it was excellent. Just the right mixture of everything and huge. One drink had me stumbling out of the place. Well, I paid 20 bucks for one at the Mandarin Oriental pool and it was cloying, sweet, and really only a few sips of drink in a small glass filled with ice. If I'm going to pay 40 bucks for 2 drinks, they need to be spectacular. My wife visited the spa, and it seems to be a magnificent place. Pricey, but definitely worth it, according to her. Her massage and spa treatments were really top notch. Not just a rub down, but many amenities and steps along the way to truly relax you. We also visited "TWIST" for dinner, which was exceptional. I mean, seriously exceptional. We've had many high end meals, but this was a level higher than them all. The foie gras melts in your mouth, the caviar is like sea air and the wines... wow. The downside to the hotel is that it can be a bit stuffy. I found myself longing for some humor and some humanity. Everyone is so insanely calm and polite. Another downside is the nit picking fees. $26 Resort fee? It's more psychological than anything else. I mean, this buys you free coffee in the morning, a Wall Street Journal and internet access. But it bothered me to forced into all this. It's like the cable company making me buy 200 channels when all I wanted was HBO and Golf Channel. Also, the nightly parking fee is annoying. I suppose the Uber-rich will not care, but me, I hate to pay for parking in Vegas. I'm too used to the free valet to start paying for it now. So I forewent the $25 per night and parked in the ARIA. It really is a few minutes walk, just over a pedestrian bridge and your there. Super easy. But it was annoying none the less. You pay $450 a night for a suite, but then pay for parking? It's silly, but I couldn't get over it. Overall, it's a great hotel and we had a very relaxing stay. My wife especially enjoyed the hotel as she hates casinos and their throngs of people. For a few days, it's quite lovely. But beyond that, I wouldn't enjoy it. The dining options are very limited, the pool is actually a pretty bad experience on several levels, and some of the nit picking on charges are galling. I would stay here again only if it was a for a few days and only if relaxation was the prime goal. But there's a lot this place doesn't offer. And since I'm not a millionaire, i'm not used to the isolation and uber polite attitude. Made me long for some real human emotion at some point. Yes, I like good service. But the staff here are almost robotic in their politeness.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Handle_11
Reviews.Content: Shaltered from the hustle & bustle of the Strip, this hotel is truly an oasis. Service is superb, as are the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like the Ritz, You Will Like This.”
Reviews.Author: stacey s
Reviews.Content: When you are in Las Vegas sometimes you just want to get away from all the noise and people as well as the casino. If so, then the Mandarin Oriental is a fine choice. If you are familiar with Ritz Carlton Hotels this is somewhat similar, but with an oriental flair. The hotel is nestled in the heart of City Centre, within a 5 minute walk of the Aria, most of which is under cover. It is also very close to Crystals shopping center where there are some very good restaurants and plenty of over-priced shopping. Again, there is no casino here and only two restaurants. As for the hotel the configuration is a bit odd. To get to the lobby you have to go to the 24th floor (they call it the sky lobby). Off the lobby there is a very nice bar with great views of the strip and with some unique drinks, so look at the menu. They also have high tea in the lobby, a nice touch. The check-in process was painless and the staff was very professional. Now, another oddity, depending on where your room is you need to take two elevators to get to it from the ground floor. I was on the 19th floor, requiring me to transfer at either the 8th or 24th floors. A minor inconvenience. The room itself is spacious, but not necessarily by Vegas standards, but roomy enough. The rooms also have a bit of an odd configuration for the closet area. The touches in the room are very nice. Automated lighting and drapes, a large separate tub with bath salts, tv in mirror in the bathroom and a nice flat screen with lots of stations. The bed was very comfortable and overall the room was clean with nice amenities, but what is expected of a hotel of this class. There is a butler pantry where you can get your shoes shined for free and where they will drop off the paper of your choice. It is locked from the outside. There is also a large safe in the drawer. I did go to the spa and so should you. While again smaller than other Vegas spas the staff was very professional and they offer multiple types of rooms, beyond the typical sauna. Worthy of at least a few hours. The best part of the spa is that it was not teaming with people, which presents a great way to relax. I dislike the larger spas where there are throngs of people as it defeats part of the spa experience. As far as dining I only ate on the 8th floor where there is a sushi bar as well as a nice place to get breakfast. It is pricey, so be prepared, but the food is far better than average. Lastly, if you made it to the end of this review here is a hint, make your reservation with a platinum American Express. You will get various benefits including a $100 spa credit, better rates and very late check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Fun night”
Reviews.Author: dobermandogmom1
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute trip to Vegas with friends and stayed at the Mandarin on a Saturday night. The service was very good. The room was nice with an awesome view of the strip. We ended up going to the Sky Lobby Bar for appetizers and a few drinks. The bar itself was awesome and so were the drinks but the shared appetizers we ordered for a ridiculously high price would not have satisfied a bird let alone three humans. The live band was really good so we stayed a little longer (hungry) to listen to them before we walked down the street to get something else to eat. (BTW the woman who checked us into the hotel raved over and over again about the great food at the Sky Lobby Bar...interesting.) We ended up coming back to the room after dinner to sit and watch the action on the strip and catch up. It ended up being a wonderful evening with good friends with a beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly spoiling!”
Reviews.Author: vicky557
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place! Apart from being superbly looked after it was such a a pleasure to return to the beauty and tranquillity of the hotel after fighting with the crowds in down town Vegas!! Every aspect of staying in this hotel was exceptional and I cannot recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “They just want your money honey”
Reviews.Author: calumc
Reviews.Content: Had the Mandarin been less expensive and not tried to charge at every opportunity, I'd gladly have increased my rating. Will NOT be staying here ever again. Minuses: Compared with the Aria's well equipped 'Gym' the Mandarin's 'Fitness Centre' is sorely lacking Breakfast doesn't offer much choice and is not included The business centre will do NOTHING for you without charging a fee. For sending a package via FedEx, the Mandarin extracted a service fee on top of the FedEx fee. To make matters worse, the staff members didn't counsel me against using a PO Box for the delivery of a small box, so the package was delivered much later than it should have been. Asked for a small amount of olive oil or similar to be delivered to the room. Hotel insisted that they would charge for this as a 'food'. Having to take 2 sets of elevators/lifts to enter and exit is a pain. Staff took the liberty of throwing away my plastic spoon, and didn't provide any cutlery. Check-in wanted to charge an exorbitant amount to my debit card upon arrival for each day of stay. Other Vegas hotels charge a far more modest holding fee upon arrival. This required a negotiation I did NOT need to have. Pluses: No smoking policy throughout! No casino. Very close to the strip, but slightly recessed from the strip, so not as noisy as some other properties. Gym is included Free shoe shine and local calls are incl Twist restaurant, although pricey and dishes are unconventional with may not really working well (creativity at the expense of tastiness imho) is worth trying once. Gorgeous views from bar and Twist restaurant Front desk made a mistake by sending another guest to my room by writing the wrong number on their room card. Front desk apologised by reducing my Twist restaurant bill. Room was attractive with good amenties, though not as attractive as the Cosmopolitan's.

Reviews.Title: “This place is AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: sujemali
Reviews.Content: What an awesome hotel. We loved every second we spent here and will NEVER stay anywhere else ever again in Las Vegas. We had a city view room which was great. The room was beautiful. This hotel has no casino and no smoking - and boy can you tell. The service is outstanding. Look for Joe at the concierge desk. He is a super star. Nothing is too hard and no request unmet. Josh at the front door is also worth finding. No matter what time of day or night or what type of weather, this young man always greeted you with a smile and a helpful hand. That's what makes your stay here delightful!!!,

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: Pageyoz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Vegas as part of a quick West Coast trip. After reading the reviews we chose the mandarin and were not disappointed! It really is an oasis right in the middle of the strip. It's has everything you could expect from a 5 star resort and then some! The staff were fantastic, rooms were amazing and the most impressive bathrooms I have seen in a hotel. It starts to get a little exy with the $24 resort fee per day and $30 parking fee but hey... It's Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “an oasis from the mayhem of the strip”
Reviews.Author: psylocke737
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a convenient area of the strip, the Mandarin has everything a high end hotel should offer. Rooms are well appointed, service is amazing, breakfast that was included was one of the best I've ever experienced. It really was an escape from the strip; but near to a number of casinos. Twist restaurant was fabulous, from the food to the decor. Will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri oh la la! Now, THIS is a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CatS1969
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, excellent service, impeccable room, über clean, gorgeous views, centrally located. Amazing resort, totally zen in the middle of Las Vegas. No casino, but surrounded by plenty. This was a wonderful escape from the hustle and bustle of LV. I highly recommend this resort. Spectacular rooms and cozy beds. Technology in the rooms is something I've never seen at this level. Totally worth every penny! Watch out for the shower heads in the fitness center locker rooms though, mine fell out of its holster when I was showering and nearly knocked me out. What a place though!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chu303
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month and I gotta to say that I thoroughly enjoyed my visit there. The staff and personnel were very friendly and I loved my experience there as well. It also helps that you won a big jackpot there too. Although I got my room comped the price is a little high for me. But again it's worth a visit for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and discreet”
Reviews.Author: J-P_Surrey
Reviews.Content: If you are not really into gambling, but still want to visit Las vegas this is a perfect Hotel choice. The Hotel is a haven of calm amid the madness of the City - it is a major plus that there is no casino attached. The pool area is very nice, and the staff were very professional. The spa is great, but for a Hotel of this class it should not be an optional and expensive extra to use the regular facilities of sauna, steam room etc.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the madness of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: hondapetunia
Reviews.Content: Mandarin oriental is fabulous. Great location, friendly staff , superb rooms. We had a strip view room and it was adequate for our 7 night stay. Bathroom was amazing, bed was comfy, use of hotel car if we needed it. One error was that as we were international travellers on a 7 night stay we were entitled to a free jet lag experience in the spa. I only discovered this on the last day while looking up the website. I asked reception and they did not know about the deal, even though it was on the website , but after 10 min the lady came back and credited us $187 dollars as we would not have had time to avail of the experience, being our last day. I would have preferred the massage!! Sky lobby is amazing and well worth a drink or tea and a cupcake for the view!! on checking out , a dinner and breakfast had been charged to our room that we didn't have!! It was rectified immediately but with ever hotel , I would recommend checking your bill.

Reviews.Title: “You can only judge the quality of customer service when things go wrong - this hotel is exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: The Innocent Man
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mandarin Oriental for three nights in early March, having chosen the hotel on the recommendation of so many people on the Trip Advisor website. As numerous reviews have already said, the rooms are fabulous: large, exceptionally well appointed, and probably a techno-geek’s idea of heaven. The restaurant is top-notch also (try the Indian cuisine, it’s wonderful). I guess we were unlucky in so far as we experienced a couple of significant problems during our stay … not even the Mandarin Oriental has managed to find a way of achieving perfection (yet!). However, it’s not the fact that things go wrong that concerns us – sometimes, things do happen – it’s the way that the hotel’s management team respond that matters to us, and we were totally wowed by the response we received. The level of customer service at this hotel is truly exceptional (far exceeding our expectations), and it’s clear to see why the hotel is rated Las Vegas’ number one on this website; it’s deserved, and I cannot imagine them losing their position any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sheril R
Reviews.Content: This is hands down one of the best hotels in Vegas. Their service is impeccable. The staff is courteous, and professional. They actually take the time to memorize your name. When you request your car, the car already has two bottles of water waiting inside. The room has a straightening iron which makes my packing easier. The gym is fantastic with hi-tech equipments. The bed is very comfortable to sleep on. The room service is prompt, and the food is much better than most hotel foods. Worth every penny to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, classy experience”
Reviews.Author: Stassi78
Reviews.Content: Great location and felt spoilt by the experience. We were on our first stop in our honeymoon. One small error was receiving a happy birthday cake instead of a honeymoon cake. Otherwise, superb

Reviews.Title: “Truly a treat”
Reviews.Author: Quannanana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is first class all the way. The first person you encounter is the top hatted doorman who makes you feel as if he has been waiting all day just for you. As you stand at the check in desk, somebody brings you a tray with a hot towel and a cup of tea. The room is very modern and high tech, immaculatly clean and very well stocked. Just don't forget that there is no coffee in the room . Bring you own with a one cup drip cone and filters and you are set because you can heat water in the room. All of the sevice is quiet and respectful and thorough. The spa is very expensive. I had a really nice treatment, but I don't think that it was worth $325. All spa treatments give you all day access to the thermal experience, which I found to be only moderately satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBana
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Mandarin Oriental over Valentines. We liked the room so much on the first night, that we upgraded to a Premier Room for the rest of our stay. In my opinion it’s not worth the upgrade - stick with the standard room, unless you need extra space. Overall the hotel is fantastic, great quality throughout, the only minor negative was having to change lifts to get to your room (same for standard and premier). The restaurant is a la carte and serves an absolutely delicious breakfast, but it did get a bit busy over the weekend. All rooms are non-smoking and of course there is no casino. But don’t worry, the hotel is walking distance to the strip and all the action. The Aria Casino is a short 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin last summer and it was outstanding. This time we had a strip view suite and it wasn't the quiet oasis in Vegas we liked last time. The strip view suite on the 14th floor is noisy late into the night due to Las Vegas Blvd. Nothing the hotel can do about this, but the sound of music, cars, and motorcycles really impacted our sleep. The strip view suites are also smaller than the cityscape suites which overlook the Aria/City Center (and those are quiet). So save the $$ and avoid the strip view suites, go with the cityscape suites which are also larger. The staff was friendly but there were some issues during our stay. Even the best hotels will have minor issues, so I'm not going into them. But the Mandarin does compete with the cheaper Wynn Encore, so they really need to execute as the Encore is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Five star oasis on the Strip, great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: FondofTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this hotel and had a fantastic experience. It's tucked away on the Strip, close to the action, yet quiet and serene. Non smoking and no casino, but close to the casinos and the bustle of the strip. We had a delicious breakfast and lunch at the cafe, delightful spa treatments in their beautiful facility, used the excellent gym and took a couple of very good exercise classes. My room was so beautiful, quiet and comfortable. What makes this a great hotel is the first class service we received from the bellmen, the waiters and waitresses, the front desk, spa personnel and concierges. Highly recommend and will definitely stay there when I return. Took the sunset helicopter tour to the Grand Canyon recommended by the concierge and it was terrific! He also booked tickets for us to two very entertaining shows: Terry Fator and Cirque de Soleil "O" show.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way”
Reviews.Author: sammygee76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and had the most amazing time, great location.Staff went out of their way to be pleasant and very friendly, room was exeptional very large room with a great strip view and the best bed.Pure Luxury, would have loved to have tried the Spa here but the prices were way off the chart $600 for a massage?! a shame as the other hotels offered reasonably priced spa's so used others instead.It was nice to come home here after seeing the sights, the bath with the tv in the bathroom mirror was great to relax in after walking around the strip. The area around the hotel was also great, The Aria next door was amazing too

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tom E
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Mandarin Oriental. It is ingeneously located on the strip, but with an entrance that doesn't invite casual street traffic, making it immediately a place apart from the usual chaos of Las Vegas. The hotel itself is wonderful from the facilities to the spectacular service. Everyone we encountered was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The spa is in a class by itself. If you are looking for a typical Vegas experience, you may be happier elsewhere, but if you want to be pampered while staying near the action you can't do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas- So awesome”
Reviews.Author: HongTravelsKong
Reviews.Content: I satyed here with my family, and it was one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever seen, it was boiling, but there was such an amazing crystal blue pool on the top. The food was execuizite, and I hope to stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Not that special”
Reviews.Author: BetterTravelled
Reviews.Content: I did a 4 night stay at MO Las Vegas (in late Wednesday, out Sunday) on a trip with friends and I was distinctly underwhelmed. The trip started out with one of the high points as you get to check in without having to wait in the long lines that come standard at the big casino resorts. But from there on I found a lot of things to be annoyed about with the Mandarin. Lets start with the most important - I was really unimpressed by the bedding and the temperature controls in the room. This isn't a problem I have often, and its not a Control 4 issue because I've stayed at Aria multiple times and know how to work Control 4, but I found myself frequently getting overheated during the night. After having housekeeping fiddle with the blankets I finally found a setup that worked for me on night number 4. It wasn't ideal. I was very surprised to find that the TripAdvisor reviewers who complained about noise levels in the room were spot on. Noise in the hallways was very easy to hear in the room, its quite shocking for a 2 year old Mandarin property. I found the elevator system, where you had to change at either the 23rd floor Sky Lobby or the 3rd floor, to be a real pain in the neck. The in-hotel services were not impressive to me. Very few services are complimentary - whereas you can get your suits pressed for free at the Skylofts (if you want to compare this place to the top hotels in Vegas), its a full $36 at Mandarin. MoZen Bistro was frankly poor when I had brunch there, I wouldn't have taken it over any quality Vegas 24-hour restaurant. I've eaten at Twist in the past and thats a world-class fine dining experience but there's no need to stay at the Mandarin to appreciate that restaurant. Finally, the Mandarin lacked the personal touch that a real service-oriented boutique hotel has. Its a bit of a silly complaint on the one hand, and it is to be expected in a hotel of this size, but frankly you pay a premium to get that and I didn't feel it. On the positive side I was quite impressed with the Mandarin Spa. The Concierge was quite good though there was often a wait as there were only 1 or 2 concierges for a 20 floor hotel. The room itself was generally nice and the view in our Strip View room was definitely impressive. Many of the reviews of Mandarin on this site are written by non-gamers. I was in town for a gambling trip with friends and Mandarin also fell short on that front. I thought that it would be fairly convenient to go to Aria to play but while the hotel is quite close as the crow flies, once you take two elevators, climb a tall staircase and then get in on the far side of the Aria and have to hike all the way across the casino floor to get to the good tables you realize its a lot less convenient than staying at Aria itself. I would not recommend this hotel for people coming to Vegas for a gambling trip, and I thought it was generally underwhelming across the board.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: izari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing. The rooms are amazing, the view from our room to the strip was beautiful, the bathrooms are unbelievable, the service is also unbelievable, the guys at the valet are amazing and pay attention to every single detail. We had dinner at their Mozen bar and both food and service where great. The hotel location in just perfect right in the middle of all the vegas action but at the same time feels secluded and exclusive. I wouldnt stay anywhere else. For me this is a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0401
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is excellent. It is one of the few hotels in Vegas that is no smoking and does not have a casino, but located in the middle of the strip. The staff are very friendly and helpful, nothing is too much for them. The hotel is quite new with a Spa (didn't use), swimming pool (water was a bit too cold), business centre, bar and restaurants. Our room was a Junior Suite (room 1200), on the front corner of the building with great views of the strip. The suite has floor to ceiling windows in every room, hence amazing views The room is large with separate sitting room which has a large tv, mini bar, desk and couch. Going through double doors into the bedroom, with a king size bed which so so comfortable, large tv, dresser, settee and CD sound system. The bathroom is also large, with a double vanity, full deep bath, separate large shower and separate toilet. There is a tv in the mirror of the bathroom which was lovely to have. The robe area is adjacent to the bathroom, with plenty of hanging space, drawers and safe hidden into one of the drawers. There are plenty of nice touches, eg: turn down service, hair straightner, shoe polish, jewellery box, electric curtains. Breakfast was included up to the value of $48.00 for 2 people per day where you selected from the menu and paid any additional cost. The menu was very good and the food excellent. We shopped around for prices and ended up booking directly with the hotel website and got a free night included in the deal. Compared to other hotels, it may be a bit more pricey, but worth it if it fits into your budget. Note, when looking at hotels in Vegas, keep in mind, where there is a casino, there is smoking. It is not like Australia, where we have no smoking, it is full on smoking and the larger casinos are worse. Do yourself a favour, don't just stay around the strip, go to the Hoover Dam, Atomic Museum, Grand Canyon and don't forget the shopping malls - excellent and cheap. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Las Vegas and the Mandarin Oriental and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of luxury in the madness of the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: LadysmithJack
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is in the heart of the action, nestling in between the Cosmopolitan and the Monte Carlo on The Strip. Even before you step inside it's single lobby you enter a zone of peacefulness. Las Vegas is a great place but sometimes it is nice to take a break and the MO certainly allows you to do that. The pool deck on the 8th floor is a great place to chill out, have a bit to eat - you can take breakfast there instead of the bistro restaurant. The 23rd floor Sky Bar with it's floor to ceiling windows affords guests a spectacular voyeuristic view of neon and lights of Las Vegas. The rooms are ultra modern with all the technology you could hope for as well as being very comfortable. Relatively small in comparison to the monolith's it is surrounded by you can't get lost in the Mandarin, it has one entrance and one lobby. Best of all are the people who take their service cue's from the oriental heritage of the hotel's operators. They are simply some of the very best hotel staff, at all levels, that I have met. Great personalities, a desire to serve for the sake of giving service rather than the expectation of a tip, professional and human - real people who engage with guests. In a city where big is considered best this hotel stands out as being truly remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Mickibbo
Reviews.Content: I travel the world for up to four months of the year for business and pleasure. I have stayed at all the best hotels in most capital cities, the Mandarin Oriental is a standout, the service is second to none, staff are friendly and attentive but not over the top, the hotel is in a fantastic location and the rooms are beautifully appointed and very luxurious. There is no casino, guests tend to be of the more discerning type. I did not want to leave this hotel, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, stay here and visit the Cosmopolitan centre for your restaurants and nightlife. I could not believe how cheap this hotel was, value for money is outstanding. Valet was $20 per night, we had a strip view room with a floating bath, just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expecations”
Reviews.Author: nnaattaalliiee
Reviews.Content: The beauty of the stay was in all the well thought out details. The rooms are beautiful, but it's the careful consideration to your ultimate comfort and luxury that makes it amazing. Even the turn down service was above and beyond. I could go into lengthy detail, but if you are considering this hotel, do it. You won't be disappointed. I felt like a princess during my stay. I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas. I used to think Encore was pretty great, but now I can't think why I thought it was special.

Reviews.Title: “Revitalize Your Qi at the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: suntrvlrgirl
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas provides a calm and quiet retreat after hanging out on the Las Vegas strip. The location is perfect (a part of the City Center), the rooms are beautiful and the service is wonderful. The spa and gym are exceptional. Not to mention the price was right. We were able to take advantage of a wonderful package that included breakfast...YUM!, spa credit, use of the hotel's car and driver (Big Ballin' in the Mercedes!) and internet access. If you want to fall out of the elevator into the casino this is not the hotel for you. If you would like to have peace and quiet without walking through the casino to get to your room, great food, superstar like treatment/service (love the VALET closet) and view of the strip, RUN to the Mandarin Oriental. It is the best hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm.....”
Reviews.Author: mhk1058
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply outstanding. There are many to choose from in Las Vegas and we ended up in this one more by luck than judgement for a first time visit to Las Vegas. It's only when you visit the other hotels in the area that you fully appreciate what this hotel has to offer. Vegas is all about excitement, shows, Elvis, Casinos etc etc and most of the other hotels are just that. However, when you've finished all that for the day, going back to the Manadarin Oriental is like entering another world from the minute you are within 30 feet of the front door. Absolute tranquility, even the smell of the place has a calming effect. The staff are impecable, courteous and, most of all totally efficient. You feel like, whatever the request, the answer will be 'Certainly Sir/Madam'. Requests to print emails were met with 'absolutely sir, email it to me and I'll sort it' Two minutes later it was brought to our room. All other service requests were met with equal efficiency and speed. Returning from a morning jog I was greeted with 'welcome back' and a bottle of water by an immaculately dressed doorman and a further 'welcome back' by equally immaculate reception staff. By the way, reception is on 23rd floor with stunning views over the strip and distant mountains. We visited most of the other big hotels during our stay. Whilst I am sure they are all very good the reception areas were usually full of people with bags, most have literally thousands of rooms, we saw guests dragging bags through smoke filled casinos in some and I find it hard to imagine how they can provide the same level of service as the Mandarin with so many more people to cater for. It all depends on what you want. The Mandarin Oriental is a non gaming/non show hotel which allows you to enjoy all that Vegas has to offer within walking distance but also allows you to completely escape it. We stayed in a Premier room, one below a suite, which is not cheap but relative to UK prices we had a lovely, big room, huge bed, massive bathroom, shower almost as big as our bathroom at home and HD TV with outstanding service for about the same price as a shoebox with reluctant service in London.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Vegas ...with a difference!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel077
Reviews.Content: For anyone that has tried to search and decide on a nice hotel in Las Vegas, you will understand how overwhelming the process can be with so many options! Mandarin Oriental stands out above ALL properties in ALL aspects of hospitality. One bonus of the hotel is that it is NOT a casino, yet still close enough to all the action on the strip. The fact that it is not a casino is fantastic as both my boyfriend and I are non-smokers and we have heard much feedback that even the non-smoking rooms at some strip casino/hotels still have a distinct smell and tinge of cigarette aroma. In summary, the staff were EXCELLENT always offering to assist in any way possible, the beds were extremely comfortable and easy to sleep in, complimentary bottled water was also a nice to have. Unfortunately the WIFI was available for an additional fee (we thought this would have been perfect if a complimentary offering as the ARIA next door offers comp. WiFi). The pool area is also fabulous with a nice resort feel and waiters available on hand to assist where possible. It is distinctly different to other resorts where can become jam packed with people and party like. Check in was also seamless with 4-5 staff available to assist at any time on the reception desk (other major hotels on the strip we walked through/had dinner at, appeared to have 100s of people standing around waiting in Queues to be attended to). Parking is available at the ARIA free of charge, which we made use of (5 minute walk next door) Breakfast – opted not to do this at the hotel as we ventured out a bit. There is a great takeaway coffee / homemade pastry store in the hotel which is attached to the restaurant. ARIA also has a patisserie and cafe within its casino if you wish to try. VEGAS tip in general – be VERY aware of the ticket scalpers at the ‘cheap ticket booths’ selling buffet vouchers at a ‘cheaper price’. One couple we were with was affected by this and required to pay additional fees and taxes upon validating their ‘prepaid’ voucher at the hotel buffet. We highly recommend to stay at the Mandarin Las Vegas if you are looking for a 5 diamond/ star hotel with AMAZING amenities, service and hospitality. Close enough to all attractions, next door to a CVS pharmacy and opposite the road from McDonalds / Starbucks next door in Monte Carlo (for those who need their fast food fixes).

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: DavidPF80
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler to Vegas (yes really) you want to stay focused but be part of the fun! The Mandarin Oriental offers the perfect solution. Calm, serene staff surrounded by opulent accommodation set the stage for a successful launch to the business day. Once you have conquered the business world you can return for an always welcoming staff, a quick refresh and a short sortie to neighboring properties' tables. Alas, if work keeps you in, the room service food quality and promptness is simply 10/10. What is weirdly wonderful? the reception desk and lobby way up top off of ground level!

Reviews.Title: “refreshing change”
Reviews.Author: Billington127
Reviews.Content: How nice to stay in a very clean, quiet, smoke free environment, convenient location. Lovely food, drinks and service. We would not hesitate to stay at the MO again.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental-Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sheri M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed and the Mandarin Oriental and loved it. It was so friendly and relaxing, we will be back. We did book a suite with a package that included dinner at Twist and passes to the spa.We were upgraded to a bigger suite which was unbelievable! We went to afternoon tea which was so tasty and just enough food. I had probably the best facial I've ever had, it was a double what I pay at home but well worth it. Our dinner at Twist was good but we felt rushed there. I can't say enough for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oasis in middle of hedonism”
Reviews.Author: heeto
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a "welcome home" by doorman daily.Sure felt like it.Great looking hotel and wonderfully scented throughout.Nice to be in hotel without a noisy,smoky casino. Had a strip view room on higher floor.Absolutely stunning view and gorgeous room.Loved the sleek yet comfortable bathtub.Nice Tv in bathroom mirror and relaxing bath products.Great turn down service and prompt housekeeping. Well kept clean and quiet hotel. Pool looked awesome but too cold to use. The Mandarin bar and Tea room were great places for drinks/snacks and to chill.Wonderful evening views and great service from all staff. Tried Twist and LOVED the food.Expensive but a nice splurge. Used the hotels comp Sedan back to airport.Classy touch. Def our hotel of choice in Vegas.Love all MO hotels esp in Asia but this is our favorite in the US. Slight problem at the Spa with a hair appt-stylist ran 30 minutes late.Decided to leave.Not big deal since the rest of the hotel excelled.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Lynnpatricia
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with all the great reviews for this serene oasis in Vegas. We stayed at the Bellagio on our last visit which was enjoyable but we chose to stay here because of the absence of a casino and smoke! We were extremely happy we did. Just a couple of very small points - the shower caps are tiny and split with each wearing (please note - I do not have a big head and have never had this problem before)! Take your own. We came back from a great afternoon trip to the Hoover Dam looking forward to sampling the fantastic looking afternoon tea we had seen being served in the lounge only to find it fully booked. We made our way to the bistro/cafe on the 3rd floor but were told it closed daily between 5 and 6pm ( it was 4.35pm) and therefore last seating was 4.30, ie it closed at 4.30. This seems to leave quite a gap for a time when people are returning from an afternoon out looking forward to tea. I will not pay the extortionate add ons for room service. However, in line with the caring and professional service in this hotel we were served our tea anyway and were not rushed. I will be looking for a Mandarin Oriental wherever we stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Everything as you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Adrian K
Reviews.Content: My wife was very keen to stay here after experiencing some wonderful hotels in Asia last October. It is a truly great hotel in every way, however it didn't quite have that last something we had recently experienced in Asia. Almost perfect, although we've enjoyed previous stays in Vegas more.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pekoe08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MO Las Vegas over Superbowl weekend. Overall, the hotel is outstanding, if you are looking for a non gaming, non smoking hotel. The rooms are slightly smaller than you might expect for LV, but extremely well appointed. The staff in general were outstanding. We had one exception. There were several events at the hotel due to the Superbowl that meant that both the lobby bar and the bar were closed. The person who was manning the entrance was quite rude about not letting us in for a drink, even though the event was not going to start for quite awhile. Other than that, the hotel was outstanding, with the kind of service you would expect at MO.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Yachtchefhere
Reviews.Content: Beautiful service. Great caring staff. Immaculate rooms. Absolutely loved staying here. Without doubt a leader in it's field. Excellent. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I will stay when visiting Las Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerUAL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental during Superbowl Weekend, February 2nd - 5th. I stay in a lot of hotels and I must say that this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in the U.S. Upon arrival, I had the rental car valet. Valet is free, but you have to pay if you stay overnight. I believe it was $20/night. Check-in was upstairs on the 23rd floor and it was quick and easy. I love that this hotel doesn't have a casino and that there aren't tons of people coming in and out. I was given a strip-view room on the 11th floor. The room was absolutely amazing, spacious and clean. The bathroom was large and clean also. The views from the room were outstanding!!! When my bags were brought up, I was shown how to use the remote control which controlled everything in the room, lights, music, blackout blinds, curtains. He also showed me the tv in the bathroom mirror, which I thought was an awesome feature. Anytime I came or left the hotel, I was greeted by name, which I thought was a nice personal touch given that there were so many people staying at the hotel this weekend. One morning, I decided to order room service for breakfast, and I must say it was absolutely amazing. Expensive, but amazing....and worth every penny. I have absolutely no complaints about the Mandarin Oriental, and will only stay here next time I visit Las Vegas....which will be very soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience we have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyChocolateGirl
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk into the lower lobby of the Mandarin Oriental, to when you check out, you will experience absolutely awesome service. We recently stayed for 5 nights, and will definitely stay here when we next return to Vegas! Every single staff member we met went above and beyond to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. Every last thing that you could possibly need was thought of and included in the room for your convenience. With every hotel that we have ever stayed at, there has always been at least one negative point. With the Mandarin Oriental, there was no negative! It is in a fantastic location (right in the city centre), close to just about everything you could want. Everything about this hotel is luxurious. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Refined and quiet, yet in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: bigfish02ut
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days in a city view suite at the Mandarin Vegas. The hotel does not have a casino and has a much different character as a result. We found the Mandarin to be a relaxing escape from the noise and hustle of the Vegas strip. The hotel has high end amenities such as large soaking tubs, electronically controlled drapes and lighting, great audio and video equipment and more. We took advantage of the on-site spa for a great massage. The bistro in the hotel was a great spot for morning coffee or a quick, delicious meal. The service at the Mandarin was exceptional from beginning to end. One minor note was that we could hear late night party-ers out on the street, though they were muted...some parts of Vegas are unavoidable I suppose. I would definitely stay here again. We paid $400/night for our three night stay, and got a roll-away bed for the suite so that we could accommodate three people in the room. This arrangement worked out very well.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: lilybert
Reviews.Content: I came out to LV to join my husband who had been staying at the Venetian with his colleagues. We stayed one night there together and then moved to the MO where we spent six nights. We had a strip view suite with great views. Every last thing had been thought about to ensure that your every need was met within the room. I have some minor criticisms. When we arrived the desk lamp was not working and when we left six days later the desk lamp was still not working, surprised that the turn down service person did not have the initiative to report it. It was not a big deal to us and couldn't be bothered to waste our time reporting maintenance issues. Also when we arrived I picked up three used dried out disposable contact lenses from the toilet floor, a third had fused itself to the marble when we checked out it was still there. Not a big deal but maybe along with the dust on the side of the bedside cabinet it hints that the housekeeping is not quite as it should be. Most importantly the bed was really comfortable. Having said all that the staff at this hotel are absolutely wonderful - all of them. The room service is really good and the food that is delivered is tasty. Very large portions though as we discovered so the next time we ordered room service we had one meal to share, which was accordingly plated up on two plates with two settings at the table. Breakfast at the MO is really good, the yoghurt with granola was my favourite, but the smoked salmon bagel is good if you have a large appetite, though I noticed they are happy to box up what you can't manage if you might fancy it later. One moan here as well. We arrived for breakfast one morning and were told there would be a twenty minute wait, indeed people were waiting in the corridor - just stood there. We said that wasn't acceptable, the duty manager Patrick came, apologised for the situation and we agreed to have breakfast in our room for which we were not charged. This was not ideal as we were keen to get out and enjoy our day and it slowed us down but better than standing in a corridor like a queue for a soup kitchen. one more thing a big thank you to David who served us our breakfast most mornings. Overall this was a really good stay. I did not like the casino hotels, they we too large and smokey, this was calm normality and was a great escape from the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: alicejean
Reviews.Content: We were completely at peace when we entered this hotel. The decor is very elegant in its simplicity. The staff was friendly and professional. There's a casino next door at the Aria which is very easy to access. We stayed in a city scape room and had a wonderful night view of the strip. We had a couples massage and it was the best massage I 've ever had. The food at the Mozun Bistro was the best meal I had in Las Vegas. The suite was huge with a sitting room and a huge bathroom. Everything was first class and beautifully decorated. There isn't a coffee maker in the room but they had 3 selections of tea and a hot water carafe. If you wanted you could bring instant coffee. The gym was also well equipped and provided water, fruit, and chilled towels.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of problems that should not exist at this level and these $$$$$!”
Reviews.Author: WYSOKC
Reviews.Content: Just took the wife out for a late valentines weekend to LV and stayed at the MOLV for the first time. We had dined there in the past and had evening drinks in the bar numerous times but this was our first stay. We booked a suite and requested an early check in (10am) that was confirmed by the hotel but we were not checked in until 3pm. This would have been a real problem with most guests but we had a car rented and were gone until 1:30 so we only had to wait an hour and a half to check in. Had we had to wait 5 hours, I would have really been pissed off. Got to the room and my wife noticed that there were no bathroom items left. At this class of hotel, we fully expected there to be a bar of soap, shampoo and conditioner and the like left in a room at these prices but no. We had to ask the luggage guy to go get some for us when he brought up our bags. He did his best but had some items stuck in his back pockets as he couldn't carry everything he tried to grab. Is this really the top notch service I have heard so much about? Keep reading- When we tried to turn on the TV and relax a bit, we discovered that neither of our TV's worked well at all. Nor did any of the curtains or lights, all of which seemed to be on a minute or two delay after you pushed the button. But if you became inpatient and pushed it twice, then you were either closing the blinds when you were trying to open them and shutting off the TV when you were trying to get it to come on. We fought this stuff for the first two days and then the delay on all things got to be about 5-10 minutes to get anything to react and then we called and got engineering up there. He said they had trouble with this system all the time (same as at the Aria) and he had to climb under the TV's and re-boot the system on both TV's and then go down the hall and re-boot the system from down there as well. Some of the face plates kept falling off the walls while we tried to push the buttons so we just put them back as they fell off (forgot to tell him about that one). After about 20 minutes, he came back and we gave it all a shot again and had to wait a few more minutes. All of this going on as my wife lay on the bed under the covers trying to get some rest. The thing finally re-booted and it did work better for our last night. Believe it or not, we were actually able to rent a movie and watch it! (Unreal! I know!!) Everything still had problems but just not as bad as before. This re-booting of the system actually allowed us to get the curtains in the bathroom to function properly and maybe that was not such a great idea. As such, my wife was able to get the sheer blinds to stay down and the black outs to go up in the bathroom and what a surprise!!! Someone had squirted either lotion (my wifes vote) or had S-E-X in there (my vote) and squirted (you get it by now I'm sure) on the blinds and then proceeded to roll them up! And then we got to roll them down. (oh yea!) It was disgusting to say the least. That sheer blind needed to be removed to get it properly cleaned and possibly thrown away entirely. Even with the system re-booted or not, we could never get the two lamps in our sitting area to turn off no matter what we did. I finally had to lick my fingers and simply unscrew them at night and then screw them back in during the day. I am an architect and if I EVER see this technology that is used in this room come across my desk, my trash can is going to get a quick workout I can assure you. We used the glasses from our bar to make a couple of drinks in the room and then we took them down to the bar with us and left them there. When we went to get a glass to drink a coke, we found that the glasses had not been replaced. We had to drink a soda from our wine glasses the rest of the trip, they were never replaced. Lastly, the lightbulb that was in the shower was burned out for our entire 4 days. I notified the front desk of all these items (had them written down) and was told they would get them fixed before the next guest checked in. I just wish they had them fixed before we checked in. Thats was it, not a sorry, not a apology, not a word. I was just handed my bill and asked to verify that it was correct and asked if I would be going back up to the room as my key was going to be shut off and I would not be able to use the elevators. Needless to say, this was our first and last time at the MOLV. I just expected more from a MO hotel. Sorry to say, it was not delivered. I would expect service like this at the Rio or the Orleans but not a MO hotel. I guess it's back to the Bellagio or the Wynn for us!

Reviews.Title: “Killer Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WINEandTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: I loved the new Mandarin located at the City Center. Great location, AMAZING Mandarin service, great rooms, marble everywhere. This place has everything you want in a luxury hotel and what you expect from Mandarin. The Twist restaurant there is also one of the finest in Vegas. Loved the fact that it didn't have a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Getting away from it all”
Reviews.Author: milopeterson
Reviews.Content: The spa here is beyond amazing. If you need to get away this is the place to do it. I spend much time in the spa enjoying every aspect of it. Close to everything but far away enough to get the solice you need.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: pingpongb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas for 3 nights in February. Having read other reviews on this site, I'm not entirely sure that there is only one MOLV. In my opinion, the MOLV is nowhere near as good as other reviewers suggest, and in many ways, it was below average for a true 5 star hotel. There is no casino, and so there are no crowds, which is a big plus. During my stay, I saw very few other guests. Some people may like this, but I found it all a bit surreal. I was told that the hotel was absolutely full to capacity, which makes it even more strange. The entrance to the hotel is not that easy to walk up to, and so you don't really get anybody walking in off the street, which is a good thing. From the arrivals lobby, you take an elevator to the 23rd floor where the reception is. Views from the windows at night are quite extraordinary. Check-in was straightforwards, although I was annoyed to hear that they are now charging US$24+Tax 'Resort Fee'. I'd already paid US$320/night equivalent through British AIrways, and so to be charged this on top, is a disgrace. I decided that as they were giving me no choice in the matter, I'd spend my money in bars and restaurants elsewhere, and thats exactly what I did. From reception, you take an elevator down to your room. I stay in a lot of hotels on my travels, and I must say that the room itself was particularly comfortable. Everything inside the room was top notch, and the bed was excellent. I should point out that the room was spotlessly clean, dust free and well maintained. I'd arrived at around 8.00pm, so I had expected to see the bed turned down, but it wasn't, and there was no mineral water left in the room, bar bottles to purchase. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is a valet cupboard, so no excuses on the hotel's part there. If my 'Privacy' sign was on, water could have been left in the valet cupboard. Service is okay, and what you'd expect, and nothing more than you'd expect of a five star hotel. My bed was not turned down until the third night of my stay, and at that stage, I finally got the free mineral water. The view from my room was okay, down to the swimming pool, which was a wreck- Dirty linen bags and furniture all over the place. Dirt in the pools etc...............I realise it's not the time of year for bathing, but come on, five star....? I've never been to a 5 star hotel before, where there's an outdoor pool, that is so obviously neglected for periods of time. It should be well-maintained at all times, and should not be the visual disgrace that it was. Check-out was straightforwards, as I only had three nights resort fee to pay, and departure straightforwards. I may stay again with family, but certainly not when travelling alone. There is no comparison between this hotel, and it's counterpart in Bangkok.

Reviews.Title: “calmness on the strip”
Reviews.Author: MarineCarnage
Reviews.Content: this is the place to stay if you want to be able to turn vegas "off," but still be close enough to where all the action is! very calming and a great place to be able to take a break.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: Gessica80
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a hotel like all the others on the strip you're looking at the wrong hotel. This is strictly a hotel-no Casino. The hotel is in the new CityCenter which is in the center of the strip. As soon as you pull up to the hotel you are greeted by men dressed in grey and black outfits with tall black hats. Very distinctive and totally different than any hotel you'll go to. you then go up to the 23rd floor where the lobby is. Very sleek and very pretty. You are immediately greeted by the front desk personnel. All very nice. You are offered hot towel while they are checking you in. To the right of the lobby is the Tea Room and the bar that is next to that. The views are amazing. We had some tea-tini's while we waited for our room to be ready (we arrived earlier than check-in time). They were very delish-although very pricey. The rooms are wow--awesome in one word. I love how high-tech everything was. I don't know what the most favorite aspect of the room was. I guess my fav was curtains opened and closed by a touch of a button on the wall and the remote control using the TV. I loved having the alarm set by opening the blinds--too cool. We ate appetizers at the bar on the 23rd floor-food was good---drinks were good. Nothing about this hotel is bad. My favorite was the Spa-extremely pricey BUT voted as best spa currently in Vegas....so I gave it a try. Wow--the staff were superb and the service is nothing but impeccable. I love the decor/style throughout the entire hotel. Everything was spotless clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful relaxing Asian hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mwderm
Reviews.Content: This was perfect for us; no smoke, no casino, just beautiful and calming. Great service. Very comfortable and spacious regular room; excellent bathroom and closet hallway. Very close to casinos but a great getaway. Spectacular view from the 23rd floor bar and lobby lounge. We will stay there again. We had a rattling A/C and they sent an engineer right away to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Proper 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Moonstonemoclips
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a few Vegas hotels before and tried this as the deal I received through AMEX was excellent. The staff at check-in are extremely professional and not over enthusiatic. Personal without being too informal. The rooms are superb with so many touches of service, from the various toiletries and amenities, to the lighting, to the spare bits they provide. The restaurant was excellent, service immaculate, food unbelievably good. When I did have a complaint, it was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The gym was top notch (except no bosu balls). The only downside - the coffee was poor. But that is so small in comparison to the way this place is run. I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “An oaisis in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: cam0061
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday, and what a present that was . The moment you enter the hotel on the ground floor its calm and relaxing . The doormen and women and very welcoming and informative , up to the 23rd floor to check in , what a view . Then to our room , we had a city view which was amazing we could see the start of the canyon and the sunset over it at night was beautiful . The room was a great size with seating and a desk , the bathroom was fantastic laying in the bathtub with a glass of champagne looking at the canyon what more could you ask for !!!!!!!. The service throughout the hotel was of an excellent standard . We had a massage in the spa which was very good ,we had a very nice meal in the twist restaurant , yes it was a bit expensive but worth every pound .. The bar was very good for evening drinks and light snacks , with good view of the strip .the concierge organised 2 shows for us which had excellent seating and was just added to the bill at the end of our stay . This hotel has no casino which is what we wanted so if your looking to gamble go elsewhere .I also had a birthday cup cake in my room for my birthday which was a nice touch and very good toooo.I would like to thank all of the staff for making my stay perfect and i look forward to returning to this oasis ...

Reviews.Title: “the gold standard”
Reviews.Author: db1337
Reviews.Content: As far as I am concerned the Las Vegas Mandarin Oriental is the gold standard for quality and service in Las Vegas. As well, as it's not priced as high as MO generally is in other places, due to the competition in Las Vegas, it's also an attractive value proposition. Having stayed with Mandarin Oriental in New York, Singapore, Las Vegas and Munich, I have to give high (highest) marks for the Las Vegas property, and I think it's certainly the best hotel in Las Vegas itself. Service standards are second to none, and the quality of food, and room are top notch. The attendants in the spa are on the ball and there to help you in any way possible, to the point of you wanting to help them back for being so helpful. Beds are super comfortable, drapes are controlled by switches on the walls, along with touch screen bedside units (which also control temperature and everything else you can imagine). Rooms are nicely appointed, if I were to criticize anything it's that the modern architecture results in some oddball dimensions in some of the rooms, but it's very minor. High definition TV sets have great fidelity, service is quick and careful, it's really the closest you can get to being in Asia with Asian standards for service without flying over the pacific. The spa is welcoming and beautiful as well. I even remember the last time I stayed here, some years ago, where I gave them some clothes for dry cleaning and they came back in 2 hours instead of the next day. And I wasn't even asking for expedited service. I can only highly recommend MO Las Vegas, they know how to run a hotel. It's the one place you can go to in Las Vegas where you don't feel like you're one more element of the herd being ushered through the vast machine that are the big casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect...with a few KINKS”
Reviews.Author: Lucifel
Reviews.Content: I had stayed there for my birthday, and everything was simply perfect! The room itself was grand and I loved the bath tub arrangement! They even had a hair straightener for those girls who can't imagine going out in the dry heat with messy hair. The small details of the hotel was perfect up to setting me us up with a great Birthday Surprise and a note. I know it's a business but small things like a note for my birthday I appreciate and the cupcake was delicious! I was really happy that I got to stay at the Mandarin for my birthday. I always have used them for various occasions including business and leisure, never disappointed. Make sure to talk to the Concierge. They are a life saver! The concierge got us into the hottest clubs and restaurants. With our names on the VIP list it was a breeze to attend those oh so impossible clubs without that much hassle. I think we just were tired and not sure what was going on with the list, but once we got the hang of it we just slipped through the line and the damn entrance fee. It was nice to get in without having to really pay for entrance, more for other spending I say! I also enjoyed the NO CASINO atmosphere. For one with major allergies and health problems it was nice change. The cleanliness of the rooms and the hotel itself was just great. The smokeless air was a great change from the other hotels. With its location so close to the mall while it was FNO I enjoyed the few little parties it was hosting in the stores. It was a blessing to stay there. My friends and I enjoyed the pool as well. It was nice to dip in the clean pool with excellent service. We ate by the poolside and honestly I think we could have stayed there all day and night. The food was great, the service was just spectacular. Nothing bad comes out. Honestly without the whole incident of my being stuck in the elevator...the stay was just perfect. The elevator was occupied by a few security people who didn't mention they were testing...and I got stuck in there for over 10 minutes. That was horrifying. Must say probably a one time thing but I would have appreciated a heads up for the testing. And since they didn't really follow through with my getting stuck issue that was a kink in my service factor for them. Overall I guess its a great place to stay. I would go back yes, but next time I would like to avoid getting stuck in the elevator! Oh yeah ask for their car service it's complimentary I think?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the tranquility”
Reviews.Author: ccs_007
Reviews.Content: In a city as hectic as Las Vegas, the Mandarin Oriental is a paradise. Of course that depends on what you are looking for. This hotel has no casino, so if you love to be where the game action is then maybe you will not like this place. For us it was perfect. Our room was very ample, the bathroom was the best part. The service is impeccable since your arrival. We had some reservations arranged, but for the ones we needed assistance the concierge was of great help. Had dinner at Twist, had bad luck with an unknown food allergy but up to that moment the food had been great. No buffet breakfast but a good menu. Tried to make reservations for the spa on 3 occasions and they were always full, so book ahead of time. It is in the middle of the Strip so it was easy to walk to any hotel in the Strip. The only problem we had was that the temperature in the room did not get cold enough and at night it could get too stuffy. The technician came to assist but did not seem to be able to fix this issue. They left a ventilator and it worked for the nights. In general we had a wonderful time here, would repeat it.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite experience on the strip - amazing!”
Reviews.Author: DLSproul
Reviews.Content: This property is so soothing and relaxing it is hard to believe that you are in Las Vegas. From check-in at the Sky Lobby (unbelievable view) to your comfortable room with easy to use high tech service to the marvelous restaurants - you will be amazed! There are so many beautiful touches throughout this hotel - live flowers everywhere and the scent that permeates the property will relax you instantly. The stafff is attentive, courteous and helpful. Ordering room service was a pleasure - unlike any hotel experience I have had - quick too! I stayed in the City Scape room - fabulous views! The bathtub is large and deep and bath salts to die for are provided. I could go on and on but you get the idea. Don't worry about this property not having a casino - there a many right outside your door. This hotel is the perfect place to come back to and relax and sooth yourself - try the in-room yoga!

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet in Busy Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Continent-Bouncers
Reviews.Content: Walking into this hotel was like walking into a secret oasis. No bells and clanging of the casinos, no smoke, no noise. It was like an escape. The rooms are beautiful and very modern. The beds are very comfortable and the linens crisp. I did miss having a coffee maker in the room. They did have a kettle for making tea but no milk to go in it. They offer complimentary coffee on the 3rd floor between 6 and 8 am. This is Vegas..late nights. Not too many people are taking advantage of this offer. Who wants to get dressed and go down stairs to get a coffee to take back up to your room that early. I must also comment on the fact that check in is on the 23rd floor. Above the 23rd floor is residences. Below is the hotel. Once on the 23rd floor you must enter a second bank of elevators to take you to your room. The second bank does not go to the ground floor, only to the 3rd floor. You have to get into another elevator to get to the ground. If this sounds complicated it is. Oh, by the way the gym was excellent with all the latest equipment. Don't use room service..very expensive. Bottled water in the room is $7.00/bottle. They bring you free bottled water at turn down each night, there is free water in the gym and outside the main entrance. It is to bad the pool is not open year round. Resort fee was an additional $24.95/night. This got you internet.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Stunning”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterzrgo
Reviews.Content: By far the best and most luxurious stay on the Las Vegas strip!!!! Everything beautiful =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip Location, 5 Star Service and no hustle n bustle ! - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RelaxWithMax
Reviews.Content: If you like Vegas, five star everything, want to be in the middle of the action, but are fed up with walking forever to get to your hotel room and having to act like a line blocker to get you and you family through crowded gaming floors then this is the place for you ! The first thing you notice when you arrive is the lack of big crowds and noise. Just a lovely lobby with friendly doormen and porters to take care of you and your luggage. This also works well when you want a taxi as there is never any queue or wait. Next thing that happens is that you are whisked to the "sky lobby" on the 23rd floor for check in. Once again none of those long queues you get in other premium strip properties all very easy and prompt to check in. Next, off to your room which is a normal transit you would expect in a non Vegas luxury hotel. We has an Apex suite which was beautifully appointed and very spacious. Had its own lounge, dinning room, full size bar with bar stools, kitchen, study, powder room,Steam room, 2x55inch pmasma's, etc,etc. very nice. Staff were very friendly and attentive and everything arrived on time every time. Very seamless service and what you would expect in a high end premium property. Food for room service and restaurants was good as well Tried out the spa and the massage was fantastic ! Wife said the same. The hotel is situated in between the Monte Carlo and Cosmopolitan which is next to the Bellagio. Very central location and 5 minutes walk to a casino if you want to hit the tables. Right next door to the hotel is the Crystal complex which houses high end fashion stores and high end restaurants. Definately my place to stay from now on after trying other premiums on the strip over the years. - You just have the best of everything at this hotel without all the queues and noise! - If you want that you can get it any time by walking next door to one of the casino's. Thank goodness for the Mandarin Oriental LV !

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Todd S
Reviews.Content: Simply perfect. I cannot say enough about how amazing this hotel is. It is pricey but you definitely get what you pay for. The service was nothing but exceptional. The atmosphere was relaxed and comfortable. The bed was great for a good night sleep and our suite was the perfect size with an amazing view of the strip. Treat yourself and stay here at least once in your life. In the morning, try a waffle. I still haven't found one that can compare.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: neilos100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sptember 2011 for three nights. The hotel is located directly on The Strip......is there anywhere else in Vegas? and it has fantastic views up and down. Its part of the relatively new City Centre development with a shopping centre and other apartment blocks as part of the complex. The room we had was amazing, an enormous bed with big screen tv that doubles as the control centre for various things such as lights, curtains, music etc etc etc.....I would imagine that for some less tech savvy guests it could be a problem to use; I thought it was great though! Bathroom is enormous and has all the amenities you would expect of a hotel of this calibre. Rooms definitely 5/5. We didnt eat in the restaurant but we did go to the bar a couple of times. Fist time was not so great, had to wait a little too long for drinks and ask for the snacks which should be delivered before the drink! Also the waitress seemed rather cold and unwelcoming on the first visit....more style than substance i think.....she seemed to think she was rather special and the guests were there to look at her! The second visit was much better, a different waitress who was much friendlier and far more efficient.......redeemed! The best bit though is the terrace where the pool and spa is. My wife loved it up there and said the service was fantastic.... Overall a very good stay indeed and its one of the best features of this hotel that it DOESNT have a casino......you can escape from all the light and noise of the Strip to a bit of peace and tranquility in the MOLV!

Reviews.Title: “Bar none best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RichardAZ
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here four times now in various rooms and I can tell you it is the best hotel in Vegas. We've stayed in every high end hotel here and none can compare. The small size lends itself to great service. You will pay for it of course but it is worth it. The location is great and I really like the spa and fitness center as well the restaurants and bar. It's quiet - that's the whole point the noise is just right outside if you want it. I do wish they would include wifi with the rooms but I think that's an MGM thing. The staff will remember you after your first visit - be ready to be spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Four fantastic nights!”
Reviews.Author: KeonYu
