Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights there for a vacation and we truly loved our suite. The room is spacious and elegantly designed. Bed and pillows are extremely comfortable, Asian style decoration is very chic and the scent is unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, quiet”
Reviews.Author: GeeksterAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and a beautiful contemporary decor are the hallmark of this new Las Vegas hotel. No casino, but you are right next to Aria and the Cosmopolitan which are beautiful. The Crystal shopping mall is right next door which is beautiful, but empty of people most of the time. The location is good, but it still requires a lot of walking to get out of the complex. There is a tram that takes you to the Bellagio. Otherwise you really should take a taxi everywhere. The only problem is the prices of the food/drinks etc. Outrageously high. I mean 5 dollars for a cup of tea to go from the coffee stand? 40 dollars for an appetizer at Twist Restaurant? If you don't mind the prices and want a little quiet oasis, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: skatelefty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MO Thursday-Sunday this week joining my husband who had been in LV on business and who stayed those days at the Palazzo. At first he was upset that he moved from the Palazzo to the MO because his room was much larger in the Palazzo and the building was more centrally located on the strip. However, he soon came around to being much happier at the MO. We don't gamble so the oasis from the ubiquitous casinos was a relief. Our room was certainly not the biggest ever, but it was big enough..14th floor with a view of the strip, mountains and sunrise. The bed was softer than I prefer (we have a TempurPedic at home), but ended up being quite comfy. Pillows are too hard especially for stomach sleepers, but a quick call had them bringing me up two flatter and comfier pillows. Like others had mentioned, I would have liked a coffee maker in the room. My other only complaint would be that the lighting could have been brighter, especially in the closet/dressing area. Bathroom had many amenities, even a flat iron! First time I've had one offered in a hotel. One complaint is that we ran out of body lotion and I left the tube out of it's place, thinking the maid would pick it up and notice. She didn't. Put the empty container back in it's place without a replacement. But again, these are small issues. Black out curtains were great, but could still hear strip noise. Fortunately, it didn't go on all night long and wasn't an issue at all come sleep time. The food at the restaurants was amazing. So good, in fact, that we decided not to eat anywhere else since we were too tired at the end of the day to get a cab and go elsewhere. My husband said the food at MO was better than the other places he had eaten during the week over at Palazzo, although that food was pretty good. As others have noted, the tea service in the lounge can be slow, but everything is delicious. We didn't realize that you should make a reservation for a seating area and were a bit put off that they gave us a hard time about sitting down for a cup of tea/coffee in a "reserved" area (all spots were reserved but no one was there). After that, we made sure to "reserve" a time and seating area. Other than that, no complaints. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. Service in the restaurants was great. Being that they have no casino, it was wonderful that we had no trouble with dinner reservations, even changing the time several times. It was never packed. I guess most people want to be in the casino environment. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Truly the finest hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BRANDY2426
Reviews.Content: Not much more to say that previous reviewers haven't already mentioned. A calm oasis in a perfect location on the strip. Not a screaming drunk bachelorette or bachelor in sight! Service was great. Beds extremely comfortable, and room layout well-planned. The bar is not only beautiful, but the cocktails were delicious and the bartender very friendly. Their only fail was the concierge recommending Scarpetta for a meal. Looking forward to another stay here in the Summer when the pool is open.

Reviews.Title: “Four circles because the MO should be held to a higher standard”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Premier room for 3 nights (for the price of two...fantastic special). The room itself was exquisitely decorated, extremely spacious, and the bed has now won my award for most comfortable bed ever. It wasn't just the mattress, but the bedding, the pillows, everything. I fell in love with that bed. The view of the strip was colorful and fun to watch at night and expansive enough to see the mountains during the day. The bathroom, of course, was the size of many Manhattan apartments. The bellmen and the door people were friendly, gracious, and helpful. So why not give it an "excellent' rating? First of all, the clerk who checked us in was not particularly welcoming, just cool. When I raised a potential problem with a request I had made, she brushed it off. It actually turned out to be a serious problem, and while I did eventually get an apology from the manager, that apology took two days. I expected a lot more, in terms of service. Secondly, a hotel of this caliber should have rooms that are soundproof. We were on the 17th floor and could hear noise from Las Vegas Blvd when the drapes were open. There's probably nothing they can do now, but I hope that doesn't mean the construction is shoddy in other ways. And finally, as others have complained, there is no in-room coffee maker, even though there is a carafe to boil water and some tea bags. I don't buy the explanation that this is because of the Asian ambiance. And, as others have complained, charging anything for the Internet (much less $18/day) is a shameful practice for this level hotel. Taking all this into account, though, I must say that when I go back to Las Vegas this is the place I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Zen City Indeed”
Reviews.Author: BostonEsan
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Las Vegas and, this time, I got the hotel right! The level of service, decor, food and quality that the Mandarin Oriental delivers is second to none. Although, I enjoy the casinos, I don't enjoy living in them. This hotel smartly separates itself from the hustle and bustle of the rest of the city and focuses on the two things it does best- service and luxury. I took advantage of the Zen City Package over my stay, which provided an excellent value. If there wasn't such a large quality of rooms to fill in Las Vegas the prices at this fine establishment would most likely be four times the price I paid. While you are there don't forget to get a drink in their bar on the top level overlooking the strip and enjoy their excellent restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Sia C
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at a Casino hotel in Vegas again. After several visits to Vegas this is it for me. Rooms and service and staff attitude in the whole of this Oriental is the best ever. Management you should be proud of yourself. Breakfast and dinner are up there with the best. Thank you for the wonderful and very satisfying experience. You made me feel very welcome and safe as I spend some evenings on my own and had dinner on my own on the third floor as my husband was in a conference. Your are better than 5 stars. I felt like a princess in your beautiful room. Once again Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Review for the Tea Room”
Reviews.Author: marinasurferchick
Reviews.Content: This is a review for just the afternoon tea served in the tear room on the top floor. The best thing about this experience is the view. You can see the modern lines and rooftops of the City Center buildings, and a view of the strip that features the Paris hotel's balloon and Eiffel tower. The food: Above average. The scones are warm and delicious. The marmalade that comes with it is so good. The sandwiches were good. Some of the desserts, especially the chocolates were not so good. My tea was marginal. The service: I had crappy slow service. But I noticed some of the other tables had great service. So I guess it was inconsistent. For $40pp, it's worth it if you want to try something more girly, elegant, non-gaming with a great view. You can find better food and tea for a cheaper price in so many other cities. But it's Vegas, so enjoy if it's your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Definately should be #1 in Vegas !”
Reviews.Author: dbenamy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel and enjoyed every minute! Non Smoking property , incredible rooms and fantastic service, was at hotel 2 years ago when it opened and great to see many of the same staff. Hotel restaurant was also best hotel food I have experienced in the states. The Spa and workout facilities were also top notch ! No casino but only 5 minute walk to Aria! Also incredible value if you are using Amex Fine hotels and resorts for booking!

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and beautiful; top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: jpisha
Reviews.Content: This was the first MO hotel we had ever stayed at and I must say we were very impressed. My wife and I stayed here in late December of 2011 for three nights to get married. When I booked the reservation online I let them know that we were planning on getting married in the room in a small ceremony with a few friends and requested a high-floor suite with a great view. They delivered on this request and gave us a corner suite on the 21st floor. Views were great -- especially looking north up the Strip. The room was furnished impeccably, and was very technologically advanced -- all of the curtains, lighting and thermostat could be controlled using the TV remote. Service was extremely attentive, professional and courteous. The room service food we ordered while we and our friends had some cocktails before the ceremony was excellent. Also, the hotel sent us a bottle of Veuve and chocolate covered strawberries as part of the turn down service on our wedding night, as a gift. My wife and her friend spent the morning of our wedding in their spa which they both reported was heavenly. The lobby, restaurant and bar on the 23rd floor are achitecturally striking and very beautiful, all with jaw-dropping views. I also like this hotel's location in CityCenter -- it is just a short walk from all of the hustle and bustle of the Cosmopolitan, Belagio and other places on the strip, yet when at this hotel you feel that you are a world away in a land of serenity and relaxation. Extremely pleased we chose to get married here and highly recommend. Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the heart of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Minneapolis24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to relax and get away from the craziness that is the Las Vegas Strip (while still being totally central to all the action!). This hotel deserves it's top Trip Adivsor rating as it is a beautiful hotel, has a great location, and the staff are wonderful (not to mention a nightly turn-down service that is fabulous!). The concierge services were particularly nice and helpful and we had an all around great stay. The high tea they serve is also recommended. It was such a great experience to stay in a place with no noisy slot machines or smoke - we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStrawberry
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental Hotel is the best hotel I have ever stayed in, in Las Vegas! It is the perfect hotel from a single person to a single family. The breakfast, lunch and dinner is very good and tasty, everyday they have a different continents food. If you are a child, when you first check in to the hotel, they give you a surprise present, a t-shirt and a polarbear stuffed animal. The lobby is located on the 23rd floor and an elevator will take you to your rooms. This hotel is a non-casino (100% smoking) free relaxing getaway hotel. It has two pools, and adult pool area and one main hot tub jacuzzi. They have an excellent spa and excercise/yoga room. The bad thing about this hotel is that the halls connecting the pools, spa and excercise/yoga room is very dark and full of dark mirrors but otherwise this hotel is the best hotel in Las Vegas. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: cajungirl728
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Vegas and stayed at the Mandarin Oriental. The staff was so helpful and welcoming upon our arrival. I loved that this hotel didn't have a casino...that was a big positive for me. Vegas is fun but when i'm done, i'm done and it was nice to come back every night to serenity on the strip! The rooms are nice but the bathrooms are INCREDIBLE!!! I'll stay here every single time I'm back in Vegas. Thank you Madarin Oriental!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ldubeiws_12
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a non-smoking oasis in the chaos of Las Vegas. Service staff was excellent and attentive. If you've not had the pleasure of staying in the world's best hotel series, Mandarin Oriental, then this hotel is an ideal opportunity for you to experience the pleasure. Not one of its best but certainly heads and shoulders above the other hotels that we strolled through. The hotel is perfectly located in the City Center with access to Crystals, very fine high-end shopping (Gucci, Prada etc) and adjacent to Aria and the Cosmopolitan. Check-in is PAINLESS and rapid, no lines like cattle being moved through the market. This is another reason why I stayed here. Due to the configuration of the building rooms can be strangely angled and to some, small. We stayed in the Strip View Suite and was not nearly as large as our previous stay at another Mandarin however, it was very comfortable and inviting. Electronic wall and bedside controls for everything from shears, blackout curtains, lights and TV. The suite NEEDS better closets and I had to position my suitcase in the bar area. Breakfast in MOzen Bistro was very good however, plan on a leisurely meal as ALL service in Las Vegas is slower than in NYC. Meals can take quite a long time to be served. We enjoyed cocktails in the bar on the 23rd floor and staff service again was ideal but prices extravagant. A quick stop in this bar before our show for five of us, we had two Jameson's on rocks, one martini, two glasses of wine and it came to 104.00. The hotel of this caliber should attempt to have additional cars available for its guests convenience as taxi's and the hired limos can cost widely varying and expensive rates. The Mandarin Concierge is extremely attentive and friendly, excellent service from them as well. Definitely, I would stay here again and ONLY at this hotel as the other hotels such as Bellagio, Aria, Cosmopolitan etc are zoos. We strolled through Bellagio before their fountain show and the line to check-in was approx. 10 deep spanning the entire registration counters staffed with numerous check-in attendees.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Jerry K
Reviews.Content: After spending 8 days at a mediocre resort in Las Vegas, I transferred to the Mandarin Oriental. The contrast could not have been more significant. Our greeting/check-in, the room, the Tea Lounge -- everything was outstanding, and every desire anticipated. I only wish I had opportunity to stay longer. I will make every effort on my return visits to Las Vegas to ensure that this is the hotel I book, and will seek out other Mandarin properties as I travel.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit and still loving it.....”
Reviews.Author: Chililover
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the MO over New Year recently on our 3rd visit to this hotel. We usually stay over summer and love the pool but obviously at this time of the year that is not on the agenda. It was lovely to see several of the pool deck staff working around the hotel and to receive a personal greeting from them. As usual we took a strip view room, this time on the 19th floor, which offers a view of the mountains to the east, Planet Hollywood, Paris etc... We find the rooms to be of good size, extremely well appointed and the beds are so comfortable I could spend all day in them. Check in was quick and efficient even though we had a short wait for our room. The guys in the lower lobby are very friendly, always quick to offer advice and directions as well as procuring cabs in a timely manner. As we were not lounging around the pool we did not use the hotel for dining this time, there is an awful lot of choice at any budget right outside the door, Aria and Cosmo which are 5-10 minute walk both over a vast array of dining options and the Todd English Pub is a fun place to hang out. New Years Eve was a lot of fun, as we were out of the hotel for a function (Bridge Bash at NYNY) the security arrangements for keeping revellers at bay were very well handled on the night. Another great stay and we are counting down the days until we return.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental is my new Favorite in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl12
Reviews.Content: Truly an incredible experience. The service is stellar and the technology in the guestrooms is simply amazing. The bed was SO comfortable that I almost didn't want to leave but when I finally made myself leave the bed, I was delighted with the shower, bath amenities PLUS a TV in the mirror of the bathroom. There's also a lovely soaking tub that was a great relief for relaxing after a day of shopping and walking the Strip. Speaking of shopping, the hotel is adjacent to Crystals--and the shopping is simply incredible. Final words: SPA--best experience EVER TWIST--incredible dining with an amazing view of The Strip ROOM SERVICE -- fabulous especially since I loved the comfy bed so much. I highly recommend this hotel above all others in Las Vegas (and I've stayed in the best of the best)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, best in town”
Reviews.Author: Voilacestmoi
Reviews.Content: Although I have one remark: If you are in a hurry for business appointments in the morning you have to wait too long for breakfast. It is not a self service buffet, you order your breakfast and thats quite long. This is the only negative point for a business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and serenity, convenient to Vegas activity”
Reviews.Author: ActiveTraveler1
Reviews.Content: With no casino (100% non-smoking), a lobby located on the 23rd floor and an elevator you take down to get to your rooms, this is a very unique hotel. Quite frankly, it is one of the finest hotels I have stayed at in North America. Service is excellent. The spa is 'out of this world'. And, you have only to walk out your door to take advantage of all that Las Vegas has to offer. And, if you are unable to stay, at least come for their afternoon tea. As for the rooms, expect to utilize the automatic controls at your bedside for everything from the TV to temperature, curtains, etc. I found these controls easy to use...even the special 'wake up' function. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the room was spotlessly clean, and the bathroom was beautiful. There are only a few Mandarin Oriental's in the US, but due to the current economic situation, you may be able to find the most competitive pricing/specials at their Las Vegas location than elsewhere in the US. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Zen Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bumd168
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the BEST place I've stayed in Vegas. I really couldn't think of anything I would have changed. First off...it was my first time staying at City Center. I usually stay at the Wynn or Palazzo/Venetian, but the Mandarin is just pure luxury. Either that or I'm just getting old. But if you want to see mad drunkenness or coeds screaming at each other or vomiting in a lobby....then this hotel is not for you. If you want more of that "trashier" "no holes barred" Vegas experience, then you should stay at another hotel. Best of all, there was no smoking in the hotel, but if you wanted the more Vegas element or a casino....the Aria is only a 5 minute walk. Shopping is of course out of this world....5 minutes from the Crystals Shopping Center. Architecturally significant shopping mall....all luxe European goods can be found there. Check out the Assouline bookstore for a very nice collection of books. The service is extremely discreet, and you are not in a MOB of customers. Even the entrance is extremely discreet. There are no 45 minute lines for taxi cabs which can be annoying. Valet parking is extremely efficient. The valets address you by name, ask if you are planning on leaving again for the evening, and it seems your car is ALWAYS there and ready to be driven, and you aren't waiting for a long time for your car to get picked up and brought to the front. Sky lobby is gorgeous....views of the strip, and the bar view is also out of this world! All things you would expect out of a Mandarin Oriental. The receptionist escorts you to the elevator. Lots of personal touches. The concierge helped us book restaurants, and helped us with changes when our party size grew bigger. I stayed in a standard room on a high floor with American Express Platinum Program; so room came with early check in; late check out; free breakfast, and also a spa certificate. Plenty of technology in the room. Everything from the lights to curtains to billing could be operated through the television. I guess the one thing I could say is that the lighting was a little more difficult to figure out...since there were many different ways to turn them on/off. Twice turn down service.....Flower petal left on bathtub. Real orchid in bathroom. Water at bedside at night. All reminiscent of the Mandarin Oriental hotels in Asia. The spa is also very beautiful....very relaxing also. Can't say enough about the hotel. Real 5 star service. Beautiful room. Zen Vegas experience. And if you want a lot of excitement (along with the cigarettes and drunken tourists)....well that's only 5 minutes walk away!

Reviews.Title: “True class. Nothing comes close in vegas”
Reviews.Author: ASMULREADY
Reviews.Content: I start this review by stating that the start of my stay wasn't at all good, yet it ended so well this hotel gets full marks. Has anyone ever noticed that the air con systems in all Vegas hotels are hopeless? If you are like me, I like a cool/cold room to sleep in. That's just me. Unless the room is 65 or lower, I just can't sleep. So, the first night the aircon basically didn't cool below 72 and i had about 20 mins sleep.The room was so large that the temp in the bathroom was more like 85. I spoke to the duty manager the next day, quite distressed as you can imagine, and raised the issue. At the end of the day, this is the only true 5 star hotel in Vegas and the guest should be able to have the room at whatever temp they want, yes? Long story short, the hotel admitted that the system won't really cool below 70, and they then went out of their way to make me happy. Upgraded me to a suite and they had the techs do something funky to the system in this room to keep it at around 60. Keep in mind is Vegas and every other hotel would do nothing. I have had the same problem at both the Wynn and bellagio, so as mentioned this problem is not unique. Both of those places told me the issue was mine, and the systems are fine. The staff proved to me why mandarin oriental are a class act. They even sent me chocolate biscuits, a fruit platter and a 'sorry' card. Great service negates any other issues in my view. However, if you are like me and like to sleep in a cool/cold room, beware, the whole town has a problem as they all use small, inadequate systems.

Reviews.Title: “Much needed Oasis”
Reviews.Author: LadyBarballard
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas on a number of occasions and I have to say that this was the first time I have stayed in the Mandarin Oriental and it was one of the highlights of my stay. It is an absolute oasis in the original city of sin and a peaceful retreat away from the bright lights and constant noise of Vegas. My room was incredible and the service was second to none, I couldn't rate it highly enough. If you want to be immersed in Vegas then this might not be the hotel for you, however if you want the possibility to escape it then this is the place to go. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Mandarin Oriental is now an annual event.”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Mandarin Oriental, Las Vegas. Again, my stay was over Christmas (now an annual event), this time for three nights which were on December 23, 24, and 25. I used the Zen City Getaway deal which is a pay for two nights get the third free, deal. This time I stayed in a CityScape Suite ($425/night for two nights with the third free). These Suites are located on the west side of the building in the corner closest to Aria. Again, I took advantage of the “Breakfast-In-Bed” option and pre-arranged Breakfast Christmas morning in my suite for $25 plus tax. Usually the cost is about $42, so this is a recommended amenity you can order when making your reservation. While there are some negatives that I have been reading lately, I have never experienced what I have been reading. No loud plumbing during my stays. In fact, just the opposite, it was nice quiet and restful. No rude staff, just the opposite. Every single encounter with staff, be it at the front desk, in the restaurant, MOzen, the cleaning people or the laundry delivery, or even at the Salon, would end with the staff saying “Is there anything else I can do for you?” This is not an exaggeration, it really is what they said, all of them. All highly skilled and well trained. Check-in of course is on the top floor of the hotel before it turns into condos, the 23rd floor. Above the 23rd floor are the condos. Check-in time is 3:00 just like every hotel in Vegas. Last time my room was ready at 11:30. This time my lodging was not ready until around 2:30. I had an appointment scheduled for 1:00 at the salon for a haircut and checked with the front desk before going to the salon. They were going to give me another Suite because mine was not yet ready just before 1:00. I insisted that they not go to any trouble and that we could stick with the Suite they had set aside for me. As I found out later, this was to my advantage. I had made my reservations back in June and the Suite I was scheduled to occupy was the highest floor for a CityScape Suite, the 19th floor. In fact, the Suite was 1935. Thus, I received the best view possible for the Suite I chose. I received a phone call when the suite was ready (about 2:30) and grabbed my luggage from my brother's room in the Monte Carlo and proceeded to a quick and painless check-in. The Suite is described as 1,040 sq ft. It has a separate living area from the bedroom (see pictures). I really enjoyed the extra space. The bed was ever so comfortable as it was in the Premier Room I had last year. The MO is a true family hotel with not only three channels (CN, DC & Nick) for children, but also HBO and Cinemax channels as well as many HD channels that the other standard hotels will not give you. As mentioned, I got a haircut at the salon. Cost was the highest I’ve paid on the strip, $80. Usually costs are about $50 (Monte Carlo and Mirage). I’ve stayed at the MO in Manila and Jakarta so I was expecting a little bit more than just a haircut, like perhaps trimming ear hairs, or maybe a little scalp message, but that did not happen. For men, I recommend getting your haircut at KimVo in the Mirage and saving $30. I make no comment about what women get at the solon because all that business is another language to me, LOL! I had a wonderful breakfast at MOzen. I recommend you get a side of waffle with your breakfast. It is delicious. I also enjoyed coffee at the little coffee take out area which is open until I think 10 AM or so. There is a water boiler in the room with tea provided. Hint: I bring some instant Starbucks coffee with my own sweetener and creamer to get me out of bed in the morning. If you are so inclined it can really help to get you out of bed so you can get down to breakfast. Here’s another little hint to get you in and out of the hotel faster. You can take the elevator down to the 3rd floor and then you can go around the corner and continue in the lobby elevator to the entrance. You can do the reverse to avoid going out of your way to the 23rd floor lobby to get to your room. There were carols sung by a local school choir (or at least that’s who I thought it was I did not ask I know, shame on me) in the lobby. It was a really nice touch and they were really good. Last year “Santa” put a stocking on my door Christmas Eve, but this year that did not happen. I missed that treat. Next Christmas, I will put the stocking I received last year on my door and we’ll see what happens. I meant to bring it this year, but forgot it at home on my table when I headed out the door. Consider yourself warned MO! Yes, I’m still a kid at heart. Now let’s talk about something serious. While I was there, there was no Resort Fee, so I incurred an $18/day internet fee. The fee supports up to 4 devices. I use my laptop and my ipod. If I stay at a hotel that charges a resort fee, the internet is included. If I stay at a hotel that does not charge a resort fee, like any of the Caesar’s properties, I get two internet charges for about $28. The MO internet fee is a bargain compared to any of Caesar’s properties. With the above said, I noted during my stay that the MO website now says that they will start charging a Resort fee beginning January 1. Other than Caesar’s properties, every Vegas hotel on the strip charges a Resort Fee including the Four Seasons. This Resort fee is being called a “Golden Access Fee” and the rate is $24. It will include Wired and Wireless Internet access, Fitness & Wellness Center access including scheduled yoga or Pilates classes, Morning coffee or tea from 6am–8am (I assume this will be in the lobby from a cart or from the coffee shop in front of MOzen), telephone calls, a paper, and overnight shoe shine services. Consider yourself warned! In my opinion, I’d rather see this just be included in the room rate, but I’ve already become accustomed to adding Resort Fees and internet fees to Room charges when comparing hotel costs. Mandarin Oriental, look for me again next Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dewtrell
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for a short 24-hour trip to Vegas. Being from L.A., Vegas is like our backyard, so I've been many times and have stayed at many hotels but I am partial to the Wynn, which is my go-to place to stay but can be pricey particularly on the weekend, and usually splitting the cost with friends. This time I was on my own meeting a friend, who was on a family vacation from across the Pond, for an evening. At the last minute, a great deal for $250 appeared on Expedia for the Mandarin and I quickly booked. I have stayed at the Mandarian Oriental Kahala (now Kahala Hotel) in Oahu a few years ago, so I was familiar with the level of customer service and luxury amentities which did not disappoint. Marina, the front desk manager, was extremely pleasant and checked me in quickly: however, I was slightly disappointed with the view. When I got to my room, I had a view overlooking the pool (NICE) but also the parking lot for the Aria Resort (weird), and a partial view of the Monte Carlo pool (ugly): however, reading the reviews I was glad to be on this side of the resort rather than the Strip because it was quiet. I think the issue is that this is one huge complex with 3 major hotels in one small area, However, for me, this is rather minor when there is a fantastic room and pool. Unless one has the pleasure of staying in a high roller suite, the rooms at the Mandarian Oriental are just flawless and luxurious, even for Vegas standards. The rooms are large, the quality is that of the Peninsula chain. There is a large sitting area with a love seat and desk, floor to ceiling windows, a very comfortable bed, and the bathroom is second to none. At the end of the night, I used the deep soaking tub with the free bath salts, nice. TV was very easy to figure out and MP3 player with great sound. I did not want to leave my room. My friend came to hang, so we just relaxed by the pool for most of the afternoon. There are 3 pool areas, decent size but not the huge Vegas type resort pools, just classy and rather serene. We didn't hit the pool until about 1PM and there were plenty of lounge chairs, wait staff was plentiful, they even came around and handed out free jrefreshing slushes, juices and water. The pool menu could use some improvement, it's a bit too healthy (spa-like) and a bit too Asian-centric, I'd like a plate of nachos or something. We ordered some bruschetta and cocktails. When I wanted just a plate of french fries (not on the menu), the kitchen whipped it up for us, free of charge. What is not free of charge is parking, and that is one reason why I took off a star. For me, parking is huge and most Vegas hotels to do charge for parking, this is the first time I've come across this. In addition, I don't know if it's because of the hotel location, but there's not alot of stuff going on at Aria or Cosmopolitan, so there are not a lot of cabs. When we tried to get a cab to go out for dinner, the valets just sort of stood there, and there was no define area on where to wait for a cab until someone came up to us - it took about 10 minutes to get a cab and we were not waiting in a line either. So, the hotel needs to work on this as everyone takes cabs in Vegas. Overall, a pleasant and quiet stay. While I still prefer the Wynn, the Mandarin is a solid second choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good high-end hotel, but at this price was expecting more.”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MO-LV for 3 nights during Xmas 2011 for a family reunion. At that time, it was Tripadvisor's top rated hotel in Las Vegas and as far as I can tell - the most expensive hotel in Las Vegas as well. For that reason, I'm going to be extra-picky in my review. There's no casino at this hotel, so it's very quiet, almost too quiet in the public spaces. There's only 2 restaurants in the hotel - the fine-dining restaurant for dinner and the more casual place for breakfast/lunch/dinner. That's in contrast to the other big hotels in town with ~10 restaurants. The bell-hops are very friendly and were good at answering my questions. A downside is that there is no self-parking at this hotel, only at the adjacent Aria hotel. Another negative is that that the only car entrances are on the strip so you'll be stuck in traffic for at least a couple of blocks. There are no car entrances on the side streets. The ground level entrance only has a small sitting area and the elevators to the main lobby on the 23rd floor. When you get out of the elevator, you face a dramatic ground to ceiling geometric wall installation. The main lobby on the 23rd floor has a nice view of the strip, but its also not large. There are a few sitting areas between the check-in area and their cocktail lounge. They serve you a cup of special tea during check-in. The tea was tasty but I felt the service wasn't particularly engaging. The guest rooms are actually below the lobby so you take another elevator down to your room. That's one negative - to get outside you need to take 2 elevators - one up to the lobby & then another down to ground level. I got a standard room with a view of the strip.The view was so-so, it was definitely of the strip - looking at the Crystals mall, Paris Hotel & Planet Hollywood hotel. But it wasn't facing the more interesting spectacles like Bellagio or Treasure Island. As expected, it's a very nice room with high-tech controls for the lights, drapery, weather information, room bills, etc. - on the touch-screen pad next to the bed and the flat-panel TV. The decor is in dark wood, creme colored wallpaper and cocoa-colored fabrics. The headboard of the bed was this curtain made of jade-like pieces. Neat. The bed was very comfortable. There are nice robes & slippers, as expected of an Asian-influenced hotel. The flat-panel TV had a lot of HD channels which is good. Below the TV is both a stocked mini-bar as well as a stocked mini-fridge. Two sides of booze. The bathroom was even better done with beige striped marble used through-out. A large soaking tub in the middle, dual vanity sinks, the shower & toliet behind their own glass doors. There's the obligatory small TV in the mirror. One trend that I wish would go away are the peek-a-boo windows which allow somebody in the bedroom to look into the bathroom. The bathroom was of good size, while the bedroom size was just average, which is to say smaller than I expected for the price. Again, this is the most expensive hotel in Las Vegas, so I expected more. By the front of the door are the closets and an alcove for you to open your luggage. A very fancy gimmick is that the extra pillows are in beautiful Japanese-style boxes. There's large safe in one of the drawers here. The neatest thing in the room was what they called the "valet closet". This was a small closet in which the room service person could place items into your room from OUTSIDE in the hallway through a separate locked valet door. Through this valet door they could place new towels or your dry-cleaning without entering your room. Super cool, I hate having to wait for somebody to come to the room! Another cool thing is that when I opened the front door for the first time, the window drapes opened automatically to show me the view of the strip. Unfortunately I didn't check if that could be programmed to happen every time I walked into the room. But there were slight disappointments as well: * bedroom smaller than I expected * the view was only OK * the front desk service was nothing special * no self-parking Competent 5-star hotel, but it didn't blow my socks off...

Reviews.Title: “Choose the Four Seasons Instead”
Reviews.Author: wired4travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas on our last four trips, but decided to try the Mandarin for a three-night stay based on the positive feedback we read on Trip Advisor. We booked a Mandarin Premier Room which was advertised as having a "commanding view of the famed Strip". Upon arrival, we were told our room was being upgraded to a junior suite and were given the keys to a 6th floor room that had a view of the driveway for Aria and the bottom of every building in the City Center complex. We immediately called the front desk and were moved to a suite on the 12th floor with a view East to the Polo Towers and the mountains beyond. The view of the Strip was of below average quality and a far cry from the "commanding view" advertised on the Mandarin website. The main view which was East included the Hawaiian Marketplace, the Polo Towers, the Travel Lodge and a McDonalds. The room was of average quality for a 5-Star hotel. The drywall was cracked above the shower and the wood floors were scratched and stained. I wish we had read the review of December 28th 2011 before heading to Las Vegas because it was right on. The construction quality is average and the walls are paper-thin. The worst part of our stay was Sunday night when the Hawaiian Marketplace across the street blasted music into the Strip which reverberated through the concrete and steel of the City Center between midnight and 3am. Although we had earplugs in, we could still hear the heavy drums and singing. At 1:30am, we had had enough and called the front desk. At 2:30am we were given a second "sleeping room" on the opposite side of the building so that we could have some peace an quiet for an early morning flight. Needless to say, it was an awful nights sleep for what has been described on Trip Advisor as an "oasis of calm" from the madness of Las Vegas. Not true. Upon checkout, we spoke with the front desk manager Marina who upon learning about our situation was gracious and removed our room charge for Sunday night. She was empathetic and was a bright spot in our stay. Overall, The Mandarin is at best a glorifed "The Hotel". It is not a 5-star hotel and is not in the same league as the Four Seasons. Stay at the Four Seasons for a real oasis of calm in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rosscopcotrain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at MO for 11 nights over the Christmas and New Year period of 2011. Our original booking was for 4 nights in a Strip View Suite but we extended to a further 7 nights once we realised how great a hotel this was, we wanted to treat ourselves and relax whilst also being able to enjoy what Vegas can offer and the MO was perfect for this. The service there is second to none, you get treated fantastically. The MO is so close to the strip yet you could be a million miles away when you are in the hotel as it is so serene and relaxed. It was a great place to chill and get away from it all but with the added bonus of being a 1 minute walk from the strip if we wanted to get out and about. The Strip View Suite was fantastic and comprised of a lounge area, bedroom, bathroom and small walk in wardrobe area. All of this is arranged in a corner suite so we also had fantastic views of the north and south of the strip. After 4 nights in the suite we moved to a Premier room for 7 nights as there was no availability in the Strip View Suite for our extended booking dates. The premier room is a more conventional hotel room in terms of shape (rectangular) but as with the suite the decor, bed and finish to the room and bathroom was impeccable. As we were relaxing we used the in room dining option for breakfast and dinner on many occasions - the food was fantastic and it was certainly the best room service food we had ever had by a country mile. The menu had a great selection of Thai, Indian and American food and it was all to a very high standard. We also had a few drinks in the Mandarin bar which has huge floor to ceiling windows and great views of the Strip from the 23rd floor, the cocktails were fantastic and the best we had in Vegas. On NYE we had dinner in Mozen bistro - again the food was great. We then went to the 23rd floor where the lobby had been transformed into a bar where you could get a glass of champagne and watch the crowds below on the strip and the fireworks at midnight through the huge windows. A great experience. All the staff at the MO were happy and personable and every single one provided a very high level of service which was better than any other we have experienced at other 5 star establishments in different parts of the world. We also enjoyed a 3 hour massage and treatment session in a private Spa Suite which was amazing and very relaxing after a long old year. This cost a bit but it was a fantastic experience and I would recommend it to anyone. The general spa area was also very good. Compared to other Vegas hotels this certainly isn't the cheap option but in my opinion it is worth every single penny. Overall this is the best hotel I have stayed at - highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, luxurious and close to the attractions”
Reviews.Author: cdsukGuildford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in late December. We can't say enough about how much we enjoyed this hotel! We specifically picked this hotel since it did not have a casino and night club. It is very close to the main attractions (right on the strip) but it is quiet and relaxing when you are in the hotel. We had a premier room on the 19th floor which was huge and had a fantastic view. The room had every modern amenity such as touch screen controls for the TV, blinds, temperature etc. We ate lunch twice in the bistro restaurant and the food was excellent. My husband loved the lobster bisque soup which was a special on the first day. The staff were so accommodating that they offered to make it especially for him the next day even though it was not on the menu. The cocktail bar is on the 23rd floor and has great views of the strip. I used the fitness center which was spacious and had all the most modern equipment. We had a small problem with WiFi connectivity on one of our iPhones and when we checked out we were told that all internet charges were removed from our bill. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at this hotel. We have travelled extensively in the US and this was by far the best value and service.

Reviews.Title: “What a Beauty!”
Reviews.Author: Principissimo
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is an incredible town and hotel there tend to be too big and too busy. Mandarin is not. It is a regular hotel and, moreover, it does not have a casino inside: this helps reducing confusion. Being a new hotel everything is clean and perfect. Rooms, typical in LV, are of a good size and with good views of the town. It is on the main road and you can walk everywhere! Breakfast if far too expensive: have it outside! There's a very nice gym and pool.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful”
Reviews.Author: iandeneitz
Reviews.Content: very well situated. expensive meals but fantastic breakfasts. no coffe in the room because (they say) instant coffee does not meet their standard. probably the best hotel I have stayed at. No shuttle from airport. the lobby is on the 23rd floor which keeps out the din of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional, in every way”
Reviews.Author: TheTub
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April 2011 (should have written a review sooner). The hotel is located towards the mid-southern end of the Strip, in the new CityCenter complex, in front of the Aria and adjacent to the Cosmopolitan. I’d say this is the best location in Las Vegas – surrounded by new developments rather than ageing monoliths. The moment you walk-in the driveway, let alone step through the doors or take the lift up to reception on the 23rd floor (with stunning views), you feel as if you’ve entered an oasis of calm in the madness that is Las Vegas (the hotel is non-gaming). Everything, and I mean everything, is absolutely pitch-perfect: service, décor, room, food (did not try Gagnaire’s outpost – the menu seemed a bit schizophrenic - but breakfast at the Mozen Bistro and lunch at the pool café’ were very good indeed), the pool area, they all ooze ultra-luxury without a hint of crassness or overstatement. I normally write longer reviews, but there is really nothing to fault on this one. Without a doubt, the best city hotel, and room, I have ever stayed at/in. At $400/500ish a night, it is not cheap for Las Vegas standards (where you can get lavish rooms in some of the gaming resorts for much, much less). In fact, it probably is one of the most expensive options in town, if not the most expensive. However, considering that it is a non-gaming hotel (and therefore cannot use the gaming revenues to subsidise room rates) and the fact that if it were located in any other major US/European city, you’d probably have to pay double for comparable quality, the Mandarin Las Vegas is an absolute steal. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else. P.S. In case you had any doubts, the gaming places, even the new top end ones, do feel like circuses.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great quality - no equal in Vegas. Being a non casino hotel there is no cheap thrill or attaraction to the hotel other than being in the hear of the strip. It is quiet and elegant and meets the standards set by the chain worldwide. Great room (I have a strip view), good facilities, comfortable and quiet. Food and service for breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Property”
Reviews.Author: lms0001
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that if you're looking for a traditional Las Vegas experience, do not stay here. However, if you've had enough of that and want to escape to a serene, first class resort that is still in the heart of the strip, you've got to try this place. Even before we stepped one foot on this City Center property, the staff went out of its way to get to know our needs and preferences. Then, during our entire stay, we were greeted warmly and by name. The room was spacious, clean, nicely decorated, and equipped wth the latest technology. Everthing was operated by remote control, including the lights, curtains, thermostat and televisions. We loved awakening to the alarm that slowly opened the curtains, raised the lights, and turned the television to a sunrise beach scene. Housekeeping serviced the room twice a day, including turn-down service complete with flower petals. I regret not making it to the spa, but the pool area was very nice and not crowded. The poolside menu also was excellent, though a little pricey. However, the friendly staff circulated quite often with complimentary smoothies and frozen fruit. At the end of the day, I was thrilled to walk through the property without hearing the clang of slot machines and everything else that goes with casinos. I admit that my husband thought the place might have been a little too peaceful, but it was a short walk to the malls, restaurants, and casinos of the neighboring properties. We booked the room directly with the hotel during a promotion and received three nights for the price of two. That resulted in an exceptional price for an exceptional property.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LAMN8R
Reviews.Content: I've just finished a short stay at the Mandarin Oriental, Las Vegas and am pleased to provide a positive review of the hotel. The property is reasonably well located - although dodgy shops and eateries across the road make it look like you're in anonymous suburbia somewhere, rather on one of the most famous and busiest strips in the world. The fitout is typical MO - excellent. Top marks for the "valet box" and dressing area. Service is very good, although not quite as good as the Landmark Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong. What I liked best...when you enter the lobby it's serene and calm. As opposed to the chaotic noisy mess that marks many of the other hotel/casino lobbies in other Vegas properties.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before Believing the Hype”
Reviews.Author: BIRC0014
Reviews.Content: I can’t help but make this personal, I had a terrible experience both during my stay and dealing with the administration after the fact. Generally, if I don’t feel an experience lived up to expectation I chalk it up in the loss column and move on. However, the great thing about this site is (usually) the reviews help avoid making too many Xs on the wrong side of the page. (Bored already?? Scroll to the bottom that pretty well says it all!) With this in mind I booked a week at the "Top Rated" Mandarin for my 30th, let’s start with the fact my GPS was stolen from baggage check at the front desk (this was after we left our luggage with the desk because the room wasn't ready). When we finally got into the room we were greeted with a urine stained toilet seat, suspiciously spotted glass, and gunky counter and fixture surfaces. The 'zen' view included parking structures, commercial rooftops, the back of a few casinos, and of course a rollercoaster just far enough away to make more annoying than interesting. We asked for a clean room and were 'upgraded' to the strip view room, this little beauty included torn bed sheets, holes in the pillowcases, perpetual cooking smell, and a dirty streaked view of the strip mall across the boulevard. True you can make out the strip if you kink your neck sideways and smoosh your face into the aforementioned glass but unless you were looking for petri dish samples I wouldn’t recommend it. We didn't spot any dried fluids this time so between the jet lag and dwindling dinner reservations decided to settle. After a few days of note passing with the maids we got a reasonably clean room and the sheets and cases were replaced. The interesting thing was how the staff handled the initial complaint, over the next two days they twice referred to our issue as having a 'problem with the view' I wasn't in Vegas to fight so figured lesson learned next time I stay at the Wynn. Now the fun stuff, as for the missing GPS I assumed (despite stacking it with my battery charger, phone charger, ipod charger, and other electronic odds and ends in my carry on) I left it behind at home when I went looking for it and couldn't locate it at the hotel. When I got home and retraced my steps I realized the GPS was in the bag which only left my side during the time it was checked..... I contacted the hotel and made it clear that theft was the tipping point and provided a summary of the points above. In a word their response was underwhelming...first type of complaint...cleanliness below usual standard....hotel engineer says 'cooking smells' not possible....theft under investigation.....and the icing? Offer for a complimentary one night stay in a 'strip view' room so I can enjoy the 'true Mandarin experience' HAHAHA This was direct from the GM after taking a week to respond and then explaining neither of my email addresses worked (despite having received a response from two other members of his staff) I figured he could have taken the three minutes to check before sticking his foot in his mouth. Axe to grind? Only with over priced sub standard accommodation that would have trouble passing itself off as a 'world class five star spa' in the outskirts of Mogadishu. The only thing worse than knowing I could have stayed at the Four Seasons or Wynn for the same price is knowing I spent the equivalent of a weeks stay on cocktails at the hotel bar and could have walked out and got a cleaner room at Circus Circus instead.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable and then even better yet”
Reviews.Author: yanasim
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel we've ever stayed at! The attention to detail at MO is amazing, there is nothing they haven't thought of, and the level or service is of the absolute highest standard. The rooms are beautiful and equipped with everything you could possibly need: from a hair straightener and a box with all possible chargers and adapters to the perfectly stocked mini-bar and yoga mats and DVDs in case you want to properly relax (not that we did any yoga ourselves, but we were only there for 1 night). It is truly an oasis of peace and tranquility in the center of crazy Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: 1GuyNamedJoe
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky when it come to hotels. The MO exceeded my expectations. My only issues were that we request ice one night and it was never delivered, not enough hangers, no chocolates with the turn down service, and we ran out of shampoo. Small things but it's the small things that make or break a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A W E S O M E”
Reviews.Author: CavalierSPICE
Reviews.Content: 5 star everything. A total oasis from the smoke and gambling of the strip, yet perfectly located within the action.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-worth the great ranking. It's in the heart of the strip in the new City Center area (Mandarin Oriental, Aria, & The Cosmopolitan). The great thing about the M.O., though, is that there is no casino so you can do all of your gambling and shopping at other places and then come back to the M.O. and get away and relax. From the moment you pull up, the extremely friendly and helpful bellhops take care of your bags for you. You check-in on the 23rd floor with an amazing view of the strip. The desk workers and the concierge were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean, stylish, and modern. The fitness/spa center was excellent. All of the extra attention the put into the "little details" is what makes the experience over-the-top. Even after we left, they were amazing. Nine hours after we checked out, my wife realized she had left her necklace in the bathroom of our room. I called the hotel and they sent a member of security to the room. They immediately called me back to tell me that a member of housekeeping had found the necklace and turned it into security. They mailed the necklace back to us.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental Tea Room”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLColeman
Reviews.Content: Open from 2:30 - 7:00, on the 23rd floor $40.00 per person and absolutely worth the money! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could recommend it... but we had lots of issues”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: The M.O. Vegas is obviously a favorite on this site... it's the #1 Vegas Hotel on TripAdvisor. Due in part to this, we decided to stay here instead of the Wynn Encore for a Vegas trip this holiday season. I was curious about it... not anymore. I loved the Mandarin in Honolulu (the late Kahala M.O.) and really like the Mandarins in NY and Miami. This Mandarin falls short. The hotel, located on the edge of the City Center project (a disappointment in itself) is really rather stunning inside -- the lobby and lobby bar on the 23rd floor are especially beautiful. Most of the service (with the exception of the greeters... who usually just ignored us when we came out) was great... really great. The Female Front Desk Clerk (from Sherman Oaks!) was the best. The elevator greeter/security guy was extremely nice, as was the bellhop who brought up our bags. (Note: They actively try to discourage you from bringing up your bags yourself by telling you your room's not quite ready... that way they can hold your bag for you, which means they tag it and have it delivered). The bag thing was annoying, but here are the bigger problems... most of which stem from the fact this luxury tower was poorly constructed (remember, the 30 story Harmon "Hotel" in the same complex is uninhabitable due to mistakes in building and will probably be torn down). Issue #1. The plumbing is Motel 6 loud. The impressively huge two-person soaking tubs (which people like to use late at night) have speedy tub fillers that are EXTREMELY loud. So loud they WILL wake you up. And up. And up... because the bathers upstairs will keep refilling it. Issue #2. The walls are THIN. Very thin. I could hear the TV next door pretty well. Traffic noise from the Strip is also noticeable, as this hotel's top floor is the 23rd (Condos are on top of the tower). Issue #3. The A/C didn't work properly. Either too hot (70) or too cold (65). It would not hold any temps in between. We didn't bother calling the front desk about any of these things... it was 2 AM and at that point, the ship had sailed. A good night's sleep was not in the cards. As for the room itself, our first impression was GREAT. Really generously sized. Extremely elegant (except for several semi-nudes of Asian women either framed as wall art or used as screens... all the decor skewed a little too Asian... yes, I know this is an Asian chain... but it felt like the room had Vegas theme which was "China 2012!"). Very good bed. Unfortunately, lots of computerized lighting and temperature switches and control panels... which were cool but extremely hard (but not impossible) to figure out. All fluorescent lighting means no dimmers. Room and bathroom was either BRIGHT or not. I did, however, love the large dressing area/closet/suitcase area by the front. The views are not great. I shudder to think what the least expensive category rooms look at... (the parking garage?). We were given an upgrade... which was nice (it has the same view as the formal restaurant)... but what you look at is the Hawaiian Marketplace and the Travelodge across the street, rather than the Strip itself. Kind of sad to face. Avoid the room service at all (high) costs. Extremely friendly on the phone and in person, but the food was seriously subpar and (predictable) expensive. The food quality seems to be a problem at every M.O. I've stayed at. Glad we packed a big container of Tums. There is no gift shop. Some other potential issues. The pool is closed for the winter. The whole WINTER? Really? How can this be at a 5 star hotel? Also, self-parking doesn't exist. You have to park at the Aria self parking garage and drag your bags about a mile unless you want to valet park. Another thing. You can't check out on the TV. So you have to wait on the phone (a long time) to leave. Overall, I was really hoping to love this place and leave feeling like I had a great Vegas vacation. We left feeling like we'd just spent the weekend at Guangzhou's (second) best hotel. With our problems, our poor night's sleep and their come hither Asian nudes, I can't recommend staying here on its own merits. Do stop by for a drink at night in the bar and enjoy some of the design details. You'll experience the best of the hotel that way. I personally missed the Wynn Encore's sense of cutting-edge Vegas elegance and glamour. Starting with Bellagio, Steve Wynn made high-end Vegas what it is today. So next year, it's back up the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not-so-hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: avgfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that I normally don't write reviews...but feel obliged since I relied on other peoples' reviews when planning our recent trip to Vegas. From the first minute at check-in (there was NO line up at 3pm) to the last minute after check-out (valet giving us driving directions), our stay was excellent. There are so many positives that you have to get past the few seconds it takes to switch elevators to get in & out of the hotel...once you walk out the door (nicely tucked away & was very peaceful), you are approximately 25 yards from The Strip, (and less than 1 minute away from CVS 24-hour Pharmacy, which came in really handy considering we had 2 boys). Gambling wasn't a priority (luxury and peace was), but I did manage to visit Aria's casino, which is right next door. We have stayed at Palazzo, Encore and Bellagio before (they were all excellent), but Mandarin exceeded our expectations. Wife really enjoyed the spa. We rarely had to wait more than 5 seconds for an elevator, and getting our car from valet was never an issue as the car was always there, whether we called ahead when leaving our room or having valet offer to leave the car in front when we were back to the hotel for an hour or less (just to change clothes or whatever). All staff was excellent - felt like they were truly glad to have us as guests. We stayed in a Strip-View Room for a night, then moved to a Strip-View Suite for the next night (yes, it was a pre-planned "treat")...both could not have been better - I did not notice anything negative, as far as cleanliness goes. In my opinion, currently THE BEST place to stay in Vegas !!! Best Wishes & Good Luck in Vegas !

Reviews.Title: “A ruined birthday”
Reviews.Author: Karramba
Reviews.Content: I write reviews very seldom, only when experience is extremely good or extremely bad. Unfortunately with Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas it is the latter. If this it a #1 hotel in Vegas, I don't know where to start. HUGELY overrated will probably be a good place to begin. We came here to celebrate my birthday and it was completely ruined. As it turns out, their swimming pool is closed for winter - no information about this on their website. I need to swim daily due to my back problems, and a swiiming pool is an essential we always check for a hotel to have. They did say we can use the pool in Aria (10min walk), but when my husband went to check, he was told that we cannot use their pool. It was only the next morning that Mandarin confirmed again that we can use Aria's pool. The matrass is very soft - we assumed that Mandarin Oriental will follow the Asian practice and have firm matrass, which (again) is needed for my back. They could not change it to any firmer options for us, which meant back pains and a poor sleep at night. They don't have a buffet breakfast, it is only available during weekends. This is the first time a hotel that claims to be 5* has the only option of a la carte bfast - and I've travelled to nearly 40 countries and stayed in MANY hotels. We were told to wait 30min just to be seated for bfast (on my birthday...) And the internet is not complementary, it is 18 USD per day. Although I booked a Spa treatment for tomorrow morning, I will probably cancel it was we most likely will move to another hotel for our final night here.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jajd123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, during our overall 14 night stay in Las Vegas. We got the lift on the ground floor to reception which is on the 23rd floor, check in was efficient and we were allocated a room on the 7 floor, so we had to get another lift down to that floor. The room was pure luxury, with a large bathroom area with superb furnishings and a LCD TV in the mirror so you can watch it in the bath if you wish ! As the hotel is geared towards making sure guests are disturbed as little as possible, there is also a valet cupboard which enables you to leave shoes, laundrey etc. There is also a seperate area with plenty of wardrobe and drawer space for clothes with a large safe in the top drawer for valuables. The hotel also has a small outside area with a pool and sun loungers etc which looked nice although it was too hot to sit in the sun. Back to the room ! The curtains, TV, air conditioning is all centrally controlled via the TV itself or a touch screen remote control by the side of your bed. The TV also had mood music and pictures which was lovely and enhanced our experience of this beautiful hotel. We had a couple of drinks at the bar on the 23rd floor which has spectacular views of the strip and had breakfast in the room which was very sumptuous and kept us going until the evening ! Something to note is that the hotel does not have a casino and also has a strict non-smoking policy - great for us non-smokers but not for others. This hotel is absolute luxury and some people may (as previous reviews have stated) feel slightly overwhelmed by the opulance, but we loved it and the experience gave us yet more memories of this fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the madness of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Samuiteacher
Reviews.Content: Thank God for the Mandarin Oriental! We went to Vegas for 2 days more as sightseers rather than party gamblers and purposefully chose the mandarin as it doesn't have a casino! Vegas is totally mad and expensive! The first night we ate in the hotel's brassiere, the food was fantastic but the bill was a bit of a shock at the end! The hotel however, is beautiful and worth the extra money! The bar is gorgeous, staff great and the rooms anazing! The bed is super super comfy and the bath heaven! Vegas wasn't really our cup of tea in the end and was glad to leave! If it hadn't been for the Mandarin oriental I think we would have left earlier!

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: ellasahar
Reviews.Content: The few tiny glitches (broken tub drain, for example) were fixed promptly and the little room touches (rose petal on the towel on the tub) were elegant. The concierge gave me some mis-information on a church service (yes, even in Vegas) which caused me to arrive almost an hour early. Amusing that he also strongly suggested a cab for what would've been a mile mid-day walk. Perhaps I was looking fragile that day. Didn't try the restaurants but did receive a beautiful cupcake for our anniversary. Even nicer was the desk calling out "Happy anniversary" as we walked through the lobby. That was impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: trishsen
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at. It has excellent service and beautiful modern rooms with fantastic bathrooms. One negative aspect was having to go to the sky lobby to access the elevators to the rooms and to get back to ground level, however this was a really minor inconvenience. Gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: agr8one
Reviews.Content: I had a free weekend at the end of a gruelling 3-week business trip to Phoenix and had never been to Las Vegas, so decided to make the trek north. I was exhausted, so didn't really want the typical hyper, casino Vegas experience. The Mandarin Oriental seemed the ideal solution. It was. From the moment I arrived, every possible wish was catered for. The service here is astounding. The mark for me of five star service is for your needs to be seen to before you have to ask. They anticipated mine excellently. My only quibble would be that they were a bit too formal and seemed nervous, which put me a bit on edge, but that's a minor point. I stayed in a Cityscape King Room on the 11th floor. It was the perfect blend of technology and eastern zen, which suited me down to the ground. Highlights include the remote control of practically everything as well as the stunning bathroom, with deep, relaxing bath. Personally I'd never stay anywhere else in Las Vegas and just wish all my hotel stays were as amazing as this one.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaintHelenaCAUSAGhb
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is not a place that I look forward to visiting, but the Mandarin there may have changed my mind! I recently spent several nights there and can say without hesitation that the service and attention to detail are equal to world class hotels such as Baur Au Lac in Zurich and Le Bristol in Paris. The facilities are even better and perfectly maintained. I would not even consider anywhere else in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: valsdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Mandarin for another stay and I have to say this place just gets better all the time. Rooms are very nice but service is why you stay and why you return. I've already made reservations for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: jamesclau
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few days in October/November and I have no doubt in my mind this is the best hotel in Las Vegas. I have stayed at almost every single hotel on the strip (and off it) and given it's convenient location and five-star service, this is the one that I would recommend to friends if they can fit it in their budget. I love that it is right in the heart of the strip yet so quiet that you are completely undisturbed. The views are spectacular and of course the rooms were so luxurious. We stayed in a Premier room and it was huge - the most impressive part was probably the washroom, featuring a rain shower stall, seperate free standing tub, dual modern sinks, seperate room for the toilet and seperate area for changing/getting dressed, all decked out with complimentary wonderful aromatherapy spa products (including bath salts, robes, mani products, etc.) Staff was very accommodating to our requests and I would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, reception on 23rd floor...”
Reviews.Author: DN2311
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in nov it was my 40th birthday the day we arrived. The whole place is seriously amazing, I don't have a bad word to say about it. STAY THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet bit of calm in crazy Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Monica004
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at Mandarin in December. A sightseeing / shopping trip. I chose the hotel based on Trip advisor reviews. Overall excellent. Our room was large and comfortable. All staff we came into contact with were very good.... However, we didn't see the staff much, as the layout of the hotel is such that you don't need to pass reception to get to your room. For us this was the right choice. Having visited some of the large hotels with casinos.. I really would not want to stay there. If you want action and things to do in your hotel then stay elsewhere. If you like a quiet hotel then Mandarin is very good. I would add, as many others have the charge for wifi is annoying. $ 45 for 3 days. A hotel of this standard should include wifi. That almost put me off booking.

Reviews.Title: “hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Almond66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in November. The idea of staying somewhere smokefree was appealing. I booked on my Amex Platinum Luxury Hotels and Resorts website. I enjoyed the location. I enjoyed breakfast and ate no other meals there. The staff were always responsive and helpful. The problems: on my arrival (late by my hometown time) there was a smell in the room that smelled like cooking. I was really too tired to address it that night but was nauseated by the smells all night. I spoke with someone at the front desk and the problem was fixed by redirecting a vent. The person preparing my room was leaving when I first arrived. The smell was very obvious but initally I thought it was something correctible by just turning up the air. I suspect they must know they have this problem already because they fixed it so easily and others must have smelled it. It should have been already addressed by them in my opinion. Amenities were not replaced on the day after my arrival and I had to ask for this on day two. On my second morning, a Saturday morning, I was awoken to loud clattering at 630 am approximately. I called about 7 am and security found that someone was working on the pipes in the room near me. The problem was corrected but by that time a second night's sleep was disrupted. IF YOU HAVE BACK OR NECK issues like I do, the bed is very soft and by the time I got home I was having neck pain I hadn't had in a few months. Some I'm sure was due to the disrupted sleep as well. The room and electronics were fantastic. The tub inviting. There was even a straightening iron in the room which is exciting for the women who travel and like to straighten their hair. Finally it was clear when I checked in that as Amex Fine Resorts and Hotels that they didn't even consider an upgrade which is something they do if there is availability. I've used this program many times and staff will tell you whether there is or isn't on the front end. I asked and the front desk person, albeit nice, brushed it off and I could tell it wasn't even a consideration to upgrade my room. In fact I was instead put in a room next to an elevator. Beautiful hotel, my experiences may have been unusual I know, but I'll never stay here again. (At some point a tray of chocolate covered strawberries were put in my room, but this didn't make up for two nights of disrupted sleep.)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for business and pleasure alike”
Reviews.Author: Luzius01
Reviews.Content: I was staying almost one week for business and was happy to stay in a peaceful place without a casino, even so I like the action in Vegas. This hotel is a perfect spot as you can easily access many places within walking distance, but retreat to the Mandarin to get away from the crowds. The staff is excellent and trained "Asia-style with a smile" and they also managed tickets for me for the ever sold out performance water show "O" by Circque du Soleil which is a must to see! The room layout was exceptional with the bathroom being central and with world class amenities (TV integrated in the mirror etc.). The whole room can be operated by touch panel, controlling also curtains, lighting and mood and 24 hours service is available for any kind of hotel service (including food and drinks).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury”
Reviews.Author: Greendocket
Reviews.Content: This lovely, quiet spot in Las Vegas provides a tranquil place to lay your head. Visually delicious hotel. The rooms are modestly sized but well designed with neat modern controls and a clever valet closet. The bath is top. We ate at Twist. Super expensive, brilliant food. The staff at the hotel is attentive. No casino. No smoke. All Zen. Wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable rooms & service”
Reviews.Author: AimeeEssex
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out this hotel exceeded our expectations. The room we stayed in was strip view and was a great view towards the Eifel Tower! The room layout was exceptional with the bathroom being central & world class!! The whole room can be operated by touch panel bedside controlling curtains, lighting & mood! We did the strip helicopter ride which is within a $15 cab ride about 10 minutes away which we think is a must if you're planning a visit to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “mandarin las vegas”
Reviews.Author: shoga621
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I like the action in Vegas, but my wife hates the smoke and the crowds. This hotel is a perfect spot. You can easily access Aria for Vegas style fun but retreat to the Mandarin to get away from it all. Its quiet and the staff is excellent. It was a packed weekend and we still felt like there was hardly anyone at the hotel. Rooms and bedding are top notch. If you want that Vegas bachelor party experience you will be very dissapointned if you stay here. It is quiet and very peaceful.The bathrooms are very well done, and the bedding was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “True 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: kekelala
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the most amazing hotel I have stayed at during my 27 years on this planet... From the second you arrive, everything is so peaceful and welcoming. During my stay in Vegas I actually found myself not wanting to leave the peaceful paradise. It is just what I personally need in an environment such as Vegas. Peace and quiet in the middle of a chaotic world. Staff were amazing, concierge made my trip worth while and knew exactly where to send me. The tranquillity of this venue is amazing. I will be returning, that is a definite. Absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: thankyouta
Reviews.Content: Without doubt this has to be one of the finest hotels in the world let alone Las Vegas. A true 5 star establishment from the moment you arrive. The greeting you receive when you arrive makes you feel like your home. The staff are all very well trained and are probably the best I have ever come across in any hotel. Nothing is any trouble. The 2 guys who did the evening turndown service were top class, well spoken and looked liked they took great pride in what they were doing. This is a must stay when in las Vegas and it is very well priced and great value.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: panam747
Reviews.Content: This is the third hotel in the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group that we have stayed. Indeed, truth be told as reviewed by other travelers, it is the best hotel In Las Vegas. It is tranquil, an oasis away from the mass, the smoke, desperation and cheap thrills. It is an elegant hotel, not diluted by casinos, eateries, gift shops or meandering crowds. First impression is the swaying bamboo that greets you at the front door. Next are the friendly doorman and efficient bell captain; they were the only people that greeted me by name throughout my stay. Impressive is the doorman, Glenn; he is an utmost professional, with an incredibly keen memory and always pleasant. The rooms are well laid out with very comfortable bedding. All things are electronically controlled and views of the strip are superb. Aroma therapy toiletries are generous in size and the soaking tub unforgettable. Lacking is the little greeting notes I have come to expect from the general manager. Also, no fruit platter or fresh cut flowers.
