Perhaps I have been spoiled by the sister hotels in Bangkok and Kuala Lumpur. Other pluses of this hotel is the housekeeping; extremely efficient and always kept the chambers spotless. Complimentary shoe shines are done within the hour. I was surprised to find my mind shirts and pants neatly folded on my return. Very impressive. Downside is the reception; they are eye candies, but the presentation lacking. I am left with an overall feeling that they are bunch of young kids playing house. After a few interactions, I can't help but feel that the individuals holding court are amateurs. They hesitate on questions, uncertain of answers and mutters when asked to rectify erroneous charges. Other downside is that the hotel pool will not be opened until March, 2012. I was told that we can use the adjoining property's pool about half a mile away. We left the hotel rested; the rooms were superb, comfortable and beautiful. It is indeed one of the best hotel in North America. Overall, the staff is eager to please and requests quickly met. However, it is not up to the Mandarin Oriental standards I have experienced in Asia. In Bangkok and Kuala Lumpur, the receptionist and staff manager walked us to the car and waved until we turned the corner. My last impression here is the receptionist muttering in low groan when asked to removed an erroneous charge; limited eye contact as he handed over my receipt. Housekeeping is superb as well as the doorman, Glenn; he was superior than the cohorts at MO sister hotels. I highly recommend this hotel for relaxation and family time in Las Vegas. Don't hesitate to stay as you will have a superb time; just don't expect the Mandarin Oriental standard par excellence found in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great and great”
Reviews.Author: Ann and Joel P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November during our holiday in the U.S (roadtrip) We can't find any negative points about this hotel, it was a great experience to stay at the Mandarin Oriental. Room was perfect, service perfect, food perfect, location couldn't be more perfect.. So if you would like to have a great time in Vegas, choose this hotel.. we will be definitely stay here again... Wished all the hotel in the world were like this!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, will go back”
Reviews.Author: ting w
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the lobby is on the 23rd floor and in order to get to the 11th floor (where our room was), you have to go up to the 23rd then take another elevator to the 11th. Free bottled water Daily housekeeping 2 times a day!!! Automated-everything! Even Curtains!!! Very CLEAN. Quiet rooms/halls No Smoking in lobby or hotel No casino! (very quite). Almost like a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in the madness”
Reviews.Author: Paul-Scotland
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels I have stayed in....ever! Service was slick, rooms were amazing with great views of the strip and afternoon tea was just amazing. We were there for 4 nights and actually had afternoon tea in the tea lounge overlooking the strip three times! Hotel is great value for money and well worth paying a little extra for. Casino free and smoke free!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay! The best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Travellator10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandarin for 3 nights in June with my husband & baby boy. The hotel is beautifully decorated. The room size is quite good with a lovely bathroom. The views from high floors are amazing. Vegas at night looks lovely from up there. Very classy. It definitely beats all the other hotels with smoke filled casinos. I chose this hotel as it did not have a casino which I didnt want as I was travelling with my baby. The service is excellent, the concierge desk is so prompt. They recognize you by name. My husband had his birthday here and the concierge sent a beautiful looking pastry cake which was so yummy. I'd only stay here if I go back to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “magical”
Reviews.Author: tuescon
Reviews.Content: 2nd leg of a total of 4 legs of my honeymoon in USA and I wish it could have been the last leg as it raised expectations exceedingly high for other hotels to emulate. As the hotel does not have a casino, you enjoy being in a very quiet environment but with easy access to hotels with casino. The only downside is, they do not have buffets that draws queues likes bees to honey. However, some of the good ones like Cosmopolitan and Bellagio are very close by so that isn't really a problem. Another drawback would be the cost of parking and wifi; but I guess at a hotel like this, it comes with the territory. As I wasn't very interested in gambling, this hotel was ideal for me. All in all, a very good experience; that is if you don't mind spending.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Peace & Quiet coupled with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: openminded01
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas was definitely a success due to our choice of the Manadarin Oriental as our base. From the moment we arrived, we were treated exceptionally well - from the welcoming doorstaff and bellboys through to the superb concierge (special mention to Doug who was exceptional), front desk staff and Walter, the excellent chauffeur. It was evident that all the Manadarin Oriental staff had received excellent customer service training. Our Manadarin premier room was modern, spacious, very clean and had a wonderful bathroom with separate toilet and a useful dressing room. The technology (mentioned by others on TA) was interesting, but we soon grasped it. MoZen bistro was excellent for dinner - great food delivered by excellent staff - friendly, knowledgeable and keen to help. The bar was busy when we were there - hard to get a seat so sat outside in the tea lounge area - service there was not on the same par as other areas of the hotel. Not bad, just not outstanding e.g. removing candles at 10pm when there were still guests in the lounge and others arriving - gave an impression of 'trying to close up'. We visited most of the top hotels in Vegas during our trip - we left every one of them saying we were glad we were staying at the Mandarin - others were noisy, busy, smokey and huge. If you want first class service and accomodation delivered in an aura of peace and calm after a mad Veags day and evening, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Resort in the desert”
Reviews.Author: TNElvis
Reviews.Content: This property is centrally located and probably the best value for a luxury hotel we've seen. We visit Las Vegas a few times annually and this is our favorite spot so far. The best attribute of this property is the resort-like, serene nature of it--all right in the middle of Las Vegas. It has all the hallmarks of a Mandrin Oriental without the less attractive features of the Vegas strip, depending on your perspective. We gamble very little and visit Las Vegas for the weather, dining and nightlife. The property boasts a gorgeous pool area complimented with a fantastic spa. The pool was where we spent a majority of our time and trip. It offers exactly what you would expect from a five star resort. We utilized a cabana on the Friday of our stay and the service was excellent--highly recommended. The room was moderately sized with an average view. It was well appointed with a luxuriously comfortable bed and a great tv and room electronics. The room controls for temperature, lighting, audio and entertainment can all be navigated on one device. The bathroom is well done and has a separate areas for the tub, toilet and shower. Casinos reside across the street if you desire the gaming action that Nevada offers. Living in New York can make Vegas seem less like a getaway and more like a frantic desert extension of the manic city pace. The Mandarin Oriental is your best option for a relaxing experience while enjoying all that Vegas offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBruse
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms last week-end and celebrated my birthday at the Hotel. Both rooms were fantastic. The service was great, and I liked the easy check-in. There was no line like other Hotels. I liked the fact that it was non gameing but if you wanted to gamble there are plenty of casinos less than a block away. The rooms were luxurious and every thing around the Hotel is high end. You don't have all the lookee lews wandering around the Hotel and you don't have all the noise and smoke like at a casino Hotel. Also, they really made my birthday special. There were welcoming cupcakes and special drinks at dinner at Twist. When in Vegas we will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: airdoug
Reviews.Content: Planned a couples getaway in Las Vegas and found that the Mandarin Oriental was offering a special of stay for 2 nights and get the 3rd night free. I jumped on that opportunity as I have stayed at some of their other hotels and always had a great experience. This one was no different, from the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out. Keep in mind that there is no casino or club at this hotel, so if you are looking for that scene this won't be the place for you. The crowd is also slightly more "mature." The hotel is right in City Center so Aria is next door, Crystals mall in next door, and the Cosmopolitan is a short walk away. That means you can easily get to a casino or a popular dance club very easily but you can escape it if you want by just heading back to the Mandarin. What you do get when you stay there is no crowds or lines to wait in- either at check in or breakfast or the bar. You get personalized service with attention to detail from the warm towel to freshen up when they greet you to the personal escort to the elevator. The hotel is relatively new and there is no smoking and it is kept very clean. This means the wife is happy! We had a strip view room with a king bed. The view was nice, the room was spacious, and the bed was comfortable. They have full automation of the lights, room temperature, curtains, music, and tv from the tv controller and a small touchpad near the bed. This was very convenient and included features like sleep timers and wake up call modes. We ate at the Mozen Restaurant twice for breakfast and it was very yummy. Even when things are not perfect they take care of you. My friend ordered the steak and eggs and the steak came out undercooked for him. The waiter apologized and took the steak to have it corrected. They offered him some fresh fruit and bread to hold him over while he waited. Then the manager came out to apologize for the error and said that he informed the chef and that it will be corrected. When the steak came back it was a new one, not just the same one cooked more and was done perfectly. In the end they did not charge him for it either. We dad drinks at the view bar which featured live Jazz the nights we were there. Went to the spa which was one if not the nicest spas I have ever been to with great personalized service. Now, keep in mind that you are paying for the luxury and service. Breakfast for 2 averaged about $80 per couple at Mozen and drinks at the view bar for 2 couples was over $150. However, I would definitely stay there again, especially with the wife!

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!!! Absolutelly perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: AllanMCCosta
Reviews.Content: Since the moment you arrive until the moment you live, staying at the mandarin Las Vegas is an unforgetable experience. Attention to details, confort, technology, first class service. If hou are in doubt, don't hesitate. Just go for it. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in a mad city”
Reviews.Author: jlmoura
Reviews.Content: Just spent last weekend at the Mandarin Oriental after a conference at the Encore. What a difference. No noise from slot machines or people walking around and smoking. It was perfect. The attention to detail was incredible and the service impeccable. As you arrive at the hotel, they ask your name and by the time you get to the 23rd floor for check-in, they have everything ready waiting for you, greeting you by your name. Another great surprise is when you get to your room, as you open the door, the lights came in, the curtains open and a welcome message at the TV. Vegas is not my favourite city in the world, but if I go there again, this hotel is my definite destination.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental LV three times now. In my opinion, this is the best hotel to stay in Vegas if you are not a gambler. The rooms are gorgeous and the staff are very polite and courteous. The spa is a must go and the massages are heavenly! The location is also very central. The gorgeous CRYSTALS mall is just next door. The elevator system is quite unique but it can be quite confusing at first. You have to take the elevator to the top floor where the lobby is and then you have to take a separate set of elevators to your room. Overall, this is a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin is our choice”
Reviews.Author: WestMidsP
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many times, often stopping at the MGM, Luxor. One year we had problems getting the elevator in the MGM about check out time, which made us choose something new... and a little more luxury. The room was really luxurious. We had a view down the strip. The bathroom was one where a screen could open the room so you could watch TV!! Lovely scented flowers everywhere, but beware the turndown service, the maid comes in and folds everthing... including things you shouldn't have left out!. The bar has an amazing view of the strip... nice cocktails and nibbles are available. There is no gaming in this hotel, but you only have to go a couple of steps if you want it. We went in July, the pool area was empty.... the place is quiet.....very clean pool area. Free refreshments come around regularly e.g. frozen grapes, banana sorbet, cold chocolate dip... very nice! We did not eat in the restaurant, but it always looked busy. The entrance to the hotel is not on the strip, but it's just a matter of steps with a CVS around the corner for drinks and anything else. All the staff were really friendly and professional. Can't fault anything....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Great Service but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: mark j
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was back in Asia where hotel service is very special...kudos to them. I like a quieter experience and was very disappointed by the level of noise coming from the hallway all night long from talkative and, perhaps, inebriated guests. I guess you can take the Vegas out of a hotel but you can't take a hotel in Vegas out of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: jckmd
Reviews.Content: I was here for 4 nights for a conference. 4 nights in Vegas is a long time so was happy to have a non casino hotel. The Madarin exceeded my expectectations. Most of all the service was fabulous, from the doorman,front desk, concierges to spa attendants. I would return again on my next vegas trip. It is easy to find excitement outside the door but this is the place for elegance and great service

Reviews.Title: “You don't have to be part of the 1% to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Wabbit1963
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the Mandarin and it was amazing. We specifically wanted to be close to the strip but not stay in a smokey casino. We are typically budget travelers but as we age, appreciate a nice hotel once and awhile. The rates we were able to get through Hotwire were comparable to other casinos and in fact, much less than many. The facilities, staff, (Marie was super sweet at check-in) and location was perfect. We loved that it's a bit of a stealth hotel. It was almost hidden away but still right on the strip. Can I just say that the bathroom was awesome! While soaking in the lovely tub, I was able to have a view and watch the tv that was projected from the bathroom mirror, all at the same time! We travel light and carry backpacks, not fancy luggage, so we thought we might feel weird since a lot of the other guests were obviously very well-heeled. Not once did anyone on staff make us feel like we didn't below there. Next time we go to Vegas, we'll definitely stay at the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: irishmannyc
Reviews.Content: Ok..so caveat here..I stayed for 3 nights at my company's sales conference so didn't have to pay, but that said..OMG! I arrived at the entrance in a cab and the porter asked if I needed help with my bag. I said no and he asked me my name and directed me to reception which is on the 23rd floor. When I approached the desk after my express elevator ride, the desk professional greeted me by name, which freaked me out for a second, but ultimately was appreciated. It is the Mandarin after all! The room was fab. Most notable was the huge porcelain tub in the bathroom that begged for you to take a soak (and I did one morning before my meetings). What was also fantastic the had an integrated entertainment system, which when I first entered the room turned the lights on and played lovely spa-esque music, In fact, you can program the alarm to open the curtains and play music. Now I had some food and drinks at the bar my first night, and it wasn't inexpensive, but it had a friggin' great view of the strip (and the food was tasty!). All the staff I interacted with were amazing. As someone who trains on customer service, my hats off to the Mandarin. One last thought, there was a wonderful subtle lavender fragrance in the hotel, which immediately makes you fell comfortable and (obviously) relaxed! Hat's off Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place shame about the position”
Reviews.Author: MARTIN r
Reviews.Content: Liked the room and the tv in bathroom and nice touches, like our names were displayed on tv on our arrival. Everything seemed to be worked by a remote control or another system somewhere else in the room which the wife couldn't master so I ended up trying to do, sometimes it's just nice/and quicker to open the curtains by hand. Music or mystical oriental type droning in lifts got a bit tiresome after while, it never seemed to be getting anywhere no matter when you joined it. Other than these minor points a very nice hotel, found the food somewhat expensive and having never been to Vegas before actually did think we would have liked the idea of a casino on site, so on reflection most probably wouldn't stay here again. Staff very nice and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: burlistic
Reviews.Content: Really nice, modern and funky hotel. I decided to spoil the wife and book us at the Mandarin for our trip to attend a friend’s wedding. It turned out to be an inspired choice. The service was excellent, the room chic luxurious. I absolutely loved the bathroom and would like to take some of the design ideas to put into my own home. We tried the Asian fusion restaurant, MOZen Bistro and where really impressed. Standard was top. Very happy. The pool cafe was also great. Kobi beef sandwich easily large enough for two and the Muesli in the morning a great way to start the day. The gym and swimming pool are great. Loved getting over my jet lag in the gym watching the sun come up. The swimming pool area is very nice. Great place to escape Vegas and chill out. All my freinds kept coming to visit once the saw how nice it was. The place is very modern with dark stylish interior. I loved the design. Some great touches. If there was one point of feedback, some of the halls and spaces are quite dark. Could do with the lights being turned up a little. Defiantly recommend if you want to treat the other half or yourself. Will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis amongst the madness”
Reviews.Author: DC10Gooner
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure the Mandarin was superb. This is not a gaming hotel and we would recommend it for couples looking for the right blend of luxury and comfort. Every staff member was welcoming and they couldnt do enough to help you. The room is sublime, we had a 'strip view' room and we loved returning to it after each venture into town. The Spa is amazing and is a great place to relax and re-charge. A special mention for the concierges who organised our show and Grand Canyon trips, just brilliant at getting it done efficiently, we didn't have to lift a finger. We could only find one fault, a hotel of this standard shouldn't be charging for Internet access. We love this hotel and will definitely be back when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay in this Zen hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Magadeb
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, quiet, no casino, nice staff, great vibes! It seems really protected from the strip although it is located on the strip ! It is beautiful inside, I loved the design. Bedrooms are great. We stayed with 3 friends in August and had a very good time. The pool is really cool too (even though it gets windy).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: monkeytony18
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful, luxurious, fabulous hotel. So nice to be in Vegas, but away from all the cheesy, dirty ambiance. It's a total treat to be there and to be treated so well. The breakfast was delicious, the spa treatment was perfect (though expensive! but our $100 spa credit sure helped!). Everything in the room is so well thought out - you feel like you're living in the future with all the high-tech details. By far the nicest hotel I've stayed at in Vegas. The casino at the Aria is right next door and the shopping center across the bridge is beautiful. The staff is so courteous and being there is just a lovely experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Very zen and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: thxm
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place for people who would prefer not to be caught up in the Las Vegas craziness for their entire visit. The atmosphere is totally zen, and the spa is fabulous. The room we stayed in faced Monte Carlo/Mandalay Bay / the airport, and the room was bright, open, and a pretty good size. As a prior reviewer said, the lighting panel can be slightly confusing, but it's not really a huge deal. One thing to note though - the bathroom isn't walled off; it's pretty much all glass, meaning that someone sitting in the bedroom can see into the bathroom from certain angles. I'm not sure if that's the case in all rooms though. In all, I really enjoyed the room. The best part of the Mandarin Oriental has to be the service. All the employees are friendly, professional, and always happy to help. That said, the service at the Mandarin is truly amazing. My husband and I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Macau, and the service here is just as good. It goes without saying that a stay here isn't cheap. However, any casino/hotel of a similar quality in Las Vegas is going to cost just as much if not more, so it's a great deal. Additionally, they are very accommodating (which goes back to great service). We arrived at the hotel at about 9am but were checked in on the spot without any questions. I'm guessing that this probably wouldn't happen during peak season, but then again, I'm not sure we would've gotten that if we stayed anywhere else. In summary, the hotel is new and luxurious, is centrally located on the strip, and the service is excellent. The casual restaurant is also pretty good. Overall, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: esposch
Reviews.Content: Made a big switch after 12 years at the FS. Made a tough but right choice. Great location, rooms, and excellent food and service. Will return without question.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: jcrb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in a strip view suite with the "suite temptations" package - this was basically 3 nights for the price of 2 with continental breakfast included and $100 spa credit. The total cost was about $1,000 but it was worth every penny! I can't really say enough good things about this hotel. We had previously stayed in the Vdara which was lovely but the Mandarin really is a class or two above. Lots of little touches like an umbrella in the room and fully stocked bathroom with bath salts. The room was huge with a nice living room and fabulous bathroom complete with a wide array of good quality products. The bed was enormous and very comfortable and we loved the air con/lights etc being controlled through the TV. The bath tub and shower were both enormous and easily fit two in side by side with a view of the Monte Carlo/NY hotels - fantastic! We spent our spa credit on day passes into the spa which was one of the most pleasant and enjoyable experiences of my life. Definitely recommended. The pool area was great with towels provided and plenty of sunbeds. Breakfast at Mozen bistro was fantastic. Again, the service was impeccable - we asked for a bag for some of the pastries we were served and the waitress came back with a box complete with some small jams (jellies). Great touch. Only minor downside is the location. The view directly across the street isn't great, better views to be had a 200m or so further north on the strip I would imagine. You can see both ways though to Planet Hollywood/Paris North and MGM/Monte Carlo/NY NY to the south.

Reviews.Title: “not quite zen and definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: susanpross
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel that provides an oasis of quiet, tranquility and beauty right on the main strip in Las Vegas. HOWEVER, there are some significant issues that make it less than a five star hotel. Housekeeping is not good. We got back to our room at 3:30 one day and we had to call three times to get someone to clean our room. The woman who finally came had such a horrible cold and she coughed all over everything she was cleaning. We asked for a blanket- it was never delivered. Room service delivered my breakfast on time, but the bowl of oatmeal wasn't hot. Deisgn flaws in our room were a big surprise. There was no dresser or real shelving to store folded clothing and small items. We had to pile stuff on a small chaise. The closet was small and we had to request extra hangers. There was no full length mirror. Otherwise the room had many luxury appointments, they just neglected to include some of the basics. Even Motel 6 has a dresser and a mirror. Valet and concierge staff were great- friendly and helpful. There is no little store within the hotel for incidentals- you have to leave the hotel to go to the CVS drugstore nearby if you want aspirin or small items. We had to ask them to cancel morning paper delivery because they woke us at 5:45 the first morning when they slammed the valet door while delivering the paper. It wasn't something we wanted to risk a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: angel5353
Reviews.Content: we had a strip view room, however the view is somewhat limited as the cosmopolitan is in the way to see far but had a nice view of the hotel paris and its balloon even from the bath tub! we only stayed one night but the hotel was very 5 star all the way from the check in to the special room keys my only problem was if you wernt getting there by car it is a little tucked away and hard to find from the strip access is either under the escalator and down some steps or from the strip onto the road with no pavement, other than this everything was excellent and very romantic

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndThePea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights for the SEMA show in November 11. The first surprise was the Sky Lobby on the 23rd floor. The atmosphere was quiet and peaceful and the staff were attentive and friendly. A member of staff shows you to you room. Do take some time to read the technology guide in the room as the curtains open electronically and the lighting system is a little complex. At all times the staff were extremely courteous and polite. The hotel feels secluded, has easy access to the strip - turn right as you leave the lower lobby and you will find a CVS pharmacy, with Walgreens just across the road. Turn right as you leave the lower lobby and you wiill find stairs leading to Aria and The Crystals. We stayed in a premier room with kingsize bed, desk, small sitting area and hanging space with drawers. The room tea making facilities, but no coffee, not even instant. Coffee had to be ordered through room service or there is a Starbucks in the Monte Carlo casino next door. There was a large bathroom with separate bath and shower. We don't care for the modern trend of having bathrooms with glass walls that seems to be popular now. The pool was outdoors and unheated which means opportunities foe swimming are limited. The poolside area is very nice and the is a an outside hot tub. The corridor to the pool and spa is completely black with little lighting and it is very difficult to see when entering from the bright sun. I found this rather disorientating. There is a large range of facilities in the Spa. I had a massage which was very enjoyable, but I felt the masseuse's training was fairly elementary. The price was steep at US$220. Breakfast is available at MOzen on the third floor - buffet is US$24 + gratuity, eggs are extra, or you can walk to the much more inexpensive buffet at Aria. A la carte menu also available at MOzen. Do have afternoon tea in the Sky Lobby with a view of the sun setting over the strip. Overall we enjoyed our stay, the room was very quiet at night except for the sirens from the strip in the early morning hours but I think that is unavoidable in Vegas. We did find the electronic controls for the lighting and TV annoying, especially when the turn down service left the tv on the Mnadarin channel. There was no guide to the TV channels in the room. We felt some of the 'features' of the room were annoying and inconvenient and weren't totally satisfied with the value for money aspect of our stay. However, you need to remember that in Vegas the majority of your room price is paying for the location rather than the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A sanctuary in loud and busy vegas!”
Reviews.Author: KsReview
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in October for business prior to moving to the Palazzo for a conference. What a difference wish I never moved! I really had a great experience as would be expected at Madarin Oriental! From the arrival where you are handed a cold towel to freshen up, attentive and gracious staff througout the hotel and excellent restaurants. If you are looking to get to have a little sanctuary to come home to after some fun in Vegas, this hotel is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic hotel, peace and tranquility away from the noise and chaos”
Reviews.Author: Frequent2
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Stayed at many 5* properties globally and this was easily on par with properties such as Ritz-Carlton and Shangri La (maybe better) . Having stayed at a number of properties up and down the strip and been treated with utter discontent, this hotel was a breath if fresh air and easily the best. Highly recommended if you want to receive 5 star treatment and relax between outings to the strip. Room was full of nice extras, favourites included electric window blinds, technology kit and decent sound with a sound system under the tv. Then there was the in mirror tv in the bathroom and my, what a fantastic bath. The list goes on. At the risk of this hidden oasis getting too popular, I owe it to the hotel staff and without hesitancy recommend this great hotel - try it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: LAdyG1425
Reviews.Content: We were at the Mandrian Oriental for a friend's batchalorette weekend and it was fabulous. The staff was so hospitable and took special care to pay attention to our needs. We briefly mentioned to the concierge the we couldn't find a sash/crown for our bride to be, and upon returning to our room for the night, a full basket of bridal gear was waiting! We had champagne and delicious treats waiting when we first arrived. Having a car that the hotel would drive us anywhere on the strip was awesome. The spa was brand new and very clean. My only compliant was for a very expensive massage, I did hear outside music. Lastly, there is no casino, so if you are looking for a "vegas-y" experience it may not be the place for you. But, if you are looking for luxury and some relaxation, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: scoi00
Reviews.Content: The two first reasons why I like this hotel are : no slot machines and no taxi lines. But there is much more. A nice pool , great architecture, excellent service , amazing location, superb SPA . There is only one thing I really disliked: the hotel during my stay long before I checked out over-reserved and deducted so much money from my credit card (and much more then the complete stay at the end actually costed) that when I went out one evening shopping the credit card was blocked. Why a hotel needs to reserve and deduct more money from a credit card of a returning customer then he actually spends during his stay is hard to understand. This especially as the credit card used as guarantee is not always the only one that at the end that is used. Definitely I will return to this great hotel. I just wish they would in future not use my credit card as a kind of slot machine....

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Orientalgreat in all ways”
Reviews.Author: cx123
Reviews.Content: great stay, rooms small for Vegas standard, but big enough. all the rest is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel in Vegas !”
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family for 4 nights. This is a lovely hotel, where you feel relaxed as soon as you enter. The rooms are lovely and the service is fantastic. It is nice to be away from the madness of Vegas for a while. The pool is nice, very civilised. The only negative point I can make is that breakfast is very expensive in comparison to the room rates. Certainly not worth feeding a family in the hotel. There are places for breakfast in the mall across the road, or the other hotels close by at a fraction of the price. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you want to enjoy Vegas but have some relaxation too.

Reviews.Title: “Modern friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bert H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mandarin for a conference in Vegas. I would thoroughily recommend the accomodation and servicing of this hotel, which is modern and very techno - actually took about 3 days to work out the lighting! but it all works well. However as I understand, in common with other hotels in Vegas, the costs within the hotel, particularly for food, are exorbidant and you can find options not too far away for lunch and dinner. Mon Ami Gaba underneath 'Paris' is great for dinner. Lunch - I found an Italian in the 'Forum' Shopping centre, or over the road at Harrah's the 'Flavours' buffet is a very good buffet for about $US20. Breakfast I tended to miss - but the first day at Mandarin I had it in room - $US70. Mandarin has an excellent gym and swimming pool area - you can hire your own room around the pool if you want to put your food and clothing somewhere and have a dinning table to eat food! As a show I went to - The Beatles, A Tribute on at Sax was absolutely fabulous if you were a Beatles fan.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD BUT SHOULD HAVE BEEN EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Josh G
Reviews.Content: This is my third time in Vegas and the hotel was hands down the BEST I had ever stayed in. The people were great the service was excellent and the atmosphere was perfection. The only strive I had, was when we arrived at the hotel and our room was not quite ready. I asked for an aprroximate time which the lady behind the desk could not give me, not even a slight idea. I ended up waiting 3 hours until the room was ready which is ridculous considering the overall standard of the hotel. However the pool manager Micheal was absolutely outstanding and really catered to us whilst we waited. Also the bar tender Marcom was excellent too in catering to everything during our stay. It was these guys who really made our stay, had they not been there I doubt we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: Barney64
Reviews.Content: Firstly, be aware the Mandarin Oriental has no casino and no shows but these facts just help it to be an oasis in the middle of the madness that is Las Vegas. From the moment we pulled up to the entrance the service we received was 1st class, being efficeint,informed and friendly.My wife and I stayed in a strip view room. It was large and beautifully furnished. The quality of the bed and the linen was excellent with nice touches such as a tv in the bathroom and an ipod dock in the room. One of the reasons we choose the hotel was the look of the pool area from the website. It did not disappoint. Cabanas with tv's and sofas for those who wanted them along with plenty of sunloungers around the 2 pools. This hotel is an ideal choice for a couple who want to dip in to Las Vegas but want the chance of some relaxation surrounded by luxury when it all gets too much.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and calm...yet right in the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: DeAnStr
Reviews.Content: We just spent a great weekend in Vegas. This was our first stay at this hotel. What we enjoyed most was the peace and quiet of the hotel. The hotel's location is perfect to enjoy all The Strip has to offer yet no hussle bussle once you to the corner to the short walk to the lower lobby. The hotel has no long walk thru a noisy casino.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Fond as we are of the Mandarin Oriental brand, we opted to stay here for 3 nights while attending a convention elsewhere, before transferring to the Cosmopolitan (separate review). It was our first stay at both hotels. The rates at the Mandarin (MO) are on the pricey side for Vegas, but the quality of the experience is well worth it, and is a relative bargain compared to rates at other MO properties. The non-gaming MO is an oasis of serenity and civility, seemingly far from the madding crowd. It would fit nicely in any major city, and is a good representation of the MO brand, with the Asian inspired decor that is a hallmark of MO in evidence throughout the hotel. Indeed, if all the window views were blocked, you could comfortably be in another sophisticated urban environment. ARRIVAL. The hotel sends a pre-arrival e-mail should you wish to contact them about anything beforehand, such as spa reservations. The MO is part of the vast CityCenter complex that includes the Aria and Vdara hotels, the Veer residence towers, plus the high-end Crystals shopping mall. There is also the exoskeleton of what was to be the Harmon Hotel, which apparently is having both structural and economic difficulties. The MO tower also has residences above the hotel. The MO has no self-parking; overnight valet parking is $30. One can self-park at the adjacent Aria. The MO has an elegant ground level lobby where the doormen, valets and bell services stand, but one checks in at the 23rd floor Sky Lobby. This is the highest level of the hotel--one uses separate secure elevators to access one's room on lower floors. Floor 23 also houses the Twist Restaurant, Tea Lounge, and Mandarin Bar. This is as far as the looky-loos can go, and you will see some, usually checking out the views from the Tea Lounge. Our check-in experience was professional and smooth. The room was not quite ready, but was within an hour. The receptionist will escort you to the elevator and have your luggage sent up. ROOM. We booked a Junior Suite, about 850 square feet, located at the end of the hall. The Jr. Suites are on lower levels, higher up they are called Strip View Suites. As soon as we exited the elevator, a familiar scent greeted us--it seemed identical to that used at the MO Hong Kong which we visited in Jan. The ends of the hotel are very angular, with lots of acute and obtuse angles. Upon entering the suite, the drapes opened, and the TV screen was on, as one can control all the room features from the remote--lighting, drapes, temperature, etc. The entry has a valet door (as do all rooms). The living room had a sitting area with a fresh fruit platter, plus the huge HD TV (with a concealed DVD/CD player) sitting on a large console that housed the minibar and fridge, plus a hot water kettle. The bedroom was beyond double doors, and had another TV/DVD player. The desk had a technology kit filled with cables and what not. The touch screen alarm clock by the bed also controls room functions--one's "alarm" can be set to be certain lights turning on, drapes to open, selected TV station on. The TV also had music and nature sight and sound selections. The dressing/closet area was a bit tight but had all the amenities--iron and board, slippers, umbrella, blanket, safe, robes, etc. The bathroom was huge, with 2 sinks on opposite sides of a free standing tub, upon which rose petals were placed nightly. The sinks interestingly were not porcelain, but enameled metal. There were lots of cleverly boxed amenities, mostly contained within a jewelry box-like vessel. The large marble shower stall could have used a bench. The extra roll of toilet paper in the WC was hidden in an embroidered tasseled bag. SPA/POOL/FITNESS. The spa is lovely and fairly large, covering 2 levels. Rates are higher on weekends. There is a fee for access if you don't have a treatment booked. There are a variety of heat, water, and relaxation experiences: a relaxation lounge (with bed-like chaises from which your therapist will call you), steam room, Laconium (a room with a warm tile bench, less intense than steam), Vitality pool (a large jacuzzi with slatted metal chaises--the attendant will place a towel pillow under your head) and warm and cool experience showers (a shower where you select your experience from a touch screen, which directs varying types of water flow, mist, music and lighting--very Vegasy). Men have a dry sauna, women have a Rhassoul, which involves mud application. There is also a coed Hammam room--a tiled marble table for exfoliation, plus benches. I enjoyed a 2 hour "Stress Buster" treatment, which included a body scrub, hot stone massage and facial massage. The pool area also is fairly large considering the size of the hotel, with 2 long lap pools, a couple of jacuzzis, a cafe and a variety of lounging areas including cabanas. It is on the southwest side of the hotel for afternoon sun. The fitness center is also fairly large, with a studio for yoga and other classes. DINING/BAR. We only tried the Mandarin Bar and the MOzen Bistro for breakfasts (included in our package). The Bar probably has the best public views from the hotel, situated as it is on the highest hotel floor and closest to the strip, with north, east and south views. Be aware that all north views will be dominated by the CityCenter complex. The drinks were tasty, the sliders good but not warm enough. MOzen, situated on the 3rd floor along with the meeting rooms and business center, is a busy place at breakfast--foreign guests and a lot of business folks (there was another large convention at the LV Convention Center). The food was decent, but one time took about 45 minutes to arrive. The continental buffet was elegant but far from ample. For dinner, the Bistro offers pan-Asian menu. ODDS & ENDS. Our biggest ding for the MO was no free Wifi! In the Business Center, internet access is free for 5 minutes, but your time is constantly interrupted by pop-ups asking if you want to extend your time for $10.95 for 15 minutes. The hotel has a complimentary house car on a first-come, first-served basis. It was never available for us, so we had to take a taxi to our convention. Although the MO is non-gaming, Aria and Monte Carlo are short walks away, with the Cosmopolitan and Bellagio a bit further. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. This is one of the more elegant and quiet hotels on the Strip, similar in vibe to the Four Seasons at Mandalay, but a bit further removed from the madding crowd. Service was of high quality throughout, and the hotel's smaller size makes for a more personal stay. This is not the place for you if you want to be in the middle of the action, but you really only have to take a few steps outside for that.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and Absolutely Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Stephen M
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is does not have gambling anywhere. We were visiting Las Vegas for the shows and shopping and didn't want the constant noise and the 'ding sing ding' of the one arm bandits combined the haze of stale smoke wafting all around. Room was exceptional. The electric curtains opened up as we walked in and provided a great view of 'The strip' The suite was well furnished and had a number of extras not usually seen in 5 star hotels. From the usual bathrobes (very good quality) to a host of technical gadgets & electrical adaptors. My wife thought the ornate drawer box in the bathroom was a nice touch, This contained everything from sewing kit, manicure set and even toothbrush/paste and razor / creme. Many hotels have these but you allways have to request them. The bathroom contained a massive shower and huge marbled bath tub with rose petals at the side, bath salts and various other bits and pieces. We ordered room service as we had just had a 6 hr flight in from New York. Very good quality delivered in 20 minutes. The additioonal fee of $6 + tax + tip is very reasonable for Vegas. Breakfast was also excellent (both in the room and in MoZen restaurant) Huge variety of both American and oriental cuisine. During our second night the Air con in the bedroom failed. The staff could not have been more helpful and instantly upograded us up to a Dynasty suite. This was totally unbelieveable and has to be seen. Go to their website to see these suites. The outdoor pool complex is situated on the 8th floor. It has 2 pools, jacuzzi + childrens pools. Plenty of very helpful and keen staff. Plenty of loungers, and occational furniture. The staff move the parasols to where you require without you needing to ask. Luxury Cabanas at an extra fee, these have TVs, fans, mist sprays and sofa / furniture as well. The food around the pool is quite exceptional. The Spa is without doubt the best we have ever visited. The treatments are very expensive at around $250/300 each, but worth the experience. The hotel was so good that we extended our stay at The Mandarin Oriental. The staff are quite exceptional. Very polite, helpful and knowledgable. They are also discreet and don't hover around you hankering for a tip. In conclusion, the best hotel we have ever stayed in, better than the best London can offer, such as The MO in London, Claridges, Savoy, Ritz, Hempel, Blakes etc etc. Only 1 hotel has ever come close and that is The Landmark. We had been told that you can wait for 10 minutes for cabs at this hotel We never waited more than a minute. The hotel is very select, does not allow visitors or browsers in. Visitors are only allowed in if they have booked one of the restaurants or a spa treatment. This keeps the hotel exclusive and secure. The location between The new City Center complex and Monte Carlo is very good, (Midway between Bellagio and New York New York) and right next door to Crystals, which has the most exclusive designer shops in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SallyJonesCowplain
Reviews.Content: Have just spent an amazing week at the Madarin Oriental in Las Vegas. It is a very serene hotel and I could not fault the staff or the service. They even arranged to check us in for our homebound flight and print our boarding passes. We found it to be conveniently placed on the strip but taxis are available the minute you walk out the door and are reasonably priced. The area around the swimming pools are a calm oasis away from the noise and bustle of the strip. Food and drinks are pricey but there are plenty of places on the strip to eat and drink if you don't want to pay these prices. Loved this place and would return if we ever have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Atmosphere in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Emiliano L
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great staff and amenties, however it doesn't reflect the Las Vegas style... It's a little bit pricy considering that it doesn't have a Casino and that it's a little far from the main attractions. It's located at the beginning of the Strip, 20 minutes walking distance from the Bellagio, and 40 from the Venetian... On the other hand the Mandarin Bar is a very good solution to spend a few hours before going out. It's located at the top floor, and it offers a very nice view of the Strip together with a high level service. If you are looking for a relaxing atmosphere in Las Vegas, the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas is the best solution for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice, for Vegas at least...”
Reviews.Author: rita i
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the Pros of this hotel: 1. The Service, this is impeccable! Probably the best service we have ever gotten in a hotel, by far. 2. The Cleanliness and overall feel of the hotel, very quite, clean and room was fairly spacious. The Cons (a longer list): 1. The water pressure and shower, this is THE worst shower I have ever taken, at a hotel or at home! THE water literally dripped from the shower head! This was such an issue that we had to call the front desk (we honestly NEVER do this), to which they sent up an engineer and he said that this seems like a normal shower. After which the front desk rep said that she would try to locate a room for us with better water pressure, an hour late we received a phone call that all the rooms and suites had the same water pressure. Again, the service was beyond belief, and I appreciate their efforts. Never the less we were stuck taking these horrible showers for 3 nights. 2. The Spa, I have no idea what spas people go to, that they rank this spa in their top spas??? I mean there was nothing special, and the size is fairly small. previously I have been to the spas in Encore, Pallazo, Venitian and Aria, and all of those rank above the Mandarin spa. The BEST being the spa at Encore. Mandarin spa does not rank anywhere close to it. Not to mention we were charged $60 per person for just the use of the spa facilities. 3. The Pool, it was just way too small. There were two pools on the deck, and one of them was so narrow that only one person could swim laps there at one time. It was a very relaxing area, which you would expect from Mandarin, and the music was melancholy. It the kind of place where you would take a nap instead of having the fun Vegas pool experience. 4. The Food, while the food was by no means bad, it was terribly overpriced and only mediocre (again, by Vegas standards). The Bottom Line: at the end of our trip I always reflect on why i liked or didn't like something, and here is what I came up with for Mandarin. If this hotel was in any other city, say New York, Chicago, Los Angeles even, I probably would have LOVED it. Yet, having stayed at other Vegas hotels, again: Encore, Wynn, Pallazo, Venitian, Mirage, they all are better than MO. You just don't get the luxury and and the beauty that you get at those other places, not to mention the pools, the INCREDIBLE food, and the spas. We found ourselves going to that side of the strip every day. I will not stay at this hotel ever again, and I don't recommend that anyone would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyCali74
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a loud and busy hotel with drunks and gamblers running around, the Mandarin Oriental is not for you. This place is visually stunning and tranquil. The rooms are TO DIE FOR!!! Beautifully designed and comfortable. The bathroom is incredible. And, there's such attention to detail throughout. The service is top quality and very friendly. And, the restaurant is delicious. I highly recommend. NOTE: The only thing you have to work out is transportation from the hotel to the airport. I had a hard time getting a taxi. Because the hotel is set back from the strip, (even with the hotel's help) it took much longer than expected to get a cab, so that made for a stressful exit. Now that I know it's an issue, I'll plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, quiet, great location.”
Reviews.Author: nik_google
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Great location on the strip. * Staff generally just on the right side of obsequiousness. * No casino, so you're not running the gauntlet of slot machines every time you go in and out. * Room was great -- comfortable, spotless, large, excellent bed, good shower and spacious tub. Cons: * Breakfast in the 3rd floor restaurant was OK, but not good value for money. * Wanted to extract $18/day for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Luxury Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LakeView10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights from the end of September to eary October in this wonderful quiet oasis in the new City Center development in Las Vegas. From the moment of our arrival, we were well taken care of by the attentive staff. The room was spacious, spotlessly clean and up-to-date with the latest technology and with a super view on to the famous Strip. Especially appreciated was the warm personalized welcome from "B" who checked us in and escorted us to our room on the 16th floor.She kept in contact with us during our stay and provided lots of good help when required. Also appreciated was the hotel limo service and the outstanding driver. The manager must be very proud of his excellent staff. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best way to experience Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALT1976UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mandarin for 4nts at the start of September and was blown away by it. The rooms are large and modern, the pool area cool and sophisticated with awesome food, a great Thai Restaurant and a bar overlooking the strip with panoramic windows. I had been to Vegas earlier in the Year and was put off by how smokey all the hotels were and my clothes stank for ages and my breathing was bad due to this but this hotel gave me the perfect experience that Las Vegas has to offer. The Mandarin Oriental was non smoking and has no casino so you feel like you could be anywhere in the world. Staff are 10/10. My hotel of choice in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - great stay”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfixation
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in Vegas staying at the Mandarin Oriental and booked this based on other TA reviews. Excellent choice. We had a strip view suite and the room was fantastic. Okay the electronic blinds, air, tv, music etc got some getting use too but it was a remote control for my husband so he was happy.... The staff were excellent. A slight hiccup on checkin (room not ready) was overlooked by the service and their sincere apologies for the inconvenience. Location was great in the heart of everything. We walked through several other hotels whilst there all were smokey, noisey due to poker machines and no where near as security conscious as the Mandarin. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful. Would not stay anywhere else whilst in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sit back, relax, and enjoy the experience - very critical review”
Reviews.Author: MonteChicago
Reviews.Content: I'm being very critical and giving it 4 stars because otherwise you won't read it :) We have stayed at Wynn, Belaggio, Cosmopolitan, Hard Rock, MGM Skylofts, Palazzo, and Encore Suites in the past to give you some Vegas perspective. We arrived very late on Friday night (11:30pm). An employee of the hotel met us immediately after we got our bags out of the car and whisked us directly to our room. No Check in necessary and we signed our credit card authorization once in the room. Nice gesture and great since we already had a long day. Room: They upgraded us to a StripView Suite and when we walked in we were a little perplexed. The living room is on a very weird angle so you feel likes its very small. When he opened the blinds we were facing the "ugly side of the strip" meaning gift shops, convenient stores, etc. The bellman came up with our bags and the closet was very small, especially for a suite. We only had 6 hangers and hardly any space to put our shoes and other items as well. Our Bedroom was comfortable and the view was great from that room (very small window). I was not thoroughly impressed although the quality of the doors, bed, and lighting was top notch. I guess they put 500 sq. feet of the 800 in the bathroom. Bathroom was giagantic with a two person soaking tub, massive shower, seperate toilet area, and two sinks. So, it was nice overall and my suggestion is save some money and get a normal room if you can. Spa: Including all the Vegas hotel spas mentioned above I've probably been to 40+ spas around the country. This is in my top 2. The facilities were spectacular, clean, and service level amazing. I got there an hour early and the attendant showed me around (Sauna, Steam, Laconium (which is in between heat levels of suana and steam), 2 rain shower experiences (not one for a bar of soap, just for standing in and hitting the digital screen for various body sprays), a hot tub (had 4 loungers built in that had individual bubblers, so if anyone was in there with you it would be like lounging at the beach next to someone not staring at each other). Also, they had many heated relaxation loungers in there as well. I was there on a Saturday at 10am and only saw one person for 10 minutes. Later I found out they try to schedule things this way for the ultimate privacy and relaxation. The attendarnt literally followed me around and would pop up with clean towels and cold towels when I stepped out of each room. Seriously Jonathan needs to get a raise or a promotion. For me to remember his name is saying enough. This was our trip without our baby (first one) and I booked a time capsule 2 hours in a spa suite. The spa suite is worth every penny. It has an amazing shower, hot jacuzzi for 2, loungers, massage tables, and more. Pool: We did rent a cabana for the day and we had a lot of fun. However, for a new hotel I did not find it that nice. Yes, its Mandarin Oriental and its clean. However, staying at the Cosmopolitan and seeing there pool scene and cabanas (with clear hot tubs) this seemed a little dated. Again nothing wrong with it, but it was just OK. Service at the pool was again OK and I'm not sure I would be dying to run back there. After the spa day I expected a more "sanctuary" like pool area. Food/Restaurants: We had breakfast at Mozen Bistro and it was mediocre. I got the menu and it coffee stains on every page. I looked over and the whole window sill and crumbs and dirt all over the floor. We got an omelet and I got the ham and egg sandwich (well it had no top so I guess it should be called open faced). I could have a better breakfast food anywhere on the strip. Also, since this place has no casino its charging breakfast like any high end resort. 20+ dollars an entree, so it better be damn good. We never ate again at the hotel and its very boring there. Obviously I went to have a place to relax and have fun on the strip. However, they never make it that inviting to want to stay at the hotel and have fun one night. Overall I absolutely loved the hotel and the vibe for wanting to have a relaxing time in Vegas when you want to get away from it all. However the room and food would maybe have me think twice if its not a romantic getaway. If you don't go to the spa then your really missing out.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: MadisonJack
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome on (23rd floor), fabulous room with views as seen on film. Staff were super efficient and hotel like an oasis of calm in a busy but wonderful city. Location is in the heart of everything with all major attractions within walking distance of public transport to shopping malls and Fremont Street (old Strip) Breakfast service superb if a tad expensive, but a "Denny's" a short walk for full American feast at $15 We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet In the Storm”
Reviews.Author: boyohboy10
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is an oasis of calm in the middle of the wild Vegas strip. The decor and service are as superb as you would expect from a Mandarin Hotel. There is no casino which means you can get to the elevator without a 100 yard dash through chaos. If you want a casino one is not hard to find!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Great Service. No Smoking, No Casino.”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_Dearest
Reviews.Content: A quiet haven from the noise, crowds and stench of cigarette smoke that characterizes Las Vegas. We each had CityScape suites, which were immaculately clean and well-appointed. The shape is a bit odd. I recommend floors 14 - 20 for the best views. Lower and you are just looking at rooftops or nearby buildings. Living room was well apointed with a sofa, coffee table and flat screen tv. Bedroom was a nice size and had a desk with wifi outlets. It is wonderful to have both the sheer curtains and the black-out curtains able to be opned or closed from the wall buttons. Lighting and tv also are done by wall button. Large extra firm pillows are on the bed and great for sitting up to read or watch tv. Call housekeeping if you prefer smaller soft down pillows for sleeping. Good closet space for a short stay. Bathroom is also big in size. Tub was okay for one person but not that comfortable. Shower is large, and the water pressure is okay. Great assortment of amenities. Soap smells really good. Double sinks. Towels were disappointingly thin. Toilet is in a frosted glass enclosure - fine if only one person is in the room - odd if two were in the bathroom. Toilet paper roll in an odd postion. Service throughout the hotel is outstanding, from the valet to the concierge, to the housekeepers. Breakfast is excellent on the third floor. Room service food was good, and brought on time. Twist Restaurant on the 23rd floor is very romantic for dinner, with a great view. Soundproofing in the hotel is excellent, and it is refreshing to have a quiet relatively uncrowded spot in Las Vegas. It would be my hotel of choice in the City, partially because it is new and has all the amenities you want in a luxury hotel, and also because it is smoke free, which is wonderful. Cirque du Soleil water show at the Bellagio was outstanding. Try to watch the fountain show at night in the front of the hotel, as well. Informal yet expensive Wolfgang Puck's 'Cut' Restaurant had superb kobe beef steaks and a delicious banana cream pie for dessert. The nearby formal 'Guy Savoy' restaurant (at the MGM Mansion) with a 16 course tasting menu were both superb. The Mandalay Bay aquarium (shark reef) is worth visiting as well for 30 - 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ClarinCheshire
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the hotel (we have previously stayed at the Paris and Luxor) and it exceeded our expectations. We had some reservations as to whether we would enjoy our Vegas experience as much as we had previously done because we had chosen a non casino hotel, but we were not disapointed. The hotel facilities are stunning and the service is fantastic. We would certainly choose to stay in this hotel again. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the strip and several of the newer resort hotels, connected via various walkways, so its easy to get around. The rooms are lovely and have lots of nice touches such as the large bathtub with TV in the bathroom, free water, remote control curtains! The staff couldn't do enough for you and the hotel bar has a great view of the strip, well worth a visit albeit quite pricey. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds excelence!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas V
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Mandarin Oriental Hotel and I can only recomend this hotel. I had the feeling everything had been tought over to make your stay perfect. I've been travelling for over 15 years for business and i've rarely seen that kind of dedication from the staff, as from doormen, counter- to restaurant personel. The accomodation is a real pearl, the hotelrooms are pieces of design from bedroom to bathroom and clean like a freshly minted coin. I can't think of anything that wasn't foreseen. We also visited both restaurants and they were magnificent, the restaurant crew does realy everything to meet your desires and the food is of the highest quality. As Belgians we are fond of fine dining and honestly, they can compete with Europe's best. For me it was one the finest hotels i've visited and whitout a doubt the finest on the Strip. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Danni145
Reviews.Content: Had the most fantastic time at this hotel. The service was outstanding and would rate as the best service I have received anywhere in the world. Loved the room and the design features of this hotel. All staff were friendly and helpful and the concierge service was wonderful (especially Hayley). Loved the pool area and also the peace and quiet of the hotel. Stayed here 2 nights and then 2 nights at The Encore and although The Encore was good I found myself wishing I was back at The Mandarin. Stay here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “26 Nights of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: balimontana
Reviews.Content: My partner and I checked into the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas for 26 nights this August. As a frequent Vegas business traveller I know all of the top hotels on the Strip. For those seeking quiet discrete luxury with genuine 5 Star service The Mandarin Oriental is the best option in Vegas. Our favorite things about the Mandarin: 1.) Guest suite was large and luxurious. Rooms and suites are very nicely appointed. 2.) Pool area was never crowded and the service was immediate and genuinely friendly. 3.) The staff - WOW - what a quality group of individuals. The staff we met during our month were genuinely friendly and service oriented. Many of them were serious professional hoteliers and not just there for a paycheck. You could tell they enjoyed their jobs and took pride in providing a high level of service. Not one time did we meet an obvious "tip monger". If you're a regular traveller to Las Vegas you know what a "tip monger" is without need for further explanation! 4.) The excellent center strip location. Close to everything. 5.) Quiet discrete low-key luxury. Not walking through a casino to reach our room was a very pleasant luxury. You can't go wrong with this hotel. Why choose it over the Four Seasons? Because it's newer, fresher and has a better center Strip location. For the discerning Las Vegas traveller who enjoys a genuine 5 star experience this is the finest hotel in the city. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel let down by staff”
Reviews.Author: Gail M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, rooms amazing although the air con didnt go down as low as i would have liked and found myself always waking in the middle of the night with the heat as there was no sheets on the bed only a heavy duvet? The staff let this hotel down, they were bordering on being extremely annoying, twice i had staff walk into the room without waiting for the door to be answered. There was an air of snobiness which was very uncomfortable. Some staff were rather rude and so completely fakea, if they thought you didnt have money they werent that interested. We were late one morning for the free breakfast we got with our package and the lady said it wouldnt be a problem. We then later found out they charged us nearly $70 (even after i left a $20 tip at breakfast) for 2 breakfasts. When i went to reception to explain that the lady at the bistro had said it was still ok to get breakfast the lady at reception did take the charge off our bill but acted as if she was doing me a favour when it was their own mistake. We did meet onbe member of staff that made this stay a bit better. Christian was friendly, genuine, and chatted to us for a long time at breakfast. I will not be staying at this hotel again or any other mandarin oriental hotel. You can get cheaper hotels at the same quality if not better, with much friendlier staff who dont make you feel uncomfortable and bug you every 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: Dario S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, large luxurious rooms, excellent service, away from the crowd. fantastic experience

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic retreat away from the craziness”
Reviews.Author: kevinl31
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than expected and anticipated having to wait to check in. We left our bags with the doorman to be stowed then went up to the 23rd floor to let them know we had arrived. They checked us in early (11:30 am) and had our bags sent up within minutes. Very friendly and welcoming atmosphere that made you forget you were in Vegas. We were given a corner room that overlooked the strip. Super clean and roomy. I will definitely return to this wonderful oasis in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert!”
Reviews.Author: LarryinCA
Reviews.Content: Went to the MO for a couple of days of celebration. Amid the craziness that is the Strip, the MO is an ocean of calm and serenity, especially if you're willing to indulge in a spa treatment or two. From the moment you arrive, you are personally greeted and addressed. The staff is extremely attentive. The rooms are tranquil, clean and quiet. There is no casino, so there is no riffraff coming in from the street. In fact, we even found a cabbie who didn't even know the hotel existed. And it's centrally located on the strip. One of the cool things is that the curtains, lights, tv and media are all operated off the same remote control.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: omanolo
Reviews.Content: The MO is from my point of view the best place in town, with a little restriction that you dont have a casino in the hotel. for some this will be an advantage for some not. The rooms are fantastic designed... arefreshing mixtre of asian and european style combining modern and traditional elements. The bed is the best I ever slept in... The service is superior... and basicaly what you would expect from MO. The food in generel is very good, unfortunately i cant judge abot the sushi. Only breakfast could be a bit less american like. One of the highlight is the tea lounge and the bar which are locaten somewhere in the mid level of the building with a fascinating vie on the strip (see photos). summarizing... fantastic :)

Reviews.Title: “Wow - beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familygdl
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely has the wow factor. Reception is on the 23rd floor overlooking the strip. They have a beautiful orange aroma throughout the public areas. Our room wasn't ready so we were offered afternoon tea in the lobby. Our son was given a gift (and an in room snack). The room was flash including the room central control panel. There's a TV in the bathroom mirror to watch TV in the tub - very cool. They even had a hair straightener along with the usual hair dryer. Lovely toilettries. Housekeeping is on the ball - they organised my own toilettries! Turn down service is nice too. The pool area is also lovely - excellent service from bar and poolside staff. Excellent service throughout the stay. It is a pricey hotel and I found it strange to have to pay a hefty "bond"for incidentals up front (refunded on check out). We were a little bothered by street noise (we were on the 11th floor facing the strip). It was the only hotel during our trip which charged for wifi ($18/day!). Nevertheless, a beautiful hotel with friendly, professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: gth01
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. We stayed for three nights - in a room on the 20th floor, located under the sky lobby, with phenomenal Strip views. The view has to be the best thing of all about the room. I could have sat for hours just taking it all in. The room was very high-tech, with the curtains, lights, TV, alarm call etc. all controlled electronically, either via switches at strategic points, via the TV or via a console by the bed. There was even a TV in the bathroom. The bathroom was exceptionally luxurious with a deep standalone tub, a large walk-in shower and two basins. The bed was very comfortable and very large. There was a well-stocked mini bar, and free water bottles. The room was totally dark with the curtains closed and very quiet at night - perfect for light sleepers. If there was a downside it was in the design of the room. The bathroom in our room had partially glazed walls - one of these could be covered by a sliding wooden screen, one couldn't. The toilet was set in a recess with a frosted glazed door. It would make things difficult if travelling with a non-intimate friend. Unfortunately, wi-fi wasn't included in our room rate (that was 18 dollars a day). I cannot understand why the large hotel chains persist in charging for internet access. For many people these days this is a utility like water or electricity - i.e. an essential. The staff have been very well trained, but sometimes it's a bit OTT. While at breakfast one morning we had to chat with the maitre'd, then the waiter who brought the juice and then the waiter who took our order. It was a bit too early in the morning for all that. You could have asked for anything and the staff would have brought it for you. We went to have a look at the pool area one day. To do this we passed the lobby where the staff asked if they could help, we then passed the spa, where the staff asked if we needed any help and when we actually got to the pool the staff made an immediate bee-line for us and asked us if we wanted any help. Lovely but too much. I know I can't complain about this - I'm certainly not going to mark the hotel down for it. You could have asked for anything and they would have brought it for you. While at the hotel I didn't use the spa or the pool. The lobby is very impressive - verging on awesome. The hotel has a dress code according to in-room literature. We certainly didn't always conform to this and nobody pulled us up on it. It did make me feel a little awkward though... I would definitely return. I might even take some smarter clothes next time.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie M
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, non smoking, unassuming entrance, transport available at one's convenience. Rooms and views are spectacular. Love the bath, the salts, the music. The service is excellent. Love,love, love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sean D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights (12th to 16th Sept 2011). Everything about this hotel is excellent. Our room was terrific, large, very clean, very modern and with a great bathroom. The staff are very courteous and helpful and nothing seems too much bother for them. Room service was excellent and the lounge on the 23rd floor is a great place for a drink (with an excellent view of the strip). The location is very good, right next to the Aria, Crystal Shopping Centre (this is very upmarket but has some good places to eat) and a short walk to Bellagio and Ceasar's Palace (although you can catch a free monorail from Aria to Bellagio). There is a 24 hr CVS supermarket/pharmacy right next door which is also very handy. Overall a terrific hotel and would be my first choice if I return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis amongst the Madness of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: billichka
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in - period! We stayed for 10 nights in September and received a surprise upgrade to a cityscape room with strip view! The rooms are huge, quiet and have every conceivable amenity. A control pad controls your tv, alarm clock, curtains, do not disturb status and other things too. Rooms are made up during the day with a seperate turn down service in the evening. My attempt to tip the turn down maid was refused! Daily complimentary bottled water was provided as well as a complimentary shoe shine service. Room service was expensive (this is a 5 star hotel remember) but was so good that it represented value for money (gotta try the Kobe Beef Burger!). Dinner at the Mozen bistro was exceptional both at the tables and sitting atthe sushi bar. The sushi in particular was very good with the chef creating some innovative dishes that I hadn't seen before back in Australia. I didn't try the pool but could see from our room that it wasn't crowded. The location cannot be beaten as it is right on the strip - no need to walk a long way through a casino to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: xplorthwrld
Reviews.Content: if you want real luxury you'll get it. Rooms are super, high tech, great comfort. Service is superior. I stayed for a meeting but food was excellent anyway. Location is great, the hotel has everything close. I would love go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ooo La La”
Reviews.Author: MisplacedHawaiian
Reviews.Content: Alright...let me start by saying that this had to be the nicest hotel overall that I've ever stayed in. Our 'room attendant' greeted us at the door by name and escorted us up to the lobby of the hotel, which we proptly bypassed and went straight up to our room. We endulged that weekend and booked one of their 'suite deals' meaning we got one free night our of three (thank god!). We were in one of the corner suite (ends in the hundreds...ex 500) and all I can say is WOW!. We arrived at night to floor to ceiling windows that wrapped around the corner and gave us a perfect view of the entire strip from one side to the other....amazing. The room was large and nicely appointed with everything that you may need...one drawback was the closet sort of stuffed in the corner. Service at this hotel is top notch....although with the price of everything from breakfast to a beer at the pool it should be! We were lucky enough to have a day at their award winning spa, what a treat....absolutely hands down the best spa experience I have ever had, which is saying a lot! Make sure you have the entire day to spend there...go really early and enjoy the entire facility...because after your treatment you might drown in the whirlpool in the state you'll be in. We'll be back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Over-the-top Service”
Reviews.Author: Teedub44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend Sept 9-12, 2012 and was very impressed by several things: (1) Check-in was efficient and friendly (no wait) (2) Hotel staff greeted my buddy and I by our last names whenever we entered the hotel (3) The room was gorgeous and the bed was by far the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I even contemplated stealing a pillow (but didn't) (3) Housekeeping staff folded EVERY piece of clothing that was in the room and neatly aligned all the shoes long the wall (4) The hotel provided car service (Mercedes Benz) to all our local destinations, including the airport upon our departure. (5) NO RESORT FEES!!!! There is no casino, but if you want gaming the Aria is a 2 minute walk from the lobby. Other casinos are less than a 5 minute walk.
