Don't worry about needing to take one elevator to the check-in area and another to your room. We found this to be a VERY minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous non-gaming hotel, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Diva-KD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 1815 for 5 nights at the end of August/ beginning of September to celebrate our first anniversary. It was our first time in Las Vegas and while we wanted to enjoy the gambling scene, we were happy to return to a quiet non-smoking, non-gaming hotel for some calm. Our room was stunning, with a great view of the Planet Hollywood Hotel and the Eiffel Tower (Paris resort). We thought the window was strange as it had a mirrored panel, whereas just glass would've been better for photos of the room/ view. The bed was big and comfortable. The bathroom was also nice, with two sinks, a TV screen, a big bath and lovely bath salts. The hotel welcomed us with a small cake wishing us a Happy Anniversary, which we felt was a lovely touch. :) We decided to go to the pool for breakfast every day, as we wanted to sit outside and make our choices from the menu (instead of a buffet). The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We loved eating by the pool as it wasn't too busy and it was a relaxed atmosphere. The menu was excellent - we particularly enjoyed the muesli and granola. The bagels and yogurts were also good and the coffee was perfect. :) We were able to head over to the pool area as soon as we'd finished breakfast. The pool area is very trendy, lots of cabanas that you can rent with big screen TVs inside and ceiling fans. We were happy enough with the sunloungers and parasols. Staff occasionally brought round complimentary iced smoothie drinks and melon balls to each guest, and there were bottles of iced water available. The pool is a fine size and perfect for cooling off after sunbathing. There are also spa pools round the corner, but we didn't use them. The poolside lunch menu was excellent, especially the chicken tenders and fries. On our last day, the hotel had a Labor Day BBQ - the food was amazing, especially the mini desserts. We spent some time in the Mandarin bar one evening, enjoying the views, fancy cocktails and a jazz band. The location of the hotel is excellent - there are walkways across the strip and heading up to the Cosmopolitan Hotel. We managed to walk around easily enough (even though it was boiling hot) to various restaurants and casinos for sightseeing. We took a few taxis when going further up the strip (to Stratosphere Tower). At the front of the hotel it was mostly just a short wait for a taxi, apart from the busy weekend, when we had to wait for a bit longer. We loved staying at this hotel and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis in a mad city!”
Reviews.Author: badgerfrombristol
Reviews.Content: We recently got married in Las Vegas - and stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 3 nights. From the moment we stepped out of the cab from the hotel we were received a warm welcome from all the staff. We had a great room with a strip-view - and a complimentary bottle of champagne - thanks for that too! The hotel does not have a casino inside - which I think helps to make this an extra special place, where you can take a breather from the mad city outside. We only hope that Mandarin Oriental Paris lives up to the same standard on our first anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: kjawi
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt...the best hotel we've ever been to. I don't write reviews and am picky as can be but I need to write this because I am so impressed. In summary: - courteous and friendly staff - impeccable accommodations - room very clean, modern, spacious and quiet --- didn't hear anyone closing doors, flushing toilets, talking, etc. - pool (and hotel) is an oasis in the Vegas strip madness - conveniently located to everything - no casino equals no crowd, no smoke and no buffets - 5 star all the way for a very reasonable price Ok, there were a couple MINOR things....someone sneaking a smoke in the side pool area and a room thermostat that kept resetting itself during the night to 73 degrees. When we return to Vegas, we will only stay at the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jefft53
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Mandarin in August. It is brilliantly positioned for all the Vegas attractions but is an oasis of tranquillity with none of the brashness and anonymity of the big casino resorts. The service and quality are impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “HIgh Tea”
Reviews.Author: rosiehowe
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a reservation to high tea at the Mandarin Oriental. Fantastic views, and excellent service. Loved all the food, large tea menu, and awesome deserts. We went for the $40/pp, would highly recommend. Oh, my husband was able to dress "smart casual"!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: lulumommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas a few times a year for conventions/trade shows. We always stay in 5 star hotels because the online deals make them so affordable. We booked the Mandarin when we received a particularly great deal last spring. We had 2 trade shows back to back and decided to stay in 2 different hotels to break up the trip. The Mandarin was our 2nd hotel. Neither of us are gamblers and so we appreciated being in a hotel without a casino. From the time we arrived, we knew we were in for a special experience. Everything was so serene, most unusual in a town like Vegas!. The staff was both attentive and professional. The room was gorgeous and the bathroom was truly special, with wonderful amenities, rose petals in the tub, and a television screen that was in the the mirror! Calm music playing when we walked in, everything computerized, everything working perfectly. Bar had great drinks and view of the Strip. We tried the less expensive restaurant one night for dinner and that was excellent. Some of the best sushi we ever ate. Many other dining choices within walking distance in City Center so dining is not a problem if you don't want to travel. Pool area was gorgeous, very low key, not a party atmosphere at all. Didn't try the spa but it looked beautiful. If you are looking for a non Vegas experience in Vegas, you just can't go wrong. We felt like we were in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “The best service in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MarioApostolov
Reviews.Content: I have been to every hotel in Las Vegas and a lot of them are not bad at all, but this one is the top, especially the service. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent"”
Reviews.Author: FriendsVancouver
Reviews.Content: Beautiful 23rd floor lobby. Had an excellent strip view room. Perfect for families. Excellent location in the middle of the strip. As the hotel has no casino it is very peaceful. Easy access to Aria and shopping. One of the best hotels we have stayed in. Bathroom and amenities are outstanding. Great staff who call you by your name.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: StevenandBec
Reviews.Content: As a background, my fiance and I stayed at this hotel on the last stop of our round the world trip. It was the biggest and most expensive hotel that we stayed in for the entire trip, and as we had lashed out a bit, we were really looking forward to our stay. We arrived on the first day at 3pm to be told that our room wasn't ready yet, it was just awaiting a 'final inspection'. That was no problem as we were starving anyway so we left and got a late lunch. When we came back, our room still wasn't ready. We were told 'it is getting there, it just needs a final inspection' - the same as they told us an hour before. We were given complimentary tea while we waited. After asking again, eventually the room was ready just before 5pm. When we finally got to our room, it was beautiful. It is well designed and spacious and we had a strip view room with a great view of the strip. As it was the final leg of our trip, we were being careful with our budget, so we checked our credit card before we went out that evening. There was a $1200 charge on there that we hadn't made. We called reception to check if they had charged our card when we swiped it on check in and were told no. We then spent 30 mins on the phone to Australia trying to find out what the charge was only to find out that the hotel HAD charged our remaining balance to our card plus $170 a night for incidentals, without telling us. Unfortunately for us, this pretty much used up our remaining money for our trip. We received a note and some macaroons that evening for the stuff around with our check in, however unfortunately with the credit card incident as well, we were already very disappointed. Additionally, for the first two nights we were there, we didn't receive the newpaper, even though they asked for our newspaper preference on check in. We had to go to reception and get this fixed. Finally, this was the only hotel we stayed in on our trip that didn't offer free wifi. These are small issues, but as a hotel that makes a point of offering great service, we were disappointed. The hotel itself and the decor are beautiful and cannot be faulted - there was even a TV in the mirror in our bathroom! It's also in a great location on the strip. Unfortunately though, the service did not match the surroundings. Final tip: If you are coming back late at night (which you probably are in Vegas), you can't get back to your room via the third floor as you can during the day. Because of the strange lift/lobby set up you need to go up to the sky lobby, then change lifts and go back down to your room. We weren't told this on check in a so thought the lift was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Head and shoulders above the rest”
Reviews.Author: Trompe_Le_Monde
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of 5 star properties on the strip - the Mandarin Oriental beats the competition hands down. The service is impeccable and personal....let's face it, most of the top hotels in Vegas have great rooms and amenities, but lack the personal attention that MO delivers in spades. The rooms and decor are beautiful and elegant and the bed was amazingly comfortable. This hotel does not have gaming which makes it an oasis in the Vegas jungle. Will make it my choice for a luxury the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing haven in a fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: Colinmc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a beautiful Haven for relaxation inbetween the gamblimng party heaven of las vegas A+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: F4monty
Reviews.Content: You know you're in for a treat staying at a Mandarin Oriental and this one delivers the goods in spades. Visually stunning and handily located in the new City Center development, it's hard to find anything wrong with it. It's really handy for places like Bellagio and The Cosmopolitan and just a short drive to the airport. The Sky Lobby on the 23rd floor was stunning and our room with a view of the strip was luxury from end to end, complete with all mod cons and totally quiet despite the madness outside. Air conditioning was a bit over the top but no hotel seems capable of getting it right. We did not use the spa or pool, although the latter looked like a great oasis amid all the concrete. Breakfast was excellent but pricey (almost $100 a day for two!). Free water is available all day. Service was stunning although sometimes you could do with a bit of privacy and without the inevitable conversation with a maitre d! My main criticism was having to pay for wifi. I'm typing this in an independent hotel where wifi is free - something the chains can learn from.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hide Away In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TMCNEWS
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas several times a year and have stayed at many different hotels along the strip and have also had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Golden Nugget years ago, a mistake that I will not repeat. Recently I have been staying at the Mandarin Oriental in City Center. This is an amazing hotel that offers you an escape from the craziness that is the Vegas Strip. When you arrive at MO you are greeted by very professional and helpful Bellman. If it is your first visit to MO they will escort you to the 23rd floor lobby where the Front Desk is located. It is a little odd set up but you travel up to the 23rd floor lobby and then go to another bank of elevators and go down to your room. I’ve gotten use to it so it is no big deal anymore for me. The 23rd floor lobby is nothing short of amazing and must be experienced. There is a sitting area next to the front desk with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the strip. Just next to that is the Mandarin Bar with even more spectacular views of the Strip. The rooms are very spacious and contain beds that are more comfortable than I have ever found in all of my travels. An interesting feature in the room is the Butler’s Closet. It is located next to the door and can be used for deliveries to the room (ice, shoe shines and so on) without disturbing you. (see attached photo) The bathroom is nice with a great shower. The water pressure is strong and gets very hot if you like that. The giant tub sits in the middle of the room with views of City Center. I will say that the sinks are not in the best spots for men who want to shave. They are in the corner and tough to work without spilling water all over the counter. Housekeeping has been phenomenal. I left the room on my last night in town to visit the Mandarin Bar. On my way out I saw that the privacy light was still on so I turned it off. When I returned to the room about an hour later Housekeeping had been there to do the turn down service. I was surprised by this because of the hour and figured it was too late. With the turn down service comes a couple bottles of MO water, a nice touch especially being in the desert. The entire experience was great and I will certainly return when I go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Spa and dining experience unequalled”
Reviews.Author: Rbs7562
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for a business conference and we wanted to get away for an afternoon of quiet tranquil spa service and cuisine. The atmosphere was like a retreat, quiet relaxing and peaceful and you forgot you were in sin city, but entered an isolated paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LivingLaVidaLocaLV
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is new and beautiful and modern, it has logistic problems with it's 23rd floor lobby. You have to take one set of elevators to get to the lobby and then another set to get to the ground floor. Parking is Valet only but it is free. It is in City Center which has a lot of great restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil in the madness of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ADELLE181
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a New York/Las Vegas trip & I have to say that the Mandarin Oriental, Las Vegas is a haven of tranguil in an otherwise crazy Las Vegas. It's non gambling (apparently the only one in Las Vegas) which was great, I'm not into gambling, but if you are everyone needs an escape from it & you will find it here for sure. It's also in a great location. The staff throughout the hotel, as you would expect from a Manderin Oriental hotel, were superb. Eager to please & always there to assist with a smile on their faces - they must have some training program, as I have stayed at their London hotel a few times & they offer the same service with a smile - always! It was a celebration holiday & we were given a room upgrade - the rooms were especially nice - perfect in fact with all the necessary toiletries - even hair straightners! The pool area was very relaxing with a great choice of breakfast & lunch, which is reasonable priced - the portions can be big (egg sandwich $16/granola $15 etc) so get them to split between 2, which they will gladly do. One moan is a cup of tea (tea bag & hot water) is $9 - a tad overpriced, considering what you get on the plate when ordering an egg sandwich at less than double. The drinks & cocktails are fairly expensive ($16 approx), but this is the same as most of Las Vegas, for a similar standard of hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel & hope you have as much as a relaxing time as we did. If your going to any shows, would recommend La Reve - awesome - really fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Polished”
Reviews.Author: TheStandardBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This is what you'd expect from one of the worlds premier Hotel Chains. Professsional outstanding srevice. It warms the cockle of my heart to find that there are companies that truly believe that looking after the customer is paramount to success. Not disimilar to Bloomingdales Depatment Stores, the Mandarin Oriental, seems a company that obiviously belives in staff training,education and fostering a positive culture. As a customer this shows and I will be back for more please. There are too many instances to mention about how courteous and helpful the satff were on my families four day visit in Ausgust 2011. Our City Suite Suite was comfortably large with a sepearte sitting room with television. Large modern bathroom and spacious Bedroom area. The 16th Floor corner room afforded a warp around view of City Centre and a glimpse of the strip. The decor was modern, clean and functional. The air conditioning did require adjsutment from the Hotels engineer because we found that given the loaction of the vent in the bathroom hallway thare was a lack of circulation to the bedroom area. This was rectfied by having the register bypassed and the room cooled sufficently. That said it was one of the hottest weeks on record. Given the building is relatively new, part of the City Centre precinct, the Hotel has been outfitted in a modern style comapred to more traditional Mandarin Orientals like the one in Hong Kong. It does take some tinkering to work out how to operate the lights and curtians,but by the time you are about to leave you will have worked them out! My only dissapointment with our stay that was on ocasion there was some booming bass packed music from a nearby establishement which emenated the room,to the point where if you placed your hand on the expansive glass windws you could feel them vibrate.Particuraly frustrating was that it kept getting louder till 3am. I did contact the front desk the next day and they were more than happy to move us,though we were quite settled and stayed put. Fortunately though it did not hapen again untill the afternoon of the day we were departing. The pool area is quiet compared to other Hotels like the Belagio but thats a good thing if you like being away from the maddening crowds. Service is attenatvive and there are a great selection of poolside meals with a backdrop of relaxing tunes. The highlight of my experience was the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas Spa. I had the most beautiful and relaxing Spa expreience I have ever had. The one hour massage was devine and the Spa amentities too numerous to mention were fantastic. For the non gambler discerning tarevller the Mandarin Oriental provides a great alternative to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mahamer
Reviews.Content: Had one of the best vacations ever for what I wanted it to accomplish. I wanted to give my adult daughter a getaway before her second year of post-graduate school, and all the stress that goes along with that. We wanted the excitement of Vegas, but a place that would give us calm once we were in our hotel. Everything about the hotel fit this bill. The hotel had a Zen like quality from the moment you entered and were presented with a tray that held a wet rolled up cloth to help you cool down from the Nevada heat. The room was beautifully appointed, quiet and very clean. And the most invitingly comfortable bed we have ever slept in. The room was hi tech at its best. Everything could be controlled by the remote. The marble bathroom had a wonderful soaking tub. The long mirror over the vanity had a built in TV. Everything was thought of before we could even think of it. The pool area was very relaxing and had a top notch professional staff there to assist you with your every need. All the restaurants in the hotel were top notch. The hotel made this vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sussed_nl
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Las Vegas for a Trade Show this August. Having been to Las Vegas a few times before, I wasn't too interested in the casino's. The Mandarin Oriental proved not only a perfect choice to escape all the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas but this was the (almost) perfect hotel experience. From the reception downstair, to upstairs they make you feel welcome. We had a great room facing the strip looking north. The room was nice and roomy, the bathroom was perfect with a great bath, separate shower and toilet. And all was kept very clean. I had to do a lot of work and it was comfortable having a nice desk. Normally we don't eat in hotel restaurants, but for some reason or another we did end up having dinner at Mozen, The Mandarin Bar and at Twist. The food at Mozen was very good and tasty but the service was slow, very slow (the only negative I can name). The second night we had a few snacks at the Mandarin Bar, they seated us at the Tea Lounge because the bar was too loud. A real treat was having dinner at Twist, the food was indeed extraordinary and the service impeccable. It is often in the details and at MO they had it down to a T. All in all it was a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Dennishulse
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at a non-gaming hotel in Las Vegas. There are pros and cons to that, but because there isn't a casino on sight the Mandarin Oriental is vert calm and relaxing. You have to change elevators on the third floor to go to any of the guest rooms or to the lobby which is on the top floor of the hotel. We opted for a room with a strip view which was spectacular. The room was probably one of the nicest I have seen in LV. Be warned though that it is very modern and has lots of bells and whistles. We came back in the middle of the night to find our room had not been made up because when trying to turn on a light that morning we had illuminated the do not disturb light without knowing it. Given the quality of the hotel, I am sure if I called, they would have made the rooms up at 2:00AM but we were too tired and just fell into unmade beds. We had minor issues with room service...virtually every order they were out of something on the menu that we asked for. There are several casinos quite close to hotel so you can easily walk from one to the other. It is also close to the new upscale shopping center on the strip. I would highly recommend the hotel. The positive side of not having a casino onsite is that you don't have the constant chatter and noise associated with a casino either.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Oasis of Beauty and Charm in the Midst of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ploosh
Reviews.Content: Overseeing Las Vegas strip, there is a unique hotel... An oasis of beauty and charm in the midst of busy Las Vegas. This hotel is like nothing else we have ever experienced: extraordinary service (and I mean EXTRAORDINARY!!), great staff, incredible customer service, beautiful and tasteful amenities, great rooms, and quite possibly some of the best guest bathrooms ever! For an unforgettable memory have Afternoon Tea in the beautifully decorated high-story lobby with breathtaking views of the Strip, or if you happen to be there during the week-end try the Sunday brunch for some of the best sushi and brunch entrees available in a 500-mile radius... :-) A bento box breakfast is also available. Across the way from the hotel there are the new CRYSTALS stores - visit these stores for a great shopping adventure. An unforgettable memory. Overall this is one of those hotels where you feel at home at all times and would never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedSF
Reviews.Content: We have an excellent stay at Mandarin Oriental, Las Vegas in August for two nights. The room is nice. From doorman to front desk, the staffs were very impressive. They all have lived up to Mandarin Oriental reputations. Each traveler has his unique experience, you have to experience yourself to know what I meant. For instance, during my check out, the front desk lady asked me did I have my airline boarding pass. I said no, immediately without hesitation, she printed the airline boarding pass for us. This is what I called service beyond the call of duty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Wish I could live here!!”
Reviews.Author: robinraner
Reviews.Content: I am impressed. The hotel was amazing. The staff were courteous and accommodating. My sister left her charger at home and they charged her phone for her during the night. We used the web site whatahotel to book our rooms and we received free breakfast and $100 spa credit. I would recommend this experience to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “first class treatment”
Reviews.Author: jnene
Reviews.Content: had a 6 nite stay at the mandarin oriental las vegas it was absolutely everything we were hoping for we had already stayed 3 nites at the planet hollywood which was fun but we needed a more peaceful place to stay leading up to ending our trip, the service was great very friendly & very personal, right from the greeting until we left. The oriental hour long massage was devine & the use of the spa ect was perfect. We were upgraded from the standard to the cityscape room & it was beautiful!! We were a party of 3 couples & we all enjoyed the wonderful stay! highly recommended!!! we will be back!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel itself was great but had some issues”
Reviews.Author: JLFog
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel itself was great. The rooms were amazing, very modern, bells and whistles, turn down service. etc. The fitness center was clean and top notch. Not having a resort fee was also nice. I also really liked the pool area; however, one day we ate lunch at the pool, and it was seriously ridiculous. We paid $20 for one measly grilled chicken sandwich, and it took them over 1.5 hours to bring it to us. Completely unacceptable for a 5* hotel, and the drink service was equally as bad. Another thing that made me mad was that we had booked our room on expedia and paid extra money for two double beds, yet when we checked in we were told that all that was available was a room with one king bed. They said they were completely booked and that we wouldn't be able to change all weekend. This did not sit very well with me since we paid extra for the two double beds, and they used the "we can't guarantee things through third party vendors." Overall, the service was pretty bad all around but the hotel itself was great.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Crazy33Italy
Reviews.Content: I wish all hotels were like Mandarin Oriental! I am so happy we chose this non-smoking and non-casino hotel for Vegas! It was like going back to paradise after visiting hell! Ahahah! Really, we were so happy with our stay, everything was great! Service is so attentive and nice (maybe sometimes too much, it can look fake but not complaining!). The room was fantastic, we had a strip view. The bed is so comfortable, the bathroom is huge with separate shower and toilet, 2 wash basins and bathtub. There is a TV in the bathroom mirror which was nice to watch when I was drying my hair and putting make up on! There is also a hair straightener! The bathroom has glass walls but there is a sliding door so you don’t get any light coming through to the bedroom. We also really liked the pool at this hotel, it is nice and quiet during the week, but got a bit crowded on a Friday. Had lunch at the pool a few times and it was great, light and tasty. We also had breakfast at the hotel restaurant once but did not think it was worth it. It would have been better to get breakfast at the pool as there is a wider choice. The wi-fi is not free, I paid 6 USD for 1 hour connection…The hotel is close to Aria and City Centre (but need to go outside and walk a few minutes pass the bridge) which has lots of restaurants and shops but City Centre feels a bit empty and sad…we had dinner there a couple of times but preferred restaurants at MGM and shops at Palazzo and Forum Shops. Mandarin Oriental is in the centre of the strip though so you can get anywhere. There is a complimentary car at the hotel which takes you at airport or other parts of the strip but we were never able to get it as it was either busy with other guests or too late (it stops working after 9pm), but it is a plus

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, we didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: sarahg828
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here while in Vegas as part of our honeymoon. We had booked a strip view suite but they gave us an upgrade to a Dynasty Suite.....OMG it was so amazing we didn't want to leave our room! The bed was huge and very comfortable, lots of wardrobe space and our shower had a steam facility. The service was excellent from all their staff, the pool was heavenly as the temperatures were in the 100's and while you sunbathe various complimentary watermelon dim sum and non alcoholic drinks were offered throughout the day. We had dinner one night at their 'Twist' michelin star restaurant which I would recommend everyone to visit if you love fine dining. We chose from the a la carte menu but there are a few set menu options, it's expensive but worth every penny. I'm so glad we chose this hotel as is was tranquil away from the madness of the casino hotels and the location is right in the middle of the strip. I also had a Mandarin Oriental signature massage in their spa which was very relaxing and you can use the spa facilities free of charge before any treatment. The only thing I could critisise is that to use the spa facilities without a treatment there is a charge of $60 which is overpriced for what's available to use.

Reviews.Title: “Highest standards”
Reviews.Author: mjcSING
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Finely appointed. Highest level of service. Stayed here for 6 nights for a sales conference. Glad we stayed here instead of one of the loud overly busy casino hotels. If you're in Vegas, and you're not looking for the typical Vegas hotel experience, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: LesAZRIA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, peaceful pool, impeccable service, best food in town, best location right on the Strip but that is not very important point because you'll not quit the hotel! Marvellous! Coming back for sure! The ONLY thing that could be better was the bar, it has beautiful views but nothing else...

Reviews.Title: “trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: howljane
Reviews.Content: we went to vegas after we got married and this hotel was the cherry on the cake. topped off our trip nicely. I cant make any complaints! great food, the hotel staff are really cheerful and helped us alot with questions about local things going on. We wish we could go again but that wont happen anytime soon unfortunatelky. Maybe the 10th wedding anniversary?!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Class, and no casino”
Reviews.Author: ammark57
Reviews.Content: Visited Vegas for 4 nights, chose this hotel based on reviews, first time, didn't know what to expect, wary of possibility of smoke filled casinos, noise etc. Needn't have been concerned, as all public areas (cannot comment on rooms) were spotless and not noticeably smoky (non smoker), and room areas protected by security, and seemed well away from noise. Chose strip view room, our room had view of lower end of south strip, with view to airport, I think north strip views would be better ! The hotel and room were classy, very modern, but tasteful. All modern conveniences, as you would expect, staff very attentive. Didn't eat in, as we wanted to try / look in as many casinos / restaurants as we could. The location is really right on the strip, access by a walkway takes you behind to the Aria (has casinos etc) and across to Crystals, (up market shops and eateries) The Cosmopolitan and Monte Carlo are casinos on each side of the hotel The only minus is having to pay for Wi-fI, why is it (as previously discussed by reviews for this and many other hotels) guests are made to pay for internet access, surely it is just as cheap as all the toiletries provided. We got a good deal, so were more than happy, highly recommended for an up market non casino base in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “An island of tranquility in a sea of madness”
Reviews.Author: George Best
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we liked the idea of this quiet place of relaxation, and were not disappointed. It was about six years since our last visit and Vegas seemed noisier and brasher than we remembered it. After some time spent on the strip we were more than happy to get back to the hotel and its neighbouring attractions. The cosmopolitan and the attached crystals complex were much more to our taste. The hotel is what you expect from a five star, impeccable service and attention to detail. The room was not the biggest but everything within it was top quality. We had breakfast in the hotel and whilst not cheap it was value for the service and quality, same with the service in the bar. If I ever went back to Vegas this hotel would be first on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the MO!”
Reviews.Author: SS2
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location around the mid point on the Strip. On arrival, Doormen to guide you to take the elevator from street level lobby to main lobby on level 23. Quick check in was fantastic after a long flight. Gorgeous strip view room on level 17 facing Monte Carlo / New York New York and views of MGM Grand with welcome chocolate covered strawberries and peaches in the room. Well equipped gym on level 8 with complimentary water bottles and clean headphones to use on treadmills and a nice view of the strip. Everyone at MO was helpful and efficient. Did not eat at MO - so easy to access so many places to eat - Aria just behind, a walkway across to Crystals and then directly to the new Cosmopolitan Hotel with so many new places to eat or across another walkway to Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile shops. We just walked and walked and walked!! Check out again was great, able to confirm and receive our boarding passes for domestic flight out 24 hours beforehand from front desk and complimentary lift to the airport in the MO Mercedes. Great way to end a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegant oasis”
Reviews.Author: skiNebraska
Reviews.Content: We've been going to Vegas for 40 years and haven't had such a relaxing stay. Good exercise room and pool. Excellent food and servers are well trained. They act like they care. Nice turn down service and the tub is fabulous. Confusing entrance (you have to want to find it). G

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chloe4245
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin for only one night while in Las Vegas and wished I had more time. I enjoyed the spa going at least an hour before my scheduled massage to enjoy all the water amenities. The ladies in the spa were attentive and helpful and the steam room and experience shower was awesome. The massage was excellent and the massage room was the best I have every been in. The room was very peaceful and had a complete bathroom with shower to wash off the scub and excess oil from the massage. The locker room ammenities were excellent, providing complimentary toiletries. The room my friend and I had was modern, well decorated and spacious. The free-standing bathtub was decadent and we enjoyed having 2 sinks and tv's in the washroom. Our room had a great view of the strip, with huge floor to ceiling windows and the all important black-out curtains The hotel provided us with a car and driver for the evening. The service was discreet and top-notch. I liked that the hotel did not have a gaming floor - no smoky area to walk through to get to your room. It truly was a haven from the business of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Plus (but no free WiFi)”
Reviews.Author: Raynboz
Reviews.Content: Great service - including a Limo service back to the Airport. The staff could not have been more professional and pleasant. The room could not have been more High-Tech and enjoyable. But why NO FREE WIFI ??? That is a mystery. Pool area terrific. Location is right in the centre of things

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PetBull
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, perfect for couples. Clean and comfortable beds, slept like a log! (Can't say "baby" because I have babies, and they don't sleep!) Valet closet is also very handy, received deliveries without interruption. Large spacious and clean bathrooms. Soaker tub, see-through glass into the bedroom. Loved the TV in mirror, allowed for a long relaxing soak. No casino, but we were not there for gambling and more to see a few shows and enjoy some good food and shopping. Lack of casino meant no smoke, which turned out to be a real bonus. In fact, the hotel infuses the air with this wonderfully pleasant scent. Appreciated after strolling through all the other smoky hotels. It is a bit quiet because the building is also for residents, but it's fine because Aria (another beautiful hotel) with casinos and restaurants is next door if you want. The decor is modern, and for us, preferred over the "theme park" hotels that were the thing a few years ago. Only thing I could criticize is that there was only a very small gesture (a cupcake) made when my husband and I told the staff we were there to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary. Otherwise, the staff are perpetually cheery and helpful! Spa and pool are gorgeous. Spa is very expensive, but pool is free, and we only wish we had more time to use it. Spa experience may be worth the money and will consider going back. Also looks like they offer free yoga/pilates classes, but we did not have time to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hotelmikey
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access to Aria and shopping. Great staff who call you by your name, accomodations excellent but very high tech and for those (like me) that like just an "on" and "off" switch might get confused. Bathrooms and amenities are outstanding. Great bar with amazing views. F&B excellent but high priced.For those that want some peace and quiet amongst all the hubbub of LV this should be your home. Will return..

Reviews.Title: “one of the best Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: italgourmet
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons to go to this mandarin: the perfect location, the amazing service, great rooms and the astonishing wellness area. What I really liked is also ... no taxi queues.. you can just get a taxi, something that seems impossible in the big hotels in Las Vegas who make you wait for 20 min or more because they don't know how to speed up boarding. What I also liked is the bar and ... no slot machine in the hotel. yes, it's a bit pricey but its worth it. In this town this is the place I will go back , something I 'm not sure about all the Mandarin's I have been in other towns.

Reviews.Title: “Short Review”
Reviews.Author: sanmerle
Reviews.Content: I am going tok keep this short for now. I want to say that the service at this hotel is the BEST . I have previously stayed at Four Seasons. The attention to detail throughout this hotel is exceptional. How does Chris the doorman remeber my name whether I have on big sunglasses, a huge hat or dressed up at night, amazing. The most exceptional service has come from the outstanding Michael Aquino at the pool He is so sroffessional and makes everyone at the pool feel very special, I feel as if he is one of their most valuable managers, as he pays attention to every detail of his guests details, nothing is over looked or too much for him or his staff. They are all exceptional especially Anthony. I was deciding between the Encore ans the M/O and after calling to get details of the pool set up and speaking to him, he sold me on the hotel. and I certainly made the right choice., MO you are so lucky to have somebody so caring as Michael. This hoel is run to perfection, and we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ok service”
Reviews.Author: Freak77
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very beautiful. The room was very nice. Place is let down by somewhat lackluster service. We had the following issues: -No turndown service (we had to call to ask for it before we left for the evening) -Extremely long wait for coffee in morning from room service -A few items broken in room on check in (bath tub stopper) To be honest, for Las Vegas the issues we had were very minor. For the Mandarin group it felt like a let down, especially after our wonderful stay at the Mandarin property in Tokyo. I would stay there again, the setting is really nice. The staff is very nice, that isn't the problem. Just don't expect 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about service, but...”
Reviews.Author: fabry73
Reviews.Content: Please keep in mind I'm quite a picky traveller when coming to luxury hotel. I'm not generally picky, I'm very accomodating when going around in motels or so, but the more the rate and the more the hotel is a luxury one the more I'm picky. MO is totally service oriented. Never been there, so during my long Vegas vacation I took advantage of the suite temptation offer and stayed there 3 nigths. I have to say that, staff and general spaces regarding, everything is absolutely perfect. Everyone smiles, everyone greets you and wants to please you. When giving you anything (your credit card, or your check) any employee uses both hand to give it to you and move head and back slightly forward as in a small bow. I suppose it's something in oriental culture, anyway nice touch. The hotel is really beautiful, lobby and other spaces are perfectly appointed. I didn't like too much the two sets of elevators, forcing you to switch in the sky lobby when directed to your room, but I think small couch in every elevators are a very nice touch, although not really useful. Breakfast at Mozen bistro was nice and in a great setting, but I found a bit excessive 35$ including taxes and a 20% tip (it was included in my rate, but the price is that) for the continental breakfast including a coffee, a cup of fruit and some mini croissants As I said, service is the best I've ever experienced. Some other touches I've especially enjoyed: 1) doorman asks your name when checking in, advice lobby with a microphone and when you get there they're waiting for you and greet using your name 2) when you arrive in the room, your bags are already there. Wonderful! Strip hotels don't deliver if you're not in your room, and I generally keep my luggage with me to avoid being forced to stay 30 minutes in my room waiting for them. 3) A/C in my room was set in celsius degree and not fahreneith 4) a full set of electronic devices were in my room, comprehensive of an adaptor for european plugs Problems start when considering my room (a cityview suite). It's large, well appointed, the same electronic controls used at Aria. But: 1) no fridge for personal use was provided. In a 1000 sq. feet suite, I think they should 2) The safe was in a drawer, so it has to be opened from above. The fact is the drawer opening didn't allow to open the safe, so you had to keep it opened and slide everything in with a small space. A classic one would have been more easy to use 3) A/C didn't work well. The fact is that bedroom a/c opening was close to the living room door, and pointed in that direction, far from the bed. Refreshing the bed area this way was almost impossible 4) I accept a charge for wireless internet. But when, scrolling down the channel list I found a single italian channel, tryed to see it and being asked for a 20$ or so credit card payment, I thinked that was really a nonsense 5) Bathroom was huge, and visually amazing, but poorly designed in some areas. Sinks were small and circular (your elbow couldn't fit in, and I'm small size), and positioned just in a corner. You felt like being in a sort of punishment there. Not easy to have a shave, also because the tap was high and lowering exactly in the middle of the sink 6) From the (floor to ceiling) bathroom windows I could see faces of people laying around the pool, no more than 20 feet away from me (I was in a low floor). I felt somewhat unconfortable thinking they could have seen me, too, but I thinked windows would have surely looked like mirror from outside. Then, from the Crystals mall bridge, I shockingly realized that I could easily see inside the windows. And so could have done pool people. So, my 4 is an average value for 5 (plus) service and 3 accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons or MO? Hard choice to make ....”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: The MO is a non-gaming hotel similar to the Four Seasons down at Mandalay. We had stayed at FS twice before and always enjoyed the quiet oasis. Decided to try out the MO. The MO is located inside City Centre at the centre of the strip so it's within walking distance to Bellagio, Caesars, Paris and MGM etc. As opposed to the FS, the MO is really a standalone building as you have to walk outside even to get to Crystals or Aria next door. Both hotels give out different vibes. MO is modern and trendy, FS is classic and stylish. I thought FS was more calm and relaxing than MO. MO's decor is very dark. When you enter the MO you are at the sparse valet lobby and you have to take the lift to 23rd floor to the sky lobby. Then you take another lift to go down to your room. It feels a bit like Park Hyatt Tokyo, and the disadvantage is you don't get to walk into a grand lobby as you arrive. I found the service at MO was much more warm than FS. The FS service was always at arms reach but at the MO it was more personal. Rooms at MO are fantastic. Everything controlled electronically. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Spa was excellent though expensive. I was the only one there but the peace was disrupted by noisy spa hostesses either showing the spa to guests or talking to each other. Mozen features a wide variety of food and the decor is bright and modern - totally different from the rest of the hotels dark decor. Best thing is breakfast was not as busy as FS where you sometimes had to wait and it's always full. Food was great at Mozen. I think if I had to pick a problem it would be the rooms are noisy. Seems the walls are quite thin. From my room I could hear footsteps but I could not figure out if they came from the room next door or upstairs. There were also some noises I could not determine it's origin. Sounded like scraping metal doors. These are noises you don't often hear in well built soundproof 5 star hotel rooms. I didn't think the rooms were as spotless as they could have been. Ice bucket was wet inside, bathroom glass wall was spotty, shampoo bottles looked used, napkins in mini bar looked like they'd been wet and dried ... I visited the public toilet on the 23rd floor near the bar one night and it was in a horrible state. Not too big a deal but not what I'd expect from MO. Overall I'd probably go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: StephenMmurphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had 2 adjoining rooms, one for the children. This is simply one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. We loved everything about the hotel. As the hotel does not have its own casino it is very peaceful which is a great haven in the middle of Las Vegas. You can walk to several of the main casinos, shops and attractions. The swimming pool and jacuzzies are great. The decoration and facilities of the room were outstanding. The service was outstanding, from the front desk to the guys downstairs that valet parked the car. The concierge managed to get us tickets to one of the best shows at a very late notice.They all made you feel really special. The kids had a great time. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANtastic: A Luxurious Refuge from the Frenzy of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: We planned a nine night vacation in Las Vegas in order to have lots of time to see a number of shows and dine at a number of different restaurants, while still having time to relax and explore at our leisure. We decided to spend the first night downtown at the Golden Nugget to experience ‘Old Vegas,’ then move to the Strip and Mandarin Oriental to avoid the weekend crowds, and finally end our visit with four nights at Wynn to experience a full service casino resort. At the end of our trip we definitely wished we had just spent all nine nights at Mandarin Oriental, it was that terrific! After a short taxi ride from downtown we arrived at the hotel’s very discreet entrance and were greeted by a veritable SWAT team of uniformed attendants. Within seconds we were being greeted and welcomed, our luggage was whisked away and we were escorted to the elevators that would take us to the Sky Lobby to check in. The Sky Lobby delivers a knock-out first impression: sumptuous furnishings, dramatic lighting and stunning views along the Las Vegas Strip. There was no line up at the front desk. We remarked to each other how elegant the staff uniforms were as we were greeted and checked-in, and within a few minutes we were off to our “City View” room on the tenth floor. We are fortunate enough to have stayed in some remarkable rooms with dramatic views at luxury hotels around the world, and our room at Mandarin Oriental ranks among the best. The room was elegantly outfitted with top quality finishes. It was immaculately clean, and everything was in pristine condition. Although it was not very large, the décor, artwork and accessories were definitely a cut above most hotels. The automatic blinds opened and we were greeted with an awesome view of CityCentre, Crystals Mall and The Strip. Our room was located at the end of a hallway, so there was one entire wall of windows that ran from the bedroom right into the bathroom (including the water closet), which made for brilliant natural light during the day and exciting views at night. We loved the plush bed with its premium linens and feather pillows and duvet—it was difficult to leave the bed each morning. There was also a comfortable divan and a good-sized desk with comfortable chair. The lights, blinds, clock and television could all be controlled with the television remote, which was very convenient. We enjoyed the specialty music and ‘ambience’ channels and often had them on when getting ready to go out at night. The only shortcoming with respect to the room was the storage. We tend to be heavy packers, so we had trouble finding space for all of our folded and hanging items, and we were not able to store our suitcases out of sight. Although the bedroom was a little lacking in storage the bathroom more than made up for it – it was huge! There was lots of counter space, two sinks and four drawers in which to store toiletries to keep them out of sight. The bathroom really did offer a spa-like experience with its abundant light, generous use of stone and marble, free-standing soaking tub and rainfall showerhead. There was even a potted live orchid next to the tub—great attention to detail. The bathroom is not quite as private as we would have liked (all glass walls and doors), but a privacy blind could be lowered outside the shower wall to make bathing/showering a more modest experience. We loved the Aromatherapy Associates toiletries and the ‘jewellery box’ of grooming products by Gilchrist & Soames. There was also a good quality hair dryer and ceramic straightener for ladies who don’t want to have to pack their own. Daily housekeeping was always thorough and very discreet. Not once during our stay did we see a maid’s cart in the hallway. Turndown service was also performed every night while we were out at dinner or shows. The maid would replace towels, close blinds, turn on mood lighting and one of the mood channels on the television, and place bottled water and glasses on the nightstands. I thought turndown service could have been a little more special: Orient Express Hotels do all of the above plus they leave chocolates or cookies, place mats/slippers by the bed, and light a scented candle. Wynn also offers chocolates and leaves a different bookmark each day. This is just a minor quibble with what was otherwise exemplary service. We would begin each day with a workout in the fitness centre, where there were cardio machines with city views, a variety of weight machines, free weights and stability balls. Fresh fruit, bottled water and cold or dry towels were always available. Group or private classes could also be booked for a fee. We just wish all the guests had been respectful of the proper dress code. On two occasions one large, older man decided to workout shirtless, in a bathing suit and flip-flops. One of the spa staff should have politely asked him to return to his room and change. Otherwise, most of the guests working out looked like they were probably gym-regulars back at home. Most afternoons we spent a few hours by the pools. Perhaps the staff here was the best in the entire hotel: very welcoming, always smiling, often inquiring if there was anything they could do for you. Occasionally, staff would circulate with complimentary frozen berries, sorbet or smoothies—a very nice touch. We never had a problem getting two lounge chairs together with an umbrella; there’s no need to make a mad dash for the pool when it opens like at the mega resorts. The pools definitely are small and narrow, but there was always room to do some actual swimming, as opposed to just standing with a cocktail amidst a shoulder-to-shoulder crowd as we witnessed at other hotels. It was a very quiet, zen-like atmosphere made all the more pleasant by the ambient music piped in. Surprisingly there were a few families in residence (this really is not the right hotel for children), but they were mostly well-behaved. The majority of the guests were looking for some quiet relaxation and pampering; a party pool it is not! At the pool we enjoyed freshly squeezed juices and delicious snacks and sandwiches (the TLT is a memorable one). Cocktails in the Mandarin Bar, with its spectacular views over the strip, provided an inspiring start or end to an evening out. The drinks are a little pricey, but they are innovative and delicious; you can taste each individual ingredient! I recommend the cucumber and cilantro margarita. One night we had a memorable dinner at MOzen, where we each ordered the Bento experience (6 small dishes each from the menu, presented in a Bento box inspired manner). The food was fresh and delicious and the service was warm and professional. It ended up being our most expensive dinner of the trip (thanks to several cocktails), but we felt it was well worth it. Twist was closed the week we were there so we were unable to experience it this time. We did not like the look of the MOzen breakfast menu as much as we did the dinner menu, so most mornings we walked over to Jean Philipe at Aria for terrific French pastries and coffee. We were sad when it came time to check out and we wished we had not decided to split up our stay; however, using the house driver/Mercedes to take us to the Wynn eased the pain a little. It was a very comfortable ride with a very personable driver and further reinforced our desire to return. Our stay at Mandarin Oriental was one of the highlights of our entire vacation. If you are similar to us, and like your exposure to the ‘Vegas experience’ in measured doses, then there is no better refuge from the madness of the city. We felt cared for, pampered and secure. We have become huge FANS of Mandarin Oriental. We’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: K_The_Tourist
Reviews.Content: This is a chic and sophisticated hotel, which is relatively small compared to the mega-resorts in Las Vegas. It’s the type of quality hotel you’d find in any top location throughout the world. You leave the hurley burley of The Strip behind the minute you enter and experience its soothing background music and dark, mysterious decor. Its mid-Strip location, just a few steps away from the Crystals mall is superb. The rooms, which are spacious and very nicely decorated, are a gadget lover's dream as everything from the TV to the curtains is controlled from one central place. There's even a TV located on the mirror in the gigantic bathroom. Yet everything is tasteful and stylish rather than brash. Breakfast at Mozen is a delightful and peaceful dining experience, and the food superb. You'd never guess you were minutes from The Strip sitting in the elegance here. However, I’m rating this review as four rather than five for the following reasons: - To say how spacious the rooms are, the wardrobe and drawer space is limited and there wasn't nearly enough room to put our clothes. - Housekeeping was disappointing at times - on a couple of occasions the room hadn't been serviced by late afternoon and one day the daily service and turn down service merged into one as the room was so late being cleaned. On one occasion, there was no spare toilet tissue. And one day, both a towel and a bedsheet were threadbare. - One of the bedside lights was broken and despite the bell boy telling us, on arrival, that he'd have it fixed for us by the time we got back that evening, it remained broken throughout our stay. - The fact that all the staff, even those on reception, are wearing microphones is somewhat off-putting, making them appear distant at times. - There was a slight coldness about some of the staff, and some of the very young staff by the pool didn't seem particularly that well trained and we didn't feel that comfortable up there. All in all, it's a very tasteful place to stay that exudes quality but, unfortunately, the wow-factor we'd been expecting just wasn't there.

Reviews.Title: “If you want quiet, quality, and service, book here NOW!”
Reviews.Author: ExoticDave
Reviews.Content: I could pour into all the details about my experience with this property because it is top notch, but I'll keep it short. From the moment you arrive, and are greeted by the door staff, you already know that you are entering a palace away from the bustle and smoke, and gambling of what is known as Las Vegas. As you travel up the elevator to the 23rd floor lobby, the calming music prepares you for the stunning views that you're about to experience as you exit the elevator. The staff at the desk were polite, attentive, never distracted, and provided me the ultimate respect while checking-in and solving any requests. Make sure you have a cocktail in the lobby bar. The drinks have a flair of the Orient while the views are priceless. I made my way down to my room, then through a quiet hallway complete with gentle lighting and tasteful decor. Once in my room, the automatic shades showed me that I was still in Las Vegas without any of the noise that accompanies such a fun city. The room was perfectly clean, the amenities were many, and the design of the spacious room was lovely. At the end of my stay the staff was kind enough to shuttle me to the airport in the house Mercedes. This property is really adult oriented since there are few places for kids to be "distracted". I ate in the Cafe on property nearly every day and was completely pleased with the service and the quality of the food that was prepared for me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, doesn't actually feel like you're in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chibimaru
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the expansive views of the Strip, I'm not sure I would have even known I was in Vegas. It helps that the check-in lobby requires it's own elevator just to get there from the parking circle. The staff is attentive, courteous, and subtly present without being intrusive and exuberant. I was there for a girls' weekend planned by one of the spouses with tremendous help from the concierge. The trip was complete with club reservations at Encore, Spa at Mandalay, dinner at the Palms, high tea at the Mandarin. There were some snafus with transportation, so I think in the future, even though the concierge is supposedly taking care of it, I suppose they should be double checked as well. The rooms are a tad bit on the dark side, so more lights (or at least brighter bulbs) would be nice--even though I understand the purpose of these rooms are not to keep you here instead of out and about!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding. Beautiful & pampering. A non gamig haven.”
Reviews.Author: CosmicvieW
Reviews.Content: The human resources of the hotel did an amazing job in recruiting & training. All staff members went out of their way to tend to all our needs.thank you bellmen, shoffer, concierge, pool staff, restaurant staff, house keeping staff for making our stay simply perfect! A special note on the amazing restaurant "Twist" where we celebrated my husband's 60th b'day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: vicki3
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!!! The front desk manager Christi gave us a tour and we immedietly switched hotels to stay 4 nights. The rooms are beautiful and very comfy bed!! I had mentioned my daughter had just had her birthday and they had a cupcake, chocolate covered strawberries, and tshirt with her name on it when we arrived...so thoughtful!!! This hotel goes above and beyond to meet customer satisfaction!!! When at the spa one day I mentioned I was looking for a particular shampoo...by the end of my treatment the spa conceirage had sourced it out from another spa and had it delivered!!!! Service doesn't get better than that!!! The spa is a 10/10...it has such special touches...throughout the hotel The staff was all so lovely!!! We had afternoon tea in the beautiful lobby and it was also incredible...I highly reccomend it!!! We rented a cabana by the pool a couple times and it was so relaxing and our server Holly was so friendly!!! the only thing that lacked was room service..someone else had mentioned this in their review also...the food was just OK and I would reccomend a kids menu...I ordered fruit and yogurt one day and it came in a tiny one or two ounce jar with 4 berries on top..it was good...but not enough for breakfast... but overal I can't say enough wonderful things about the Mandarin....love it..will be back in september...We also loved the location...easy walk to cosmopolition and bellagio or across stip to Planet Hollywood or Paris....WONDERFUL!!! Check out Maestro's for dinner one night in Cosmopolitian...excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “PAMPERED FROM THE MOMENT YOU ENTER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauren4316
Reviews.Content: This hotel has better service than anything I have ever experienced!!!! It was such a pleasure to stay here!!! Not only is the service good but the rooms are gorgeous, you will feel truly papmered. I stayed here with my bf for 3 nights and we LOVED it!!!!! Can't wait to go back!! Room service was good, beds were comfortable, shower pressure was good, everything clean as a pin, beautifully decorated and PHENOMINAL serive.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Max L
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are very nice, there are equivalent rooms in Vegas at other hotels. What makes this hotel stand out is the service. The staff is incredibly attentive and the little touches (like complimentary bottled water) make a huge difference. I seriously won't stay at another hotel while visiting Vegas. Yes, it's more expensive than other hotels, but in my mind it's completely worth it. Casino-free, smoke-free, and mostly child-free (although I did see some kids, I'm glad there weren't too many).

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis in the middle of the excitement of the strip”
Reviews.Author: JeffDyck
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a wonderful hotel, with romantic rooms designed especially with couples in mind. It is ideally located right in the middle of the strip, non-smoking, and with no casino. The room was absolutely beautiful, with many nice design, technology, and quality touches. The service is truly top-notch. The pool and fitness facilities are really gorgeous, and the spa looks great (though it was as expensive as it was attractive, so we skipped it). I was particularly impressed with Doug, the concierge. He is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. In our case, he helped us to pick an outstanding restaurant that was suitable for vegetarians, called and made a reservation for us, booking the best table in the place with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains, and informed the waiter of our dietary preferences before we arrived. He also helped us to pick an amazing show, and he provided us with free VIP passes to one of the best night clubs in town. Doug, if you read this, thanks again! The jazz band playing at the top floor lounge was also really good, and the cocktails are creative and carefully prepared. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: dizee1965
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that my husband and I have stayed at the MO each time for 10 days. We find this hotel to be one of the best in the world we travel a lot and have stayed in some pretty fancy hotels but this is wonderful. The rooms facing the strip are the best for views and the bed is so comfortable that you don't want to get out in the morning. The pool is outstanding and the staff do a great job keeping the clientele happy. Can't wait for our next visit over NYE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hotel”
Reviews.Author: londoneraway
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many brands of hotel and the Mandarin Oriental in Vegas is without doubt one of the best. I took the Zen Special rate (3 nights for the price of 2) in a Premier room with a spectacular view of the Strip. Service is impeccable with even the maintenance crew (called to check the aircon) being as discreet and polite as a butler! The room was full of nice touches - on first walking into the suite the curtains automatically opened to show the Strip in all its glory. Remote control by the bed controls everything from the TV to the lights and curtains and there's even a cupboard box by the door to leave your shoes and dinner for collection by staff outside the room if you don't want to be disturbed. The gym was well kitted out, and although the pools were more designer than fit for swimming, the cabanas and the frozen grapes helped protect you from the searing desert winds. Using the spa or eating in would have been expensive but the location on the Strip was good enough to walk to various eating places and we found a good spa treatment elsewhere from Tripadvisor. All-in all, thoroughly recommended if you're looking for an oasis on the strip and feel like splashing out on a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “sanctuary in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: samdixey2001
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure it was superb. We did get an excellent price for our strip view double room from Destinology. Wow this hotel has every gadget in the room you could imagine all controlled from the bedside table. We had a superb view, spotless room very comfortable bed. Obviously the city center complex is new, so the hotel is new, no casino which was great. We could retreat to our room in 5 minutes without walking through hordes of people gambling. Service from reception was excellent, they confirmed a dinner booking for us and welcomed us. The breakfast was superb, and a great ending to our stay. The pool area was serene, very quiet with service while you sunbath. One complaint, the bar service was a little lacking in service, we had to wait for our cocktails, only to told that they were out of strawberries! In Vegas I find that hard to believe, and they didn't make up for the error.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: wolfie73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days and it is truly an oasis in las Vegas. Service is top notch, hotel is clean and after previously staying at Palazzo we will most definitely stay at Mandaring from now on. The hotel is pricey but so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ggke
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Mandarin over a weekend and it was simply the best Vegas experience thus far, and I've been to Vegas over a dozen times. There were 9 of us with five adults and four kids. The 3 rooms we had were all upgraded, with one room upgraded two levels. The rooms were perfect, with every service and detail thought out and provided for. Every hotel staff member was cheerful and eager to assist with anything. The spa is simply one of the best, and lives up to its five star rating. The best part of about the Mandarin is the quiet and calm nature of the hotel. No chaotic scene in the lobby, no crowds, no fighting for taxis, no line up at reception. It may be because there is no casino at the hotel (which we prefer), but the central location in CityCenter allows you to simply walk to the Crystals shopping center or the Aria hotel for gambling if its the crowds and action that you seek. The bistro was excellent for breakfast each morning. An outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - the best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: anne_gregory
Reviews.Content: The MO provides a truly luxurious hotel, sophistication and above all exceptional service. We were greeted from the taxi by a bellman who discreetly read our names on the suitcase labels and addressed us by name as he took our cases. Escorted us to the lift for check in and took our cases to our rooms. All the staff are "miked up" and he called to tell reception we were on our way. Greeted by name from the lift by a super friendly and efficient receptionist who was fabulous. No queuing or walking through a casino. Cases brought direct to room in 5 minutes and all gadgetry in room was fully explained. It felt like being a film star, all the staff greeted us by name. It sounds trivial but in such a bustling place as Vegas it was so nice. The room was out of this world with everything of an exceptionally high standard. Loved the cocktail bar for a drink in the evening. When we checked out, the receptionist called down to ensure there was a taxi waiting for us to take us to the airport. If you are with a stag party etc looking for a wild lively hotel this is not for you. If you are looking for an oasis of quiet sophistication away from the madness it is perfect. Cannot praise this hotel enough and all the staff but particularly Chris and Nicole.

Reviews.Title: “First rate stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SanJoseTraveler007
Reviews.Content: We have looked for the right hotel in Las Vegas for years -- we've stayed at the Bellagio, the Venetian, the Wynn, the Four Seasons and The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. After a weekend stay, the Mandarin Oriental is our new favorite. This is the first hotel we've stayed at in Las Vegas that could easily measure up favorably against comparable hotels in another big city. Our strip view suite was thoughtfully designed, well maintained and comfortable. We've found a number of the other hotels in Las Vegas to be too high style and not well thought out and their lobbies and public spaces too crazy. The hotel is also within easy walking of the City Center complex as well -- the Aria's gaming areas are excellent. The Mandarin Oriental's service was polite and efficient. As an example, several days prior to arrival the concierge phoned to ask whether she would assist -- I asked her to arrange dinner at Sage in the City Center for 8 pm on Saturday night (something I couldn't get myself by calling them the day before) and a few hours later I received an e mail confirming the reservation. When the next day I contacted her to move up the reservation by a half hour another concierge gladly took charge of my request (my initial contact was not then at work) and she successfully changed the booking. Many times these sorts of changes can fall through the cracks -- I was impressed by how smoothly the details were arranged. The only things I might take issue with are very small -- the seating in the living room is cramped and frankly as uncomfortable as a church pew. Service in the pool area for a quick lunch as well as breakfast was slow, largely the result of what is coming from the hotel's expectations for the servers. A request for morning coffee requires the server to lay out an elaborate array of mugs, a thermos, sugar bowls and a creamer. Multiply that with a busy rush and we ended up waiting nearly ten minutes for coffee. Breakfast does not need to be a three-star production. Lastly, our first night there, as we waited for the bellman to get us a taxi, we noticed another couple get into the hotel's car. The bellman volunteered that the car was available for complimentary use and so on our last morning I asked him whether we might use the car to transfer us to the airport later that day. Not a problem, he said, and right on the dot a few hours later at check out a brand new Hybrid Mercedes took us to LAS. A very gracious way to end a first rate weekend at the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Tea at the Mandarin - a must do in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: westvillagechic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had tea at the Mandarin Oriental. The view of vegas' strip is amazing from the tea room and the signature Mandarin orange blend was delicious. We also had the spice cupcake and the red velvet cupcake-both were delicious! The service was fantastic. Highly recommend this as a must do in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Remains the hotel experience to be beaten”
Reviews.Author: Bailey92101
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Many of the new Las Vegas hotels are beautiful and I have stayed at a lot of them, however the service we received and the sincere friendliness of the staff were what made the Mandarin stand out. Turn down service without being requested, I cant stress enough how nice it was to return in the evening to a freshly made room, music playing, shoes straightened, it was every little touch that added up. Also it was convenient to the strip. Planet Hollywood across the way could get a bit loud, but hey, thats Vegas. Also the lobby being up not down disoriented my travel partner every time, but it was part of the fun for me. It was also a great value, I would have expected to pay twice as much, thank goodness Vegas has to be competitive! No parking but we never waited long for our car to be valeted. Will never stay anywhere else in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “It's truly a Mandarin Oriental!”
Reviews.Author: DLPA
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Ideally located near the Aria for your gambling desires, but away from the gambling scene (no casino in the hotel) for some zen and rest. This hotel is very close to NYNY, MGM and Hard Rock. M&M and Coca-Cola stores are also down the road, and a CVS pharmacy directly next to the hotel or any emergency needs. Though nothing beats the convenience of the Bellagio or the Venetian, MO certainly has its perks being part of the MGM group, with their own free train and sightseeing convenience on that end of the strip. Hotel staff are excellent and helpful. The concierge helped us to arrange an affordable tour to the Grand Canyon the day before and wake up calls were punctual. Great huge TV with tons of channels both inside the bedroom and out in the living room, as well as in the bathroom! Access for up to 4 computers/devices on very fast reliable wifi in the room was value for money. Service was impeccable. Extra hangers and international conversion plugs at request as well as extra bathrobes and towels. Good quality bedroom slippers are provided. The bed comforters and pillows are very soft and comfortable though one side of the double bed had a sag from whoever slept in it before (I slept on the other side). Air conditioners were also a bit cold but you could turn them off whenever you wanted. Controls in the room for lights were a little confusing, but the ability to access from the TV and the controller beside the bed, as well as manually on the walls made it very convenient. Automated black-out curtains and sheers in bathroom, bedroom and living room were really cool. And the view we got from the 10th floor was great - I could see the first drop of the rollercoaster in NYNY and got a great view of the pool, as well as view the shopping centre beside us. The hotel pool is small but great to get a nice suntan. Don't expect to do much swimming - this is very much a poser's pool. Sunbeds are also quite close together so it's not suggested for the self-conscious. I love how all MO hotels are scented the same in the lobby and lift areas. There is pretty good security in this hotel as the lift to access the hotel rooms is different from the lift to access the lobby and restaurants. A bench provided in the lift to rest while travelling up and down was a novelty! Only downsides were: 1) Shower arm had very weak water pressue so we ended up using the shower head the whole time. 2) Sink was tiny - I couldn't even fit the kettle under the tap head so I ended up using a cup to fill it. 3) Breakfast was nothing fantastic. Wake up at noon and head to one of the amazing restaurants for lunch instead. That being said the breakfast staff were very polite and accomodating. Basically you really get what you're paying for. This hotel is very pricey but the atmosphere, hotel room, service and all-in experience is nothing short of amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - No casino, No cigarette smoke!”
Reviews.Author: grandtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday night, as the Bellagio's rates were higher for the one night, and I wanted to try out this new hotel. The remaining stay was at my FAV hotel, the Bellagio. The hotel was lovely, and felt like a boutique hotel. The room was absolutely amazing, with all the latest electronics. So much so, that we had a hard time figuring the console out, which controlled everything in the room. The bathroom was lovely, with a modern large soaking tub. The pool area was very small but suitable if you want to relax. I thought the price for the massage was exorbitant, at $220.00 for 50 minutes, and I really expected to be wowed by this experience and the spa itself, but I was really disappointed. Overall, it was VERY nice to enjoy the fresh clean air in the hotel, with their non-smoking policy and I did not miss the presence of a casino, as there were many in all directions. The feel of the hotel was very calming but the spa was no comparison to arguably the best spa I have ever enjoyed in a hotel...at the Bellagio. The Mandarin was right next to City Center for shopping, and just a quick monorail ride or walk away from everything else in this perfect area on the strip. It was very convenient to move our things over to the Bellagio after the one night, as it is just about next door. I would stay here again if the rates at the Bellagio are too high again on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: melindah11
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is a beautiful hotel - we booked a cityscape view suite but was upgraded to the next suite up. It was a beautiful room with luxurious amenities. The bed was heavenly and the bath huge! I tried out the spa which was amazing with views of the strip and the massage was wonderful.
