The hotel is set slightly away from the strip but everything was still within walking distance and we enjoyed the peace and haven in the hotel away from the strip at night. The first two nights prior to the Mandarin, we stayed at the Venetian. This was a different experience and more in keeping with the Vegas theme. However, the amenities at the Mandarin and the quality of fittings and furnishings were I felt , a level above the Venetian. Having said that , the Venetian was also an amazing and beautiful hotel - just different and it does depend on the type of experience you are after. We loved Vegas and would stay at the Mandarin Oriental again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of peace and class in the midst of chaos”
Reviews.Author: Shazacay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights and can not find one comment to discourage anyone from staying at this hotel. Price in terms of value is excellent and the hotel is just slightly away from the frenzy of the strip. Also the fact that there is no casino makes it even more appealing in my humble opinion of course.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of calm in a 24 hour city”
Reviews.Author: VJM7428
Reviews.Content: As a first timer in Vegas I fought against not being in a Casino. I am SO relieved my husband won the argument. The Mandarin Hotel in Vegas as exceptional. We stayed in a corner suite - amazing views, beautiful room, and a wonderful bathroom. There was no having to walk through a casino to get to the check in desk - nor any queuing once you got there. Wonderful service from everyone we came in contact with from the front desk through to the restaurant staff. Great restaurant recommendations - happy, interested and willing people all around. They made our stay a pure pleasure. The pool is lovely - smaller than the behemoths in most of the big casinos, but is a wonderfully restful place to spend the afternoon after wandering around Vegas. The spa is lovely with great service - again! It isn't cheap but is worth it. They helped us book a trip by helicopter to the Grand Canyon - despite short notice - and I highly recommend this to anyone who hasn't been. It only takes a morning but is so worthwhile. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. I know for some people this hotel won't be seen as the true "Vegas Experience" - but for us it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL AND QUIET HOTEL ON THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: Mercedesbenz
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for a wedding, which was being held at the Mandarin. The hotel is beautifully decorated in Asian minimalistic style. We had two adjoining rooms as our 2 teenagers came with us. The room had an i-pad type device that electronically operated the TV, curtains, lights etc. The room was average size with a large bathroom and large freestanding tub. Very contemporary and clean. This hotel does not have a casino, which is why the bride chose this hotel for her wedding. It is very quiet and serene. It is also much smaller than the large resort like hotels on the strip. There are no shops and only 2 restaurants, one of which is a tea room. Both restaurants are very expensive. We had breakfast twice in the hotel and ate elsewhere the next day. The breakfast buffet, which they call a continental buffet, had cereals, fresh fruits and breads only. There was no full buffet with eggs etc. Although you could order eggs, waffles etc off the menu. The breakfast was good and so was the service. I used the gym twice. I was very happy that there was no charge to use it. Last time I stayed at Mandalay Bay and they charged $30 a day for the gym. So I was relieved that there was no charge at the Mandarin. The gym was small but very well equipped and with a nice view of the Strip from the cardio machines. I would recommend this hotel for someone who is looking for a quiet stay in Las Vegas. If you don't like the crowds of the other resorts, then you will enjoy the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape from reality (and from Las Vegas)”
Reviews.Author: mdande
Reviews.Content: I will echo others on the MO LV. The service is fantastic with some minor glitches. The location is great and the lack of casino is a differentiator. I loved the spa, the facilities are amazing and my massage was great. I will note a couple of things: The spa costs $50 for a day pass. The Fitness Center is free.... there seemed to be some confusion there. Also, my cab drivers had no problem finding the hotel, and I never waited more than a couple of minutes for my cab.... I wouldn't have waited longer in a mega hotel with the lines they have. Also, everyone complains about the cost of wifi and of drinks, etc. While I did find the cost of the beer by the pool to be shocking, I was not surprised. Welcome to five star hotels... if you want free wifi, free parking and cheap drinks, stay at the Hampton... If you want service that knows what you need before you do, you'll pay for that luxury. I am happy to do so.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: albert19
Reviews.Content: If you're tired of smoke filled casinos, blasting rock music and teenagers in tanktops and baggy pants,try the Mandarin Oriental in City Center. It's a quiet oasis a few steps from the Aria and the Cosmopolitan, just across a skybridge from Chrystals (shopping and dining) but a world apart from the typical Vegas experience. With a staff that appears to genuinely care about hotel guests (how unique!), afternoon tea. a lively bar, and rooms that are well above standard, MOLA offers a welcome alternative to visitors who want to enjoy the shows, gaming and restaurants Vegas is famous for but also want an upscale and peaceful hotel. Not inexpensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in crazy las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 1984travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MO Vegas for the first part of our honeymoon. The hotel is nicely situated on the strip. It is newly built & very luxurious. Our rooms was v well appointed with a very comfy bed and all mod cons. The gym is excellent too with new machines and helpful attendants. We loved this sleek, modern hotel. Beware, It is not a big, brash vegas hotel and there is no casino- go to Bellagio or Caesars if you want the full crazy Vegas experience- though be prepared for CROWDS. The mandarins greatest asset is its calm peacefulness, a very welcome break from the zaniness of the strip. On the negative side, it is probably one of the most expensive hotels on the strip (but quality is never cheap). Sadly we were slightly let down by subpar service. Breakfast arrived late meaning we were late for a tour we had planned & it took 2 calls to housekeeping to arrange dry cleaning after being told that pressing the "valet" button in the room & leaving the garment in the valet cupboard. As this is a v new hotel I would guess they are still ironing out staff issues.

Reviews.Title: “A most welcome luxurious haven in LV”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: A 5, but not a strong one. Unfortunately the sleep quality is of utmost importance, and me and the bed just didn´t make my BFF. The bed was a tad too soft, and the pillows just overstuffed. My neck doesn´t bend that way. But apart from that, the room was spacious, comfortable, gorgeous and they have really thought of every little detail. The staff are a dream and the location perfect! We have stayed at the Four Seasons (old school, but very nice), the Bellagio (the "worst" of them, tired and kitchy) and the Wynn (really nice, but a bit too much on the side) before so we do have some places to compare with. And apart from the Wynn which is very nice this is really in a class of its own. Location/Hotel: Right smack in the middle of the strip which from a logistical standpoint of view is perfect. It´s also a non gaming hotel which makes it a most welcome haven after the heat and frantic madness of other properties! Room: We stayed in room 2221 which is a premier room with a strip view. Unfortunately the view is mainly of the Polo Towers which isn´t exactly glamorous...But hopefully that place will go "kaboom" within the near future... The room is very spacious, the layout very well thought through and practical, the colour scheme soothing and there are classy little details everywhere to go ooh and aah over! For instance they have these gorgeous little boxes to store everything from the spa menu to cables in. It´s almost a feeling of an exotic christmas to explore ones room! Huge bathtub and separate shower. There´s also his and hers sides of the bathroom + a fab selection of amenities! Waterpressure is great and the bathtub is perfect for one. There are bigger bathtubs and also steamshowers in other roomtypes though Internet is easy to connect to and not too expensive. You can also hook up 4 devices on the same login + surf while outside in town as well! Speaking of tech stuff, you do manouver everything in the room via your nifty little touchpad on the nighstand. The system is easy to use and very versatile. The A/C is unfortunately set to not blast too much cold air due to environmental reasons, but it can be over rode if you ask maintenance...;) Pro´s: * Generously sized * Very good layout * Exquisetly decorated * Great storage * Perfect location on the Strip * Quiet and calm Con´s * The safe was a weird shape and one can not put anything a bit larger in there. Loved the little jewellery tray in there though! * One can hear what goes on in the hallway outside the room. Altghough it should be said that it´s not much at any given time! Service: Flawless and extrememly pleasant!!! Everything runs smoothly and on time! Staff: They are extrememly nice and always ready to help with whatever your needs are. Truly world class!!!!! Renee and Stephanie (Ladies at the concierge desk) were of great help throughout our stay! Food/beverage: Wonderful and not too expensive at all. Everything is also presented in the most appetizing manner. Their skybar is gorgeous with nice views of the strip and their cocktails are to die for! MOzen was a wonderful experience for lunch. Fresh and light Twist is highly recommendable!!! Internet: Fast, stable and easy to connect to. Not free (no hotels seem to do free internet in Vegas anyways), but not expensive at all. It also works in Centercity which is neat! Spa: Gorgeous and great selection of treatments. My husband was raving about his manicure Laundry: On time and executed to perfection. Also not too expensive at all. Things to do and to think about: * If you come here for the food scene, please do take into consideration that a lot of the restaurants are not open for lunch or even outside of Thu-Sun! * Don´t be fooled by the distances. It may look like a short walk, but it´s not... * If you have the time then i highly recommend a helicoptertour over the Grand Canyon. We used Papillon during one of our stays and were very happy with their service!!! It´s a wonderful experience and make sure to book a package that makes you actually land in the Canyon. * Shows, shows and more shows * The expression "shop til you drop" has never felt so fitting...

Reviews.Title: “Royalty Treatment”
Reviews.Author: 3d3mon3
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is no doubt the best hotel in vegas!...if you wanna come back from a wild night out to a luxurious yet relaxing and peaceful environment then look no further. In the heart of the Strip! and City center is at your steps...Julian Serrano is a must as well! will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aandjSydney
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 3 nights. We split our time in Las Vegas between the Palazzo and the Mandarin Oriental. I decided to try out the Mandarin Oriental based on the reviews and the great rate we received. The Mandarin Oriental is a beautiful hotel and the staff are outstanding. We loved the technology in the room and the fantastic bathroom. The bathroom was one of the nicest ones I have ever seen. This hotel is fabulous but doesn't quite have the Las Vegas feel with no casino, which has both its positives and negatives. I do prefer being located at the other end of the strip though. The area around the Mandarin Oriental towards Monte Carlo and across the street is a bit dingy. The rooms are not as large as some of the others on the strip. I would love this hotel more in a different city.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious cocoon in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: TheLuxeTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas and have officially fallen in love with this exquisite property. From the moment we turned into the front drive, a quiet and hidden environment with finely dressed doormen awaiting our arrival we knew this was not the typical Vegas experience. As we have done with past trips, we booked everything through HOM Vacation and as always everything was executed to perfection. We were greeted in the front drive and walked straight to our suite to complete check in. We immediately went and enjoyed the pool, which was serene and the staff top notch. The stay we had here was drastically different than past Vegas weekends, as the environment was quiet, no smoke or gaming anywhere in sight, and a very sophisticated clientele. We were at the pool with several celebrity's, all of whom seemed comfortable and were left alone. We cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A-M-A-Z-I-N-G-!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spaek68
Reviews.Content: The MOLAS, as they put it, is fantastic. It does not disappoint in any way. 5-stars in every way. Highly recommend bringing your exercise clothes because the fitness center is a must! I do think that Internet Access should be free, but you can take a short walk to Aria or the Cosmopolitan if you must get connected without paying for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: Friendly service from the doorman to the check-in and room service in this luxury hotel in the heart of Las Vegas. The view from the room was spectacular, the furniture, and accessories are all modern and the cleanliness and spaciousness make you feel like at home. Very quiet and perfect for some alone time as well as for business stays. The bar on the 23rd floor is great and the restaurant Twist is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “A little peace of Oriental paradise!”
Reviews.Author: LizzyA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas at the beginning of July for a week to celebrate my 30th. We wanted a casino free hotel where we could relax and come back to after the craziness of a night out at the various casinos that Vegas has to offer. On arrival, we were greeted by friendly doormen and were escorted up to the lobby to check in. There was lovely chill out music playing throughout the hotel creating an amazing ambience and constant tranquility. We were given ice cold face towels to cool down with which was very welcoming after a 10hour flight from London! Check in took as little as 5 minutes and we were staying in the city view room overlooking the strip. When we got to the room we were amazed at how beautiful it was and how you literally could not hear a sound coming from the strip! There was a welcome cake saying ' happy birthday despite that day not being my birthday yet, it was very nice! The service is 10 out of 10, they been arranged to go to the chemist to get me headache tablets! The dining manager, April was also incredibly attentive when we went for breakfast as well as secretly planning to have a bottle of verve cliquot and 2 gorgeous cupcakes waiting in our room when I returned from my massage on my actual birthday. The staff are always on hand and never once did we feel let down! The pool is fantastic too with all the pool attendants working so hard during the heat to constantly replenish your water and ice which all comes free!! Notably, one f the girls called Ashley was very sweet and constantly there to help. You are always guaranteed a spot at the pool and there is no loud raging music! This hotel is perfect for couples and honeymooners! We would definitely use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, great service”
Reviews.Author: MWang
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay away from the hubub of Vegas but still have access to it easily and conveniently, this is the place. The Asian owned hotel is beautifully decorated, the service is wonderful and you never feel crowded. You can take the monorail to the Strip but the restaurants and shopping in the immediate area is quite satisfying. Dont waste your money going to the restaurant on the lobby level, overpriced and uneventful. The bar is very nnice with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better service”
Reviews.Author: TMMWindham
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a jewel in Las Vegas. Rooms are great, roomy but elegant. Service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN LAST VEGAS, PURE PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: onestopnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from Saturday until Tuesday. I had not been in Las Vegas since 2004 and originally had booked the Bellagio (where I stayed in 2004) but then read bad reviews on this website. The rate at the Bellagio through American Express Fine Hotel and Resorts program was $250. When I called Amex back to book the Mandarin Oriental, the rate was the same including one night at $205. Check in was flawless, everywhere I went within the hotel people would call me by my last name (not that I care, but it shows the level of details). Room was on the 18th floor, looking at Aria and the mountains. Very quiet room. Well appointment, definitely 5 stars. Technology-wise the hotel is amazing. Perfect wifi everywhere, though it wasn't free, the speeds were crazy for hotel wifi, 18mpbs down and almost the same in upload speeds. Very comfortable bed. Upon checking in I asked for a foam pillow and a humidifier and got it within 5 minutes of being in the room. Great pool area, nice music but at a normal level, awesome pool staff, great menu, some cocktails were not so great but we did have great pina colada.We used a cabana one day and the rates are pretty reasonable. $210 weekdays or $310 weekends. Flatscreen tv, PS3, you can plug your ipod or ipad directly to the tv, fruits, sodas, etc. during the day. We had breakfast daily at MOzen and lunch the last day. Again, stellar service and terrific food (loved the Chicken Tika Wrap for lunch, at $14 with perfect fries and a sald it's a steal). Housekeeping was also great, room always perfectly cleaned and turned down. The spa is 27,000 sq/ft but I believe you need a treatment to use it or get a day pass. Regardless, it was an amazing experience. To give you a little background, I studied hospitality management in one of the best school in the world in Switzerland and worked as a concierge for a 5 star NY Hotel for 3 years. I now have my own business providing personal concierge services.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Relaxing and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at nearly every hotel in Las Vegas. After a disappointing experience at the Wynn, we tried a suite at the Mandarin. From the minute we arrived, the staff made us feel appreciated and valued. Mandarin has a quiet entrance that is a little harder to find (hang a right before the CVS). You are immediately greeted and walked to the elevator that goes to the 23rd floor lobby. Check-in took all of a couple of minutes and I was escorted to the elevators for the guest rooms. Our room was exceptional, best we have every stayed in. Everywhere we walked in the hotel, we were greeted. At the MOzen restaurant, not only did the manager ask how our dinner was, he also asked if he could do anything to make our stay more comfortable. The pools are designed more for adults, they are lap pools. The pool area, spa, and fitness area are exceptional. We only experience one small issue. We were offered a choice of two out of three newspapers each day. On the first morning they delivered the one we didn't ask for. How did they fix it? They brought the correct two to our room right away and delivered all three the rest of the stay. Breakfast at MOzen was superb. Great service. Try the whole wheat pancakes with Blueberries and Vermont maple syrup. Yes the food is expensive -- but is very well done. If you are looking for gambling, the Aria is a 5 minute walk as is the Monte Carlo. Perfect for us. Quiet hotel that is comfortable and no slot machine dinging when we walked through the hotel. Hint, hint, Steve Wynn. This is what a five star hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zipline
Reviews.Content: High end, yes but well worth the chunk of change. The service is incredible as are the views. When we arrived a wave of calm swept over us. This is a quiet corner of LV away from the buzz. The best of both worlds. We will be back again next year for more fun.

Reviews.Title: “A Serene Experience All-Around”
Reviews.Author: belletown
Reviews.Content: We spent the 4th of July weekend at the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas and had an exceptional time! Would absolutely stay there again! It was so nice to return to the quiet serenity of the MO. The spa treatments were incredible and the use of the spa facilities was a real treat! We rented a cabana one day and it was a great way to get away from the heat while still enjoying the pool. The staff of the hotel was amazing and made the trip more memorable. Joe at the concierge desk was so helpful! We look forward to returning to the Mandarin Oriental on our next trip to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in a manic city”
Reviews.Author: GAKill
Reviews.Content: With peaceful and serene Asian sophistication and service, this really is a welcome oasis from the madness of Vegas. Having had to go to Vegas for work conventions the last thing I wanted when taking the family on holiday was to have to walk through casinos and seeing the same person on a slot machine last thing at night and first thing in the morning. Very sizable rooms with modern connectivity and other amenities. Room rates were reasonable for e location, class of service and quality etc. Food is expensive though. Very flexible customized feel to the service. Restaurant accepted a Pre-order for breakfast to be waiting for us as the restaurant opened first thing in the morning as we had a early start one day. However, the service highlight was Hayley the concierge who helped us arrange a very special helicopter trip that will be a life-long family memory. She took a real personal interest in the whole thing and it was her personal mission to ensure that it all went off without a hitch - much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius_7
Reviews.Content: This was my first and only trip to Las Vegas as I have discovered I am not a fan of the destination. The hotel however was a lifeline amongst the madness. As previous reviewers have said it is truly an oasis with exceptional service and tranquility. I spent alot of time at the pool which was immaculate and very well serviced by excellent staff. If you want to enjoy what the city has to offer while keeping your sanity this is absolutely the place to stay - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it, but next time will look for a place with more fun!”
Reviews.Author: SolyTorres
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 4th of July holiday and absolutely love it!...is the perfect hide-away place to rest and escape from the noisy and tacky Strip...the pool is nice, the rooms are perfect, with good view and reasonable price and the staff is very helpful and well trained...location wise couldn't be better, it's in the middle of everything...however, for a fun packed holiday, you might want to stay in a place with casino and disco?...that depends on your style!...Wynn might be a better option for the later.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding. This was my second time and it was better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: JSNYC76
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin LV is exceptional in every way. The location is perfect, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and luxurious, and best of all, the service is as good as any luxury hotel I have visited. From the moment we were greeted in the entryway by a lovely host until the time we checked out, everyone in the hotel went out of their way to make our visit a great one. We also very much enjoyed the spa, which is pricey but worth it, and dinner at MOZen. In addition to the quality of the hotel and service, we really enjoy the serenity of the Mandarin. It is a wonderful and peaceful escape from the typical Las Vegas experience, while also still having close proximity to everything Las Vegas has to offer. We have stayed at just about every luxury hotel in Las Vegas, and for us this is hands-down the best. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation city”
Reviews.Author: travelmore04
Reviews.Content: Just recently came back from Vegas, where we stayed at Mandarin Oriental from June 22 till June 28th. Got 2 rooms, as we were traveling together with our parents. I must say Mandarin will meet even the highest expectations - staff is friendly and very accommodating. One of the recent reviewers called Mandarin an oasis from the strip - that is exactly what Mandarin is. When you are at the poolside - you can't even tell that you are in Vegas. I will strongly consider staying at Mandarin Oriental once again when back in Vegas. The restaurant on the third floor (MOzen bistro) is very good; the service as the whole Mandarin Oriental was friendly and competent. All the dishes ordered (breakfast and dinner) were very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: The0racle
Reviews.Content: I had very, very high expectations for this hotel, and not only did it meet them, it surpassed them in almost every way. Firstly, the hotel itself, located in the middle of the strip, is gorgeous. You enter the hotel via a beautiful downstairs entry lobby and are whisked up to reception on the 23rd floor, which is a haven of peace and calm from the chaos that is Las Vegas. There were no check in lines when we were there, ever, and we were very quickly shown to our fabulous, spacious premier room. Travelling as a family with 2 children we found that the premier room was easily large enough for the four of us, and the views from our 21st floor room were sensational. The room itself was also decorated to an extremely high level, and I loved the touchpad operated curtains/ air conditioning etc. I am very, very picky when it comes to hotel cleanliness, and this hotel is amazingly clean. Everything looks perfect and new, as if you are the first guest ever to stay there. Also the bed linen is of the highest quality and the beds are incredibly comfortable. One small problem that we did encounter was that there was excessive noise from an open air karaoke bar on the strip that kept us awake a good part of the first night. Had we been travelling as a couple and in Vegas to party, coming home late, this wouldn't have been an issue, but as a family with children who needed to sleep this was more of a problem. It was only a problem until the moment that we mentioned it to the hotel staff however, who quickly found us a new dramatically quieter room (and an upgraded one too.) They really couldn't have been more helpful or lovely about it. Apparently they are also taking legal action against the bar so this issue should soon be resolved anyway. The pool area is beautifully kept, and the cabanas look fabulous although we didn't have time to book one during our stay. Unfortunately it was very windy when we stayed so we didn't have the chance to use the pool as much as we might have liked. Nonetheless it is quiet and serene and beautiful, unlike most of the other Vegas pools I have ever experienced. The staff there, as with everywhere in this amazing hotel were wonderful and helpful. Whilst we were there we had something of a medical emergency when my husband was accidentally headbutted by my seven year old when he bent to kiss her goodnight in the dark, as we were putting her to bed. This wasn't a minor blow, in fact the bathroom of our hotel room looked like a murder scene after this incident, such was the amount of blood. The response of the hotel was phenomenal though. Within literally a couple of minutes of my panicked call they sent a medically trained security guard who helped my very dazed husband try to stop the bleeding so that I could look after my daughter who was distraught by the idea that she had hurt her father as well as suffering from a bang on the head herself. The manager himself also came to our room and seeing the amount of blood immediately called an ambulance for us, although by the time the paramedics arrived the bleeding had lessened and we didn't end up needing it. Throughout this incident everybody from the hotel was so kind, helpful and reassuring to us, I really cannot thank them enough. Not only that but within about 15 minutes of the paramedics leaving, a cleaner with a biohazard kit arrived at our room and made it look perfect again, (no mean feat given how much my husband had been bleeding) something that really helped me to settle my upset children down for the night. I think the position of this hotel on the strip is perfect, next to Aria, and right in the middle of the strip, a quick walk to the Bellagio etc. It was such a wonderful experience to be able to walk out of the door of the hotel and be in the middle of everything, and then come back in and be able to forget completely about all of the craziness outside the hotel. We visited lots of the other hotels such as the Wynn etc and the quality of the Mandarin Oriental is on a different scale to those places. I really cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Not only is it breathtakingly beautiful, the service is out of this world. Usually there are one or two service niggles even when staying at great hotels, and there simply weren't here. Everything was absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance combined with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: SATXKen
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Mandarin and truly enjoyed it. Staying at the Mandarin in Vegas is a different experience, since the hotel does not have a casino. Instead of standing in a long check-in line and traipsing through a casino with our luggage in search of the elevator, we had the new pleasure of riding straight up to the 23rd-floor reservation desk, where all the wonderful service began. We had booked our trip through SW Vacations and had chosen a “premium” room. Five days before departure, SW informed us they were downgrading us to a lesser room with little compensation. We were very angry with them. When we arrived at the desk at the Mandarin, I respectfully asked for the room we had paid for. This was apparently their second such request that day. After a call to a higher authority, the lovely desk clerk told us we got the last premium room. That made our day and our trip. The bait and switch trick that SW Vacations tried to pull was averted. From then on, everyone we dealt with at the Mandarin was equally as helpful and sincerely concerned about our welfare – from the spa to the bistro to the bar. Our room was exquisite, the best we have ever had. Our Hammam treatment at the spa was a delight. We also enjoyed the hotel’s pool area. There was only one hiccup with the Mandarin. It was difficult to get a cab from there. Saturday night we stood in a long line, while the bellmen did all they could, but cabs simply do not pull into the Mandarin very regularly, and their flashing blue curb-side light was obviously being ignored by the cabbies. They seemed at a loss on how to get a cab other than by accidental drop-off. Admittedly, the strip was extremely busy, but their impotence on this front was surprising. On the other hand, it was very convenient to stroll over to the adjacent Crystals Mall and on to the casino at the Aria or the Cosmopolitan – two very nice casinos – and to take advantage of the many restaurants and shop in those two complexes. Again, wherever we went in the hotel, people were there to cheerfully make us happy. It has a wonderful atmosphere. Take advantage of their three nights for two offer.

Reviews.Title: “VERY good”
Reviews.Author: dontwakemeupk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights for the Electric Daisy Carnival and, while the hotel is definitely not a party hotel, had a great time. The rooms were spacious and clean with a great strip view and modern amenities such as the Control4 room control system. The service was great-- they catered to every request. The pools were not that big but were nice and clean and not full. The only downside was having to go up and then down to the room, and walking a loooong way to the free Aria parking.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool in a hot setting”
Reviews.Author: Mescaline99
Reviews.Content: I can't fault it here. Everything is laid out in a confidently smoothness which usually comes with years of experience. From the impossibly handsome young door staff to the impossibly compliant poolside staff this hotel just works. If you can afford it, stay here. It's worth ever penny. Then there is the view. There is always the view. An hotel with so much glass was always going to be about the view and they really, REALLY give you a view to remember.

Reviews.Title: “heaven”
Reviews.Author: lcg330
Reviews.Content: oh i wish i were back there now. if you have to go to las vegas and aren't into las vegas --this is the ONLY hotel to stay in. it is an oasis from the strip. most of the other hotels are in casinos, so you have to walk through a gaming floor and the entire place will smell like smoke. but the mandarin oriental is sophisticated, quiet and beautiful. the food and service are fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: spen65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 9 nights earlier this month during our 3rd trip to Vegas. MO is quite simply an oasis in the hustle and bustle of what you'd expect to find on the Strip. From check-in to check-out our stay was perfect; like other reviewers I've tried to spot a negative without much success although more about that later! We enjoyed a Cityscape room on the 20th floor with a Strip view in the direction of New York New York. Floor to ceiling windows provided views of the Strip in the foreground and the mountains further afield. No worries about external noise. The room had everything you could want; almost everything could be controlled by the bedside control panel; bathroom with bath, separate shower, toilet and twin basins. TV and sound system was perfect and allowed iPhone connection for music, etc. Room service was used for ice (amazingly quick service!) and breakfast - all served to the standard you'd expect from MO. We ate by the pool and at MOzen; both were excellent both quality and value wise. Some complain about time delay but we did not experience this. Mandarin Bar was comfortable and provided great views but that for me was where it ended; not good value for money and average, yes average, service! Check-in was effortless; check-out was speedy but no valet service was offered or in evidence; this was somewhat disappointing. For us the best thing was the peace and tranquility offered by MO in the noise and heat of Vegas; walking through the casino and reception areas of Aria, Bellagio or Mirage was akin to spending time is a busy shopping centre. What a welcome bonus being able to eat, drink and gamble on the Strip then drift into a peaceful luxury hotel!! What about a weakness then? Bathroom towels were smaller and thinner than desired. Might sound pathetic but it indicates how good this hotel is!

Reviews.Title: “try the wynn”
Reviews.Author: mkellerman
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at the Wynn, but this time decided to try the Mandarin....the Hotel itself is very nice the rooms even upgraded ones are extremely small...too small for 2 people...everything is absurdly priced ...$9.00 for coffee or tea at restaurant ...the Wynn is much nicer.and .cheaper , that's where our company Executives will stay from now on..

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: carylisdeb
Reviews.Content: Close to most of the casinos the hotel is located in a very good position on the strip. The rooms are spacious and the hotel offers great views and excellent service. I agree with previous reviewers that the food wasn't that great but I'm still giving it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “an outstanding retreat -- the antidote to las vegas tacky”
Reviews.Author: jshadeLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: from the soft murmur of classical music greeting you to the elegant entrance and swift, solicitous valet service, everything about the design and execution of this hotel is outstanding. the rooms are amazing, there is no casino or club so the riff raff is kept at bay and instead you get an elegant, calm, immersive experience. the rooms are exceptional, with a single control for the lights and tv and curtains; the bathroom a glass box in the middle of the room; a vestibule so staff can deliver items to your room without entering. this may be my single favorite hotel in the country. is an experience, right in the heart of the strip -- stay here, and you rarely want to venture outside. is very cool. one quibble: we ordered room service a few times and though the food was excellent, they lard so many charges on it that you feel bitterly disappointed that such a wonderful experience is momentarily suspended by what can only be described as corporate greed. an 18 dollar burger (roughly), by the time tax and room service and various other fees are tacked on soars into the 40's. that just doesn't seem reasonable. if you want to charge 40 for a burger, just state it on the menu and don't hide fees. mandarin oriental: i love you and you're better than that. so, aside from that complaint -- literally everything else is great. truly, unquestionably, great. service, atmosphere, design. GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay.”
Reviews.Author: canadiangirl91
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is a very nice hotel for sure!!! We chose this hotel basically for the service. I will not get it an excellent because we all felt the service was a little lacking especially around the pool. We were a group of three girls wanting to get away from the kids and responsibilities. We wanted a place where we felt pampered. I would say the hotel staff make a HUGE effort to do so. But, I have stayed at places that do better. The pool service was definitely lacking. They needed more people to be serving drinks and finding chairs etc. It definitely was relaxing though, and very quiet. Not a party scene which we liked!!! The first day the servced frozen grapes, and frozen fruit drinks for free... second day we only saw this happen once. We also found this hotel to be quite far from the main areas of the strip. It is way on the other end. We would probably choose another hotel just for location itself. The beds were awesome... soooo comfortable and the rooms were nice. The bathroom especially. The couch in the main area of the suite was quite warn out. Could be nicer. The controls in the rm are hard to learn... it took us awhile for sure. Room service was pretty good. The fresh squeezed orange juice is out of this world, the fresh homeade yogurt is really good. The meals were just ok. They messed up our second day order so my sister had to eat what they brought her for a lack of time. Maid service was excellent. Although, they did forget to bring us a cott the first night and we were in at 2 am and had to wait until it was delivered... they first brought us a crib. HAHAHA. A few mistakes, but all in all I would say this hotel was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: davidmf
Reviews.Content: We come to Las Vegas to relax and enjoy all that it has to offer, staying at the cities best hotels (see my other reviews for some examples), getting a pampered, 5 Star experience that blow us away in terms of customer service, not just in relation to other Resorts in the City, but other places worldwide. They make a stay not just good, but great. I travel 100 nights a year for business, I don’t need my hand holding and perfect service all the time, but coming the Vegas I do like the push the boat out and stay at the very best. When it came to plan this trip, we selected the Mandarin, given the brands reputation, we were excited to be trying it out for the first time and to see how this would compare. While there was several aspects of our stay that met our high expectations, there were others that were sadly lacking and not what we would expect given the reputation of the Brand I do not want to just focus on the Negative and would like to give credit to the following, who “get it” in terms what the Mandarin is all about. Pool - Given the direction many places are taking these days, this was a complete Oasis of peace and relaxation, the best we have ever been to in terms of atmosphere, Staff and service. If you DON’T want the “Party/Loud Music”, that is prevalent in almost any other Vegas Pool these days, then this is hands down the best place to be.. Ground Floor Lobby - All of the Door and Bell staff were attentive and anticipated our needs, as the “Front Line” so to speak of the Hotel they did a great job. Mozen Bistro – we dined there everyday for Breakfast and once for lunch, each time the service and food were exemplary, Room – I was in an Stripview Suite, I was very pleased, I requested a high floor and got it, the view was fantastic - one of the best I have ever had - and the Bathroom/Bedroom were wonderful – the bath was HUGE! Combined with the Technology in the room, although it may not be the biggest, again it is one of the best. Staff that recognize what you want and adjust how they deliver their service and interaction appropriately are what makes things special and what makes the difference between a Hotel that is good and one that is great. The following is what did not make our Mandarin Stay great. The much vaunted “Valet Closet” appears to be useless. It is was my understanding that I was to place items in the Closet, press the Valet button and they would be promptly attended to. Also that items could/would be placed there on delivery for my collection, should I have the privacy light lit, or not be in my room. This was my experience – I needed two items for pressing, I placed them in the closet, they were promptly retrieved. Several hours later they were not returned, I called, and within 5 mins they arrived, however instead of the closet being used, I was called, informed they could not deliver because the privacy light was on, but someone was waiting at the door. I will admit I did not ask why they could not use the closet, I do wonder that the real reason was they would not receive a tip. More than once during stay, I put the Ice Bucket in the closet and pressed the Valet Button, we would leave the room for several hours, returning the find the light still lit and no ice. I spoke with Management twice mainly to clarify that I did not misunderstand how the valet closet worked. They apologized, said they would test the button and speak with Housekeeping, on each occasion they did follow up with a letter/Fruit Basket/chocolates saying that everything was working. While apologies are appreciated, I just wanted the service, I know things can go wrong, but the valet closet never worked as I was advised it would. On our final day it took two phone calls and 30 mins to get ice. At no other hotel in the world, have I ever had this much difficulty, or at the least I have the option of a self-service Ice machine in the hall. More than once our room did not receive turndown and once it was late afternoon before Housekeeping made up our room, just as we were coming back from the pool, and there was a sign on the door, all we could do was wait in the Elevator Lobby until they were done. The Front Desk staff, although friendly, is not what I would call “5 Star” perfect. To give some examples - When we checked in, I was greeted by name, but that was where the 5 star experience ended. Having checked us in, we were given directions to our room, with an apology that there was no-one available to cover the front desk, otherwise she would have walked us, I found this a little hard to believe having seen several people present that no one else was available to ‘hold the fort” so to speak. Of course we found our room no problem, but when we opened the door, the curtains were drawn, so it was pitch black and it took several minutes to find switches for the drapes/lights. Upon check out, I was planning to give some feedback, but since the no-one asked how my stay was, something I am asked 99% of the time even when I checkout in a basic hotel, I assumed they did not want to hear how things were, or the assumption was that everything just went so well. None of the above is what I would call showstoppers, indeed they could be seen as Nitpicking but it is examples difference between a good stay and a great one. There were many positives, that means I will consider the Mandarin in the future, The Property is fantastic, but it is my hope that my concerns will be properly addressed so that my next stay is a great one and not merely good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: RBH-Perth
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is in a good location on the strip. It is a short walk to most of the big casinos and there is a large shop next door to get any drinks/food etc you need. It is a wonderfully relaxed and smoke free environment. The common areas are nice and quiet, as are the rooms which are well insulated from noise. The rooms are the best i have ever stayed in, with everything controlled by a touch panel by the bedside which is really easy to use. Beds are really comfortable. The bathroom is large and really well fitted out with a large bath and separate shower. They have thought of everything and you dont feel like there is anything else they could have done to make room better, its just perfect. All the hotel staff are very friendly and so professional, they do actually make you feel like a valued guest. Turndown service provided each night comes in handy as they provide useful items like ice so you can chill your wine/champagne or whatever you like. The pool area is very modern and a great place to chillout, though not as big as many of the other large hotels, but this wasnt an issue for us. Overall there isnt even a small negative comment i can come up with, we will stay here next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in style”
Reviews.Author: Rusticpalmtrees
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for Valentine's Day weekend! It was my first time in Vegas, and I was a little apprehensive since I don't gamble. I picked this hotel mainly because I love the class and elegance at Mandarin Oriental hotels, but also because it is the only hotel on the strip that doesn't have a casino! It was very elegant and classy, as expected, and we spent a good deal at the hotel so it was a great trip. We had an amazing view of the strip, and the location was in the heart of all the Vegas action! However, there were a few things we were disappointed with. The hand held remote to control the TV and lights didn't work, even after we had someone come look at it. The TV hidden behind the mirror was very fancy! However, it was very hard to operate and work. On Valentine's night, we wanted to take a bath in the elegant tub in the very open glass enclosed bathroom, but the stopper did not work, so there went our romantic bath. We couldn't use the pool since it was being cleaned. Since the hotel is only a year old, I think they have a few kinks to work out. But the overall experience made up for it! The staff was very friendly and attentive, they made us dinner reservations twice, and they helped my husband set up a surprise gift in the bedroom!! Loved the trip, and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm and beauty!”
Reviews.Author: Richie248
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positive things to say about Mandarin Oriental. This is the best addition to Vegas stemming from the City Center complex. MOLAS offers an alternative to the typical Vegas resort. The sky lobby adds an element of privacy and exclusivity, the beautifully appointed rooms w/ every toiletry one could ask for. The valet closet adds another level of privacy. Beds were amazingly comfortable. The in room technology was also great. The pool area (small by Vegas standards) is serene and beautiful. They also have an adults only area, which is a great option for those traveling without kids. The staff also brings around little treats throughout the day ( a great touch). Complimentary bottled water is also available. The staff is warm and inviting and very helpful without being too pushy. I also love that they welcome you with fresh towels. If you're looking for a more relaxing getaway, Mandarin Oriental is your hotel. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Luxury”
Reviews.Author: shlepper
Reviews.Content: When reviewing this hotel you need to compare it to other luxury properties such as the Encore or Venetian.The room was nice with an overly complicated lighting system. The hotel is designed so that you need to take two elevators to get to your room.There is no free parking. The restaurant prices are totally overpriced, ie $24 for a continental breakfast.It is mostly filled with German tourists.The location is very convenient.No free internet .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Disappointing Food”
Reviews.Author: pcinbk
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin in Vegas as sleek, calm, beautifully designed and furnished, great views, with service to match (generally.) The rooms are spacious and very well appointed (the upgrade helped, but even lesser rooms are appealing.) The restaurant and bar, though, are disappointing, and account for the fact that I did not give the hotel the maximum rating. Our dinner at Gagnaire was a financially painful joke of a French meal (nearly $800 for 2 for mediocre food and service is really shocking.) The bar provided the second disappointment of the stay as there the service was pushy, surly and simply rude, with the prices, again, not helping. Still, I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite.”
Reviews.Author: DriveRideOrFly
Reviews.Content: Our cityscape room, located on the twelfth floor, was beautiful. The highlight of the decor was the bathroom, which featured partial walls that were translucent. The doormen, front desk personnel and bell persons provided impeccable service. Compared to larger Las Vegas hotels, poolside attendance is low, but this allows you to appreciate the sun and water -- and consummate service by the pool attendants -- in tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it.”
Reviews.Author: cm7872
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. I was traveling solo and wanted a safe hotel. I thought the room was very nice. The bed was great. I liked the deep tub and the bath salts were perfect. The room has a Valet Closet that can be accessed by the staff without actually coming into your room. It is accessed from the hallway outside your room. I really liked that feature and used it when requesting a charger for my iPhone. They use it for deliveries such as dry cleaning, newspapers, etc. You should also explore all the drawers in the closet area. They have cool stuff in them and I found this great shopping bag. The pools sucks unless you like tons of sun. The spa treatments are expensive. A day pass alone is $60. The spa is mind-blowing. The only thing I thought was strange was that they sent me though a parking garage to get to the Monte Carlo, which is next door to the MO. Overall, I thought it was a very good hotel. Staff was always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Sin City Promotion”
Reviews.Author: Antamy
Reviews.Content: The hotel essentially ups the rate on the two paid nights to offset the revenue lost from the 3rd 'free' night. I spoke to the reservations manager and a representative on the corporate reservations line and they both admit that the offer is confusing; I would call it misleading. World class hotel or not, this Sin City promotion is very dodgy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Defined”
Reviews.Author: WilliamHarrington
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas is the vanguard in luxury hospitality. I was extremely impressed with the service standards and anticipatory product layout. I recommend staying here if you want to be in Las Vegas for the convenience of both fun and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “A better way to do Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nouny2011
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels that I've ever stayed in. Although it is located in a central location in Vegas, the way that it's tucked in keeps it quiet and serene. There is no casino and nothing to see in this hotel, so it doesn't attract a crowd. The lobby is on one of the top floors. It's also easy to get around this hotel, which is a quality that can be hard to find in Vegas. The amenities are unbelievable. When you walk in, there is oriental lounge music playing. The TV has your name on it, and you control lights from your TV. Everything is extremely modern. The curtains (both inner and outer) are controlled by a switch. Awesome views of the strip. There's even a tv in the mirror of your vanity. Pool was nice but nothing extraordinary for Vegas. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely oasis!”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a lovely, quiet oasis in what is now a crazier than ever town. The hotel has wonderful rooms, a focus on service and is near casino and other dining options. At first I thought it was a little too quiet without a casino, but after a few days I really appreciated the comfort and quiet - and determined it was the perfect choice. We have stayed at most of the large hotels on the vegas strip over the years and this was the first we tried without the casino and large resort amenities, but truly once you got used to the quiet and higher level of service, there was truly nothing missing. We were upgraded to a corner suite which while not that much larger, did give a nice strip view. And the sky bar offers even better views and where else can you get a window table for after dinner drinks without a reservation? The formal afternoon tea was also wonderful. The only downside was the pool area is smaller than most of those large resorts. But the service at the pool far exceeded expectations (quick service to get you a chaise, sort out towels, etc. And every hour or so they came around with frozen fruit snacks. This is not a low cost option, but it's perfect for someone who wants a lovely, comfortable, elegant, and QUIET oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, peaceful...can this really be Vegas???”
Reviews.Author: blueswriter
Reviews.Content: First stay at the 5 star MO on the strip in the City Center complex while attending a convention at Caesars nearby. I knew I was in for an experience when even the cab driver was impressed by the secluded entry cove. The doorman caught my info off my luggage on the way in and by the time I reached the lobby the hosts welcomed me by my name...now that hasn't happened to me in Las Vegas since the coporate jerks took over the casinos and started handing out players cards in lieu of handshakes and comps. I have to say, I was impressed with EVERYTHING about the place...the bars, the pool, the central location, the staff, and the unbelievable calm that seemed to settle on me every time I entered the hotel. Service is definitely 5 star. Everyone is pleasant and cordial. When I couldn't figure out the tv...I pick up the phone and a maintenance guy showed up immediately to help. When I couldn't get the drain plug to work, I pick up the phone and a guy showed up to adjust what needed to be adjusted. Once I figured out how the hi-tech room gadgets worked it was wonderful to control the entire room from the remote on my nightstand. now if they can just figure out a way to have a fresh cup of coffee slide out from a slot in the wall precisely as I reach for the shaving cream in the morning...but, I suspect that someone at the MO may already be working on it. With no casino on site, this is a wonderful break from the overhyped and underdelivered "luxury" that is overtaking other vegas properties. This is a GREAT Hotel, with GREAT service and none of the headaches or "hangover wannabes" that flood some of the nearby resorts. If I had one complaint it would be that all the stone, and hard surfaces and architectural lines make the decor a tad too sterile for me...a few more flowering plants, and maybe a few oriental rugs to dampen the echo may make the common areas seem a little warmer...but that's just my own preference... If you come for business, relaxation or a retreat with your mate this is a great place to escape from the mayhem all around. The rooms, drinks and spa services are definitely 5 star priced, but in my opinion, the peace and relaxation the MO provides is worth every penny, and much cheaper than what the casinos extract at the gaming tables next door... Nice job MO...

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PandM0
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas often, and this is the best, hands down. So nice, quiet, exquisitely decorated and no casino. Mozen Bistro in the hotel is great for breakfast, Twist was too French for our taste.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: AAndTMD
Reviews.Content: First, anyone staying at the Mandarin should realize that this is not your typical Las Vegas Hotel... no glitz, no casino, no shows, no crowds, etc. So, if that is what you came to Vegas for, and you want it right at your hotel, you will be out of luck, although with the Aria right next door, you can always take the 3 minute walk and be right in the middle of things! The Mandarin has some of the best service we have ever had. The atmosphere is tranquil, they have a great spa (acc'd to the wife), a very nice fitness area, and an outdoor pool area with cafe that is outstanding. We did not eat at Twist, but did have multiple meals at the MOZen bistro, which I'll review separately. The rooms are large (we did stay in a suite), with good views, and well apportioned. My only complaint... $18 a day for internet (parking is $30/day, but valet with unlimited in/out and free parking is available for self park, so I cant complain about that). If Best Western can provide free internet, Mandarin can as well for what they charge nightly. So... if you are in Vegas, and like a quiet and calm atmosphere, the Mandarin is a sure bet!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly service, felt right at home :)”
Reviews.Author: LoveLifeTogether
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Las Vegas to complete our 10th wedding anniversary tour and we weren't sure what to expect. After long deliberation, we booked this hotel and we absolutely loved it. Peace, tranquility, wonderful room but the service was the stand out. Every employee in this hotel made us feel right at home and your team should feel very proud of the result. Always welcomed home on arrival and always looked after on leaving. Running late for "O" show. Needed a taxi....please take our hotel car and driver to make sure you make it! Walter, their driver is an absolute darling. From before we left home and we asked for special seats (which we got) to be arranged for two shows via the email and dealt with the concierge, until the time we spent on our last day in their exceptional day spa (you must try the heated, tiled lounge, Laconium), the service was exceptional and faultless.....thanks guys for making our 4 day stay so special and what a way to end our US trip. The Spa experience is truely amazing. Its a must do early so you can indulge more if you have the time.My first trip to the US from Australia and we will be back....thanks Annie and Anthony........P.S You must do the Gand Canyon by helicopter...its a must. We used Sundance and they were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern rooms on best part of Strip”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy1972
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at this new hotel in Vegas' amazing City Center complex with my girlfriend for her birthday. Great customer service- they called me before my stay to ask if there was anything I needed, etc. Upon arrival to this hotel, which looks like a dull office highrise building from the outside, but on the inside is spectacular. Everything is new and modern with a hint of Asian flair. Had a nice big room with great views of the Strip. The entry had a hallway with a luggage area, which was great to stash all your clothes and suitcases, etc. The bathroom was huge, with a large white tub, separate shower area, and double sink with all the fixings. There was even a glass-mirrored TV that could play wave sounds, etc. There was semi-frosted glass that could be seen from the hallway. The bed was comfortable, though I got too hot with the typical down duvet, and had to replace it with a lighter blanket in a box. New iron and board is provided. The pillows were extremely large, and honestly not that great- huge industrial types that were not down. I like the pillows at the Vdara- amazing! There is a remote control at your bedside that looks like an iPad that controls just about anything in the room which is pretty cool. All the lights dim off, and you can even set a timer so that the curtains open automatically in the morning (and the TV plays wave sounds, etc). It might take a day to get used to all the light switches. Two other things: there is no coffee in the room (only tea), and the drawer safe was broken in the room I had. Oh, and the shower control is difficult to understand. The pool area was nice, but rather small. It was $185 to rent a cabana if you wanted to stay out of the sun. There is a little bistro restaurant that is way overpriced for breakfast (and they didn't even serve breakfast around noon on a Sat. morning, which is a pet peeve of mine, esp. in Vegas). I would go to Aria or even the Cosmo hotels, which both have great buffets! Tried the restaurant Twist... small, intimate dinner overlooking the Strip. Great steaks. Was celebrating a birthday dinner, and them in advance. All they really did was say 'happy birthday', which was fine. Overall, quite the nice room and beautifully decorated. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel, a real gem”
Reviews.Author: theronware
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding stay at the Mandarin Oriental. From check-in to check-out, the service was just right -- friendly and attentive without being obnoxious and intrusive. Rooms were large, very clean and beautifully appointed. We ate dinner and breakfast at Mozen, and it was innovative and relatively good value. The hotel is large, but because of its clever design, it feels more like a boutique hotel, and not like one of the other mammoths on the strip. The architecture and the personalized service make the place seem accessible and not exhaustingly large. The hotel is beautiful too -- with fresh flowers everywhere and candles lit along the hallways at night. We also loved the pool area. The location is great too -- convenient to the new City Center (really worth a visit) and to the strip. All in all, our extended family group (from grandma who is 90) to our youngest child who is 8, had a wonderful stay. Indeed the latter, having witnessed the fuss made over us at check-in whispered to me, "Mom, they must think we're somebody famous!" The hotel is not cheap, but given the experience delivered, it's an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & opulence on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Italian_kilt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good central location on the strip. Check in staff were very helpful and polite on arrival. There was no free wifi unfortunately, rates were very high so we didn't pay for it as we were only there for one night. Breakfast also wasn't included in our rate so can't comment on this. We had a double cityscape room (room 1423) which was very nice, big and clean. Large bathroom with separate bath and shower cubicle, two hand basins which was nice. The bed was very comfortable. Would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Refined Luxury At a Steep Price”
Reviews.Author: nicolas617
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel; gracious staff - but in a way it is expected. Lobby and hallways very beautifully done - very soothing. My city scape room was lovely. Very well appointed probably the best I've seen in Vegas. Very nice bathroom and unique concept with the glass to let in light. Room is adequate in size but not big. It makes very good use of space. Spa seemed nice but was very dark - hard to even see! Can't beat the Encore in this area. The pool was nice and the staff again gracious - but the pool is nothing special compared to Wynn or Encore. Room service was good but very expensive so I would call it above average. I didn't check out the two restaurants but neither seemed that compelling. One time I will try Twist. This is a perfect place to really get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Paridise”
Reviews.Author: betonic
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights in the Mandarin as part of a 20 day vacation. I chose this hotel based on quality, location, no gaming and smoke free. We got off to a poor start when we arrived. We had driven 4 hours from LA and we not offered water or a cool towel as others have reported. We were taken up to the 23rd floor lobby and told that our room was not ready at 4:30pm. My comment to the receptionist was "isn't your check I time 3pm?". She apologized and offered us a drink and to have a seat in the lobby. After 20 minutes of waiting she returned to say that she was doing her best to hurry. I told her that she should look for another suite that was ready because it's un-acceptable that I should be kept waiting. Ten minutes later she came back with an upgraded suite on the 16th floor. The suite was amazing! When we opened the door the curtains opened and the lights turned on. The room was very large, had beautiful views and was full of high tech gadgets. The service in the hotel was very good almost all of the time but there were a few details that kept me from giving the hotel a rating of 5. The room service seemed to be a little off. We ordered a hamburger ($28) medium and they brought it well down. The urged tasted good but it wasn't how we ordered it. When I mentioned it to the receptionist they promptly removed it from our bill. Our package came with Continental breakfast included which was great because I would never pay $24 when you can have the full buffet at the Cosmo for $22. One morning my husband wanted eggs so we ordered to eggs over well ($12) and they came runny. In general everything tasted and looked great but for the price I think it should be perfect. The spa was by far the best spa I've ever been to but also pricey and worth every penny. As others have commented the parking is $30 a day and they do a great job having your car ready quickly. I paid $45 for 3 days of internet which seems like crazy money to me. We loved our stay at the Mandarin and I will stay there again if we go back to Vegas. The fact that everything is so peaceful makes up for all of the little details.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, sophisticated hotel with fun technology in the room”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located on the Strip in Vegas. There's no casino in the hotel and it's not designed to have a lot of Vegas glitz and glamor. Instead it's very elegant and modern. The service is excellent and the rooms are beautiful. You can control your TV, curtains, thermostat, lights, wake-up call, and just about anything else in the room with a device the size of an iPad. I scheduled a wake-up at 7:00 a.m. that turned in the TV, opened the curtains, turned on the hallway light, and lowered the room temperature. Sort of ridiculous but fun if you like technology! The rooms are very clean and nice. The bathroom is huge and features a lot of marble and tile. There's even a TV built into the bathroom mirror. If you want to party and go crazy in Vegas, this hotel isn't for you. But if you want to be treated like a celebrity, this is the place for you. (in fact, I saw a well known celebrity out at the pool during my visit).

Reviews.Title: “High quality room on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: macnoodle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of a week driving through Arizona (and staying at much less expensive hotels). As soon as we entered the room, we were happy with the decision. We stayed in room 1515, which has a good view of the Strip. It has a good storage area, then a great bathroom with two basins, bath, shower and WC, and a very comfortable sleeping area, with sofa and desk/table. The TV and bedside console allow you to control the room temperature, lighting, curtains etc. WIFI was available for $6/hour, or $18 per 24 hours. The parking cost $30 per night. Staff were excellent, as was the outdoor swimming pool/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Would have expected more”
Reviews.Author: pumax
Reviews.Content: Both me and my husband have stayed in a few of Mandarin Oriental properties in Asia and would like to give this Vegas one a try during our business trip to a convention. The location of the hotel is great. Its tucked behind the new City Center. Its quiet and you are just steps away from the hustle of vegas. There is a Walgreens just around the corner which makes the midnight supply run really easy. The staff were very friendly. We didnt make a booking for dinner so we ended up ordering room service. The restaurant actually sent their junior chef up to our room and explain the ingredients and sauces. What I would have expected more are the overall decoration and interiors of the property. Having been in the commercial design business for years, I am quite disappointed by their workmanship and quality of the interiors. The other Mandarin Oriental seems to do a much better job. Overall, their service is top notch but the hardware is not 5 star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: mmrb05
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the MO last week. The positives: Check-in is easy, no lines as compared to the large casino hotels. The atmosphere of the hotel from the lobby to the pool area and the guest rooms is very serene. Definitely a way to decompress from the sensory overload of the casinos. I loved the bathroom! The biggest negative is the spotty service. Like others on the board we had problems with housekeeping and pool staff. We left our room before 9 one morning requesting housekeeping as we left and returned over 6 hours later to an unmade room. I am not sure why this happened as when my husband phoned to ask for housekeeping to come up at a different point, they were there in minutes. Also, at the pool area we asked three different attendants for drink menus and were told no problem all three times yet no one ever returned with the menus. It was almost humorous putting in the same request over and over wondering if someone would ever deliver the menu. Overall, I would say I was 99% satisfied with my stay and that is about as good as any hotel can do.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but WiFi charges? Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: Elmrosie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, we loved the room and eventually managed to figure out all the technology. The soaps etc were wonderful and the hotel really felt like a haven when you walked into the courtyard from the Strip. All the staff were wonderful. Gym was lovely, but would perhaps be better positioned away from the Strip, atlhough the views would then be missing, as it was very hot in the morning and too hot to use the treadmills with the wonderful view, I also really objected to the charges for WiFi. We were on a two-week road trip in California and LV and the Mandarin was the only one of 7 hotels we stayed in to charge for WiFi. We ended up heading over to the Chandelier bar at the Cosmopolitan to use their free WiFi - yes, we had to buy drinks for this, but at least we enjoyed them! Still shameful that the Mandarin charges for WiFi considering its room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room but spoiled by needless penny pinching”
Reviews.Author: dollylollypops
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas and imagine this is a great choice if you want to escape the casino scene (we did). Our room (strip view room) was beautiful, very comfortable with a great view of the strip. The bed was extremely comfortable. Lovely bathroom with large egg style bath with TV in the bathroom mirror. I didn't use the bath but my partner did and noted it was very uncomfortable - definitely 'form over function' which sets the theme overall for this hotel. It did look nice though. Great hair dryer in the room with a thin styling nozzle (women understand) and a hot straighting iron were a very nice touch. The hotel pool area was lovely. The issues ... Its the only hotel other than the Four Seasons to charge for parking in the whole of Vegas ($30 a night). If you want to park and want to save the fee then park at the Aria next door and walk across. We returned our hire car on arrival so wasn't an issue. It wasn't easy to find the place though on foot. If arriving on foot the access to this place isn't great and not well sign posted. No coffee in the room or offered elsewhere in the morning without a room service charge. No internet access either unless you pay extra ($18 a day). They seem to have taken what should be a really classy hotel and made it feel like a budget airline experience where they charge for all the basic extras. At $350 per night this seems a little excessive and unnecessary to me? Internet and coffee in the morning would have made us happy (just simple things). They have tried hard to impress with their electronic system in the room. Everything is electronic. The curtains are open/closed at the touch of a button (sheers and blackout separately), all of the lights, tv etc. with an iPod style touch screen. This didn't work great and we are more than familiar with technology (we work in IT). The lifts were another issue and very confusing. Similar comments from other guests too who were struggling to find their way in the lift system. One lift to take you to the reception (23rd floor) or the 3rd floor cafe/meeting place and another to take you to the guest room floors. After 11pm the operation changes and some of the lift functions don't work but there are no details explaining this in the lift so you end up so frustrated unsure why its not working. Even the swipe card to use in the lift has to face a certain way. Overall an extremely beautiful hotel but somewhat spoiled with needless penny pinching for simple extras. A shame.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best I have stayed at in America”
Reviews.Author: DogenJoe
Reviews.Content: Better than the Ritz and Four Seasons, this hotel is flawless in every way. You find it hard to believe you are in Las Vegas. It is private, quiet, secure, and tasteful. The staff is so well trained to serve your needs. The only hotels that I have found with higher levels of service are in Asia. And the hotel rates are surprisingly affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - but check for special deals”
Reviews.Author: Axeloskar
Reviews.Content: Having stayed on the strip before it was such a pleasure to be able to relax and unwind whilst still being close to the centre of everything. We stayed here for 3 nights of a 2week holiday . We enjoyed a wonderful breakfast served in the room and room service couldn't be faulted during our stay. The rooms were excellent, we didn't need to request an upgrade. Everything is provided including hair straighteners, clothes brushes, umbrella (!), as well as the good quality toiletries and robes and slippers. There's a second TV in the bathroom mirror but we had a problem with intermittent sound from the speakers. Some guests may feel a little uncomfortable with the opaque glass in the toilet and bathroom doors although there is a sliding screen to cover the free standing bath. The beds were extremely comfortable. During our stay we used the pool one afternoon and there were very few guests around so we received close attention from the pool attendant staff although some of them did look as though they were new staff and were a bit unsure of things. Bottled water and sorbet were given free and additional towels were brought to us. We weren't asked at anytime if we were guests . The security is apparently monitored as the hotel reception is on 23rd floor with a separate lift for guests although visitors may still be able to get to the spa and pool. Certainly a different experience on the strip. The strip is only a very short walk away with CVS pharmacy shop and Monte Carlo Hotel next door . We didn't miss having a casino in the hotel. The only negative points were the charges for internet in the room and the cost of spa treatments. We got a great deal booking the hotel via Airmiles - certainly worth second visit .

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel with Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin for two evenings. The lobby, room, and overall aesthetics are gorgeous. The room was very modern with very clever technology included. I read a few reviews about the glass window into the bathroom - just a tip, there is a screen that slides over the glass. I do agree that it is still not a private enough, even with a spouse, but it was really beautiful. I liked that everything you would need could be found in various compartments throughout the room - extra pillows and blankets in a beautiful box, etc. Despite the beauty, our first day at the pool had a major impact on our entire experience. The pool was highly understaffed and those that were there (with the exception of one gentleman) would disappear or avoid eye contact at all cost. We had to hunt down somebody to request a lunch menu. When we placed our lunch order (after another round of hunting), our drinks arrived after half an hour. After an hour passed, I went to the desk to inquire about our lunch and was dodged several times. After an hour and a half, our lunch order - one sandwich and one salad - arrived. Yes, it took an hour and a half to receive a $75 lunch that would take about 15 minutes to prepare. We were offered nothing as an apology. We heard all of the visitors around us having similar experiences. We decided to purchase nothing else at the hotel throughout the rest of our stay. On another note, there were several visitors on both days that did not appear to be hotel guests. The hotel needs to do a better job of ensuring all pool guests are hotel guests - we never had to verify proof of our stay or a room key. With a small pool size as the Mandarin offers, they need to be a bit more careful with security - there are a limited number of seats. Overall, the hotel is beautiful but I will go back to the Four Seasons for the service - the Mandarin is not there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Alternative to Crowded Casino Hotels”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarriors
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Las Vegas is not a casino hotel and that's why I selected it over other hotels in Vegas. It is a very nice hotel with numerous amenities and a full scale spa.
