My room had a panoramic view of the strip and downtown, the bathroom had separate tub and shower. The food was very good, room service good and the staff very impressive. The room rate was a bit high, especially compared to the other hotels in Vegas. But, it is extremely quiet, elegant and has nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Truly incredible spa experience, rest of service a bit spotty”
Reviews.Author: SDHapahaole
Reviews.Content: Visited for a mini-vacation and winter splurge this past January. We'd wandered into the Mandarin during a prior visit to Las Vegas and had been awed by the tranquility of its non-casino oasis and had greatly anticipated our stay here. The amenities, room and especially the spa all lived up to our expectations. If we hadn't had reservations for dinner and a show, I would have gladly moved into the spa and not ever left. I enjoyed an amazing Oriental massage and signature foot treatment and then soaked for what felt like hours while overlooking the Strip. My husband (usually not a Spa visitor) is still raving about the spa four months later and can't wait to go back. My only real concern regarded the spotty service we received throughout our stay. The property obviously prides itself on excellent service - the Spa employees, doormen, room service, housekeeping, all lived up to this and perhaps even exceeded expectations. The bar, however, was abysmal. It was not a busy evening and after being shown to a table, our friends and I were completely ignored. After we hailed a waitress, our order was taken and 20 minutes later no drinks arrived. We tracked down a manager who apologized, but then still no drinks for over 10 minutes and then no apology when they finally arrived. The waitress then had the nerve to confront us about the small tip we left stating that it wasn't her fault... Maybe just an isolated experience or bad night for that particular server, but from this level of property, I expect more. We then had a similar off-putting experience when checking out which admittedly marred our Zen experience. On arrival we had been upgraded to a suite as the property was clearly not overly full. On checkout, however, we were charged not only for the upgrade but at the level of the suite accommodate above the one in which we'd stayed! It took a request to see the manager and then extensive explaining including production of our email confirmation for the original booking for this to be rectified. Our bill was finally settled to the initially agreed upon amount, however, it was disappointing to have to haggle upon departure. Given the number of other properties available in Vegas, for or next trip we will consider staying elsewhere and returning to the Spa at the Mandarin as day visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Whytex
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay - location, service, pools, rooms, views, staff & value. Have stayed at 5 other hotels over the years including the Four Seasons and this one tops them all. Great location on the strip, particular to the newer casinos (Aria & Cosmopolitan) they have house cars that provide free transport along the strip & airport. The pools are great with ample lounges and sophisticated pool scene - no collage students walking around with buckets of beer & bad attitude. Value for money is rare but it's delivered in spades at the MO Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Commerce90
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Mandarin. We are very familiar with the Mandarin chain in Asia and the Vegas property does not disappoint. Clean, modern rooms, excellent service, great strip views, large washrooms, etc. Better yet, got a very good deal on Expedia. Really liked the ability to play hard in Vegas at the casinos and then return each night to the oasis of calm that is the Mandarin. No drunken 20-somethings here. Location is in the center of everything. If you are tired of long check-in lines with millions of tourists roaming around (like the Wynn or Bellagio), then highly recommend the Mandarin. Only downside was our horrible experience at their signature restaurant, Twist. Eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Client & Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElissaB
Reviews.Content: Selected hotel for client meeting as it did not have the distraction of a casino and was non-smoking. Easy walking distance to casinos for night diversions. Rooms were in excellent condition and delighted clients for cleanliness, superior staff response and spaciousness. Meeting support was good, food was healthy. Only drawback was the business center's fee for copying documents.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tuomo79
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently 5 nights at the beautiful Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas. We couldn't be more happier of our choice. The rooms are outstanding. As a younger traveller I really give value for all the high technology they provided in the room. Automatic lighting, curtains etc. but especially the sound system! You can plug in your own laptop to TV and play your music with real speakers and there's even a subwoofer too! Bed's are amazing, view to the strip from our 17th floor room and away from all the gambling but still close to everything. Service was excellent except on the last morning when the "hostess" lady were missing from the breakfast:) Pool area was excellent where they serve free water and some cooling refreshments during the sunbathing. Fitness center is a big plus too though it should be open later than 8 pm. Overall one of the greatest hotel experiences ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Daanny
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and Mandarin Oriental never let you down. Great location on the strip and close to everything, had a great time and their concierge were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Best”
Reviews.Author: swoopbns
Reviews.Content: The only place to stay in Vegas. Service amazing. You walk in the front door to peace and quiet. Has no Casino which means quiet and no Smoking. To be able to breathe the air is the ultimate. Vegas is very backward and has smoking everywhere. To see little kids having to walk through other casinos to get to hotel breathing in the smoke. MGM was the worst for that. We had a corner suite with the special third night free it made it the same price as other rooms. Loved the Master switch on the wall that closed all the curtains and turned off all the lights. The TV built into the bathroom mirror was fun. Even Rose petals on towel in bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis amidst the chaos, glitz, frenzied energy of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteEpicurean
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Mandarin Oriental and greatly enjoyed our stay. The property is outstanding, extremely well staffed and provides many nice touches that ensure an excellent experience. We plan on returning. We enjoyed a 60 minute massage and having experienced many spas around the world, the spa at Mandarin Oriental is amongst the best we have enjoyed. I left my wedding ring and college ring inside a pocket in the robe. I called the hotel and they put out an all points bulletin for these sentimental items and I was delighted the next day when security called and returned the rings to our room. The pool area is A++++! Staff is plentiful to handle any needs (towels, food, drink), food is very good and venue and overall vibe is stellar. Courtesy car/limo are available for free for transport to points of interest within 3 miles of the hotel, which covered all areas we visited. Overall this is an elegant hotel that lives up to all the hype. Value was decent as we stayed on Zen City package (pay for two nights and get the 3rd night free). Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Literally an Oasis in the Middle of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtoomuch
Reviews.Content: I am not a gambler and even though I know it is part of the Vegas experience to walk through the smoke filled hotel lobbies with assaulting noise and lights, I would so much rather enter the oasis of the Mandarin Oriental. It is right on the strip in the new City Center, but the way that they took the time to design the positioning and entrance to the hotel creates a total separation from the hustle and bustle of the strip. At first you are a little perplexed at all of the ups and downs to get in and up and down to your room, but you quickly realize this was done intentionally to give you this feeling of calm, as if you are in some distant exotic resort. Other than that, every other part of your hotel stay is not just good, but perfect. The staff is so genuinely warm and welcoming that you feel you have known them as friends. The lobby is also apart from the mayhem on the Vegas strip as it is located on the 23rd floor. The Mandarin Lounge was fantastic with great food, staff, music, and views. Breakfast at the Mozen Bistro was a cut above the others. The halls and other public areas were soothing and pleasing to the eye. The room left you wanting to move in. Everything was considered in designing and outfitting the rooms. When you first open your door, the lights come on and the curtains open exposing floor to ceiling windows and a fantastic view. The in room electronics were easy to use and actually usefull! You could operate everything from your bedside controls. The bathroom was perfect and there was a separate little closet and space area to put your bag. There was even a place to hang cloths to be taken for cleaning in your room but staff would access securely from the hall. I have never written a review this long and I could go on and on, but bottom line is that if you are in Vegas - stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea on the 23rd floor. Soothing and realxing”
Reviews.Author: Tommy745
Reviews.Content: Afternoon tea on the 23rd floor was so pleasurable and refreshing. What a contrast and much needed spot to relax and enjoy very good variety of tea

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation At Its Best”
Reviews.Author: drw68
Reviews.Content: I just came back from staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Vegas and it truly was a great experience. The service is top notch and you can tell everyone works as a team, as all employees seem genuinely friendly and happy to be working there. There are a few suggestions, and comments that I would like to convey and why I didn't rate it excellent vs very good overall. 1. Upon arrival- at approx 2pm- we went to the pool area only to be told incessantly that the pool would be closing at 3pm for a private event. It was quite annoying and I think a major inconvenience for guests as it was packed. I totally understand and appreciate that the hotel needs to make revenue but they should consider clearing out an entire area to set up for a dinner that looked like only for 60 guests from what I could see may not be worth it. Also we left the area at 3pm and went to our rooms and the other guests did not leave until 4pm for after. As I said major inconvenience and maybe can be handled in a different manner like sectioning off an area until the last possilbe moment?? Also the last day the pool was shut down to high winds so we really got penalized coming and going. 2. A female employee at the pool did not get her namel-was the same employee that told us the pool was closing did not seem like she knew the hotel facilties. We came down around 10am one day and asked if there was breakfast just where we could grab a coffee and pastry. She said no, that the hotel pool area restaurant opened at 11am. Of course we found out the next day there was a service on the 3rd floor, as I knew that sounded odd. She did not seem informed. I also feel that her and her colleague could have helped people more at the poolside. At the Four Seasons in L.A. they put the towel through a chair holder for you and provided complimentary "jet lag" smoothies. Thought it was a nice touch. The two female employees seemed like they just wanted to get through the day. Also one day we came early to eat our breakfast on departure day (7am) and the pool was closed and a male employee let us eat there. Seems late (8am) to open a pool - what if someone wanted to catch an early swim? 3. A coupon was presented at check in for a complimentary appetizer, a $25 rebate for a spa treatment and one other service I can't recall. We used it in the bar and received the comp appetizer. I thought it was tacky just being able to choose one option, as the waitress took the coupon. Given that the rooms are pricy, what does it really cost the hotel to extend the other options to guests.... 4. Turndown service could use a variety.....seemed the same every night. Given there is so much competition - the more little personal touches you can give guests, the better this hotel can become. 5. The Spa -was outstanding and top notch. A note - the manicurist should put the color of nailpolish in the computer on the way out so I could have bought the color as I forgot the name. The guy behind the counter had to run all the way down to fiind her to ask and then they did not have the color. Mellissa was a great masseuse- the best! I loved coming back to the hotel's peace and tranquility. I come to Vegas for more of the experience of hotels, restaurants and entertainment and not the gambling so this was the best hotel for us to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service Experience!”
Reviews.Author: spuds
Reviews.Content: I visited Las Vegas with my sister-in-law for a girls get away. The Mandarin Oriental was wonderful! I have never had such excellent service in a hotel before. From room service to the attendants at the pool, everything was top notch! You can tell they are trained on ensuring their clients are well taken care of. This hotel does not have a Casino attached and truth be told we did not miss it one bit, we loved the quietness and the smoke free smell of entering the hotel.... and if you wanted a Casino the Aria is a short walk away! One of the best parts of our stay was the wonderful service we received from the concierge. I must mention and thank Stephanie as she truly went over and above to deliver quality customer service for us to make our trip very special. With out a doubt, when I return to Las Vegas the Mandarin Oriental will be the place I stay. In all fairness though, I do however have to mention one downpoint of our stay. We had difficultly controlling the temperature in the room with the control on the nightstand. It got very hot on our last evening, therefore we had to control the temperature with the wallmounted control. It was our last evening so we did not mention or complain to anyone... I am sure if we did though it would have been rectified.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Potential...”
Reviews.Author: eyechip
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin LV is, while by far the best in Las Vegas for those who want a combination of sleek and sexy and no gaming, but falls far short of Asian and European Mandarin properties and, as such, one should not be lured into thinking the service and facilities will be comparable.. Frankly, it seems to be a recurring theme at all North American Mandarin properties, of which I have stayed at all. Flaws and rather spotty service, even amidst the exceptionally designed rooms, is becoming a trademark of sort in the U.S. and Mexico. So, What’s Good. -The hotel has a stunning design and interior, perhaps the best in North American M.O’s, even New York. The Sky lobby, bar and restaurant make for an elegant public area. While certainly not the Park Hyatt Tokyo by comparison in sky lobbies, it does impress and makes for a beautiful entrance. -The Restaurants are exceptional and service is fantastic at both. I found Twist to be in the top three of restaurants in Las Vegas and a strong contender as best in a quality to price value. The three-course dinner is an exceptional value at $105.00 per person. As well, Mozen is a fun little bistro with a pan-asian-we-do-it -all here kind of menu. Indian, Japanese, Chinese, Thai, it is all represented. I tried a number of things but personally my suggestion would be to stick with the Japanese, Mr. Kats at the Sushi bar is exceptional, very personable, and while limited in what he offers as far as the fish, is creative with what he has. -The rooms are beautifully designed, comfortable and sleek, with exceptional amenities in-room, a bottle service mini-bar, and an amazing suite of technology enabled lighting and room controls. There is little if anything that has been missed here. And, What’s Not. -A rather deceptive measuring of the suites is my biggest issue. The Strip view suite, for which I booked, was listed on the website as being 850 sq. feet. That is fairly expansive for an entry-level suite category so I decided to splurge and book this as it seemed a good value. I arrived for business two days before my wife so I did not really notice that the room we were give, 1201, was nowhere near 850 sq. feet. I suppose I also forgot the size since making my booking. After my wife arrived she commented in a passing way that the suite is well laid out and beautiful but still a bit tight as a suite for two people. That is when I glanced quickly at the website and realized that Mandarin is either completely off on their measurements or there is a smaller version of the Strip View Suite that they try and pass off. This room is more like 600-650 sq. feet and is at a weird corner angle so that a good 10%-15% of the room is unusable. I would rate it more in a Junior suite category. Since I realized this half way through our 5 night stay I decided not to take issue and request an explanation or room change. I post this now though so that others are aware and so that Mandarin might correct this so as not to mislead in how it presents the suites at the booking point. -On a sunny and beautiful Saturday of 85 degree weather my wife and I decided to sit by the pool in the afternoon. It was a perfect pool day. There was a gusty breeze, as is typical in Vegas, but it actually made it very pleasant and comfortable in comparison to the heat one sometimes has there. After about a half hour there (around 2:00PM) the pool manager addressed each guest (about 30-40 of them) to announce that the pool area was being closed because high winds were making the area unsafe. Huh? O.K., I am not kidding here. While I could see limiting food service and securing umbrellas in a breezy situation like this closing it was very bizarre. I, and everyone at the pool, was completely taken aback at the announcement. I thought two European guys summed it up best as they stormed out, “Only in America.” My wife and I, pasty from a long eastern winter, were pretty adamant that we were not leaving our comfy chairs because of a gusty breeze without the manager on duty coming to tell me face-to-face how this would constitute a decision to close and remove 30-40 guests. The pool manager mumbled something about the dangers of a flying cushion (again, I kid you not) and left - I assumed to get the manager. After about an hour and a half, no one ever came to remove us. We left the area to meet some friends and noticed a few others as well that had refused to leave. Good for them. Again, if you are not a pool person you might not care, but many come to Vegas to also enjoy the sun and desert climate, European’s especially, so if this is a priority you might want to book at one of the more pool oriented properties like the Wynn. -Breakfast room service can be rather slow. Plan accordingly, though one should not have to at a luxury property. One morning a bagel and pot of coffee took nearly 50-minutes. No offer at all to even make the coffee on the house, just a cheerful explanation that they were very full in the hotel and room service was running behind. I hope this is helpful and keeps you informed…as well that it will enable Mandarin to recognize some flaws and to make what is a beautiful hotel one of the best urban resorts in North America as it has that potential.

Reviews.Title: “Great location fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: davemullins2010
Reviews.Content: Excellent location- our first trip to the strip! Everything within walking distance. Check in was great- in our room with luggage within 10 mins. Beware car parking charges for rental vehicle was $30 bucks a night. Hadnt calculated for an extra 180 dollars but car was safe and retrieved in minutes when needed. All the staff were really special. The concierges Stephanie and Joe were brilliant. Both got us premier seats at good prices for top shows at very short notice ( that evening) and we especially enjoyed the Viva Elvis show - a mustsee. Hotel rooms were classy and the bed sooo comfy. Unfortunately the restaurants were too pricey in my opinion and we didnt try them out. We found a great place to eat towards red rock canyon - the Black Bear diner was great fun. Sat nav in the car was a must and we travelled extensively in the region- death valley/valley of fire/red rock canyon/hoover dam and took Grand Canyon helicopter tour of grand canyon which was brilliant day out. To top it all we won 1400 dollars on the roulette last 2 hours of holiday - yippee.

Reviews.Title: “Best on strip”
Reviews.Author: hotinfo
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic. Everything from check in to checkout was first class. Loved Mozen for breakfast, great service. Spa was very good, thermal experience is a must do. Just gave a 4 star on value...and only if you pay full online rates....especially on the upper end suites. They are bit out of line with other top end properties on the Strip. If you get one of their many package deals...or better yet, a reasonable upgrade, it is well worth the cost. This is definitely a step up from Tower Suites at Wynncore. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: theparma
Reviews.Content: I went for a long weekend in Las Vegas for a friend's birthday (Fri-Mon). I was absolutely floored by the quality of my experience at the Mandarian!!! I knew they were known for their service and luxury but it exceeded all my expectations. My room was so posh with a great view, and every single staff member I encountered was totally engaged in their job and genuinely happy to make my stay great. I felt like it was a whole hotel full of friends! While their chain is more expensive than I can afford on a regular basis, I know I'll stay with them whenever I can make it happen!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I expected.......”
Reviews.Author: fly121
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and we had a strip view room on the 16th floor. It was a nice layout room and very clean and the bathroom shower had great water pressure. You have to change elevators to get to your room which after the third day was becoming a pain. The walls and windows are not as sound blocking as they should be. We could hear traffic from the street, telephones ringing in the room adjoining as well as water running in the pipes. The last was especially nice at midnight. We ate breakfast twice at MOzen, the prices are more expensive than other 5 star hotels and the service was poor at best. I don't think that the Mandarin has self parking like every other hotel so when you valet your vehicle for the night you are charged a parking fee of $30. Checking in and out was fine but nothing special compared to other hotels. I travel to Las Vegas 1-2 times per year and have stayed at many 5 star hotels on the strip. The Mandarin Orintental is not very special...next time it's Vdara, The Hotel or Venetion.

Reviews.Title: “The Mandarin Oriental is the gold standard in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SteelyDF
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Mandarin oriental hotel in Las Vegas along with a collegue and we were both delighted. The hotel and amenities are first class and the staff were so pleasant and professional in every way. This is a non-gaming hotel and it is an oasis of calm amounst the hustle and bustle of the Vegas strip. The beds and pillows are probably the best I've ever had in my travels. The location is excellent for getting around on foot. If you're planning a trip to Vegas in the future, I would highly recommend you stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with a quiet atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: lws07
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental was very modern and clean. Since I'm not a gambler, I really liked how there was no casino (and the smoke and crowds that go with it) in the hotel. No complaints about the room (king with strip view) itself. The lighting was a little tricky to figure out for the 1st few hours, but then I easily got a hang of how to use. The tv was nice, the bed and pillow comfy, and the climate control worked well. (The mini bar also had enough space for me to put in a few drinks that I bought myself at CVS.) I even requested an extra one of their softer pillows at midnight and they came to my room in a few minutes, no problems. All staff was very nice, whether it was the front desk, bellhop, or room service. Although the hotel was mostly quiet, I unfortunately did get woken up 2 mornings by people in the next room over. They didn't seem to be talking super loud or anything, so I suppose it was just bad sound proofing between rooms. I could also hear a little bit of noise from the strip (was on floor 11), but it wasn't constant or enough to keep me up. I bought Internet on one day and it worked very well, no hiccups in service. The price however was pretty steep at $18 for 24 hours worth- there were no alternatives for free, I searched for other open networks, but there were none. The location of the hotel is pretty good. The rating on this depends on where you spend your time, which for us was mostly on the northern part of the strip, where as the hotel is in the middle area. It's right across from the Crystals mall in the City Center, which I didn't have interest shopping in given that all the stores are very $$$ brands; but we did enjoy the Wolfgang Puck restaurant for a lunch and dinner meal. We didn't eat at any of the hotel's restaurants, so can't comment on those. In the final email I got from the hotel, I took a survey to rank my experience. Along with my positive comments, I expressed disappointment in getting woken up, the pricey internet charge, and no "green" option to not get the towels replaced. I also checked that I'd like to be commented about the comments I left, just to see what happened. A hotel manager called me and left a voicemail2 days after I completed the survey and also emailed me later that day. He apologized for the things I was disappointed in and genuinely showed concern for my feedback. It was really nice to see that the hotel cares about what their customers think and I was pleasantly surprised by his responses. Overall I recommend this hotel, but I was really bummed about being woken up by other guests. If it hadn't been for that, I'd give it 5 stars, but because of that and the few other things I mentioned above, I give it a 4-4.5 stars instead. I forgot to mention that the room rate we got (through the hotel's website) was phenomenal, stay 2 nights get 1 free- no regrets for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of the strip, but peaceful and serene”
Reviews.Author: retep68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my partner after 4 nights with friends at a different hotel. Booked with the suite temptations deal - strip view suite - stay 2 nights, get the 3rd night free ($100 spa credit, welcome ammenity - chocolate covered strawberries and fruit, continental breakfast - fruit, pastries, coffee and fruit juice). Great suite on the 16th floor. Entrance to lounge area with desk and sofa and huge tv, double doors through to bedroom on the corner of the hotel - another large TV, strip views through all (floor to ceiling) windows, round the corner to the large bathroom. Big bath tub, oversized separate shower, twin sink, toilet in adjoining separate room. Lots of soaps, shampoos, shower gels, towels etc... Everything in the room can be centrally controlled via the TV screen and remote control or using the electronic pad next to the bed. Easy to use, but usual air con and light switches on the wall are also there. Lots of wardrobe and drawer and cupboard space. Bed was amazingly comfortable - best I've ever slept in. Service was consistently excellent. Very friendly, but at all times professional. Staff really couldn't do enough to help. If being really picky, breakfast service was a little bit slow on a couple of the mornings, but we weren't in rush, so not a big deal for us. Continental breakfast in MOzen was great - bowl of fresh, mixed fruit, bowl of pastries - croissant, three danish pastries and a muffin, very nice coffee and lots of refils - took one to take away each morning as well. Had dinner in MOzen one evening - so peacful in comparison to the noise and music in most of the casino restaurants. Great food - cod for me, perfectly cooked, lamb shank curry for my other half - excellent (who said you couldn't get a decent curry in the US!!!). Weather hadn't been great for most of our stay, but it got warm enough for an afternoon by the pool. Again, quiet and serene with excellent drinks service. Sun loungers were very comfortable with very thick matresses. Even though you're right by the strip it was very relaxing and peaceful - bar the helicopters passing over! Cocktails in the bar on the 23rd floor were excellent - expensive even by top-end Vegas standards. Lunch at MOzen was also good. Used our $100 spa credit by just using the spa (no treatments) $50 each normally, so expensive, but as we had the credit.... Very relaxing and a perfect way to prepare for our 10 hour haul back home. Very easy to get into the middle of all the madness of Vegas (particularly Aria and The Cosmopolitan) from the MO, but amazingly peaceful and relaxing as soon as you walk back in. This suited us perfectly as we'd just spent 4 hetic days and nights with friends at Encore. Would definitely recommend this hotel. We've been lucky enough to have stayed in some great places around the world and this definitely rates as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “A Masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: There are few hotels in the world that deserve the description 'masterpiece.' Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas is indeed in that rarefied pantheon. How I would love to just stay and stay here. Each delight seems to compound the other. Check in was smooth. Our room was not quite available when we arrived; as such, the front desk sat us down to have the finest tea I have ever consumed. While waiting, we were on the 23rd floor overlooking the action of Vegas. We were directed to our room after about 20 minutes. When we arrived, I just could not believe how cool it was. As we walked in the drapes automatically opened to reveal a full 270 degree view of the strip and the mountains beyond. What could we say but wow! This is the Strip View Suite. Definitely worth every penny of the upgrade. We spent so much time just drinking in the views and the serenity of our room during our four day visit. Each day after roust-abouting on the strip we would return to this smoke free and casino free temple of serenity. Baths in the wonderful huge tub were memorable (room for two 6 foot guys!) Each staff member treated us as if we were royalty and always greeted us by name. I have stayed all around the world (47 countries and all 50 states) and nothing, I mean nothing, compares. The pool and hot tub area are ravishing. If only they would tear down the Polo Towers across the way and build a beautiful thing. One can hardly blame the Mandarin for this! The location is perfect, next door to the Cosmopolitan and the Bellagio. I understand the spa is one of the best in the country. Unfortunately, we did not have the scratch to buy into the rather high priced treatments (guess I will have to work harder!) Breakfast in the room was expensive, but worth every penny. Breakfast in the MoZen bistro was even better. You will not find a better blueberry pancake in all the world. I could lie down in the hallway and stare at the beautiful appointments for hours. It's that good. Perfection has a name and it is Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas. Like a gilded fantasy come true, I never wanted to leave. Can I come back now? Please?

Reviews.Title: “Great Zen at the MO Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: phofstad
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have stayed at – fantastic service, luxury rooms very high tech great pool area and very attentive staff. A fantastic place to return to after a hectic day on the strip. We had the hot towels on check-in no tea I guess it depends on who checks you in. They extended our checkout time to 2PM to coincide with a transport back to airport. The bar on the 23rd floor is a must even if you just do it once (very expensive even for Vegas) but magnificent views of the strip. Guests are have no access to the spa facilities unless they have a treatment which is a slight negative, we highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation Taken Up a Notch!”
Reviews.Author: HYPERSHARK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for Valentine's Day. I've never stayed at other Mandarin properties, but am impressed with this Vegas location. Check-in was a breeze and was escorted by the bellmen to the elevator to reach the sky lobby. We got an upgraded room (thanks, AMEX) and got into another bank of elevators. The room was amazing and the view of the strip/Aria entrance was nice. I like that the room was technologically advanced. I'm a nerd, so figuring it all out was easy and kind of fun. It was nice to be able to hook up my ipod/computer to the in-room sound system to be able to stream music. I also like the fact that there is a valet delivery system in place. This basically states that when it's on (distinguished by a light in and outside of the door), any deliveries to the room can be placed in the room valet box without the staff having to interrupt the quietness of the ambience. Super cool. Also, never once did we see cleaning staff. Yet, the rooms were always cleaned and turned down in the evening. They've got ninja cleaning staff. The food at the restaurant was good. We ate there for breakfast. The wait staff was attentive. My girlfriend went to the spa and she said it was amazing and felt relaxed afterwards. The rooms were quiet and rarely heard any neighbors. My girlfriend mentioned that she could hear people in other rooms, but I was lucky and didn't notice. The hotel is a short walking distance to the ARIA hotel and found myself hanging out there during the day. Parking is mega expensive so definitely utilize the ARIA self-park or ARIA valet. Both are free. I'm looking forward to going back as ALL of the staff were friendly from the bellmen to a nice handwritten note from the GM. Great service and attentive staff is what will keep me coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel, we were there for my birthday and were greeted with a cake and a "Happy Birthday" everywhere we went. Great staff, loved the Bistro, the security, all the tiny details. We had the strip room with one night free which was a fantastic bargain. The Mandarin Bar is not always open and doesn't have a lot of tables with a view, we always had our drinks in the tea room Every little touch counts and they have forgotten NOTHING

Reviews.Title: “perfection in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: notula
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas has set the standard in a city with many luxury hotels. The hotel service from the informative doormen to hot towels and tea on check in was perfection. Our room had a great view of the strip from the 17th floor. The huge closet area included many drawers and a valet area for your complimentary shoe shine. The bath salts, tv in the mirrored vanity with and towel racks everywhere show the details in the bathroom. Housekeeping immediately answered any request. This is a Zen of calm in frenetic Vegas. There is no gaming and only 1 elegant bar with unbelievable views from the 23rd floor. if you want lots of action head to Aria or the Cosmopolitan which are located in the city Center complex next to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat from the craziness of the Strip, but still on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KAS09
Reviews.Content: Pros- quiet non gaming hotel, has none of the madness that is going on outside. elegant.. good breakfast. cons- the hot water in the shower is just not hot, lukewarm at best...consistently. Why?

Reviews.Title: “Good New Option For Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ediggidy
Reviews.Content: I'm really rather conflicted regarding this hotel. I have stayed at the one in SF. It was my first time staying at a hotel in Vegas without a casino. Pros: service is terrific, nice to walk into a hotel and get to the room without zig zagging through crowds (bellagio and venitian), central location, hotel is new and you can tell in that the rooms do not look worn out like so many other hotels in Vegas (Bellagio) and once again-- service is terrific. Cons: no casino, basic room is smaller than basic rooms at Encore, strip room did not have very thick windows and sound did come through from strip, walls were not very thick and could hear doors slamming and people coughing and sneezing, the diner on the 3rd floor is not very good and uber expensive, have to go next door for water (CVS Store I think since nothing in hotel), and closest casino is Aria which is the coldest casino in the world.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: rmurchis
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about staying at the M.O. - go for it! I have stayed in several hotels on the strip over the years. This was by far the best. I was initially a little leary about staying in a non-gaming hotel - but it turns out that this was a welcomed break. The staff was great. The location was very good. We also considered Vdara, but it was in the back of City Place. I am glad we went with the M.O, which overlooks the strip. The 23rd floor lobby and bar has fabulous views. Drinks are $$$, but that's Vegas. We did not try the restaraunts in the hotel, but there are several options nearby. The only negative thing I can come up with would be that our room had an adjoining room door. There was not adequate sound buffering with it - fortunately we had either quiet - or no - neighbors, but when housekeeping was there we could definately hear them. I might suggest requesting a room without the adjoining feature. (If you had noisy neighbors this would be a problem). The technology features are a bit gimmicky and cumbersome to use, but in the end a positive. Someone else commented that the exercise room was not up to par. I did not find this to be true. It is one of the nicer hotel gyms I have used. It is available for no added cost (weights, machines, cardio) with a beautiful strip view from the 8th floor. It is stocked with bottled water, towels, exercise consultant, etc... Wireless internet is an additional fee - not sure how much as I did not purchase it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Kosquitoes
Reviews.Content: I don't think I can say any more than everyone else about this hotel. Staff were excellent, our room on the 6th floor was high tec to say the least and beautiful to look at, the hotel facilities were top notch and the pool area was gorgeous. The fact this hotel has no casino is an absolute bonus....like most people we did venture into the casino hotels and how pleased was I that we didn't choose one of them to stay in....the cigarette smoke is enough to put you off walking in!! We were lucky enough to have a $100 credit on our room so we indulged in breakfast a couple of days....fabulous, again is all I can say! If you're looking for somewhere classy, quiet but bang in the heart of all the action, this is definately the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: SamwiseAtl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at Mandarin Oriental. We were offered the towel service mentioned by other reviewers, but we weren't offered the tea (not a big deal to us though). The staff was very polite and friendly (and pretty). Our room is very clean, and the decor is very modern and tasteful. We took advantage of the complimentary shoe shine service (done through the valet closet which we haven't seen in other hotels!) They also provide bed down service which I have not seen in other large hotels on the strip. Included with the bed down service was 2 (complimentary) bottle of water. We stayed at Palazzo a day earlier and the bottle of water (house brand) there costs $5! We did not dine there, so we can't comment on their restaurant facilities or services. Our only "complain" was that everytime we went out we have to get through 2 elevator rides, although compare to other mega hotels where one would have to walk a mile before they can leave the hotel and casino, maybe our situation is not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental Just OKAY for Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelkid
Reviews.Content: My partner and I celebrated our 2nd Vegas night at Mandarin Oriental. Everything written is TRUE about inroom technology, cleanliness, aromatherapy in hallways, and decor. AMAZING. My suggestions follow: Carly checked us in and escorted us personally to elevator (a hotel standard) but it seems weird just being sent DOWN on your own to your room. She did NOT give us the signature welcome tea and towel service known at MO, which others received who were checking in around us. In room safe and television built-inside mirror were inoperative. Elevators on guest floors should have a friendly sign reminding guests to go UP to lobby to avoid countless erroneous elevator trips. Henry at breakfast room was exceptional at remembering our difficult coffee preferences, but overall dining service at buffet was inconsistent for us and tables around us; too many people had to wait for a breakfast table when 13 tables in adjacent room were "closed off" inexplicably. Getting taxis here is always a wait since there is no queue and the hotel is on the strip but off of the beaten path. The adjoining door we had (locked, of course) let in noise from guests next door, and guests on the other side of our wall w/children also could be heard through the other side of our wall and headboard. The "grand" lobby lounge only boasts 3 window tables in an exceptionally small lounge for this hotel. The fitness center is trying but just sad compared to Bellagio. Room 1207. AT NO TIME DID ANY HOTEL REPRESENTATIVE ACKNOWLEDGE OUR HONEYMOON IN ANY WAY, BUT THE HOTEL WAS AWARE OF THIS FROM RESERVATION made months in advance AND CHECK-IN.

Reviews.Title: “The Fabulous Casino-Free Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LiveAmused
Reviews.Content: I loved Mandarin Oriental! My absolute favorite place to stay at in Las Vegas. Why you ask? - No Casino/no slot machine noise= tranquility, peace & smoke free environment - The location at the brand new City Center Complex is the best spot to be at in the city. Right on the Strip but away from the hustle and bustle. - The service by everyone at he hotel is seamless, courteous and attentive. Concierge staff are outstanding. - Rooms are large, modern and Zen inspired. - Nice and relaxed cafe to have breakfast, lunch or dinner at. - Twist, the great fine dining option at the lobby level is expensive but worth the price. We also stayed at Wynn/Encore complex but did not enjoy our stay much. I also have added a Travel Article at Trip Advisor regarding dining choices. More information can also be found at http://www.livingamused.com/2011/03/03/las-vegas-fabulously-chintzy/ . Enjoy your travels!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations? This Hotel is for you.”
Reviews.Author: oceangril
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely at 5 star standards. My partner and I just returned from a 3 night stay. The employees are all genuine, respectful, and willing to help with whatever your needs may be. It's a breath of fresh air to be warmly greeted and welcomed when you arrive at this hotel. Checking in and checking out were a breeze, which is more than what can be said for other big hotels in Vegas. During our adventures on the strip there were a few smoky Casinos lobbies where huge lines of weary looking travelers stood waiting to check in...definitely not my idea of a good time. The MO is a non-smoking, non-gambling property, which as other reviewers suggested tends to balance itself well when returning from activities on the strip. I highly recommend having the High Tea in the 23rd floor tea lounge. It's a nice way to relax and watch the hustle and bustle of the strip below. I'm still smiling thinking about my overall experience while staying there. If you're debating--don't. Let your search end here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Only Heaven is better.”
Reviews.Author: ricebagpoker
Reviews.Content: Shhh...Let's keep this place a secret. + Best Customer Service I've EVER had. + Coolest technology in room. + Luxurious bathroom-- I didn't want to leave. + Gorgeous Room, among best I've ever stayed in. + In Room Dining= AMAZINGLY YUM. = The only place I will stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: yumyum5
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of visiting Las Vegas, don't look any further and be sure to book a room at the Mandarin Oriental! We had such a lovely stay. We stayed at the MO for 6 nights a few weeks ago. We carefully picked the hotel for a few reasons: 1) Reputation of MO all over the world; 2) Location in Las Vegas (centrally located on the blvd); 3) Stylish and modern look of the hotel; 4) No casino in the hotel (there are plenty around a few steps away anyway). After arrival, smooth check-in, upgrade and relaxing in the beautiful room, it became clear that we definitely made the right choice here! Rooms are immaculate and beautifully decorated, service is second to none, gym is great, view&drinks at the bar on the 23rd floor are superb and so on and so forth. After a busy day/night it feels great to walk into a peaceful place like the MO. We would absolutely stay here again - in fact - we can't wait to go back! ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: silverhair419
Reviews.Content: If you want to be right on the Las Vegas Strip so you can walk to most of the casinos and shows but dont like the idea of staying at one of the big Casino hotels then the Mandarin is a great choice. The Hotel itself has a very small and initimate feel despite being quite large. This means you get a much more personal serivce experience than you would standing in the lobby of a gigantic casino hotel. The whole atmosphere is also one of calm. It feels almost like walking around a spa. This is a great breath of fresh air walking in off the realtive craziness of the strip. Nonetheless location wise - it is absolutely slap bang in the middle of the action. Next door is the the highest end mall in Las Vegas (with the requisite Chanel, Hermes etc... stores), one door down is the brand new Cosmo casino and the Marquee Las Vegs nightclub, two doors down is the Bellagio. You are located pretty much half way up the strip so its walkable to all the major casinos and night clubs. The Wynn / Encore at the top of the strip is maybe a 30 min walk and the Mandaly Bay at the bottom is probably about 15 mins. Price wise - its pretty expensive for Vegas, over $200 a night. Its more than you would pay at a casino, but less than an equivalent level of hotel at any other major destination

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: deaconwife
Reviews.Content: Set in the heart of the strip, this hotel is an oasis in the midst of the madness of Vegas. We stayed in a a Strip View Suite, the room was awesome with fantastic views down the strip and to the mountains beyond Vegas. There was no noise, the room was spotlessly clean, the staff attentive. I have nothing bad to say about our stay here. Yes it is expensive but when comparing it to other hotels in Vegas, it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A True Oasis with Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelCR
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas exceeded our expectations in regards to the warmth and hospitality extended by the staff. From the arrival greeting, luggage assistance, early check-in, and visit by a friendly gentleman named JoJo - who dropped off some complimentary fruit and asked if we needed anything - the MO LV created a first-rate welcome. It was not until later in the week strolling through other casinos that I realized guests normally wait in long, chaotic lines to check-in to hotels on the strip. The MO was a welcome respite to return to each day, especially with the relaxing music piped into the rooms and elevators. This is one hotel that seems to have truly thought of everything you might need in the rooms. Some highlights from the Premier Room that we enjoyed: - An in-room safe that is large enough to accommodate a laptop and includes a power port so electronics may charge while enclosed - A flat screen television within the bathroom mirror - Valet door next to your room door where you can drop items off (i.e. shoes for shining) and pick up items (i.e. newspaper) - Handheld touch screen master remote that controls everything in the room: temperature, lights (which are all able to be dimmed), curtains, television, satellite music, room service, etc. - Spacious bathroom with two sinks, vanity area, large soaking tub, shower, and a separate water closet with a third sink - Fully stocked bar and snack area, and I mean fully stocked (best part: Fever Tree products) MO Housekeeping: Housekeeping during our stay was excellent. I am admittedly a perfectionist and everything was immaculately clean and continued to be cleaned throughout our stay. At times morning service was considerably late in the day (closer to turndown), which was only noticeable on the days I had to get some work done in the room. In regards to turndown, it was pleasant to come back to a room with all the toiletries lined up, hairdryer cords wrapped, etc. Not since a Rosewood property visit in 2004 have we had such meticulous housekeeping service. MO Breakfast: After all the eating this week, I was craving something lighter and wrote in an option on the breakfast card, if possible. I asked for yogurt, a bowl of berries, and their homemade granola. Each day they accommodated this request with creative flair (changing up the presentation) and it was delicious. Their yogurt may be homemade since it was not the average sweetened goo served at other establishments for breakfast. My husband enjoyed his warm breakfast (depending on the day, it included eggs, waffles, home fries, and/or vegetables) and found it to be way ahead of the Four Seasons offering he had in San Francisco earlier in the week. MO Staff: I could go on and on about the service and hospitality present in all the staff members we encountered at the MO. A few who stood out: the gentleman who checked us in (unfortunately I cannot remember his name), JoJo who delivered the fruit on the first day, Glenn who was downstairs at the door and transportation, and Daniel, who drove the courtesy car. MO Transportation: Speaking of the courtesy car, this is an unpublished amenity at the hotel that only operates during limited times of the day. In a Four Seasons vs. Mandarin Oriental thread online, I read, “House car at both properties offered proactively to clients if available.” But I never had anyone mention the car to me during our stay. I have read reviews of people using it for airport services, but I am assuming they worked something out with the concierge privately or had special privileges based on their suite. I took taxis most of the week. One early evening when I needed to attend a meeting at the other end of the strip while traveling solo, so I asked Glenn if it was an option. Within minutes Daniel appeared and I thoroughly enjoyed talking with him during the drive as he shared about the area and the Mandarin Oriental. Like everyone we encountered at MO, his demeanor and hospitable attitude left a positive impression. MO Minor Items: - The sheet situation is interesting as there is no flat sheet. The duvet is encased within a cover made of sheet material, but there is no separate flat sheet. At first we thought this was a housekeeping mistake and called to get a flat sheet when they turned down the room. An amiable woman stopped by our room with another set sheets, but explained that it was how they dress the bed. She said she came to the MO from the Four Seasons, so it was new to her too! She was willing to add a sheet, but we decided to go with it as is. It didn’t affect our sleep but was an interesting change to regular and/or triple sheeting. - One of the things that I admired about the MO prior to our stay was their use of Fever Tree products for cocktails, especially the tonic water. I try to avoid anything with high fructose corn syrup, and the Fever Tree products (made instead with cane sugar) add a clean taste to mixed drinks. Unfortunately it seems that the MO may be transitioning out of these items. The bartender said they are now using regular (aka HFCS) tonic and ginger ale, but he offered to go in the back and find some old Fever Tree products for me. They were in our room, so we were fine, but I hope they revisit this change in their main bar area. In a city full of stocked bars, it added a positive distinction to their offerings. - The printed in-room information books, hotel website, and spa brochure all have conflicting price information for spa services. They need to modify their marketing materials to reflect the same pricing information. - The elevators take a little getting used to, since you have to switch and ride two separate ones to get from the transportation lobby entrance to your room. I ended up bypassing the main lobby (23rd floor) elevators over time and instead went from the transportation entrance to the Mozen floor. The elevators there share a wall, so you just walk off, turn the corner and get on the other set of elevators to go up to your room. - I had difficulty getting through to the spa over the in-room phone, and ended up just going down to the spa to schedule an appointment for the next day. - View/City Center: Our view was not a standard strip view, but was mostly of City Center and Planet Hollywood. There was some noise during the day from a concert/stereo playing outside, but otherwise the room was quiet. Previous posts of City Center being a concrete maze of sorts are correct. It is much easier to stroll other sections of the strip, as the City Center walkways make you go up, down, and all around (or through the mall) depending on where you are headed. - Ambient/electrical lights: If you prefer to sleep in the dark, you will need to be armed with extra t-shirts and socks to cover the plethora of lights that beam from all the electrical equipment even when the lights are out. The best bet to cover the large light switch pad in the entry is to set the ironing board vertically against the wall. - While we enjoyed the comfort and technology in the room, the interior design/decor was nothing memorable or impressive. - The shower water pressure was not particularly strong, I read somewhere that this is connected to their “green” initiatives. Such green efforts seem a bit out of place considering the amount of water running in the spa - two sinks ran for almost an hour during a Hammam treatment, even when not in use (they were kept on as relaxing background noise, I assume). MO Lunch at Mozen Bistro: This was my favorite lunch in Vegas. If I could do the trip over again, I would eat there for lunch every day since dining elsewhere involved excursions and mediocre food. Service was very good and the curry dish I ordered with basmati rice (Murgh Mukhani) was flavorful. It was expensive for lunch, but this is also Vegas. Only possible downside is a lack of a nice view outside or activity going on around you while you eat, if you are looking for that on the strip. Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas - Spa: I scheduled spa services first thing in the morning, which meant that prior to my treatments I saw only one person while using the common areas and it was quiet and relaxing. After the treatments, there were more people and specifically a boisterous small group of women; you could no longer hear the music and the calm atmosphere was noticeably changed. In addition, tours of the area for new guests were plentiful. Short of limiting when people check-in for services, I do not believe this is something within the control of the spa but something to be mindful of when scheduling your appointments. The lockers, showers, and vanity areas were well stocked and guests are given a make-up bag with additional toiletries at check-in. The only downside is that refreshments are limited to water, tea, and a few apples and bananas are on the counter. I asked if anything else was available, and was told no. This meant that I concluded my visit earlier than I would have liked since I was getting hungry for lunch. I would have welcomed the option of a quick, healthy lunch while at the spa. One of the things I was most impressed with during my use of the spa was the cleanliness. I never encountered even a stray hair. I am not sure how they keep everything so pristine in between guests, but housekeeping was certainly top notch during my visit. Overall impression: The Mandarin Oriental exceeded all our expectations and will be our hotel of choice when attending an annual conference in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Strip View Suite Pleases”
Reviews.Author: traveler2099
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the positive reviews. The best non-gaming, non-smoking hotel in Las Vegas. I simply did NOT miss walking through the casino to get to room elevators. To some, the hotel will lack energy and not feel like a Vegas "experience." That's the whole point though of the property. An oasis in all the hyper stimulation. The whole hotel has a spa-like atmosphere. Definitely away and above it all, but still so accessible to all things on the Strip. On room selection, we stayed in 1400 which was the highest Strip View Suite I could get on this trip. I asked for the "00" series after finding out online that the "00" and "01" series suites were the same price, but the "00" offered a little more space than the "01." For suites, the Strip View Suites are still very much accessible in terms of price ($300-$400 per night; even better if you can snag a buy two, get one free offer as I did; great value). The next highest category after Strip View Suites are the Apex Suites. Those start at the low-end of the tipping point when you get into the $1,000+ per night suites. In the Strip View Suites, you can hear some Strip noise, but it was muted and infrequent; nothing to get worked up over.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: mataguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the last five months October 2010 and February 2011 and must say I can’t wait to get back! We are already planning our next trip to the MO. As always staff is very accommodating and the rooms what can I say, the description on the MO website is spot on (Strip view room 1825 and1917). We arrived early on our first day 10:00am and check-in is 3pm, well staff was great as we did not expect to get a room so early but the wonderful front desk said to wait an hour and our room would be available. We went and walked around City Center and when we came back our room was ready. The bar is the best spot in Vegas and well worth the price of admission view is spectacular. The staff goes above and beyond in service we decided to change our flight and leave a day later and they gave us the Sunday rate at the front desk we did not have to rebook on-line or change rooms like some other properties would make you do. The bar is a bit pricey for drinks but you are in Vegas so drinks are expensive everywhere and if you are on a budget in Vegas you shouldn’t be there. If you are planning on going to Vegas and looking for a a nice sanctuary to call home look no further than the MO.

Reviews.Title: “The Luxurious Ambiance Made Me Propose”
Reviews.Author: j15marti
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental has exceeded my expectations. We checked in today, and I was planning to propose to my now-fiancee during our stay. The luxurious ambiance and pleasant reception by the staff put us in the mood, and I proposed on the spot! Thank you, Mandarin Oriental!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm luxury in prime location”
Reviews.Author: wevorys
Reviews.Content: This hotel opened in Dec. 2009. It looks brand new and is extremely clean. It is elegantly decorated in an Asian decor with beautiful Asian art pieces. The lobby is on the 23rd floor and the rooms are located on floors below. The bar on the lobby floor has a magnificent view of the strip and excellent, but pricey($12 )cocktails. We booked our room through our travel agent and received an upgrade to a room on one of the higher floors with a strip view and free breakfast . The room was lovely and the bathroom especially luxurious. I loved the TV within the bathroom mirror that only appeared when you turned it on. The curtains were all operated electronically. Bed was extremely comfortable Most impressive was the service. Every request was granted politely,immediately, and efficiently and all of the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We were there to celebrate our 25th anniversary and were very glad to have found a place so close to the new City Center and the fabulous Cosmopolitan Club and new mall(about a 5 minute walk at most along a skywalk), but away from the busyness of the strip and crowds. We also took advantage of massages at their Mandarin Spa, a 5 star spa. The spa was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility In The Heart Of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: denverdeckers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated her 40th birthday at the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas and the hotel is perfection. From the moment you walk through the doors, the service is impeccable. There's a fine line between kissing your guests butts and being genuine and The Mandarin gets it right. The decor of the hotel is beautiful and is very Zen as the hotel website claims. We splurged on a suite and it was amazing. Very cool, chic and quite large with a bar, sitting room and 2 flat screen televisions. We spent a ton of time at the pool and had a spa treatment which was fantastic. I like that the pool is not full of drunks, acting like jackasses like a lot of the giant, casino hotel pools. The spa is not to be missed. I love that there is not a casino in the hotel. It's great to spend your night gambling and then retreat back to your quiet hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you tire of the casino scene in Vegas. It's a truly great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MANDARIN MOJO – THE LUXURY IS IN THE DETAILS”
Reviews.Author: Whoneedssunscreenhub
Reviews.Content: Took the wife to Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas for her birthday weekend. We have stayed in hotels all over Las Vegas including, but not limited to, Rio, Mandalay Bay, Paris, Caesars, Bellagio, Venetian, Four Seasons, Wynn and Encore. Mandarin Oriental was the most luxurious, attentive property we have visited. The first floor entrance was well staffed. People grabbed our bags and had them outside of our tenth floor room in a jiffy. We went to the lobby on the 23rd floor where we were greeted by people who seemed genuinely happy to see us check in. Everything about the place was first class. The lobby and bar area on the 23rd floor has beautiful views of The Strip to the north and the south. The waitresses/hostesses/bartenders were hospitable without being intrusive. The room was just beautiful. Little touches were everywhere. Open up the safe drawer and inside the safe, you will find two outlets to charge your cell phones. A universal remote/digital display on a bedside table allows you to control the television, the lights, the temperature, the music and provides indoor and outdoor temperature readings. The bathroom was well-appointed with a beautiful free standing tub with bath salts provided. The shower was also nice. The robes and towels were fluffy. Besides the expected hair dryer was a hair straightener. There was a tea kettle, yoga DVD’s and a yoga mat. We love views from our room and the wife was able to simultaneously soak in the bath and see the palm trees outside of our room. Did I mention the staff was attentive? The bellman insisted on filling up our ice bucket when he saw our champagne bottle from the limousine ride to the hotel. On our last day, they picked up our bags, after our late checkout (1 p.m.) and when we returned from a long walk the doorman called for our bags and offered us cold bottled water while calling the cab from across the hotel entrance. This is a nongaming, nonsmoking hotel, which we really liked. A nice respite from the crowds and foul air of most of the other Strip hotels. However, it was a short walk (although you do have to go outdoors in the weather) to both Aria’s casino or the new Cosmopolitan if you would like to gamble. It was only an eleven minute walk to Bellagio. For us it was a nice splurge for a special occasion. Pricey (think $19 for a martini and $130 for a pedicure) but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Converted - I'm a Fan!”
Reviews.Author: DDatYVR
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Vegas! It's a smoke-free property that is central to all the action. Right beside City Centre and all its restaurants, casinos and shops, you have signing privileges at the various facilities. Check-in Unlike my past experience at other 5-star Vegas properties, I had no line-ups to deal with here. I was greeted promptly and courteously by the doorman when my car pulled up. He immediately arranged for my luggage to be brought up and showed me to the registration desk. There, I was provided with tea and a warm towel while completing check-in. Room & Facilities While the room was around 500 square feet, it felt slightly smaller due to its layout with an entrance way & closet area that is separated from the rest of the room as the bathroom was in the middle. However, it's a gorgous room - simple, yet luxurious. Bed was comfortable and turn-down service was much appreciated with bottled water and complete room refresh. The tea kettle in the room was a great touch as well. My only knock against the room is the LCD panel that controls everything - while easy to understand and operate, there were so many lights and controls that I could never figure out which switch was for which set of lights. The bathroom was huge with a deep soaker tub and separate shower. Toiletries from Aromatherapy Associates were ample. The towels were plush and slippers provided were wonderful. The gym was nice and is complimentary, though classes are $35 each. Unfortunately, the pool was closed, though the area looked peaceful through the glass. Internet is $18 per day. Only valet parking at $30 per day is available, though free self-parking can be found through Aria. Location Central to everything, the Mandarin Oriental provided enough privacy and quiet, while not being removed from the strip. There is a CVS right outside, while the Aria and the Crystals mall are just a brief walk away. Service Staff was always responsive and courteous. The doorman who helped me the first day remembered my name throughout my stay. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and I did receive any snotty attitude so prevalent at other Vegas hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Generally Pretty Good ...”
Reviews.Author: chasing_tides
Reviews.Content: Generally, I found the stay very quiet and pleasant. I'm not much of a Vegas person, so when I found a hotel that promised to be an "oasis of calm" on the Strip, I jumped at the opportunity to stay here. It is as advertised, quiet even among the bustle of the casino hotels surrounding it. The service was good. The front-desk and concierge were extremely quick and helpful, I was able to find answers to most of my questions. Despite their helpfulness, I encountered small problems in my one week stay with housekeeping. I asked for two small hotel amenities -one of them showed up an hour late even after a few calls to the front desk (due to a room number mix-up on their part), while the other item never showed up. In addition, some nights turn-down service was forgotten ... even when specifically requested. (I suspect that miscommunication and disorganization has plagued them in the past.) The rooms were great. Very comfortable, great use of space, very tech-friendly. I was on one of the higher floors, and the view was great. The washroom was very large, and the bathtub was very inviting. I loved having LCD screen in the washroom as well, it was just a lovely extra feature on top of the automatic blinds that you controlled at your nightstand. The bed was heavenly, the pillows could have been less firm, but if you sleep on your side, it will not be an issue. On another note, my room was close to the elevators, and if your television wasn't on, you could hear it go up and down all day long. Being a deep sleeper, and finding it too inconvenient to move to another room, I did not request to be switched. However, if you are a light sleeper or bringing children, make sure to ask for a quieter room. The Restaurant/Exercise Facilities/Pool/Spa, I can't comment on, as I didn't get a chance to try them out. Location was great, in the middle of everything. Easy walk to Cosmopolitan, Aria, Monte Carlo, Planet Hollywood, and all the surrounding shops. Like everywhere else on the strip, it is a good idea to bus or cab, if you don't drive or don't like to walk. Style, it was a beautiful hotel. Almost too stylish. It was simply too dark. At 9 AM in the morning, you feel like you've stepped into a dark cave. However, the lobby in particular was stunning at night. Value was great. I had found a deal, it was absolutely worth it for the price I found it at, but would I stay here if I was paying the normal rate? Probably not. For that price I expect either much bigger rooms, or much more professional housekeeping service. Mandarin Oriental Vegas is indeed five-star in Vegas, but world-wide, I wouldn't put them there yet. They are still quite new, so who knows, maybe in a while they will have worked out all the kinks.

Reviews.Title: “They Don't Want Any Kids in the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rugby007
Reviews.Content: For a late-summer family (of four) vacation, I went to reserve two rooms, specifically the Cityscape King, at an average of about $245/night (from a number of online searches). I made a reservation for 1 adult/1 child per room, and all online reservations spit out a $150 per night per room "additional guest fee." I called, and was told yes, this room is standard for only single occupancy, so this is a legitimate fee. Really? Yes. Really, for a room with a king-size bed? Yes, this is a single-occupancy room. So, I just went back and with the same online searches asked for the same two rooms, same date, but with two adults per room. And whaddaya know, no additional guest fee. I thought this was a standard single-occupancy room, right? So how's that for family-friendly at the Mandarin Oriental? You know, if you want adults only, that's your prerogative at your property, but why can't you just be honest about it and call it the "child fee" or "we don't want any kids in our hotel" fee? Just be honest about it. I'll find another hotel to spend my thousands for our upcoming family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms, Food and Service”
Reviews.Author: CathrynG
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving weeekend at the MO Las Vegas. The hotel is exceptional and the rooms are well-appointed and high tech. Eat at Mozen for excellent food. The breakfast is great and dinner has some unique specialties including Indian (Curry) and Sushi. It is small and casual but attracks many of the local celebs. The location in City Center is OK if you don't mind walking. We always rent a car so we can zip from place to place and the Mandarin doesn't have a garage for free parking. We used the Aria garage which was about a 10 minute walk. The Aria Casino/Sports Book etc. is next door and is nice (owned by MGM). You can even eat at Aria and charge your dinner to your room at the Mandarin; nice partnership. The gym is small but has great equipment. The staff is excellent and the overall stay exceeded our expectations (and we are picky). Crystals (the high end) shopping mall is across from the hotel and quite impressive if you like the chic brands and unique items. We've stayed all over Las Vegas and this hotel is the best if you want great rooms, private atmosphere and service. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much, I went back the next weekend”
Reviews.Author: Vinovixen
Reviews.Content: Yes. It was so fabulous we spent all day Sunday rearranging our schedules so we could come back the following Friday. The rooms are epic cool. We come to Vegas once a year and high roll. This is now our favorite hotel. Nothing compares. Cosmopolitan: bring it on. The pool service is great. Love the seclusion and the frozen treats. Dragonfly drink is great. Best muesili for breakfast. Ever. The gym is great too. My only complaints: our tub had scuffs on the outside and our throw pillow on the chaise was stained. Yeah, that kind of stain, I think. Also, towel service the gym was intermittment. When you pay this much, you want every detail to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RonK_LA
Reviews.Content: First up: Vegas isn't really my thing. But I do know a thing or two about great hotels and the MO is nothing short of spectacular in every way. It's located in the giant new City Center but is an oasis of calm and taste in a city not really known for either. Our Junior Suite was beautiful, big rooms, floor-to-ceiling windows and really sophisticated design. It does have a fairly modern/masculine feel to it. Those who are familiar with the MO in Hong Kong will recognize many of the design notes. Great bed. My only negative comment would be the wall of buttons that control pretty much everything. At night, they are back lit and you can't read what they control. The technology overload can create a pretty comic effect if you are trying to turn on a light to go to the bathroom and suddenly curtains are moving one way, sheers the other, things are beeping and chaos ensues. Yeah, that happened more than once. The bathroom was bigger than a lot of studio apartments in NYC. In the middle was a spectacular slipper tub, easily big enough for two to enjoy together. One quirk is that the sinks (there were two) are shoe-horned into the corners and feels way too small and camped considering the amount of space. To shave or wash your face, you seriously risk throwing your back out. This service is as refined as the design. Everyone is friendly yet correct: Really, the service couldn't be better. We did get a couple of bad restaurant recommendations from the concierge but were warned both times that the concierge had not eaten there but had heard good things. When we came back and told them we had a different experience they welcomed the additional information. Vegas can be overwhelming. If you want to stay someplace very close to the heart of things, but completely separated from it, the MO is it. The rooms, service, really everything was flawless and actually quite reasonable for what your getting. One final note, just for the record, I hate sky lobbies. Can we just say "no" to them?

Reviews.Title: “The only reason to go to LV”
Reviews.Author: KarenE
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the highlight of our time in Las Vegas. The service was outstanding. Our suite had an unbelievable view and was so comfortable, we did not want to leave it. The Mandarin really stands out between all these tacky, gaudy and tasteless hotels in Las Vegas prentending they were 5-star-properties.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful gift to myself!”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 2121 at the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas on December 24 & 25, 2010 as part of a 12 night trip. By far, the nicest place I stayed at. I stayed at the MO in Manila and in Jakarta, so this brand in not unfamiliar to me. All I can say is if you have a chance to stay here, do. I took a break from many things and really had a great chance to recharge my batteries. Here's what I loved about this hotel: Everyone used my name when they spoke to me. It was a very personal stay. Everything worked. Often I get to a Vegas hotel only to have to call down for this or that to be fixed. Not this stay. Ordered "breakfast in bed" option for Christmas morning when making my reservation. The food was delivered at the time requested, hot and the server did a great job. Above all, it really tasted great. I did love the waffles! (Opted for eating by the window) I always felt welcome and wanted. An example, while exploring the exercise room and the pools, I was met by the person in charge who really wanted to set up a workout for me. (I was only interested in exploring) She answered all of my questions and showed real concern for me. Most times when I go to the exercise room, I am ignored and have to find my own way around (self service). This hotel is truly full service. They have a Technology box with most of the cables that you need to connect to either the internet or the television. Television. Since it is not their goal to get or keep you in a casino, they give you all the Cable channels. You'll get all the science, learning, network, major cable channels as well as Disney, Cartoon Network and Nickelodeon. It is the widest available channel line up I have seen in Vegas. Views. Really nice views from my room and from the lounge. Christmas morning stocking left on my door. Although I like the fact that there is no Casino, if you really need a fix, you are only steps away from the Aria or Monte Carlo. Yes, you will have to walk outside, but perhaps some people need that bit of reality. They have more than one book to read if you want to. And they are interesting! Usually something with an Asian slant. They deliver a newspaper. They have water boilers for fresh tea. Feel free to bring your own instant coffee if you do not want to order it from room service. I stayed in a Mandarin Premiere room which was a little bit larger 650 sq ft vs a regular 500 sq ft room. The extra room while nice is not really necessary. It's mostly bathroom space. Next time, and there will be a next time, I will stay in a regular room, perhaps a Cityscape room. The Valet closet is a nice feature since I usually have laundry to be picked up in the morning, OK, I had so many good things to say about the Mandarin, surely I must have some criticism. I only have one. They have some great tempting offers. The greatest is the stay three nights get one free. If you can get this offer, you can get a strip view room for three nights at a cost of about $203/night net. Unfortunately for me, they do not carry them out to the future very far, usually just a few months. I plan my travel sometimes 6 months or more in advance.
