Once plans are finalized, I do not like to change them, so I can't seem to take advantage of that great price. My second criticism is that the internet costs a whopping $ 18 a day. On the plus side, it is good for everywhere in the CityCenter complex. I highly recommend the Mandarin to anyone that needs a break from Vegas but still wants to be able to get some Vegas if they need it.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful haven on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Natz169
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms (well planned, massive tub), spa (in particular the 5 showers!) and breakfast at mozen bistro. Cons: no undercover walkway to aria (got soaked in rain), room service food was really bad and had to call 5 times to get an item removed from my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Mandarin Oriental in the world”
Reviews.Author: andypl99
Reviews.Content: Living in Asia, I usually love Mandarin Oriental hotels, Sadly, this is the worst one ever. Has Las Vegas sunk so low that customer service disappeared even from its top end hotles - sadly I suspect so. Do Not Stay Here if you have other options. First, the Mercedes pick up my secretary scheduled directly on the hotel website NEVER SHOWED UP at the airport. My flight was right on time. Many other hotels had reps to pick up their guests. The Mandarin car never showed up. Second, front desk was NOT sympathetic: "We can't control the cars, they do not belong to our hotel - we outsouce that so we don't know what happens with them!". Third, wireless internet DOES NOT WORK in my room. (I work in the technology world - trust me, this hotel doesn't know technology- the front desk rep originally told me that there was no hardwired net access - I found this to be inaccurate as I was FINALLY able to connect thru a LAN cable. Fourth, bedroom TV had no sound - tech took half an hour to fix late at night. (He was great). Fifth, General Manager had a "tour" with VIPs yesterday, so it appeared that everyone else was not important. My customers and colleagues are all at the WYNN. I will do the same next time. Sadly, this hotel seems to be part of the biggest white elephant in Vegas history. City Center's new mall was not crowded last night, seemed relatively empty. This whole developments feels like they started with good intentions but then cut back on customer service so much that it is just all a tragic waste.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: mileway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travelled to Las Vegas for several years always staying at a different hotel. We had heard about this new hotel and thought we would try it out. The great thing about it is the privacy. If you don't want to be around crowds of people, come here! It's great. Very private. If you want a casino onsite, do not come here. There is no casino in the hotel. The rooms are wonderful! We stayed in one of the strip view suites with 3 walls that were all windows. One thing to note - everything is computerized. You operate the lights, curtains, room service through the remote of the TV. The service was good, but not superb. As to the food, it is lacking. Food and drink are very expensive, but not superb. We had dinner down at the Four Seasons one nite. Service and food quality at the Four Seasons is 100% great. Mandarin Oriental needs to step it up a notch. I still think the food and drinks are too expensive. Our drinks were around $10 at the Four Season, but at least $16 at the Mandarin Oriental. Doesn't make sense to me. Another stickler for us -- you have to pay for internet access. That really rubs me the wrong way. You are paying a price to stay in this hotel and the internet access should be free. If you like "old money" stay at the Four Seasons. "New money" people will probably like Mandarin Oriental better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: bighead33
Reviews.Content: stayed at the MO for new years, the hotel is very nice and the employees are exceptional, but i would not stay here again. If you want to walk to City Center you have to go outside, there is no internal walkway, these is a problem if you want to go to a casino or to dinner after you put the kids to sleep. Also, there is no shop to buy water, juice, milk for the kids. We have been to Vegas 10 times and always stay in a different hotel, for us the Skylofts and the Wynn are still the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent non casino hotel at the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: 5_O
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 nights at the MO in LV over the Christmas period with our young child (almost 3) and having no casino at the hotel was a major consideration when we made the booking. The MO is a wonderful oasis amongst the crowds of this gambling heaven, even thought its smack in the middle of the City Centre the part where the MO is quiet and peaceful (but it also mean getting a taxi was more of a hassle). The service was excellent, we got an email from the hotel a couple of days before our arrive to finalise things and to enquire about the name and age of child for a small gift which was a nice touch. The check in was painless and the room was wonderfully decorated. All the latest gadgets, electronic controlled curtains and lights etc with a very nice LCD TV. The bed was very comfortable and with the climate control system a restful night of sleep is ensured. The curtains althought was suppose to be blackout had gaps at the end which faces directly into the bed, minor issue as can see the staples was loose (guess it was suppose to be stapled into the wall or something). Service was very good except for 1 day when the chambermaid forgot to give replenish the bottle water. Restuarants was so so and not quite the standard i expected from a hotel of this quality. The service at MOzen was patchy with miss orders and logn wait for service. Not tried Twiss as was with a young child. Afternoon tea at the tea lounge was overprice for what it really is. The Mandarin Bar was nice, excellent views of the strip and nice cocktails. As it was winter the pool was closed, the fitnese centre was well equipped with nice machines. Unfortunately didn't try out the Spa but it looked good even if the prices are a bit steep. If we come back to Vegas then we will seriously consider the MO again and being the first MO property we have tried we will also seriously consider their other properties around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury”
Reviews.Author: MichelinFoodie
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with no casino which is a huge plus for me since I travel with 2 small kids. Since it is much smaller than the huge places like Wynn, service is much better and more personal here. Love the fact that there is no smoky casino to walk through. Also like the lobby being on the 23rd floor....it is a world away from the noise and crowds of the typical casino. Definitely a different clientele, no tank tops and flip flops, no mullets, no riff raff crowd here. By far the best place to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but...”
Reviews.Author: Leglobetrotteur
Reviews.Content: By far the nicest hotel on the strip (that I've stayed at). Hotel, lobby, and rooms are stunning...and I actually liked that there was no adjacent casino which made for a quiet, smoke free, crowd free, and calm oasis in the heart of it all (great location) I did run into a couple of service issues. Our room went without being made for over 24 hours (even though we called twice to have housekeeping come) and room service was slower than any I've ever encountered...in fact one morning it took an hour to receive coffee! I would have to take these factors into consideration for my next trip to Vegas (visit twice per year).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sask1
Reviews.Content: Went away for the weekend with the wife and had a great stay. not a negative thing to say. Will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Chain; Plus great location!”
Reviews.Author: Armorstud
Reviews.Content: I have always like the MO chain. This was my second time staying here. My first was in May 2010. Not to repeat everyone's review but I agree with all the compliments. They have a great workout facility (for a hotel) and nice pool (too cold this time). Try the Sunday Brunch; the price is good if you figure how much the sushi and raw oysters cost. The only complaint about the hotel is that the room service is super slow. Valet and everything else, including the spa, was top notch. I have stayed at other brand name hotels on the strip. This is the most pleasant due to not having a casino. I don't miss walking down the long halls and waiting in line for the valet to retrieve your car like the larger casinos. Oh, and I was suspect when I saw these ghetto gansta thugs from LA arrive. They were obviously out of place with their attire. Hopefully this is not a trend and they do not ruin the hotel image along with the well behaved guests that stay there for the tranquility. BTW I had a horrid dining expereence at the Aria Union Restaurant and Lounge (food is ok but the service was the worst ever). And you can room charge at all the restaurants in the City Center which is good if you have to submit your incidentals to your company.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new addition to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: rkr727
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in December. The rooms are high on the "cool" factor. Automated drapes, television, music, lights. The only impractical aspect I noticed about the bathroom was the "see" through glass from bedroom to toilet, although you could close off the room with wood panels. There is also no individual climate control in the bathroom so it's brisk when you step out of the shower. The "valet" box next to the front door is cool, but there is no way for you to know if your items are in there unless you constantly check; there is not an automated light or notice that they have left things in there for you. Needling complaints like really, really slow room service on several occasions. Housekeeping left items of a previous guest in our room as well as forgot to replenish some items in the bathroom, but these were minor, needling details compared to the superb service we experienced overall. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more engaging. Eric ran over to the pharmacy down the street to get my husband a pair of reading glasses. The chef prepared a something away from the menu for room service. Service goes above and beyond. Doug, the concierge, set us up at Sage, a fine-dining restaurant at the Aria next door, and it was superb. Food was great, spa was great, gym had brand new equipment and was spotlessly clean. The hotel is a zen-like respite away from the smoky and cacophonous sounds of other casino/hotels, but is close enough to walk to the Aria to gamble. The finishes in this hotel are beautiful. The lobby bar is stunning and the bartender is superb. We will definitely return and would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: alippa
Reviews.Content: On a whim, and after receiving an ad in e-mail from the Mandarin Las Vegas, we booked a couple of rooms and took the kids a few days before Christmas. With bad weather our one-hour flight from SFO took hours and hours longer than expected and we arrived a tad on the cranky side. But the 23rd floor sky lobby and the views out at the lights of Las Vegas cured that, as did a drink and the peace and calm of the tea lounge looking out over the city. Our rooms were perfect and huge and comfortable. The staff was nice and soft spoken and willing to get us reservations for dinner or a tour. Whatever we needed. We took the kids to the Grand Canyon one day, they shopped, we ate out at great restaurants, we went to see Mystere at Treasure Island. One day in the pouring rain I took the kids to the pool which is near the health club and spa on the 8th floor. In good weather with sun shining I bet that place is hopping. I hate to admit that we didn't even gamble once. We did go look at the Belagio, New York New York, Excallibur and the Cosmopolitan just to show the girls what it was all about. We had such a nice few days, and the Mandarin was just perfect to come back to every afternoon. It was kind of a crazy way to spend family time right before the chaos of the holidays, but the kids were out of school anyway and we couldn't have asked for a better getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A Difference in Vagas”
Reviews.Author: review2010_10
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in the strip. New & contemporary decor. Clean and relaxing. Fantastic service. Excellent location,central to everything giving easy access to everything we wanted to do. Top of the line fitness centre. You are properly away from the hustle and bustle of the strip since there's no casino in the hotel. There was a quiet serenity about the place .

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly serene hotel - paradise in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: claudiaWirral
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our first ever trip to Las Vegas and we were so very pleased with our choice - even more so once we'd been and visited the other hotels around. We found other hotels smelled of booze and mostly cigarettes, in fact many of them stink of stale smoke and if you're not a smoker you'll find them rather disgusting. We wanted to see what it was all about but so glad we then didn't have to stay in these other hotels! We also found other hotels noisy because of the constant din of gaming machines. The Mandarin Oriental is so very very different, it is like staying in a spa it smells so beautiful, it is non-smoking and because it is non-gaming the public areas are serene and extremely styish. The rooms are very large with floor to ceiling windows with a fantastic view across the strip. the location is great - next to Monte Carlo and New York New York and just up from Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “The Good Life”
Reviews.Author: Rio5d
Reviews.Content: Sleep and service here is of the highest quality. I generally stay at boutique hotels or b&bs. This experience was delightfully lush. Next time I have to work in Vegas I'll book the same exact room.

Reviews.Title: “The Hammam spa treatment is spectacular”
Reviews.Author: aerotraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved the Mandarin Oriental which is so much nicer that the Wynn or Bellagio. The rooms are elegant, the food delicious and the service first rate. The spa is very spacious with wonderful steam rooms and the Hammam treatment is exceptional: in a steam room fitted with a large marble platform, you lie down and are treated to a loofah scrub and then a soap bubble massage with rinses provided by bowls of water poured over you. This simple treatment is so rejuvenating and relaxing! Don't skip the spa at this property, it is outstanding. The food at Mozen is also terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect LV Oasis”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaForster
Reviews.Content: As an author, my computer is a constant companion and I look for destinations where I can have quiet time to write and interesting surroundings that spark my imagination. The Mandarin Oriental gave me both with style, class and good humor. There is no casino in the Mandarin (a selling point for me) but they are easily accessible if the gambling bug hits (which is also a selling point). Personnel were genuinely considerate (Haley at the Concierge desk and Rishi stood out). The lobby included the exceptional tea room that overlooked the Strip. I settled into a velvet couch, surrounded myself with satin pillows and propped my computer up to work while sipping a Christmas concoction of hot cider and tea. I was in heaven. Beyond that was the Sky Bar, a perfect place to watch the city come alive in what proved to be a thematic elegance that threaded through the entire hotel. My room was beautiful: muted beiges and rusts set off by dark woods. Drapes, lighting television and music were all controlled with one remote. The bed sported a choice of pillows and a comforter that settled like a cloud. An electric tea kettle and choice of teas was at hand. At turn down, fresh water bottles instead of chocolate were at the bedside; in the bathroom were bath salts and amenities that filled the room with a soothing spa scent. The tub was a work of art, the shower large and I adored the television embedded in the bathroom mirror. To add to the sense that I was on a 'retreat', I found a yoga mat in the closet and yoga tapes in the bureau drawer. I didn't use the spa - a bit pricey for me - but I can only imagine the pampering those who do take advantage it must experience. The workout room was state of the art and classes were offered. The pool was beautiful but sadly it rained for my three day stay. Still, I couldn’t think of a better place to be in Las Vegas – rain or shine. I can’t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mplstraveler
Reviews.Content: We took a short trip for our anniversary and had an excellent stay. It was an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We received complimentary strawberries for our anniversary. The room was beautiful - one of the nicest I have every stayed in. We booked with AAA rates and got a nice discount. Location was nice - close to city center. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EYtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. It does NOT have a casino in the hotel. You have to take a 4 minute walk to Aria. Location: The hotel is located in the heart of the strip. It is a part of City Center. The entrance to the hotel is little opening in front of CVS. You are in the middle of the action here, but its still difficult to get around due to the size of everything. Service: The service is unbelievable. If you want anything done just ask. The answer is always yes Mr or Mrs so and so. This hotel has a ton of staff. There are plenty of doorman and porters, two concierges, gym trainers, attendants etc. Turn down service is nice and they provide free bottles of water. Service is impeccable even at Mozen. Plates are cleared properly and everything is served the same way. Training is amazing. Room: The room is a modern and roomy 550 sq feet. The beds are amazing. Foam pillows available upon request. The lights, shades, radio, tv are all controlled from a remote by the bed. The shower is great as is the bath tub. The bathroom has great products, plenty of room, blow-dryer, hair iron, shaving kit and sea salt for baths. I slept so well in these beds. There is ample closet space. There is also a valet where they put newspapers and service so they do not disturb you. Room is always cleaned promptly. Fitness Center: Its has all techno gym equipment. Plenty of modern treadmills, ellipticals and bikes with tvs in them. There are dumb bells up to 50lbs. Try the fitness wall, its an incredible workout. The regular machines count your reps, measure range of motion and judge speed. There are headphones for tv, cold towels, fruit and bottle of water. Spa: Hotel has an amazing spa with expensive services. There is a steam room, sauna, pool and hot tub as well. Outside pool is heated. Parking: Parking at the Mandarin is $30 a day, which is insane for Las Vegas. Park at the main Aria parking lot for free and walk 2 minutes. Or valet it at Mandarin and move it by 1am. Thats when they count overnight cars. Restaurants: Twist is incredibly expensive and did not eat there. Mozen is great. Had breakfast there everyday. It is expensive but delicious. Brunch on Sunday is great. Sushi is awesome. Value: Cheapest MO around because its in Las Vegas. Far better than the Four Seasons. Book through American Express Fine Hotels to get a great deal. STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Service comparable to any Mandarin Oriental in Asia”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas. To be honest, the rates they offered (USD215 for 2 nights + 1 complimentary night = USD430 for 3 nights) was the least expensive of the hotels on our wish list. For those of us who are used to the "treat you like king" service in Asia, it's sometimes a big culture shock when you stay at the top hotels in the US. For example, in Asia, you get complimentary slippers, complimentary bath/shower amenities, complimentary tea/coffee galore in your room. If you need more amenities you will get more. In Asia you never have to worry about tipping for every little request. It's a different story in the US, you tip, you tip, you tip. That's why we were prepared to "tip" for every request we had. The Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas exceeded our expectations. Everytime we had a request, ie., an extra box of tissues, more amenities, etc. they brought it to our room within 5 minutes. Each time we were greeted with a "is there anything else we can do for you?" Coming from Asia and having stayed at 5 other Mandarin Oriental hotels in the world including Hong Kong, Bangkok, Macau, Kuala Lumpur, Manila, this was the top one on my list. I liked how the hotel was located on the Strip and it didn't have a casino. It is quieter but it made a difference because we didn't have to wait in line for check in, check out or a taxi. The touch screen remote control was easy to operate and I liked how the light switches had a small indicator light so you could find the switch when the lights were out. I liked how they gave complimentary slippers (rare in the US). I also liked how it was located in the City Center and you could walk to the Miracle Miles shops, the Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, etc. We even walked across the street to Smith & Wollensky's for lunch one day. The spa was excellent, as was Twist. I would definitely return to the MO LV.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ben-Feo
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Las Vegas 3 times, from Australia. I have previously stayed in the Monte Carlo, and the Venetian. I recently stayed for 4 nights at the Mandarin Oriental - a relatively new property. From walking through the door, to checking out, the entire experience was amazing. The staff are very friendly, and willing to help in any way they can. Most importantly, they seem to want to do so, and didn't seem like they were doing so purely because it was their job. We stayed in a Strip View suite. The room was large, and the floor plan is very clever. The living area has an "L" shaped couch, huge LCD TV (with DVD/CD player, and many, many TV channels), a desk and large bar. The TV has a connectivity panel, so that one can charge iPods etc, and view video/photos and more through the TV. The view was great, and we could see Mandalay bay from one side, and Paris/PH the other. The bedroom has a huge kind sized bed, which was very comfortable. There is also another TV in the bedroom, equal in size to that in the lounge. There is a small touch screen control on one side table for the blinds (both sheer and blackout), temperature, wake up alarm settings (awesome!), and lights. The bedroom is large, and decor under-stated but amazing. The bathroom is also large. The soaking tub could fit 4 people (if you are so inclined - hey, it's Vegas!), and the shower more. There are 2 sinks, a large mirror, and a TV behind the mirror. The amenities are great. There was even a hair straightener. There is also a small corridor between the entry hall/lounge area and the bathroom which houses a large closet, and room to hang up numerous items of clothing. The little touches made the experience even better. There are numerous books in the room, a connectivity kit (iPod/phone charger, CAT5 cable, universal power adapter etc) and many other things you'd never think of. Each night, a bottle of water for each guest was placed on the side tables in the bedroom, and fresh towels with rose petals on them on the side of the bath. Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel enough. I have stayed in quite a few nice hotels, but when it comes to the whole package (room, service and comfort etc), nothing beats the MO. It might not have the traditional Vegas feel, but that's a good thing - it's right on your doorstep when you want it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Awesome - and everything you don't expect from Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jonders
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas for a two day business meeting and it was one of the best hotel experiences I've had. Everything was perfect - the professional bell staff that greeted my taxi announced my arrival to the front desk in advance - so when I took the elevator to the 23rd floor sky lobby - they already knew my name. The rooms are beautifully appointed and every little detail was considered - they even have a yoga mat in the room! It's everything you don't expect from Vegas - no noise, no casino, no smoke, no obnoxious partiers - and everything you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental property. If you like some of the things Vegas has to offer - but don't like the crowds or noice - this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet smoke free hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFfam
Reviews.Content: We were undecided btw the Four Seasons and the Mandarin Oriental, but ultimately chose the MO because it was newer, had a better location, and the good reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel checked us in early even though we arrived at 9am. We checked out the pool area (too bad it was freezing!), gym (nice new equipment) and MOZen (quiet breakfast place with attentive staff). In the afternoon, the hotel delivers surprise popcorn for kids, which was a real treat. The concierge helped us get good seats for Ka at the MGM, which was just a short walk away (better than when we called the box office directly). We had gone over to the Half Price Ticket Booth across the road from the hotel but they did not have half price tickets for kids unlike if we bought directly from the Ka box office/hotel concierge. The next day, we took the complimentary hotel car to the Wynn. Daniel, our chauffeur, was fantastic - very professional and an excellent driver. The doorman at the MO also greeted us by name, which was impressive. We took the free monorail from the Aria (walking distance from the MO) to the Bellagio. Overall, we were very pleased by the location of the MO. It was a bit troublesome having to switch elevator banks every time we needed to get back to our room but otherwise, it was so nice to go back to a quiet hotel, without the throngs at the casinos or the smoke. We relaxed with drinks at the lounge before flying out.

Reviews.Title: “First Time To Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DeepDoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 5th anniversary at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Las Vegas. We were very pleased with the hotel. The service was always prompt and professional. The room was exceptional (more later) and the peace and quiet demeanor of the hotel was a welcomed surprise and not what I expected. I had anticipated a "flashy" hotel that would rival the glitz and glamor of other hotels on the strip. Instead, the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas was quiet, sophisticated, and "low key". We had a "pool view" room on the 14th floor. The room was amazing. It was very comfortable with current decor. I was most intrigued by the ability to control almost everything with the remote thru the TV (room temperature, lighting, music and even room service). This room had all of the subtle "techie" trimmings that take advantage of our addiction to the electronic/digital world. Your geek husband will love this room. Yet it was plush and very comfortable. The staff were very prompt and professional without being intrusive. The main entrance/elevator only takes you to the main desk and access to the elevators for the upper floors requires a key card. A nice security feature. This was my first trip to Las Vegas and the Mandarin Oriental rivals many of the finer hotels that I have used all over the world. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Tech Failure”
Reviews.Author: rhmuir
Reviews.Content: The workmanship and decor are what you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental property. Nearly a Zen experience except for the over techno lighting, heating, privacy, etc. The one big mistake the staff makes is sending your bags to the room where they promptly arrive and the bellman leaves. A room this complicated needs at least a 5 minute explanation how everything works. You can control drapes, lighting heating with Cat 5 switches or using your TV remote(but you have to turn on the TV). I wish there was at least one subtle lcd clock in the room. We must have pressed the 'privacy" button by mistake so the room was not made up the next day. You can't just get away with hanging the card on the door. Several calls to the front desk did bring prompt service for the make up and a bath plug that didn't work. The Twist Restaurant was outstanding and lobby bar view was excellent. Kind of a mixed bag!

Reviews.Title: “Lacks charm, misses the point.”
Reviews.Author: DJDB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights after 6 nights in the Four Seasons in San Francisco, 3 nights at Four Seasons Vegas, and 3 nights in Vdara. It's hard to grade this hotel, there's a lot of it to like, but then the little things really drag it down in my eyes. I liked the check in process, by the time you're at the lobby everything is ready for you to sign, but then by the time my bag got to my room, 20 minutes, it was too late to get out in the sun for an hour. The room is generally excellent, good bed, lovely bathroom and shower, vanity area for clothes, nice oriental decor and the remote controlled two layer blinds made sleep superb. But the problems started with the tv not working properly, very poor reception on ESPN, very crackly and breaking up, then the navigation screen froze, and the tv went a bit loopy. They sent someone to reset it, but it went wrong again 10 minutes later, so I asked to move rooms. No problem there, but 10 minutes later its breaking up again. So I head down to reception on my way out, and they tell me that the Cox network they use is having issues, not them. The girl was cold as ice and sounded like I was stupid for bringing it up and complaining. So I had a repair man and moved room for no reason, very relaxing. In the second room as I was coming out of the shower, I noticed that the bath had a great many dirty black smears all along the base, as if it had scraped against black rubber while being installed, destroying the aesthetic. The control panel for the lighting and shades froze one night, so I had to get up and use the wall controls, and for some reason when you turn all lights off it turns the tv off too, very annoying. I didn't like having to phone room service to bring me ice, as its locked away in the housekeeping room, though they can put it in a service hatch in the vanity area so you dont have to deal with people, but on the third night after they'd delivered the ice I discovered they hadn't replaced the whisky tumbler, so had to phone again, and instead of leaving it in the hatch they rang the doorbell, and the guy who brought it then stood there expectantly as if I should tip him for them not servicing the room properly. The mini bar is insanely expensive, nearly double the cost of a Four Seasons minibar, 9$ for a diet coke, ludicrous. The room service food is fabulous, the best I've had, I tried three different meals and they were all excellent, and as with most hotels these days, the service is included, however only once was that mentioned by the deliverer, unlike the Four Seasons who made a great point of pointing it out, and the area for gratuity is left open, which is a real con job. On one day the bin wasn't emptied, not good enough for a hotel thats trying to be 5 diamond in every way. The pool area was closed, you could still use it but there was no service, and nobody came to clear away the towels that had been used, so I went back and used the Four Seasons pool. I was driven down there in the hotels town car, which was very nice, and the drivers were great, much rather tip them than pay for a cab. Had some drinks in the bar at the top, and the cocktails and music were good, but it was really dead, there's really not much point to going there if you're not at the hotel grabbing a nightcap, and the food was ridiculous, ordered a prosciutto appetizer and it had one slice on a big piece of bread, the waitress did get me some more when I complained. I generally found the staff attentive, but in a rather forced fashion. I felt like I was being forced to fit in with Mandarin Oriental way, whereas the Four Seasons adapts itself to make you feel comfortable. I'll be sticking with the Four Seaons till the MO irons out the teething troubles it's been having, but after nearly a year of operation it should be beyond that by now.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel With Excellent Service and Ordinary Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gurumanjohn
Reviews.Content: If you can get a bargain rate at this hotel and want someplace quiet on the Strip, book it. But at its normal rates (well over $250) there are other less expensive hotels just as nice. This hotel is part of an international chain, but this property isn't nearly as elegant as its Asian locations. At its normal price point, this hotel has lots of new competitors with equal or better facilities. Also, buying a drink or a meal at the Oriental is definitely out of the question. We ordered two drinks poolside and the bill came to $45 without tip. The pool, by the way, is open only from 9am to 5pm, which is silly in Vegas. Moreover, all poolside drink and snack service stops at 4pm. What are they thinking? The best thing about the Oriental is the service, The staff is first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Luminescent Luxury in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: Why I picked this hotel: I reviewed all the hotels on Trip Advisor and The Mandarin Oriental fared well among all of the hotels in Las Vegas, with an impressive top 5 rating out of all hotels in Las Vegas. I have stayed at nearly all of the properties in Las Vegas and this was a property I hadn’t tried due to its recent opening. I try to stay some place different each time I visit Vegas because there is so much to see, and with the new hotels in City Center, the MO seemed perfect. Also, Mandarin Oriental has a stellar reputation for their hotels, or at least I had been told. Having not stayed at a MO property yet, this one seemed like that best pick. The final deciding factor was that MO offered the most competitive rates for a 5 star hotel for the week of our stay, making this the very best choice. Arrival: From the moment we stepped out of the cab for check-in, it was like being transported into a magical place. (Think Disney World for adults.) Efficient bellmen lined up and took our luggage away. The ground entrance to MO is private, tranquil and serene. I immediately felt calmed. The bellman asked us our names and we entered the elevator to the 23rd floor where their check in is located. When you step off the elevator, you will be stunned with the magnificent view of the strip, especially if you check in at night. There was no line for registration (a Las Vegas first for me) and the woman who checked us in knew our names before we made it to the desk. (The bellman mics to the desk worker that we are coming up the elevator for check in, so before you get there, they have all of your paper work pulled and ready for you.) This was a very impressive, efficient nice touch. We were greeted with an upgrade to a strip view room, much to our delight. Also, the front desk handed us warm towels for our hands and offered us hot tea. We were so impressed with the service. Also, I needed a doctor to look at my tonsils, as I travel a lot and had a sore throat / white patches. The check in woman had the concierge dispatch the hotel Doctor to my room and he was there with medicine for my tonsillitis within 40 minutes. This saved my trip to Vegas and prevented me from getting worse. This also meant that I didn’t have to sit in a Vegas ER (Can you imagine?) or take ½ a day from my vacation to be seen by a private practice Doctor. I started my meds immediately that night after check in and felt better in the morning. (Thank you MO!) Rooms: The rooms are decorated in understated dark tones. This is very “un-Vegas” until you get inside and experience the carefully planned opulence and amenities the room has to offer. There is a small trap door for servers / housekeeping to put items through, as to not bother guests. I really liked that feature. You have a doorbell on your room as well, which eliminates that loud, obnoxious pounding that no one wants to hear on vacation. The room comes with the following: - An extra blanket, perfectly boxed and stored for your use - Easy to use safe - Beautiful closet, with inner lighting - Plenty of drawers for your belongings - Automatic button for valet or housekeeping built into the wall - Amazing smelling bath salts for the bath, namely eucalyptus - Rose petals left at night on the towels over the tub - Large, oversized jewelry box for your jewels so you don’t leave them laying around the room / lose them during your stay - Hot iron that works better than mine does at home; I am going to go out and buy the exact same one that they provided because it was so great - Tea pot with an automatic timer for in room tea service - Automatic window curtains with remote - A mini “ipad-like” remote that controls the entire room. This was very impressive and state-of-the-art. Also, it was VERY easy to use; a child could figure it out without issue. - The most comfortable bed you will ever have the pleasure of sleeping in. Both of us smiled with delight as we sank into the bed, when we felt the extraordinary comfort. Room Service: We did order room service when we arrived. We ordered 2 pots of hot tea to our room, $36 or so. Service was fast, friendly, efficient, and beautiful. We requested more tea bags, and those were hustled up immediately. At the time we ordered, we didn’t realize that there was a chrome electronic tea maker in our room that was easy to use. We used that the rest of the trip and it worked amazing. I would consider buying one for myself for my home. Service: If you are a person that loves top service, welcome to your place! This is THE place for a service destination to the highly discriminating connoisseur in hotel staff. I stay at a lot of top hotels, but this service was unparalleled. You will notice how incredibly well trained the staff is on every level. Many hotels can accomplish having well trained front desk staff, but you will find from the front desk, to the bellmen, to the house driver, to the trainers at the gym, from the concierge to MoZen restaurant servers are all impeccably trained. Even the hostesses at both the Tea Lounge and MoZen were warm, kind and connective. I would also like to compliment the HR department of Mandarin Oriental Corporate on their ability to hire the right people and then to train and develop them further into magnificent service personnel. Well done. This is not an easy task to accomplish, but Mandarin Oriental has set the standard for the rest of the industry to follow. Gym: If you spend an appreciable amount of time in the gym, like I do, stop right here and just book now. This gym IS the attraction at this property. You could make this into a Vegas show itself. You will be greeted with 2 trainers that are free at your disposal to ask any question you desire. The female trainer showed me how to get the best stretch for runners, which I will likely use the rest of my life. They offer you chilled towels, fruit, and water, all complementary. Heaven forbid, you stretch yourself out; at this gym, they have automatic stretchers that stretch you out and the trainers will show you how to use the machines. The REAL luxury experience occurs once you get onto the treadmill. My jaw absolutely dropped to the ground. The background of your treadmill screen is a large TV that you can watch 40+ shows of your choice. (Personally, I watched the Kardashians during my run.) The treadmills overlook the strip. During my running, I got to watch airplanes take off from LAS and disappear into the beautiful Vegas blue sky. It was mesmerizing. If you get bored of that, the treadmills even have games built in. I played Connect 4 for a bit. I just couldn’t believe the high luxury of this gym. If you decide to stay here, at least go walk around and see it before you leave; it is truly remarkable. Pool: I was sad that it wasn’t until after my last workout, walking out of the gym that I noticed the pool. I walked out there, covered in sweat just to see what it looked like. Stunning. Gorgeous. Luxury. The cabanas looked exactly right out of a movie and the décor of the pool area itself was trendy and modern. Overall, it looked like art. I wish I would have thought to lay out there sooner in the trip and not 1 hour before I was leaving for the airport. When I stay at this hotel again, I will be sure to take a seat in the sunshine, enjoy my IPod and the beauty of the pool; don’t miss out. MoZen Restaurant: This might be one of the most pricy breakfasts you will have in awhile, but it is a nice experience. The food is pretty light, and isn’t over weighted in oils / fats. Therefore, it isn’t overly bursting with taste, but I believe you are getting less calories. The Mandarin Breakfast is very good. The service here is amazing, just like the service is at every aspect of this hotel. Careful though: a green tea alone is $9, and a breakfast is $28 or so. It is a different experience, however, and even your fruit bowl comes with star fish and dragon fruit from Taiwan. The view overlooks City Center and in the morning, you can catch runners running by. I also liked Silk Road at Vdara and also the breakfast place at Aria where I ate next to Larry King. Tea Lounge: One of my Vegas local friends and I caught up over a glass pot of oolong tea at the 23rd floor tea lounge (at check in.) This overlooks the strip and we enjoyed our hot tea and conversation. I very much enjoyed this and would go out of my way again once back in Vegas to enjoy the tea lounge. $12 a pot, but the view, service and atmosphere make it worth it. If we had more time, I would have stayed for 2 or 3 pots of tea; it was breathtaking and tranquil. Unexpected Perks: The use of the black Mercedes house car twice, twice a day maid service who actually reservice the room at night, the hot iron straightener, bath salts, tea maker, free gym trainers (when available) and endless, high level service. Tips for Staying at this Property: Bring your favorite teas from home so you can enjoy them in your room with your private tea maker. DO spend the money and ensure yourself a STRIP view room (not a city view room which can overlook CVS or McDonalds.) Leave your hot iron and blow dryers at home; theirs are awesome. Request extra hangers when you check in; they didn’t have enough in the rooms. Downfalls: The newer hotels I have been staying in have been providing free makeup wipes; housekeeping doesn’t provide those as a room standard. The elevators are a pain because you have to “make a connection” and switch elevators on the 3rd or 23rd floor. This was kind of annoying by the end of our stay. The prices are high, as I indicated before. Internet is $18 or so a day, with the first 5 minutes free to check your email from the hotel computers. This seemed high; every place I go, it has been free or included when I sign up to be a hotel member. Agreed / Disagreed with Other Reviewers: I agreed with the reviewers that complained that the elevators, although beautiful with a couch, are a pain because you can’t take a direct line from the ground floor to your room. I disagreed with people that complained that the room technology was complicated. As I indicated, a child could operate the room remote and everything that is encompassed therein. I loved the room remote and found it very easy to use and a enlightening / exciting experience. I disagreed with writers saying that the atmosphere at MO was stuffy / snotty. I loved that it was more quiet and elegant; this atmosphere was very refreshing to what I am typically used to in Vegas, making it an attractive future option. Stay at this hotel if you: Like beauty, serenity, tranquillness, calmness, service, understated elegance, state-of-the-art technology, quiet, serene, high brow gym and pool. Best for romantic getaways, business travelers, solo travelers, & girl’s weekends. Avoid this hotel if you: Desire Vegas glitz and glamour, loud casinos, smoke, large families, children, economic pricing. Overall: Before, hands down, the Venetian / Palazzo property was my favorite. Now, this is by FAR my favorite property. The service blew my mind, the quiet, smoke free environment was almost tranquil in a city full of noise, the rooms were amazingly equipped, and the gym would give any gym on this planet a run for their money. There were few families and mostly quiet couples or business travelers. If you can afford to stay here, do it. I would be shocked if you regret your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: WestGang
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MOLV on a recent trip to LAs Vegas with my wife. The hotel is apparently brand new and was stunning with super high end everything. The rooms were incredible with granite, dark woods and first class fixtures and all electronically controlled amenities, through the flat screen TV - temperature, all the lights, window blinds, etc. The technology was almost too sophisticated as we had to call the front desk to have the sound restored on the TV. We were told that this happens quite a bit and they are stil trying to get some of the bugs out. The service was first class and staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Best of all - though the hotel sits right in the middle of the strip in the City Centre, there is no gambling or smoking and it is quiet and impecably maintained. It's not cheap but it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Topert
Reviews.Content: The hotel is probably the only good thing that hold me over during our 4 days trip in Vegas, all I can think about is going back to my wonderful hotel room and relax. I met with my partner after the conference. Upon arrival, Glen, the bellboy was absolutely wonderful, taking you in, carrying your luggage, welcome you to the hotel at 12:00 at night. Checking was fast, the whole place smells like heaven - it really does, a non-smoking environment which is totally different than these "I can smoke and drink everywhere in Vegas because I can" places. We have the standard suite, which is slightly smaller than those in Vegas - but you do not need these spaces anyway. We had a view overlook the strip, and their bed is probably one of the most comfy bed I have ever slept. Hotel gym is standard, it will be better if they have more machine. I love the bathtub (I will only stay at the hotel where they have bathtub!), fill in water very quickly. This is the place of elegance and privacy: for those who does not into drunk and sleazy scene, Mandarin is well designed and situated in the new City Center, the design of the hotel is to use different elevators and entrance to block the people who are not the hotel guest. It is amazing how you do not feel you are in Vegas anymore right after you turn into City Center and walk into the hotel. The other review is correct, this is not for your typical Vegas style where is all facade and everything is unlimited. I am so glad that I stayed there and where is truly maintaining their standard and quality and differed from anyone else. With the rate of $170 per night, why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: johngalt_DC
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in the strip. Excellent service and fantastic rooms, plus none of the usual inconveniences of the big Vegas hotels. Would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: Dekard
Reviews.Content: For those of us who are not interested in gambling, the Mandarin is perfect for enjoying Vegas. It doesn't have a casino, so you can eacape the hurly burly and tacky aspects of the other hotels. The staff were absolutely lovely. The rooms are luxurious, but over-technical. I am a devout technophile, but you need the training of an airline pilot to work all the lighting, powered curtains, etc. I pity the elderly guests without an early exposure to modern technology. It has an odd arrangement with the lifts. The lobby is on the 23rd floor, and to get from your room to the ground floor you have to exit the lifts on the 5th, walk past the restaurant, and get into another. It has a good (free) gym, but, in common with many hotel gyms, it was too warm, and no fans.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: J0andJames
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved this hotel. We have previously stayed at Mandarin Oriental Kuala Lumpur so knew that we were in for a treat. As the hotel only opened in December 2009 were we lucky enough to get 2 nights for the price of 1. On arrival to the hotel we were directed to the lift which took us up to the lobby several floors up. It doesn't take much to amaze me so I was rather impressed that the lift had a seat in it :) Once we arrived at the lobby we were welcomed with a hot towel and a cup of traditional tea. The lobby is beautifully and tastefully decorated and looks very modern. We had arrived rather early so we left our luggage and went for a meal in the Hard Rock Cafe, the hotel called us as soon as our room was ready and we went back to the hotel. Once we collected our key we were shown to the lift to take us to our room, the room key is needed to operate the lift, there were a few teething problems with our key but luckily the manager of the hotel was in the lift with us so he sorted it out. We arrived at our room and our bags were going to be delivered to us later. We opened the door to our room as we were amazed that the curtains automatically opened and the TV and music came on in the bedroom and bathroom (mirror). The room was lovely but the bathroom was amazing, the toiletries were amazing, bath salts and aromatherapy shampoo, shower gel etc. The bath was really deep and filled up in no time at all, there was a separate shower and a double sink, I could have spent all day in there :) Our luggage got delivered into a secret compartment so that we were not disturbed - genius! The remote control was my husbands favourite part, he got to control everything in the room, you could set the atmosphere and rather than setting an alarm you could set a time for the curtains to open, lights to swtich on and music/tv to come on, I want one at home! As it was our honeymoon we got a basket of fruit and a bottle of champagne delivered to our room, which was a nice touch. I loved the tea making facilities in the room, we stayed in several hotels during our 2 weeks and rarely found tea making facilities, it was either coffee or nothing. The staff in the lobby were more than accomodating when our flight back to the UK got cancelled (due to snow) and I had to spend several hours on hold on the front desk phone!!! Overall experience was fantastic, if only we could afford to stay at the Mandarin Oriental every time we visit Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but...”
Reviews.Author: drwibble
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas for a long weekend to celebrate my boyfriend's 40th birthday. I chose the Mandarin because of the chain's reputation and because this hotel doesn't have a casino and is, relatively, small in size for Vegas. Cons: We had booked a strip view room and on arrival were allocated a room on the back of the hotel with a partial view of Planet Hollywood and a view directly across to another building in the City Centre complex. We were so disappointed. Fortunately, we were able to move rooms to a full strip view the following day, but our first room had soured the experience for us especially as we had explained we would be checking in late and it was for a special occasion. The wait from ordering cocktails in the bar to them being delivered to the table was unacceptable - 15 minutes - which meant we had to rush to drink them before our car arrived to take us out to dinner. Rubbish system for getting taxis from the hotel, but I was assured this was going to be changed Pros: Beautiful room with a very comfortable bed and lavish bathroom. The pool is lovely and the service at the pool is great. No casino. We did speak to the manager on the first morning and he arranged for a change of room, but he seemed a little offhand. i also contacted the manager when we got home with some suggestions for improving things e.g. sorting out the taxi arrangements and speeding up the service int he bar. He did respond.

Reviews.Title: “A Refreshing Oasis on the Strip...”
Reviews.Author: Iowight
Reviews.Content: A comfortably quiet spot away from the kitschy casino scene along the strip. The service was superb in every facet. Views of the boulevard were excellent. The room appointments were superior and the elegance was understated, but present. Setting the in-room wakeup call included such options as automatic opening of the curtains at two levels of brightness and whether you wanted an “alarm”, music, and/or TV on feature. You could choose all of these and more. The desk generated calls was a live person who addressed you by name and always asked how they could make the stay more comfortable. The general feel of the space was more that of a small apartment more than a hotel room. The building is split use between residences and the hotel space that led to an awkward configuration for elevator service. To go out of the hotel from the room, a transfer to a second elevator bank was required at either the 23rd or 3rd floors. The 23rd floor sky lobby, tea service area, and lounge were unique and impressive. The view from these public spaces was magnificent and well planned in the overall design of the structure. Having stayed at several hotels on/near the strip, this one would have to rate at the top with the Four Seasons. The Asian flair and décor, plus the professional attention to detail by the staff would have to put it at the top of my list for the next trip to Las Vegas. It was an oasis away from the conference attended at another casino/hotel on the strip. Overall, it was serene and comfortable in a town that is rarely either.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and tranquility in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pen10poppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 amazing nights at the Manderin. Had a fab trime at the hotel. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Lobby and bar is located on the 23rd floor. I had a 'Mandarin' room on the 16th floor with a view over the pool, Aria and New York New York hotels. The room was very spacious, with a large bathroom area that included a walkin shower and massive free standing bath. Shutters could be pushed back in the room that allowed the bath a view across to the window. The bed was very very comfy. Everything in the room was remote controlled - the curtains, lights and multiple tvs throughout the room. The hotel was very quiet and peaceful and an added adavantage is there is no casino located within the Mandarin. Parts of the hotel were still being worked on by builders daily and you had to come in through a side entrance rather than by the main doors. Internet in the business centre costs approx $9 for about 10-15mins. The location of the hotel is good as well and once the City Centre complex is finally complete in December it will be muchh easy to access as there is still alot of building in other areas. Would definietly recommend staying at the Mandarin for those who want to experience Vegas at a quieter more relaxed pace of life.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been nicer, and I stay at a lot of fine hotels!”
Reviews.Author: reedharris
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a second as I always believe companies should be recognized when they do things right. I actually live in Las Vegas but wanted to take my wife to the Mandarin for her birthday and also explore City Center which I had not really had a chance to do. This is a world class hotel and the staff could not have been nicer. The room and property were above expectations even for a Mandarin. We laid by the pool the next morning, sipped coffee...it was really nice. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: orlandoxx
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Mandarin in Las Vegas for my husbands 30th birthday. The hotel is absolutly fantastic, the staff are the most curtious, polite and attentive people you could wish to meet, check in took all of 5 minutes (special mention to Emily) and then we were taken up to our room where we had been upgraded and WOW it was fabulous! The room was huge with great views of the strip and the most gorgeous furnishings, the beds let me tell you are the best I've ever slept in, you will not want to get up. We ate once at Mozen Bistro and my husband said it was the best indian cuisine he had ever had and trust me he likes his curries :0) it was also his birthday whilst we were there and he was given a complimentary birthday cake on behalf of the managment, little touches like this make all the difference. The pool are was another excellent part of this stunning hotel, it was nearly always quiet, with plently of comfy loungers and free ice lollies and snacks throughout the day and no guests from any other hotel could you it, it was only for Mandarin guests which again is nice in Vegas. I can honestly say if I had to pick a negative the only thing would be we had to leave:0) When visiting Vegas again I would never stay at any other hotel, and I have stayed at some of the other top end 'themed' hotels but none of them come close to the Mandarin Oriental. Hope you enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “If you can't stand the overstated opulance of Las Vegas ...”
Reviews.Author: oh_holidays08
Reviews.Content: Away from the all-too-lavish opulance of the Strip, comes the understated elegance in the name of Mandarin ... I stayed there for 3 nights, due to familiarity with the Mandarin brand having stayed in most of their properties throughout Asia for business. I seldom review my business hotel stays, but this one deserves a mention. The hotel is new, part of the CityCenter project that came about in Dec-2009. The check-in lobby is not on the main floor, and the view from the lobby towards the skyline of Las Vegas Strip is nice, but this is common in Vegas. What impressed me was the usual Mandarin's attention to details. They referred me by my first name when I arrived, checked me in within 5 minutes, gave me a complimentary voucher to use for my stay, offered me a complimentary use of their Mercedes S-Class Hybrid Limousine for all my meetings, and largely left me alone without being too "in your face", as one would typically like when they travel for work. There's good level of privacy in this hotel as room lifts are separated from the lobby lifts, which could be annoying as one has to switch each time you go up or come down, but the glass is half full for me on this one. And best of all, there are no casinos attached to this hotel, and the nearest one is Aria (about 5 minutes walk). Conclusion, its peaceful and quiet, how unlike any Las Vegas property! All in, nice touch and i give this a thumbs up. I will be back here again, but the competitive pricing by Wynn and Venetian are equally tempting. So 4 starts from me.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: d78230
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Vegas. Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for the 1st time. I don't think I'll stay anywhere else again. Everything was fabulous. I honestly mean that. The service is exceptional. Truly exceptional. Personalized, accommodating, pampering and gracious. The rooms are beautiful and modern. We ate at Mozen Bistro (MO Zen?). Delicious food. A little bit pricey for brunch ($65/person) but honestly worth it. Freshly prepared food, ample selection. The tastiest Indian cuisine I've ever had. This isn't a big hotel buffet but a refined, relaxing brunch the way it should be. The Bar has one of the best views of the Strip. Finally, the Spa is amazing. Great therapists, wonderful amenities. I've stayed in alot of high end hotels (Ritz Carltons, Four Seasons) along with all of the Vegas properties worth staying at (Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian/Palazzo) and the Mandarin is nicer than all of them. An absolute oasis away from the din of Vegas. My highest rating. 5* without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil oasis from the crowds of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Roozel
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is a beautiful hotel. It is an escape from the crowded streets and casinos of Las Vegas. The service was nothing short of outstanding for our entire stay. The pools are only small but at any time there were only about twenty people around them instead of the thousands around many casio resort pools. The room was quiet and luxurious. For food we ventured out to the excellent cafes in Caesars and Aria. The monorail to Bellagio is worthwhile and saved a lot of walking. The health club and spa are both top notch. We benefitted from a deal of buy two nights and get one free.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: starrynights
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from our trip to Las Vegas and a stay in Mandarin Oriental in the new City Centre. Taxi drop at hotel and then the MO staff took over. First greeted by Reginald who took our bags and guided us to the lift explaining everything as we walked. Up to 23rd floor where we were greeted by Emily at check in. We were made to feel soo welcome - I mean that sincerely - as this is extremely high end hotel and when she realised we had come for my recent birthday she got us an upgrade to a Mandarin room. It has an unusual lift system which is for security reasons and we soon got used to it. On entering the beautiful room the curtains and sheers opened automatically and the "plinkety plonk" chinese music began. Within minutes our luggage arrived and the bellman asked if we wanted our photo taken in the room. The room : Separate corridor for wardrobes which contains ironing board, umberella, yoga mat, bathrobes, safe and a valet drop (your newspapers are left in a secure part of wardrobe accessed from outside corridor), tray to put your shoes out for shoe shine, clothes brush. Bathroom- Part frosted glass walls which can be covered by sliding wall, Egg shaped bath, Plate glass vanity wall which conceals tv, separate toilet, separate shower room. Bedroom- King size bed, sofa, desk, chair, built in flat screened tv, floor to ceiling windows with view of strip. Very very nice. On return to room in evening they had put rose petals on towel in bathroom and small bowls with pebbles, water and rose petals next to bed. Also they had set out all my toilettries on the vanity unit. If you are like myself I travel with all sorts of toilettries plus hair straighteners etc. This hotel provides lots including hairdriers and straighteners! It was so hot (100+) mid/end Sept. we only went 2x to pool but they spoil you too. You tell them where you want to be and then they make up your lounger and provide extra towels and water, came round with frozen fruit and popsicles. They are concerned that you keep hydrated. No doubt about it - This is a beautiful new hotel and expensive for drinks, food etc. but to us normal everyday people, it was worth it. We have been to LV several times before but this was best yet including Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent Environment”
Reviews.Author: Sunset1001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the height of elegance and the service is impeccable. Our room was large with a great view of the Strip. The finishes and furnishings were all high end. The Quality of the Food and service in the all day restaurant was great. Room Service was also great and punctual. Every staff member we encountered bent over backwards to accommodate our needs. The hotel is in City Center, which is a great location. It has no casino and this adds to the high quality ambiance. However, if you are in need of some gaming, the Aria Casino is a short and interesting walk away, especially if you wander through the high end Crystals Shopping Center. We booked our hotel at WhataHotel. They were able to get our room upgraded as well as several additional, money saving perks. This hotel booking site is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed overpaid and under delivered service”
Reviews.Author: MEaton
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel but bad service. Located mid strip but when we walked out of hotel area was shady. Our room overlooked mcdonalds. Casino was a trek and not as close as we were led to believe. Atmosphere snoty and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, refined OASIS”
Reviews.Author: Lovebeingretired
Reviews.Content: Ahhhh...solitude amid the Vegas noise. Service extraordinaire!!! From the moment you step into the 23rd floor lobby you know you are in someplace special. The stress melts away. Exotic rooms. MOST COMFORTABLE bed and bedding I have ever experienced. Like sleeping on a cloud. Best staff of any hotel I've been in - it's obvious excellent service to their customers is their number one priority. Food was very good but very pricey. Spa was outstanding. Make sure you take advantage of using all of the exceptional spa facilities before and after your treatment. Loved the Hammam turkish bath treatment. No casino here but you can go next door to Aria or the Bellagio to gamble. The pool was also lovely with the staff bringing sorbet and smoothie treats to cool you. This truly is an oasis among the noise in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes wow, sometimes not so much”
Reviews.Author: LAesquared
Reviews.Content: To summarize: Beautiful rooms, too loud, technology doesn't quite work, service is hit or miss We so glad to arrive after our long drive in from LA. It was Friday night, so the door area was busy, and it took the attendants an extra second to notice we were there, but that's ok. We were guided up to the 23 floor "sky lobby," where our check-in was smooth and seamless and utterly without casino noise or smoke. We were escorted to the elevators and made our way down to the rooms. In order to get from the strip to your room, you must always take two elevators, as the ones on the ground level go only to the 3rd and 23rd floors. When had booked a premier room, but when we got there we found we'd been upgraded to an executive suite. Our room was uniquely shaped, as it sat in one of the triangular corners of the building. We had a lovely sitting room as well as an gorgeous bathroom, and my immediate reaction was that I wanted to spend the entire weekend in the room. We were hungry, though, and wanted to walk a bit after being in the car, so we went out to City Center for a bite and then a drink at the bar on the 23rd floor. The service at the bar was not quite there, as the waitress forgot part of our order. The sleeping could have been better that night. These glass-walled hotels really do not keep the sound out, and so I woke up a number of times to hear a pounding disco beat or sirens going up and down the strip. Also, the clock/room controller at the side of the bed was incredibly bright, and I couldn't figure out how to dim it. In the morning, I called reception, and asked how to dim it, and they informed me that this was not possible. In addition, often when you tried to control the room using this controller, it didn't work. Ditto with some of the other switches, though anything you tried to control through the TV obeyed. Room service breakfast was delivered promptly and was well prepared. We spent time by the pool, though when we asked to sit in a shaded area, instead of setting up an umbrella for us, they guided us to the bunker-like "quiet area." Attendants bring around complimentary tidbits frequently, and the pool area is much more peaceful and civilized than some of the other ones I've been to in LA. Things started to fall apart a little bit the next day. We ordered room service coffee with whole milk, and the coffee was not particularly hot when it arrived, and it came with skim milk, not quite a value at $20. And the coffee wasn't great, either. We went to the pool again Sunday morning, and this time we knew not to ask for shade. We ate a nice breakfast pool-side, read and swam for a bit, and then checked out. One surprise was that with all the technology, you can't check out on the TV. There was no line so it didn't matter much. Also, they brought the wrong car and we had a fairly substantial wait as we were trying to leave. It's a hard call whether I would stay there again. I'm pretty sure I would ask for a room facing away from the strip. If you can overlook the small errors (while footing a bill the likes of which should make the experience error-free), it's the most relaxing place I've stayed in Vegas, particularly so much in the center of things.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but would not return”
Reviews.Author: Travel147
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The rooms are stunning, and very technical. We were escorted to the elevator, but not the room. The room is so technical and has so many gadgets, it really needs someone to guide you through it. The pool area is very concrete looking, surrounded by glassy highrises. It felt sterile. The pool staff was super great until 6pm. The pool closes at 7, and the staff really starts closing things down at 6. This was a huge bummer. The mini bar was outrageous....two drinks would have cost $150 to make because they use bottles that are bigger than typical mini bar bottles.....I suspect so they can't be replaced when you're down at the liquor store on the strip. Still, I think this is rude on the hotel's part....it takes away the convenience of the mini bar. I looked at the massage menu.......$400 was the cheapest massage I saw, The lounge space is spectacular. Drinks are about $20......which is a lot cheaper than what they cost in the room. The food in the restaurants and room service was also good and prices are typical for a hotel of this caliber. The hotel is very dark.....at times I really had to feel for the walls because it was so dark. Many times the lower lobby had no personnel. I expected more from this hotel considering it was charging $400 per night when 90% of the other vegas hotels were charging less than $100 for that week. The design is great, but I will go back to my old standard in Vegas....the Four Seasons......they do everything right.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Amazing experience..”
Reviews.Author: Global_vagrant
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend the Mandarin Oriental, Vegas strongly enough. From check-in to departure, the staff could not have been more friendly or efficient. However, by far the highlight of the stay was the exceptional room. Had booked via www.cityandshow.com at a very reasonable rate and was put in a fantastic room with great views of the strip from the floor to ceiling windows. The room featured centralised electronic control (blinds raised automatically upon room entry), large plasma TV and good sized bathroom with rain shower and glass panelled separation with the bedroom and the hall facing external windows. Key stay pluses also worth mentioning: - very cool bar at reception level (high floor) with great ambiance and a special view of the strip. Excellent for a sundowner for the sunset over the strip - was offered complimentary use of the hotel S Class Merc for a trip a few blocks along the strip. As the outside temp was well over 100 degrees this was very welcome. The driver was extremely courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Luxury on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: I conducted a workshop at this hotel. I had a thorough site inspection with Brandon about a month prior. The year prior we had used the Four Seasons. The Mandarin does not even compare. They have a private entrance and it is a quick walk up the stairs to the Aria for casino action. The rooms are beautiful! Large bathrooms with a huge tub, separate shower and his and her sinks. Everything is programmed through the clock or tv, for instance you can program your alarm for 7am, curtains open, lights dim and tv on channel 40. If you have laundry or shoes to be polished, placed them in the private lox box and push the button that pages someone to pick it up without bothering you. The bar was also very neat with some of the best views of the strip. This is an excellent choice especially at the low rates I have been selling it at lately (about $200 a night tax inclusive with the 3rd night free). The only drawback is the mini bar, small water and soda $9.00 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we changed our booking from the Four Seasons to the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: Ewok
Reviews.Content: My husband and I unexpectedley had to change our booking from the Four Seasons to the Mandarin two weeks before we left the U.K. I'm so glad we did. The Mandarin is modern and in a fantastic location for exploring the Strip. Loved the fact it was non-gaming and the hotel lobby was on the 23rd floor so it didn't get outsiders wandering in. The gym was well equipped. Unfortunately I didn't make it to any of the yoga classes but will try next time. We used the house car once to take us to the Mandalay - the driver was great and took a back street so we were there in minutes. We self parked at the Aria which is less than a five minute walk to the MO and it was free. Overall the hotel is very pricey but then I guess it caters to the high end traveller. Next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely book the MO.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and great personal attention”
Reviews.Author: carole6
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel in City Center. We chose it because it did not have a casino to pass through to get to the room and it took just 3 minutes to get to our room. Fabulous personal attention the moment we arrived at the door, Room is very clean, beautifully decorated and unique. Bed is soft. Pool is quaint , lounge chairs with cushions and again great service. Loved the hourly treats the staff brought around to enjoy at the pool. The hotel does not have many dining options, so we walked the 5 minutes to Aria for use of their restaurants and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Chun_416
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay in August at the Mandarin Oriental. We stayed in an Executive Suite, which was beautiful and extremely comfortable. The "first entry" set up for all of the electronics in the room is really quite impressive! (Everything turns on when you walk in). We dined only at the Bistro as Twist was closed for its summer holiday during our stay. Dinner at the Bistro was amazing. A bit pricy, but in line with what you'd expect for a hotel of this class in Las Vegas. We also had room service breakfasts every morning of our stay. It was always promptly delivered, beautifully presented and delicious! We spent quite a bit of time at the hotel pool, which was very nice, quiet and relaxing. Not a party atmosphere at all, which was great for us. The service around the pool was excellent. We also had some spa treatments and would highly recommend a visit to the spa. The views from the vitality pool are amazing. The fitness centre too had the same great views, and top of the line gym equipment. I would highly recommend this hotel. It was so calm and relaxing, especially in comparison to the craziness that awaited as soon as you walked outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: drbrksmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September and had a fantastic stay. Have previously stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas but decided to try out the Mandarin Oriental this time as the rates were the same. The rooms here are definitely much better, and have every amenity you can think of. Fantastic bed, beautiful bathroom and bath. Great electronic toys in the room - had no problem getting the lighting how I wanted it through the intuitive control panel. Pool area perfectly nice but was quite windy. Great service here. (I actually preferred the atmosphere of the Four Seasons pool though). Location is pretty good - 5 mins walk to Aria and then the shuttle to Bellagio. I have to say we did occasionally pine for a big 'casino' button in the lift to whisk you off to the fun like you get at other hotels. I guess its all a trade off because having that means crowds at check in etc... Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetraveler44
Reviews.Content: The new Mandarin in City Center is the place to stay for world business travelers that like to escape the Vegas crowds and enjoy an upscale hotel. You can´t even tell that you are in Vegas anymore once you enter the valet grounds on the lower level. (of course if you like - you can step out and walk over into aria and enjoy a vegas casino resort any time of day). The service of the staff was out of this world - we have never experience anything better in Vegas and we`ve been to every single 5 star hotel on the strip....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ajw26
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel to stay in Vegas. There is no casino so you don't have to drag your bags through a busy casino when you arrive, and you don't have to put up with tour groups wandering aimlessly through the hotel. The rooms are gorgeous, we had a cityscape room and free standing bath was enormous! The pool is gorgeous and the staff are very attentive, including bringing you free iced water throughout the day and little treats like frozen berries. The only downside is that everything is very expensive, as you would expect, so unless you're on a big budget, you couldn't have lunch by the pool egery day or it'd baankrupt you. But other than that, this hotel is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “never again-4 seasons is better”
Reviews.Author: mflickermd
Reviews.Content: First the good. the staff, except for timely housekeeping was very good.The bed was also excellent. the bad:The hotel entrance was hard to find.Signage is poor. Upon entering our room, we discoved 2 problems immediately.The ac wasn't working well and when I went to take a bath, the controls came off in my hand. This was fixed immediately. The room was beautiful aesthetically, but not very functional. The lighting was terrible, even after we were given larger light bulbs. It was impossible to read. In the bathroom,there was no place to put the bathtub soap. Also ,the controls were so badly placed that I had to stand up to adjust the flow of water. Also the drain was in the middle of the tub. If you accidentally sat on it, the water began to drain. There were also no more than 2 drawers in which to place our things. The pool area was very attractive, but there was a wind tunnel effect,which meant closed umbrellas much of the time.The poolside cafe, while sheltered, was stuffily hot. There were no ceiling fans or misters.Lastly,the food selections at Mozen were rather limited.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas: The more peaceful part of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsS_09
