Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay in an executive suite at the mandarin oriental, and the email correspondence between us and the hotel even weeks before our stay was an indicator of how wonderful it would be. Check In We arrived late on a Sunday night; our taxi had no problem finding the hotel entrance. Our bags were taken on the ground floor and we were directed to the sky lobby on level 23 by a bellman. Check in process was smooth and very quick, without feeling rushed. The agent was friendly and efficient and if we didn’t ask any questions, the whole process would have been done in under a minute….very nice! When we got to our room, the luggage attendant was already outside the room waiting for us with our luggage Room The executive suite was incredible!! There was a living room with chairs couches, 2 TV’s with TONS of channels, including premium channels (HBO) and cold champagne waiting for us there. One should note that the executive suites come in 3 different sizes, we were in the largest one (rooms ending in 35). All the lights, curtains and temperature could be adjusted on either of the TVs or a small little control unit. The controls are a little laggy, but if you’re patient with them, they work. The bathroom was quite large and split in to two opposite sides with 2 separate sinks and mirrors. There is a TV in the mirror on one of the sides, but you are able to watch it from the other side through the mirror; the sound is played through speakers in the ceiling. The Bathroom was stocked with tons of amenities, everything and anything you would need. Shampoo and lotions were Bvlagari; however, the restocking of them was inconsistent. The shower was very nice with excellent water pressure, didn’t get a chance to use the tub which was right by the window with a nice view at night. The bed was really comfortable and the views surrounding the entire room reminded you of being right in the core of the vegas strip. Pool Area A nice pool area with 2 small lap pools, but not long enough to actually swim laps in. The pool was never busy and always had tons of loungers, even late in to the morning and early afternoon. The service was excellent some days and non existent on others. We found there to be more families at the pool than other hotels, but the kids were generally well behaved and quiet. Frozen fruit and popsicles were served every few hours by the pool attendants. The poolside restaurant was good for quick lunches, just make sure not to get a coke (8$ for a 250ml bottle….. that’s half of a can!)The cabanas were almost always empty, only 1 or 2 used per day, although they looked very nice. Service The service we found was definitely acceptable, however it didn’t seem seamlessly perfect as one would expect from a mandarin property, it did seem a little forced sometimes, but it definitely didn’t leave us with a negative impression. Generally, it does feel more personal than other hotels as they refer to you by name (most of the time) and remember little details about you (where you’re visiting from, reason for visiting). These details seem to be passed around to all the staff so when you encounter them throughout the hotel (restaurants, spa) they do know a little about you. Spa Definitely the most expensive on the strip, but not by that much (relatively). Massages were around $220 for 80 minutes and Hamam was $100. We made reservations about 3 weeks in advance through e-mail, as per recommendations; however the spa didn’t seem that busy. Overall the spa is beautiful and service is very friendly as you would expect. Upon entering you’re asked to fill out a form and given tea and a towel while your shoes are taken away and replaced with slippers. You’re then escorted down a set of stairs (yes no elevator) to the locker rooms and facilities. Locker rooms are very nice and facilities are great as well. Saunas, Steam Rooms, bubbled pools with large windows (however view is not that great) and cool showers that play sound effects with mood lighting with different streams of water. The Hamam treatment was perfect to have done before spending a lot of time under the sun as it involved a full body exfoliation. You’re taken in to a cool looking room with led lights on the ceiling and lots of humidity and asked to lie on a heated marble slab. You’re then rinsed with water and scrubbed down with a loofah and goats milk, which was a little painful at times. Finally you get covered in bubbles, and then massaged with oil. It was new to us and it was definitely an interesting experience – our skin felt so soft after. For the massage you’re escorted back up the flight of stairs and in to the treatment room. The rooms are very nice and dark, one thing which was odd was there was no board under your head to rest your arms. The massage was very good and overall the service was really professional and attentive. Mozen & Room Service Our package included a daily breakfast, either in the Mozen bistro or for room service. I must say the room service was the best we’ve had anywhere, but the exact same dishes were ordered at the Mozen bistro for breakfast and they were much better there, aka bigger portions, nicer presentation, fruit was riper etc. For breakfasts, there was never any wait for a table, service was very good and food was delicious. For dinner, we made reservations ahead of time for a 7PM seating which were definitely not needed as we were the only ones in the restaurant. The food was good, had different plates of sushi but we found it a little difficult to read through the menu. The menu seemed convoluted with tons of options from chinese, to indian to sushi… a more streamlined menu would have been preferred . General The mandarin offers a complimentary house car (Mercedes S) which is very nice (when available). The chauffeur was friendly; however it was only available once during our stay. Bottled water is complimentary; it’s left in the room for turndown service and also available at the pool. The lobby on the first floor is very nice but small. The lobby on the 23rd floor is beautiful with a very nice view. It’s about a 7 minute walk to get to Aria, you do need to cross the whole mandarin Porte-cochère about four lanes, as there is no path (as people mentioned) , however there’s barely any cars so it’s not a big deal. Once you cross that, it’s up an escalator and a small walk towards aria. We did take a taxi one night from Aria to MO, as we were very tired, and it cost about 7$ with tip. Final Thoughts Overall the experience we had at the Mandarin Las Vegas was a pleasure, it was very peaceful (probably due to lack of casino) and you really felt like you were one of very few guests staying here. We would recommend it to people looking for a quiet place to stay and specifically families. As people said, it definitely doesn’t feel like Vegas, so if that’s what you are looking for – it’s’ an excellent hotel that just needs a little additional fine tuning and experience. We continued our vacation at the Encore Tower Suites after, which while also is rather quiet, as soon as you step outside into the Encore you’re right back in Vegas. Ultimately it depends what you’re looking for, for us the MO was a nice start to our Vegas vacation, but we wouldn’t have stayed there for the entire vacation. We would have missed the Encore Casino and the vast selection of Wynncore Restaurants being right outside our door.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan33
Reviews.Content: Really awesome expereince at MO Las Vegas. Arrived on a Saturday and left on Tuesday. Doormen very friendly and helpful when we checked in and whenever we went in/out. No problems with check in and very nice that there wasn't a mass of people trying to check in like other resort casinos in Vegas. Yes, you do need to take one elevator to the lobby and another elevator to your room. I really did not mind it, especially considering that you never had to wait more than a few seconds for either elevator. Most hotels in vegas you spend a lot of time waiting for an overcrowded elevator. Room was outstanding with touch screen controls for everything. Bathroom nice size with beautiful separate bathtub . We had a great view of the strip. Bed was super comfortable and had no problem sleeping late into the day as the curtains were great and noise was minimal on our floor. Had afternoon tea which was actually a decent bargain considering how overpriced all the other food and drinks were at the hotel. Pool area wasn't huge like most resorts in vegas but that was a plus for me. 2 pools and hot tub. Pool staff greeted you at the door and set up your lounge chairs and towels. Also brought you complimentary water bottles whenever you needed it. Actually all staff around the hotel provided water whenever you wanted it. A really nice perk when visitng Vegas in the summer. Location of the hotel is good too since its relatively in the middle of the strip. Another nice perk is that hotel has car to take you to places within 2 miles of hotel. Only have one car so you might have to wait but so much better than taking a taxi. If you want a typical vegas casino resort, this probably is not the ideal place but if you want a relaxing luxury hotel in Vegas, this should be right up your alley.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: asd_md
Reviews.Content: What a trip! It was short and sweet, but it one that will have a return trip ASAP! Traveled with my wife for a short 3 day stay at MO. From the beginning of planning with help from following TA's we chose the MO. Arrived to hotel at 12 pm requested a high floor and early check in and both were granted. Check in was smooth and simple, then our front desk attendee took us for a brief tour of the hotel and upto the room to explain how everything worked. I know some have had issues, but it was a breeze for us. Every wire connection is included weather you want to hook up your ipod and listen to music to your laptop to watch movies from the big screen. The room is a decent size with very modern decor. Ample space in the closet and huge well appointed bathroom with a great soaker tub, stand up shower and separate toilet. The tv in the bathroom is a nice touch. Being a non-gaming hotel was nice for us and Aria is about a 3 min walk, the quiet peacefulness is nice after the crazy that Vegas is (but this may not be for everyone). The pool area is very nice, comfy chairs always avail. and the treats from smoothies to frozen fruit is a nice touch. If you want pure elegance, great service from everyone from the front door to the front desk stay at the MOLV.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. An oasis in the middle of the Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: heatherinPhilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Mandarin after a 4 night stay for our wedding. Before arriving, I had alerted the hotel that we were in town for wedding and that we would love a room as high up as possible, with a great view. When we checked in, they greeted us with a congratulations and an executive suite on the 22nd floor (highest floor), as well as nice note of congratulations. The executive suite was well appointed, a nice size living room, full bar area, spacious bedroom, bath and closet. The living room and bedroom had floor to ceiling windows facing the Vegas Strip (looking down towards Paris). All was controlled through the TV, and they also included a technology kit with any extra cables that you may need. We really enjoyed being in a quieter more traquil hotel. It did not bother me one bit that we needed to go to the 23rd floor lobby in order to get into another elevator to get to our room floor. In most Vegas hotels you have to walk a mile, through the casino, to get to the elevator.. so one extra stop didn't bother me. Plus the staff greeted us every time we came through. Our room rate included continental breakfast and $100 at the spa. I did not use the spa credit as we just didn't have time, but we did take advantage of the continental breakfast via room service. It was just wonderful. We had no problems with the valet or doormen as one reviewer had previously posted. It does cost $30 a night to valet, self parking is available for free at Aria. We decided to valet, and our car was always waiting for us by the time we made it downstairs... cooled off, and with two bottles a chilled water. A nice touch on teh 107 degree days that we were there. The one slight complaint I have is that housekeeping is a bit inconsistent. The rooms were spotless, but they never seemed to service the room in the same manner. At night they did come by with ice and water, as well as a turndown service. A very minor complaint, but something to mention. All in all, a WONDERFUL experience. We will definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “It is all about the service”
Reviews.Author: drdough
Reviews.Content: just got back from 2 nights with another couple and would have to say, if you do not mind not having a casino in the building the Mandarin is great. Spa service my wife had was reallly good, extra goodies passed at the pool were nice, bottled water given out at checkin and work out room. the staff went overboard to help us with a few problems we had. Extras are all expensive-spa treatments-coffee ofr room service, but this is a high end hotel and you pay for what you get. Room's are very nicely equiped and laid out.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter7503
Reviews.Content: Our stay the MO in Las Vegas was nothing short of fantastic. It was a weekend retreat - so there was some aprehension about "getting away" in Las Vegas, but the MO proved to be a true oasis in the desert. Staying at a non-gaming hotel was key (but certainly close the equally impressive Aria). The service is world-class. Even before we turned into the property, there was hotel staff to assist us getting around an abandoned taxi in the turning lane off the strip. The greeters and front desk staff were exceptionally friendly and took time to explain everything we needed to know about the hotel - and even walked us to the elevator. The rooms are pure relaxation. The bed is so comfortable you don't want to get out!! The decor and lighting were truly relaxing. The automted control systems worked fine, and it was easy to use. We had forgotten a wire to hook our iPod up to the connectivity panel, but there was an entire technology kit available with cables we needed! The bathroom was good - 5 fixtures (2 lavs, toilet, shower and tub) and the privacy panel in front of the tub was a nice feature. The shower had plenty of space and the fixtures were very modern and simple to use. We recevied a spa credit with our stay and used a day pass - it was fantastic!! The men's spa had stone everywhere! The service from the attendants was outstanding. We enjoyed all the features - the hot tub, the steam, the sauna, the rain forest showers, and the relaxation room. The ammenity kit was a nice take-home! We couldn't have asked for amore luxuiros our relaxing stay!! Already eyeing dates to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property But Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: travel_blurbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Mandarin Executive room for 3 nights. We were on a higher floor so we had a great view of the strip. The positives: 1. The interior of the hotel is very beautiful, elegant and quiet. It did not have the feel of a typical Vegas hotel, probably because there isn't a casino on-property. 2. The fitness center was good, though on the smaller side. The equipment was well-maintained and staff was there to help. 3. MOzen Bistro served delicious breakfasts --- the french toast was especially good. 4. The room was clean and the decor was modern and beautiful. The bathroom was a good size and the separate dressing area (with ample closet space) was nice. The technology kit, which included an ethernet cable, iPod charger, etc., was nice. 5. Bell staff was very good. 6. Location was good. It was an easy walk to Aria, where you can take a tram to the Monte Carlo and Bellagio hotels. The negatives: 1. Having to take two elevators to get to your room. From the lower lobby, you have to take an elevator to either the sky lobby on the 23rd floor or the 3rd floor and change elevators to get to the room floors (room cards are needed to access these floors). While the extra security is nice, it became tedious over time. 2. Housekeeping service was spotty. One day, the room hadn't been cleaned when we returned at 4 pm. On another day, the room appeared to be only partially cleaned, as there were used cups and trash still in the room. Turndown service did not occur on one night --- instead, they came at 10:30 pm to ask if we wanted turndown service. 3. Upon check-in, it would have been nice if they had confirmed our room/floor at the desk to ensure it was the room/floor that we preferred. She told us our floor number as she began to escort us to the elevator, but I preferred a higher floor, so we had to go back to the desk so she could check on availability. 4. Internet access was not included --- charged $17 per day. Overall, we would go back to this property, as we are not big gamblers and tend to see shows and go out to restaurants and shopping when we are in Vegas. If we were more into gambling, I think a hotel that has a casino would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Pilot_P1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, quiet, clean, and comfortable rooms, equipped with high-tech control systems for lighting, drapes, etc. Everyone is very polite and eager to assist in any way they are able. Top marks to this perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service not as polished as it should be”
Reviews.Author: Jane32655
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on a road trip. We stayed at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas (see separate review) on the way to our destination and at the Mandarin Oriental on our way home. We generally stay at Four Seasons hotels, but were very excited to try the Mandarin Oriental. We mostly liked the room, but overall were not crazy about the hotel and were definitely not impressed with the service. When we arrived at the hotel, there was one guy standing downstairs who seemed to have no idea what to do with our vehicle or our luggage. Another guy showed up after about 8 minutes to take care of the car. There was no 'welcome to the Mandarin Oriental' or anything of that nature. The ONLY way we knew to go to the 23rd floor was from reading it on here. The guy who checked us in tried very hard to act the part, but just wasn't polished. It felt like he was trying to hard. He was the most professional of anyone who helped us during our stay. The bellman who took our bags back to our car was pretty rough. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable. We loved the big bathtub. The water pressure in the shower was inadequate and the toilet was just weird. We did not enjoy controlling the curtains and everything else in the room by remote control. I'm sure plenty of other people would love it though. When we first saw the room, we really loved it and thought it was the greatest hotel ever. However, the feeling just didn't last after dealing with the staff. It felt amateurish. Also, the hallways in the hotel are very dark and slightly smelly. The pool and fitness center were both nice. We would probably not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made me like Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gfgflf3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a stopping point before traveling on to Southern Utah / the Amangiri Resort. I am someone who normally avoids Las Vegas - but the hotel changed my opinion and I would gladly return. They simply know what they are doing and do it well. They made our time in Las Vegas a true pleasure and we thank them.

Reviews.Title: “Like It Should Be”
Reviews.Author: bloomstewart
Reviews.Content: This is unlike any other hotel I've ever stayed at in Las Vegas. It's like it dropped into the Strip from some civilized place where they know what good service is all about. I've stayed in hotels all over the world and have never received such consistently outstanding and sincere service. The staff is ultra-courteous without being patronizing - a rare skill indeed. They call you by your name, make eye contact and are amazingly service-oriented without being the least bit intrusive. It's a service formula that is usually only dreamed about. Ammenties are equally astonishing. Rooms are wonderfully appointed with extra large and spacious bathrooms with unique arrangements. It's difficult to accurately convey how creative and comforting these bathrooms can be. The beds are so comfortable, you may want to change your plans and stay in the room. Food is terrific, if not a little pricey; there is a great selection at the bar, and the view is one of the best on the strip. The spa was probably the highlight of my stay - the range of services available is unparalled, even at places I've stayed in Asia. And the staff at the spa are so pampering you start to believe that you are their favorite guest of all time. The only constructive criticism is that the place is a little dark and sterile, especially downstairs, and it's just a little sparse, and the building itself doesn't give as much of a comforting feeling as the staff does. Also the technology still has a few bugs in it; room phones frequently didn't work and it was difficult to take a bath in the luxurious bathtub because the plug didn't stay down. Elevators and rooms were challenging to open with the sesored room key, as you needed to swipe it in a particular way, and that was sometimes a hassle. Room service was efficient and timely to the minute. I don't think I'll ever be able to stay anywhere else when I return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil yet Costly, Best Hotel Staff on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Sammamish
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, but I'll likely not stay again since it lacked in a lot of the amenities of other hotels that turns out i missed more than i thought i would. Things i missed were self parking at the hotel, snack/news stand, buffet and other minor things to do within the property that i needed to go elsewhere to find. Of course the lack of some of these things, like gambling, keeps the property tranquil and cleaner which are a great plus and I would highly recommend this hotel if those are important to you. The hotel staff were outstanding, the best i've experienced in any hotel in Las Vegas (i've stayed at 8 hotels there over the years including Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Venetian and more). The staff call you by your name and were all friendly and helpful and informative. Kudos to MO for their fine staff.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Tranquility on Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: n2exploring
Reviews.Content: I suppose I should start by admitting that I am just not into Vegas. I am not dazzled by a town that specifically caters to impulsive behaviors in things that should not be done on impulse- namely gambling, high-end shopping, and marriages. Many conferences over the years have placed me in Vegas within the confines of smoke-filled, crowded casino hotels. After my conference in July placed me at the Mandarin Oriental, I must confess that I now want to return to Vegas as often as possible. The Mandarin Oriental is unlike any other hotel on the strip in so many wonderful ways. From the moment you are greeted by the attentive doorman and step into the inviting elevator complete with soothing music and comfy bench, you know your stay is going to be relaxing and memorable. The spacious lobby is on the 23rd floor and features the check-in desk, a tea lounge, and a cocktail lounge. The Asian décor and breath-taking views were stunning. The check-in process was a breeze with the skillful staff easily deciphering the details of my reservation- half covered by the conference I was attending with additional days covered by myself with my sister joining me. You are given a key card which you need to activate the second set of elevators which take you to your room. This was actually a great security measure for keeping unwanted traffic out of the guest areas. There are plenty of elevators and I never had to wait to catch one. I stayed in a Mandarin Room (1833) overlooking Planet Hollywood and the strip. When you first enter your room, your senses are delighted as the window shades automatically begin to raise up and the lights gradually glow on. Soft music warms your ears as your eyes feast on the beauty of this magnificent room. Windows cover every outer wall and wrap around to your bathroom. The bathtub is huge and inviting- resembling a work of art perched inside the glass walls. A shade can be lowered for privacy while you are soaking. There is a canister of scented bath salts for your indulgence. There is also an overhead rainforest shower as well as two hand held sprayers. The vanity area has double sinks with lots of essentials. I appreciated the full size hair dryer with all of the attachments. My sister and I enjoyed room service for breakfast every day. The home-made berry yogurts, the sinfully delicious pastries and waffles, and the perfectly crispy bacon always arrived quickly and with a smile. The room service table has a heated compartment that ensures that your hot entrees arrive hot. Best of all, the coffee was always piping hot and plentiful. We enjoyed dinner one evening at MOzen restaurant. Their Indian cuisine is not to be missed. The wait staff is helpful and very knowledgeable about all menu items and specialty drinks. We never did get a chance to try the other restaurant, Twist. Of course, we had to check out the spa, and I am so glad that we did. The hammam was such a lavish delight and I highly recommend it. We explore all of the amenities of the spa and were thoroughly pampered and relaxed when we left. The staff at the spa are the best. The pool area is very nice and quiet. The staff makes certain that you have everything you need. The pool does close at sunset, so don’t wait too late to go enjoy it. I tried to think of any negatives, and they are so few and minor. My room did not have many drawers for unpacking my clothes. I also would have like a full length mirror. The vanity mirror was about ¾ tall and I couldn’t see how my shoes looked with my outfit. And coming from the east coast, I was ready for coffee very early in the morning. I would have appreciated a coffee pot in the room or in the main lobby for an easy caffeine fix prior to breakfast. Since the positives of this hotel are so numerous, it seems absurd to even mention these slight inconveniences. I suppose it comes down to what you are looking for when you go to Vegas. If you want to be right in the middle of the noise and action, then this is not the place for you. If you desire an oasis of tranquility to retreat to after a long day of visiting the sensory overloaded strip, then there is no better place. This is by far the most elaborate and visually stunning room that I have ever stayed in. The amount of attention put into every detail of this hotel accompanied by a very friendly and polished staff made it a unique retreat from the Vegas strip. How nice to have Vegas at your fingertips and tranquility just past your door.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal”
Reviews.Author: GEW5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel and as I have already stated it was unreal. Everything about it was sheer luxury. The Lobby of this hotel is on the 23rd floor with fantastic views of the strip. Check in was complete hazzle free and the girl was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a city view hotel with 2 doubles and we had no complaints whatsoever. Pool staff were excellent and we were treated regualary to frozen fruit etc by the pool. We were in the US for three weeks and our stay in the mandarin was by far the highlight of our trip. We have been to Vegas a few times before and stayed in a few of the other top hotels but none compared to the mandarin. Def would go back and would highly recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “A Marvelous Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Mokona
Reviews.Content: I just came back from this wonderful property. There are so many positive things to say about my stay so the review may be a bit long. First, the online reservation system is very easy and intuitive. I love the various Special Requests I can make when I make reservations. I choose Quiet Room, Away from Elevator, Non-Smoking Room and Early Check-In Requested (I check in around 1:30 PM, but more on that later). I can even give them my arrival flight # and they will arrange a Mercedes Benz Sedan to pick me up! But as many reviewers mentioned, this service is definitely based on availability. I receive a confirmation e-mail after I finish the reservation and a few days before my stay I receive another e-mail to welcome me to their hotel. It is very heart warming. On the day of visit, thanks to all the reviewers here, I find the entrance with no problem. It is indeed very subdued and I like its quietness/calm ambiance. I walk in, tell the attendant that I am here to check in, and he walks me (not just point to me) to the elevator where it will go straight to 23rd floor. To my surprise, there is a very comfortable bench inside every elevator! The lobby attendant greets me right away, and after confirming with my reservation I am being greeted by my last name during the check-in process. The process is quick and straightforward. She re-confirms my special requests with me and she asks me for my daily newspaper selection, then she explains the private and non-intrusive personal walk-in cabinet where they deliver newspapers, toiletries and so on. Because I use my debit card when booking the hotel, she explains the held fund to me clearly and I really appreciate her attentive service. Then she walks me to another elevator area where hotel guests use and she shows me how to use my room card to operate the elevator. My room is on the 12th floor facing Planet Hollywood. It is clean and quiet, the bed is soft and fluffy, the Technology Kit is definitely a plus, the soaking bath tub is so big, and it provides all the amenities I can think of (and they are inside a beautiful chest!) The touch screen which controls the blinds, lightings, TV and music are just fabulous. This is the only hotel that will give me a morning call by playing "sunrise" music on TV, opening the blinds automatically, and turning on all the lights (the settings can be adjusted of course.) I think I will let other reviewers' photos to speak for itself. A few more things that not many people mentioned: 1) The HDTV in the restroom is built inside the mirror (unlike other hotels which are "sticking out" and in SD); 2) The big HDTV in the room is equipped with a simulated surround sound system with a subwoofer; and 3) Having the TV home screen shows the deadbolt is locked and both inside plus outside temperatures are very convenient. After a relaxing short rest, I head to the tea lounge on the 23rd floor. I strongly recommend making reservation in advance as the tables are full during my visit. Once again, the staff greets me by my last name and then leads me to my reserved seat. She patiently explains everything on the menu clearly and promptly, then she gives me some time to decide. I order engligh tea set (need formal name) and it is such a wonderful experience. Great tea, tasty sweets and yummy sandwiches (plus jams!) and marvelous views. Service is still very attentive but not intrusive. She asks me from time to time if the tea is hot enough and do I want to try more sandwiches. I go back to my room shortly after finishing my afternoon tea, and to my pleasant surprise I notice a personal and handwritten thank you card from the hotel manager placing under the room TV. Talk about wonderful service! I head to the pool in the evening as it closes at 7 PM. Once I walk in the staff immediately greets me and setup an empty lounge chair for me with a towel and a bottle of water. After knowing my name, all staffs in the pool greet me with my last name during my stay. There are two big pools and several smaller spa pools with the timer. I spend a good two hour there swimming, relaxing and reading magazines. I also order a freshly made mango and strawberry smoothie to help me keep cool under the 110F weather in Las Vegas. Before I head to Twist for dinner (dinner experience will be under a separate review), I receive a message from the front desk notifying me to re-arrange a turndown service. I guess it is because I place the "Privacy Please" sign outside my room for an extended periods of time. However I really appreciate their message as this is the first hotel I stay that will even contact me about this. Almost all hotels I stay will just leave things as is until I call them to re-arrange the turndown service. This attention to detail service totally wins me over! I eat my breakfast at MOZen (once again, the experience will be under a separate review) and it is again a unforgettable experience. Speaking of service above and beyond, before I leave the restaurant the server even asks me if I want a freshly brewed coffee to go. By the way, how can I forget Amore Patisserie? It is a gorgeous patisserie on the strip and I stop by one afternoon for their fabulous galeto. Then I decide to try its cappucino smoothie and walnut cake. Once again, always smiling and helpful staff, attentive service and love to explain everything clearly to me. It is such a perfect place for me to enjoy some quiet time on a busy street. I stay there for an hour while writing postcards to my friends. The checkout process is also quick and easy. The attendent asks me if I have a good time. Well, not only do I have a wonderful time, I don't even want to leave and I can't wait to come back next time. This property definitely deserves 5 stars and it indeeds is a marvelous retreat, an oasis in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe now our favorite hotel on the globe!”
Reviews.Author: Chililover
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I travelled to Vegas to celebrate our 12th Wedding Anniversary with a 10 night stay at the MO. I was last in there in 1984 and my wife had never visited, effectively this was our first visit to Vegas. After 24 hours travelling we were pretty tired but excited to finally arrive at the hotel. You are met on the ground floor and then taken to the Sky Lobby on the 23rd floor for efficient check in, we then went to our room, a Mandarin Executive which enjoys great views of the Strip. As it was our anniversary the hotel had kindly left a bottle of French Champagne in the room for us which was most appreciated. The room was beautifully appointed, lovely furnishings, subtle artwork, great bathroom and the air conditioning was working well given it was 42 Degrees Celsius! The room was very technologically advanced, curtains, lights, TV, air conditioning, privacy all driven by bedside control panel. Finally, the bed was incredibly comfortable, could have slept all day!! Before we arrived the concierge had arranged several restaurant bookings for us which were all terrific, they were so eager to help and nothing seemed too much trouble when we had extra requests or changes we needed to make. We spent several days by the pool. After seeing some of the "mega pools" at the bigger casino hotels we were very happy with the pool deck at the MO. Although it was modest in size there were always plenty of sunbeds available and it was never crowded. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and there was a constant stream of complimentary snacks such as ice cream, popsicles and frozen fresh fruit offered during the day. Food and Beverage was good quality, a little pricey and the portions were huge, but we were happy with the offering. Although this is not a casino hotel you really do have all the action just outside the front door so you can easily get to Aria, MGM Grand, New York New York, Monte Carlo, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood etc etc. These are all a short walk or tram ride away and most of the other big hotels are not much further away. We really enjoyed being able to return to our sanctuary at the MO after a busy day or night emerged in the madness of Vegas. Probably the only small gripe was the lack of free wi-fi internet, these days I think that is almost the standard, MO charge $US 60- per 5 days. We have stayed at plenty of 5 star properties and this is now firmly at or near the top of our list of favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCash
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental was a wonderful hotel to stay in if you need to get away from the casinos and Vegas action for a little tranquility. The rooms were beautiful. I have never slept in a more comfortable bed. I think my expectations of a 5 star hotel were a little disappointed in certain areas. On one of our evenings the bathtub had not been cleaned thoroughly from the night before's use (we used it, not another guest). Also, we were not given clean glasses for water in our room after the first night. Outside of these two issues, the staff was wonderful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnny1066
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home having stayed 6 nights at the Oriental. It was as good an experience I have had at any hotel in the World. What makes this hotel so good is the level and quality of staff service. In particular I want to say thank you to the pool staff who looked after us each day. Yes, it can be expensive for food and drink but hey come on you pay for what you get! When back in Vegas I wont think twice about staying at the Oriental again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect July 4th Weekend”
Reviews.Author: NVDeeJay
Reviews.Content: After a hectic & grueling week at work the week prior, I decided that my wife and I would take advantage of the long weekend and make a trek to Las Vegas from the Bay Area, CA. With it being a last minute decision, I knew that I would have to be creative in booking our hotel accommodations, shows, meals, etc. After several websites, both third-party & hotel websites, I found a tremendous deal on travelocity.com for the MO for $175 a night. In my opinion, it was worth the few extra $$$ rather than Priceline a 5 star hotel and most likely receive the Trump International...especially after reading all the reviews. Needless to say, the MO was an exquisite oasis on the strip...from the moment we pulled up to check-in, to our 3:00 a.m. check-out, we were treated like royalty. My wife and I were teasing that our taste buds don't match our income, and after such a tremendous stay, I am sold on the Mandarin properties! I'm not sure what the big deal is w/ the other posters regarding switching elevators and such...it literally took an additional 30 seconds!!! Our room was a Cityscape room w/ a king bed. The bathroom is magnificent as my wife fell in love w/ the bath tub, his & her sinks, in-wall TV, hair straightener...I could go on and on... I particularly loved the bed. Absolutely fantastic, I don't know how else to describe it. The room itself was plenty spacious for my wife and I. I did utilize the provided cords as I left my iPod charger at home, but no worries, as the MO had that covered. I know that there wasn't any real rhyme or rhythm to this review, but I can't help but to speak in the highest regard of the Mandarin Oriental. You have a fan for life!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, horrible value.”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: The interior design is stunningly nice and the rooms are excellent. However, there are a few major flaws. Everything is a ripoff here. Overnight valet parking for hotel guests costs $30 / night (its free everywhere else in Vegas). The mini bar is 3x priced compared to Venetian / Wynn. There is no direct walkway to Aria. You have to go up an escalator and walk in the sun. Also, you have to take 2 sets of elevators to get to your room. When I came here in May 2010, the hotel was very empty while Venetian and Wynn were bustling... Management will need to lower prices and create more value to attract more customers, otherwise they will go bust.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury is defined at this property.”
Reviews.Author: JHNY
Reviews.Content: I have worked in the hotel industry for 8 years now and this property is on the top of my list! The staff was very friendly, gentle speaking and informative. From the bell staff, front office, pool staff, housekeeping, and restaurant staff (which I didn't get a chance to taste but often walked by) everyone went above and beyond to make my stay a delight. Feature amenities in the room: LCD remote that controlled curtains, blinds, lights, etc. then informs me when my deadbolt is locked, yoga mat & video, beautifully made water bottles, technology box ( which has wires & cables, in case you forgot to bring yours), duel showerheads, sexy looking tub with bath salt, electronic scale, flat iron for the hair and sexy art works without it looking cheesy or provocative (such as those cards people consistenly give you on the streets). My only mixed feeling on this property is the lobby. Although it's located on the 23rd floor, and has a stunning view on the strip, it's at a location where guests can avoid the personal greetings by the front office. Also since the lobby is on the 23rd floor, all the guestrooms are below it. Before checking in, I thought the guestrooms would be above the lobby but was a bit dissappointed to find out that all guestrooms were below the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm - just awesome”
Reviews.Author: pinkbootpootle
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the lateness of this review - I spent so long researching our trip and posting on the LV forums beforehand but have only just got around to writing this review. I'll try to give you a little background on our trip and then layout the good, the bad and the ugly. My husband and I stayed at the MO in February 2010 for 8 nights along with my parents. I've been to LV a few times before with my work but this was the first time I was going for pleasure. As this would be the first time for both my husband and my parents I wanted everything to be perfect so did many months of research prior to our trip. I've stayed at the Palazzo on previous trips and thoroughly enjoyed it so made a reservation there as part of my first research. A few weeks later I also got a good rate for Encore so did a booking there too. While further surfing I found an incredible deal on city and show.com for the MO. The only issue was I had to pay up front and the MO was not yet open so I had no reviews to enable me to make that big decision. Having stayed a other MO's and by asking LV Forum experts I took the gamble and made the city and show reservation. I rang the hotel a few days later and they confirmed the booking for both my husband and I and my parents and asked us if we had any special requirements. I think with tax we paid about £139 a night - bargain in my eyes. So to the actual trip...... We landed at McCarran, grabbed our hire car and headed to the MO. Contrary to later reviews we found the entrance to CityCenter and the tunnel to the MO very easily although some taxi drivers during our trip did struggle. As we pulled up we were greeted by the top hatted bellboys who asked our last name and radio'ed our arrival up to the main reception. Our bags were quickly whisked away although we asked for our golf bags to be stored - "no problem Mr XXX" came the quick response. We were escorted upstairs in one of the three elevators that leads from the lower lobby and shown to the reception desk. We were very warmly greeted by our names and informed that my parents had arrived safely the previous day (they came a day earlier than us and left a day earlier) and were settled in. We were then given cold towels and jasmine tea presented beautifully with an orchard. A quick check in later (5 mins max) we were shown to our room. A quick tour of the amenities followed and we were left to unpack. A few moments later the light for our valet closet went on and we opened it to be greeted by an MO bag which upon inspection contained golf balls, a presentation box of spa oils and a wonderful hand written note from the lovely girl on reception who had checked us in. In the few minutes it had taken for us to be escorted to our room and shown around she had written a card saying what a pleasure it had been to meet us, check us in and that she hoped we enjoyed our golf and spa treatments - something we had discussed briefly during check in - wonderful service. Our room was beautiful and although not big by LV standards was perfectly adequate for our stay. I loved the valet closet which turned out to be handy as we had to use it to access our room on two occasions (more about that later). The bed was extremely comfortable although the sheets were still a little new - a few more wash cycles and they would be perfect. The bathroom was great with good lighting, perfect for applying my make up and the amenities provided were excellent especially the hair straighteners. The bath was great - perfect to lay back and soak in. The wardrobe section of the room was good too although it was a little tight for hanging space for our eight days. Now for our slight problem - in our first three days we got locked out of our room three times - the first time in the afternoon and we were let in by security within 5 mins and our keys reset but the second and third time it was close to midnight each time and a major inconvenience as we had to wait for security for 15 mins each time. They arrived with a machine to reset the lock but when that failed I showed security how to open the valet closet and reach through to open the door. Not wanting this to keep happening as there was obviously a fault with the card reader on the door, I called the Duty Manager who was extremely apologetic and offered us an upgrade to a Premier room. He even arranged for all our belongings to be transferred to the same place in the new room. The next morning we left early and returned later in the afternoon to collect the keys to our new room. It was fabulous! Whilst I appreciated the cosiness of the standard room I loved the bathroom and closet space of the Premier room. We ate a few times in MOzen, used the bar and had afternoon tea and all were fabulous. So apologies for the long review - here are the good, the bad and the ugly: THE GOOD The service is just fabulous, everytime we left or arrived we were greeted personally by everyone we passed. Attention to detail. The afternoon tea - just yummy and very sophisticated The reception being on the 23rd floor kept riff raff from gawping around the hotel The lack of casino meant for an oasis of calm and feeling of tranquility The spa - hot stone massage was brilliant Cucumber and cilantro margarita in the Mandarin Bar THE BAD Just the lock issue THE UGLY Nothing at all In summary I cannot recommend the MO highly enough if you want a peaceful, professional, service rich oasis of calm in Las Vegas. We're returning in November and I cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not flawless”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental a good choice for Las Vegas We stayed here for 2 nights this week and really liked the hotel.. The room: Opulent and decadent and with a beautiful bathroom. I did not like the beds, but that is a matter of opinion. Some probably will love them, I found them too soft. We had room number 1609 with a beautiful view of the strip down to Paris I loved the closet room, nice to have enough space for clothes. Every morning they bring your news paper in the valet closet, so you will not be disturbed. The pool area is really beautiful and is divided into two sections where one is for adults only and the other has two large lap pools with really nice sun loungers and excellent service. They set you up with mineral water and towels and comes around every hour with smoothies or ice cream samples. We had breakfast in the room in the morning, and they set a complete table for 4 up with flowers and small juice samplers. We also ate lunch at the Mozen. I had the Bento box and My husband had the Kobe Burger – both good and the children menu was also really good with fish options – which our youngest loves. The reason I cant give this a 5 star rating is the fact that they forgot the promised welcome gift for the children, the container for bath salt was empty and dirty, the bathtub had large black streaks on the outside and they also forgot to subtract the credit included in our rooms rate at check out. All was fixed when we told them, but make sure you check your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SGER
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel. Maybe the best hotel rooms in the country. Everything controlled in the room by touch pad (lighting, drapes, TV, music, temperature, etc). Very quiet and calm. Pool is very nice and while not huge certainly large enough for the hotel guests. Excellent service. Great breakfast and a spectacular lounge on the 23rd floor with a great view. We enjoyed the calm of the hotel after being on the strip at night for dinner and shows. Had dinner at Twist and it was just ok---maybe we were not in the mood for such a sophisticated dinner. Dinner the prior night at Bartolotta at Wynn was much better. Lots to do in City Center which is all just next door to the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: 75xyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, one and a half days of which was business. Lobby on 23rd floor of 47 story bldg, hotel below, residences above. Rooms are amazing. All is controlled from a touchpad on night table. Built in furniture is stunning. Bathroom great but couldn’t get tv in mirror to work. Service is really special, always smiling and very helpful. Many employees are from former Mandarin Kahala in Hawaii, which was sold, jobs were offered to re-locate to Vegas. Breakfast was superb, it helped getting $50 in vouchers per day toward breakfast booking through Amex FHR. Not enough loungers at pool on weekend, arrive early and put down a magazine. Men need a jacket at Twist, the restaurant on 23rd floor. Will always remember attendant at spa coming in to steam room with an ice towel for my head.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel when in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ladybugSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple, the best place to stay in Las Vegas if you want the best,, From the staff to the beds everything is impeccable. Past reviewers complained about the sheets, I guess they never experienced excellent quality linens and a good ironing. Red flower amenities for the bathroom is one of the nicest choices. This is 5 star +. Now the spa,,, again, the best ever. The haman is very good..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: skonicke
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive suite. It had a lot of widows and great views of the strip. The pool was south beach chic and a great place to relax and have quiet time. The gym was great, they actually had pilates reformers and offered several classes in pilates, yoga , and kinesis. We found the concierge extremely helpful. They offered great recommendations and VIP listing to most of the popular hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant management attitude - try to be Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: hog4oc
Reviews.Content: This is a late reviewer - stayed there for CES 2010 when they just opened. Staffs are new and not familar with their job yet, but eager to help. I booked the hotel from AE Fine Hotel program - stay one night and get one night free. When I got my American Express bill, I found out I was charged for two nights, made phone call to the hotel and was immedately told that they were right and I was wrong about the bill. I requested the GM to call me back and he did the same thing, the hotel was right and there was nothing they can do about the billing - very arrogant tone and attitue. So I have to call AE and they did a charge back for me. This was my first time staying in Mandarin, I was Ok for the hotel until the billing issue. My question is why a 5-star hotel will make itself arrogant when dealing with customer. We all know people make mistakes, but when do make mistake, take responsibility of it, make your customer feel good about you try to correct the erros. I probably won't stay in Mandarin again. I will probably stay with Four Seasons and Shangari-La in my future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: Islandmind
Reviews.Content: We like trying new places, so were at Aria for five nights before moving to the Mandarin Oriental for the last three of our vacation. Maybe it will catch on, but I wonder if they will survive until it does. This place was dead. And not just in a quiet, exclusive kind of way (which it is), but a *is anyone else staying here?* kind of way. First, the entrance is almost impossible to find and not very impressive. Then you have to kind of luck out on finding where to go. The lobby is actually near the top floor and the ground floor was devoid of anyone to direct you there. Getting to your room requires first going to the third floor then transfering to another set of elevators that work with your room key. Okay, it's nice not having the general public accessing your floor, but also a little inconvenient doing that both directions. The rooms are nice, but not anything you can't get at Bellagio. Like Aria you better not be shy about the bathroom since the toilet stalls have translucient doors and little privacy. The pool is nice, but WHAT IS THAT SMELL? Remember what the intersection in front of Caesars was like a number of years ago - there was that sewer odor in the afternoon? This was several times worse. They even had incense sticks burning; I guess in an attempt to mask it. It didn't work. Unless the wind is blowing - wow. The pool service is very attentive, the drinks expensive ($15-ish per). We went to MOZen Bistro while there, very good and nearly empty. The Mandarin Bar has a great view and was about half full the evening we went. When we got home I looked at the invoice they emailed me. It had charges for in room dining, mini-bar and a day of parking on it. We never ordered room service, opened the mini-bar or even had a car. I called and they were very good about removing it from the bill. Overall I would say it is a nice place, but I doubt we will be staying there again. It's not that anything was wrong, there are just equally nice places with better locations for the same or less money. I'll give it a recommend, but would tell them what I said about other places.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Refined Calm in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kismet007
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long weekend at the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas. Although we live in Los Angeles, we only visit Las Vegas every few years. We enjoyed this hotel so much that we would consider going more often. This visit was inspired by a fantastic deal through our AmEx Platinum card. We had a tiny glitch on arrival (our luggage was delivered to the wrong room, and we already had little time to get dressed for a show that evening), but from that point on, everything was perfect. As a non-gaming hotel, the Mandarin Oriental is a respite from the chaos of the casinos, but the full excitement of Las Vegas is just outside your door. Because the Mandarin is a small hotel (around 325 rooms?), you don't feel like cattle, as in so many of the other hotels in Las Vegas. Service is personal and attentive, and while the hotel is completely central to all of the action in Las Vegas, it envelops you like a luxurious cocoon when you've had enough of the city. I think this hotel is the perfect base for exploring the Strip. Our room was thoughtfully designed, had a great view of the Strip, and the bed was divine (we had to force ourselves out of it each day!). All of the technology in the room worked perfectly. We enjoyed the daily New York Times delivery (including on weekends, which many luxury properties do not do) and our other housekeeping needs were attended to promptly. Turn-down service includes tall bottles of water on the bedside tables, and the valets also put chilled water bottles in your car. The bathroom was spacious and the bathtub and shower are both perfect for two. Our room was so relaxing and pleasant that we found it hard to leave. Our only minor problem with the room was that we found the safe, which is in a bureau drawer, a bit tight. Once our two laptops were in the safe, we couldn't fit jewelry boxes or other valuables. Breakfasts in MoZen were delicious with fantastic fresh fruits. My wife found the French toast a bit dense, but the omelettes were as light as air, and I could eat the apple-chicken sausages all day. Service was prompt without making us feel rushed. We had one late lunch at MoZen, too, which was also very nice with amazingly succulent shrimp in the pad thai. The concierge was helpful and efficient, securing us tickets for a top show in under ten minutes and offering great advice on restaurants. The gym is very well equipped with a large and nicely outfitted locker room. We didn't use the pool, but the area was attractive. I ventured into the spa for a Chinese foot bath with massage, which felt great on my feet after walking up and down the strip for two days. The treatment was very nice, although I found the high-backed chairs in the foot spa quite stiff and uncomfortable. Spa prices are very high here; for those interested in a splurge, the spa is extremely relaxing, staff are at once discrete and fawning, and the views are very nice from many of the treatment areas. For those who want to avoid the $30/night valet fee--and I really do think that's exorbitant for Las Vegas--parking in the neighboring Aria is free and is about a 3-5 minute walk--still easier than self-parking at the Venetian or Bellagio. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas, and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: JWLMontgomery_AL
Reviews.Content: From the extremely well-appointed and tasteful rooms to the superb service to the quiet and elegant public spaces, the MO Las Vegas exceeded all expectations. As part of the stunning new City Center project, the MO puts you within walking distance of a casino at Aria, incredible shopping and dining at Crystals while providing a buffer from the cigarette smoke, tank tops and tattoos walking the strip and "touring" the mega hotels. This hotel has a very small and exclusive feel from the time you arrive. The room service was excellent, the spa services perfect, even the sheets smelled wonderful. On our last day as the valet pulled our rental car around for us to head to the airport, we noticed they placed two bottles of water in the cup holders. Now that's above and beyond ordinary service. I've stayed at all the luxury hotels in Las Vegas, including the Ritz at Lake Las Vegas (when it existed) and the MO beats them all. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You'll never go back to budget hotels!”
Reviews.Author: DocSteiner
Reviews.Content: When the hotel is so exclusive it doesn't have a sign on the street you know you are in for unrestrained decadence. The porter greets you once you snake your way back to the private entrance in the City Center and shows you to the 23rd floor where the lobby is. Rooms are opulent and indulgent and have every amenity you can list. Drapes that close at the push of a button, a HUGE soaking tub in the bathroom, a dressing area, bathrobes and slippers and a view of the city that will make an impression. The most common phrase you'll hear from the staff is, "It's my pleasure". Tasty American breakfast can be arranged to be delivered to your room on full linen and china. The SPA at the MO is amazing. One of the finest anywhere. Every kind of excess you can imagine is not spared. Ice showers, heated stone beds, themed shower experiences. When can I go back?

Reviews.Title: “A reason to come to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Brauna
Reviews.Content: After reading several Trip Advisor Reviews of the Mandarin, I cancelled my Four Seasons reservation and booked through Amex Platinum. Got an upgraded room, a $100 spa credit, breakfast daily, and an excellent rate. And, boy, is this a beautiful hotel I love Mandarin Oriental hotels. Have stayed in them in Hong Kong (during the 80s!), San Francisco, Washington, and Miami. They're all great. This one has the most modern of rooms technically, and is incredibly elegant. And, the restaurant, Pierre Gagniere's Twist, is to die for! Sadly, not open on Sunday and Monday, so we could only eat there on Friday. We even asked them to help us book the Paris restaurant when we are there in July. No complaints here. Am in town for a family event, and the family is all staying at another hotel. Too bad they weren't as clever as us!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel; A Retreat from Casino Crowds and Noise”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental offers an oasis in Las Vegas right on the strip. The newly built hotel is well appointed with an, obviously, modern Asian-style decor. The staff is quite helpful. You'll be great upon arrival in their "sky lobby" on the 23rd floor and shown to your room. My room was what they called the Apex suite. It was a large suite with a living area, a dining area, a bedroom overlooking the strip and a bathroom with a large tub and shower. The suite also had a kitchen area and a small work desk area along with a large closet. The entire suite was furnished with new and comfortable furnishings. All of the lights, curtains, and other items could be controlled with a remote or touch-screen display. The bed was most comfortable and the pillows were plentiful. The towels were fresh and soft. The bathroom amenities were of good quality; they even had collar stays (which was a good thing because I had forgotten mine.) I needed two shirts and a pair of pants pressed. The valet had it done in an hour. The room had a nice "valet closet" feature. This allowed the valet to leave things for a guest (and vice versa) such as the days newspaper without disturbing the guest. On the second day I reserved a cabana at the pool with some friends. The pool was quite but very nice. The service was attentive and the pool-side lunch was amazing. The spa and fitness center were also very impressive. I also took breakfast in the room. The presentation was amazing, the food was about average. That was the only mediocre spot in the entire hotel. On the whole the Mandarin Oriental is one of the best hotels in Las Vegas. It's particularly outstanding if you are looking for a hotel without throngs of casino goers traipsing through the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “best service ever”
Reviews.Author: DanaG
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas and stayed at some other nice hotels, but this is by far the best luxury hotel on the strip. The service here was amazing - we were greeted by name and they even bow as you walk by. We went to the gym (which is free including free bottled water, vitamin water, and fresh fruit) and there was a personal trainer there to help you with the machines. She even brought me a new bottle of water while I was on the elliptical machine - the second I took the last sip of my water, I turned around and there she was presenting me with a fresh cold bottle. I was amazed! The spa was amazing - definitely pricey but the massage was great and the facilities definitely make it worth it. Our package included breakfast and it was probably the best room service breakfast we have ever had. The food was great - I loved the fruit bowl with fresh and exotic fruit - but the omelets were great too. The presentation of everything was exceptional - I esp loved the surprise little fruit smoothie drink they included each day. The room was nice, decent-sized but not huge, but the extra amenities put it over the top. The amenity kits had everything you could possibly want - toothbrush, toothpaste, loofah, razor and shaving cream, etc.. My personal favorite was they included a flat iron hair straightener - I've never seen that before.. There even was a little container of bath salts on a platter with a spoon to add into your bath and a bath pillow to relax in the soaking tub... They really do think of anything and the personal service was unlike anything I've seen in Vegas.. The hotel is quieter and doesn't have a casino, but I prefer to have a nice, quiet room and walking 5-10 minutes to big casinos and nightlife is perfect.. the Aria casino is minutes away and we were told you can even park your car there for free if you don't want to pay valet fees.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every respect. Well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: CnPScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved everything about this hotel. The rooms are stunning, the staff are extremely helpful, the service was personal and the location great. For us there were several points which made the hotel stand out; Unlike other Vegas hotels there is no casino in the lobby. As we are not too interested in gambling this was a big plus. The lack of casino made the hotel much quieter and more classy than others we have stayed in. The location in the new 'city center' is great. It is further away (but still walkable) from the Venetian / Wynn end of the strip but is closer to the best shops. The cocktail bar is so much fun and has incredible views down the strip. The 'spoon' snacks were also a highlight and well worth a splurge! The staff really stood out; at an extremely busy time of year (the technology convention) service was personal with staff welcoming us by name upon our arrival in the foyer and no queuing to check in (one of my greatest dislikes in Vegas). They were also invaluable in securing restaurant reservations (which was surprisingly difficult due to the convention) and show tickets. Overall I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again. It is slightly more expensive than other Vegas hotels but is absolutely worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: wcnightowl
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend stay at the MO and decided that though it was nice, we wouldn't stay there again. First off, the price...500 sq ft. room...$500/night. No self parking..valet only for $30/night, no empty refrig. for drink storage, regular soda...$8.00/glass. Since it's a nongambling hotel, they charge for everything, so we didn't dare touch the bottles of water left for us at night. No ice machine handy, butler delievered only, and the one time we asked for ice, it never arrived, which didn't matter as we were getting ready to check out anyway. The walls separating the bathroom from the bedroom are frosted glass, with solid walls you can slide out for privacy, but they don't extend all the way around the bathroom, so coming from the hallway to the bedroom, you can still look into the bathroom and see everything that's happening, even into the shower stall and toilet! I prefer privacy while using the toilet, just call me old fashioned. We only had drinks there, and went elsewhere to eat, so I can't comment on the resturants. Poolside service, though not busy, there wasn't enough staff for the pool area. There wasn't one person assigned to an area, and when my sister-in-law went to try and get a cabana for a half day, it took over an hour getting someone to help her, and they still charged her for a half day, which was from 1-6 pm, even though we didn't get the cabana until after 2 pm, despite repeated attempts to get the manager in charge. The service was slow, but there were only 2 bartenders, and they were working their butts off trying to keep up with all the orders. I felt sorry for the staff as they were trying their best to keep up, but they obviously didn't have enough help, and needed 2 more bartenders to keep the pace going. I would rather stay in Mandalay's sky view suite for $349/night and 1050 sqft., with empty refrig. handy plus privacy for the bathroom and toilets, free self parking, and more resturant and bar options than stay at Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect. Little room for improvement!”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: Wow. About as good as it gets. Staff to guest ratio is incredible. It's a small hotel yet had almost as many people at the front desk as big hotels like Bellagio. Staff is incredibly well trained and accommodating. Rooms are super high tech yet understatedly elegant. Wood details, aromatherapy amenities, great towels, lots of connectivity options that allow computers and iPods to be controlled by the bedside touchpad. Touchpad also controls temperature, lighting, drapes, etc. A few unique features. 4 different newspapers offered (WSJ, NYT, Vegas RJ and USA Today). Room has a valet closet that can be opened by staff with a key on one side and by the guest on the other side from within the room so deliveries, newspapers, etc, can be left w/o disturbing the guest or requiring one to get dressed to retrieve a newspaper. Also loved being able to preset wakeup music, temperature and drapes to open at a designated time. Much cooler than being woken up by an alarm clock blaring or the phone ringing. Room keys are RFID instead of magstripe. Room key is needed to operate the elevators for added security. It's a short walk to Monte Carlo and Aria. Food is $$$$$ but suppose that's to be expected. The food court at Monte Carlo offers some better values if you don't want to have gourmet meals all day.

Reviews.Title: “A True 5-star hotel on the center of the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: Mindwanderer
Reviews.Content: Vegas has lots of glitsy hotel options, but few that provide real luxury and excellent service to the average person (i.e. if you are not a person who gambles for thousands of dollars at a sitting). The Mandarin Oriental is a true 5 star city hotel with excellent service - you could be staying in any major city. The high level of service and detailed attention are yours whether you are there to gamble or not - and the hotel lobby is delightfully free of any slot machines or vestiges of a casino. The place is classy and luxurious, there is no line to speak to someone at reception, and the staff manage to show genuine friendliness - not just politeness. My room had a very good view of the strip, although the best views are at the top of the Mandalay Bay or in the Four Seasons - but the problem there is you really have a long way to go to get to the center of the strip. From the MO (Mandarin Oriental) you can walk in <10 mins to the Bellagio and Paris, and in <5 mins to anywhere in CityCenter. The hotel has a complementary Mercedes to take you down the street if you are going a bit further, and without my asking they put me in it twice, after I asked for a Taxi - that is service and it really made a difference (thanks Dean!). Bathrooms are fantastic and large. As with most new hotels, the rooms are all very similar - both a positive and a negative, as you know what you're going to get, but you lose some of the variety and originality present in older hotels. The electronic systems are truly amazing, and worked well (and note that they provide cables to hook up just about anything including your ipod to the inroom stereo/tv) - although I worry that too much electronic interaction within the room is a set up for issues in years to come. The Spa is lovely, although pricey, but you get fantastic treatments in rooms with picture windows onto the strip. It's worth it if you have time. I tried the room service and the MOZen Bistro, and both were very good - and well worth enjoying if your booking comes with any spa/dining credit. All in all I think this is the best hotel to stay in when in Vegas, because it is well located, truly luxurious, and has class without losing genuine friendliness. The general manager deserves a lot of credit for hiring excellent staff and setting the right tone in this very new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and serene”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelOzzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 kids for 3 nights. Loved it- one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in ( and I have stayed in many outstanding hotels all around the world). So different from anything else in Vegas. Great for kids as no casino. Expensive but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: elyke1234
Reviews.Content: If you like smoke and countless slot machines when you enter a hotel in Vegas, this is not the right hotel for you. The entrance at the Mandarin is almost hidden, but in a good way. No lines of taxis or other cars to be found, no horde of people. It's very discrete and subtle, unlike most other Vegas properties. Service overall has been excellent, I couldn't find someone who was unfriendly or unable to help me. Service at the Mozen restaurant (we had dinner and breakfast there) is worth mentioning, it was the best service we've received during our stay! Overall, the staff makes you feel like a person and not just a room number. It's a very different experience than at some other larger hotels like the Wynn or Venetian or even the Four Seasons, which we all visited before. Room service was excellent and prompt. Rooms are new and still spotless, bathrooms are great and spacious. We had one of the least expensive rooms and were shown a suite upon arrival, but it seems you can't really go wrong with any of the rooms here. We decided to stick with our original Mandarin room, as the suite had the same amenities, it only had more space. The only thing that did bug me was the 30 dollar parking fee, as someone mentioned before. And the minibar prices were excessive and almost offensive, 7 or 8 dollar for a soda can. The spa seemed nice but be prepared to spend over 200 USD for a treatment. Overall, it is one of the more expensive choices in Las Vegas but you can really experience the difference in quality. Highly recommended if you want an oasis of peace and calm to escapte to in bustling Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: justme2Georgia
Reviews.Content: It's the people at this hotel that make the difference. While the accommodations are very nice, in Las Vegas they become more average. However the staff is excellent. Chris and Glenn at the front door and Mary, the room service operator truly made us feel at home. Having stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas, including the Wynn (including towers), Encore. Four Seasons, Venetian, Palazzo, MGM, MGM Signature, Mirage, Bellagio, etc. This is one of the best hotels for service, average for room size, above average for decor (of course it is new). The storage space is very nice. My primary compliant would be the $30 per night parking fee at the hotel. My parking was more than my rental car. I realize this is a non gaming hotel. However so is the Four Seasons and the MGM Signature, and I do not recall paying a per night parking fee there and certainly not $30 per night. Due to the nightly rate of the hotel + the parking fee, I will probably not chose to stay here again. There are just too many excellent choices in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “MANDARIN ORIENTAL... NOT HONEST”
Reviews.Author: cedricgerald
Reviews.Content: Hello I stayed at the MO Las Vegas in January (FHR booking) in a premier room and stayed in a premier room (per front desk no upgrade was available despite Executive suite was available on MO web site). They told me that it was just removed ) I asked for a rate reduction as I'd end in a premier room with booking a cheaper room. They agree and reduce the rate by USD 50. I did came back in February with a guarantee upgrade from executive to Dynasty as I had a nice chat with one of the manager there. I made 2 back to back bookings to enjoy 2 paid and 2 free nights. This was confirmed with one of the manager there. (we stayed 4 nights all together) 5 days prior arrival I received an e-mail from their reservation'manager indicating than 2 paid / 2 free nights is not possible and asked for an extra USD 795 (only one free night and 3 paid nights). After 10 e-mails back & forth explaining that I received the confirmation from a manager there (this manager was surprisingly not available) reservation'manager finally agree to keep what was already agreed as I was returning guest and they value my patronage etc etc. Make me wonder if they're honest there. By the way, some of her e-mails were very tricky for example she told me I'm pleased to agree with one paid and one free night, details of your reservation is below, it was written "Executive suite". I don't believe she was that stupid she was just tricky. Make me wonder if they're honest there. I was that close to cancel everything and my manager'contact who made the booking surprisingly came back (when the problem was solved) and e-mail me indicating that he made a mistake and he'll make sure that my stay will be grand bla bla (they're very good in blablabla) 2 nights prior arrival my manager'contact e-mailed me and advised he was able to block me a suite with a strip view but it won't be available before 6 or 8 pm. (they had some guarantee late check out until 4 & 6 pm and had to clean the rooms) I asked him if I can have the room earlier without the strip view and..... he didn't reply despite a second request. Believe he had none suites available before 6 pm with or without view. (anyway the strip view is a view of the polo'tower...) The dynasty suite is OK but doesn't worth the money, the PH at Bellagio is nicer and the Salone at Wynn is much nicer The Dynasty doesn't have jet bath. The suite is relatively small (the PH Bellagio is larger) They have a nice kitchen, in case you'd like to cook .... We were on the 20th floor, looking at the Polo tower. As someone already said, there is no view from the Mandarin Oriental. There is an expresso coffee machine but the coffee (nor tea'bags) are renewed Several problems during the stay : - As informed 2 days before the room was not available until 6 pm (no compensation given for the wait) - No amenities at all one morning - No amenities at all during turn down service - At 9 am we asked for the room to be cleaned, we come back at 1 pm and it was still not cleaned. - The next day, we can called at 9 am and asked if the room could be cleaned at about 10 / 11 am . At 9.30 two people came to clean the room, I was still in the shower.... - We had a complimentary fruits basket (& water) upon arrival which was removed the second day despite it was not empty at all - In January I a had the same fruit basket plus a bottle of champagne in a premier room, since they appreciate that they come back and come back in a suite they upgraded me... to water !! - Concierge booked me a restaurant but the restaurant didn't find the reservation. - I asked the concierge for an aisle seat at a show, I had no aisle seat despite the seats were available .... - I have read that the concierges at MO have a lot of connections... but they were not able to book me a window table at Boulud. - I use a towel as pillow at the hot tub'spa and one of the SPA'people almost cry one me : "your're not supposed to put towels like that".... oops I'm so sorry to have wet a little part of your towel ) After he start to dry it next to me... wonder what he was watching. - 20% tips on a massage and she was unhappy and clearly show it (no "bye bye" etc). The staff is usually speaking very nice, but there is no consistency in their service.
